**Second Day: Midday Procession of the Dao**
*Entering the Chamber*
Each pays homage to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

The Yellow Center guards with qi, severing the roots of demonic clans.
Suppressing the sources of evil,
Cutting off the traces of demons.
By the talismanic command of the Most High,
Divine power is summoned and controlled.
The myriad spirits are thus subdued,
Repelling misfortune and eliminating calamity.
The three wheels of royal qi,
Circulate the true wind.
The purple portal cradles jade,
Bestowing boundless deliverance.
To the left, the Azure Waist is commanded;
To the right, the Mushroom Youth is summoned.
Riding the whirlwind and soaring light,
Mastering the nine voids.
The Mysterious Altar responds to the moment,
Mounting the qi in emptiness.
The ten thousand perfected descend in unison,
Delivering boundless salvation.

*Strike the ritual drum twenty-four times*

O Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Origin of the Three Qi, Most High Lord Lao: summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Envoys, the Left and Right Fragrant Bearers, the Dragon-Riding Couriers, the Golden Youths attending incense, the Jade Maidens transmitting words, the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans, the Direct-Day Fragrant Officials—thirty-six each. Summon forth the local earth gods and territorial deities, the true officials and orthodox spirits, to swiftly emerge, prepare their attire, and open the gates. As we now burn incense, we dedicate it to so-and-so official, so-and-so person, for the state and for the family, in the performance of the Most High Yellow Register Great Retreat for so many days and nights. Today, on the second day at midday, we ascend the altar, pay homage to the perfected, and practice the Dao. May we receive the life-generating qi of the Most High and the ten directions’ true perfected ones, flowing into our bodies, so that our supplications swiftly reach the presence of the Most High, the Limitless, the Great Dao, the Jade Emperor.

Each declares their dharma rank:

We, disciples of the Mysterious Capital, humbly and with one heart, reverently supplicate the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Non-Being and Spontaneous Origin, the Limitless Great Dao, the Most High Great Dao Lord, the Most High Lord Lao, the August Jade Emperor, the ten directions’ great saintly perfected ones who have attained the Dao, the myriad true lords and venerable masters, the thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs, the Jade Void Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection, the Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Watchtower, Seven-Jewel Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace, the Numinous Treasure Perfected Sovereign of Luminous Augustness, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the King of Total Perfection of the Western Culmination, the Eastern Minister of Destiny, the Supreme Primordial Perfected One, the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace Lower Teaching, the numinous palaces of the Five Marchmounts, the perfected immortals of the renowned mountains and grotto-heavens, the responsive and perceptive spirits of the Three Realms, and all true numina.

We, by fortunate coincidence, meet this blessed occasion, our good karma accumulated from past encounters. The Three Honored Ones spread the transformation of non-action; the Four Luminaries open the gate of broad salvation. Thus, with mortal forms, we rely on the wondrous dharma of our lineage. We unfold the precious writs of the ninefold radiance, gaze upon the jade chapters of the Three Caverns. Though inwardly we measure our meager capacities, surely we are unworthy. Only through the fast and precepts do we hope to establish modest merit, aiding the state and delivering people, fulfilling the mysterious intent. In all our endeavors, how dare we not report them above?

*Reading the Petition*
Following the words of the petition, we sincerely submit to the Mysterious Culmination. For the state and for the family, we request blessings and pray for grace.

Disciple so-and-so reflects: my nature is endowed with the three numina, my spirit molded by the four greats. In the River of Love, my nature is drowned; in the Sea of Desire, my sincerity races. Illusory realms are easily confused; the mountain of blessings is hard to construct. Faults and transgressions accumulate, deepening with the years. I have heard that the wondrous retreat of the Yellow Register is a secret rite of the Mysterious Capital. Above, it delivers billions of ancestors, severing the roots of evil karma and sinful retribution; below, it rescues the nine nights and three paths, the destitute souls and hidden spirits. It dissolves calamitous knots, opens deliverance for heaven and humanity. Wherever its blessings extend, families and states enjoy eternal peace. Thus, with solemn reverence and earnest sincerity, I prepare fragrant flowers, offerings, patterned silks, golden dragons, lamps, and candles, establishing the retreat and practicing the Dao, praying for the descent of the perfected. Universally for the living and the dead, I turn my heart and plead for destiny.

Today, at midday, practicing the Dao, we, the assembled dharma practitioners, offer this first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering to the Most High and True Dao Treasure. We dedicate our bodies, lives, and destinies, prostrating ourselves, reverently relying on the Three Honored Ones of the Most High. May this merit, above, benefit the sacred spirits of the altars of soil and grain and the ancestral temples. May they merge with the three realms, ascend the nine heavens, secretly assist the great foundation, and safeguard the great enterprise. May the emperor’s longevity equal the sun and moon, his transformation harmonize the three origins. May his chariots and standards reach the eight extremities, his dominion embrace the ten thousand states. May the heir apparent, the regional lords, and the imperial aides assist the imperial plan. May the worthy ministers and meritorious officials protect and govern the royal house. May auspicious clouds spread their radiance, and the dharma rain nourish all. May the four companions and three masters, the mountain-dwelling fellow practitioners, together attain the fruit of perfection, all ascend the immortal ranks.

Thus, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the great saintly host of the perfected and true. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, in harmony and union with the Dao in truth.

Today, at midday, practicing the Dao, we offer this second pinch of incense. We dedicate our bodies, spirits, and lives to the Great Dao, prostrating ourselves, taking refuge in the Most High Revered Scriptures. May this merit bless the nine generations of ancestors in the hidden chambers and the seven lineages of spiritual consciousness. May the vast radiance shine downward, leading them from the dark springs’ gates; may the mysterious grace spread widely, releasing them from the net of scorching toil. May the Three Officials erase their records, and the Five Paths generate their spirits. May they hear the true dharma in the Purple Tenuity, pay homage to the perfected in the Azure Vault. May they wear the talismans of the numinous writs, transcend the cold courts of the night prisons. May the six destinies and three paths together reach the realm of blessings.

Thus, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the great saintly host of the perfected and true. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless.

With the Dao uniting in perfected truth,
we now perform the midway rite of pacing the Dao.
Burning this third pinch of incense,
we offer body, spirit, and life to the Great Dao,
prostrating ourselves in reverence to the Three Supreme Ones of the Most High.

May this merit flow to the nine affinities and six clans of such-and-such a household,
to all inner and outer kin.
May their forms harmonize with primordial harmony,
their spirits merge with the wondrous Dao.
Gold steadfast and jade lustrous,
may their blessings increase and their radiance grow;
mirrors bright and dust cleared,
may their lifespans extend and stretch afar.
Disasters disperse like vanishing mist,
goodness arrives like gathering clouds.
From the moving and still to the flying and sinking,
within the realm and beyond its bounds,
may all alike receive vast fortune,
all bathe in the mysterious workings.

Thus we now burn incense,
taking refuge in the great saintly host of the perfected and true.
After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless,
with the Dao uniting in perfected truth.

The rites proceed:
Repentance,
Pacing the Void,
Reining the reins to traverse the ten directions,
resting in turn upon the slopes of the darkly luminous.
Gazing upward at the Terrace of Kalpas,
looking downward at the Purple Cloud Net.
Wandering freely in the Capital of the Most High,
together we sit upon lotus blossoms.
Through accumulated study, one becomes a perfected person,
serene in harmony of nourishing qi.
Forever enjoying boundless life,
why count even ten thousand cedars as many?

Threefold invocation,
Threefold prostration.

We, with utmost sincerity, bow our heads in reverence to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, with utmost sincerity, bow our heads in reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, with utmost sincerity, bow our heads in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

Once more proclaiming our rank:
Disciples of the Supreme Clarity Mysterious Capital, we humbly and with one heart address the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin; the Supreme Great Dao Lord; the Supreme Lord Lao; the Boundless Great Dao and the Host of Virtuous Saints and Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions; the Heavenly Emperors and Celestial Thearchs; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center; the High Ministers and Prime Ministers, the Four Offices and Five Emperors; the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace Lower Teaching; the King of Total Perfection of the Western Ultimate; the Divine Officials of the Five Marchmounts, the Grotto-Heavens of the Famous Mountains, and all responsive and perceptive perfected numina of the Three Realms.

We prostrate ourselves, having heard that the Primordial August One established the teaching, and the Supreme Dao transmitted its texts. The Azure Scriptures spread afar, rescuing the four deluded from the six destinies; the Vermilion Writings broadly expounded, bestowing abundant blessings upon the Nine Dark Realms. The living and the dead alike receive grace, the benighted and the enlightened together know peace.

We, above, consider the nine mystic generations and seven ancestral lines, the karmic bonds of kalpas past, extending to lord and kin, and reaching to family and state. Reflecting upon the radiant favor, we grandly open the vast interior. We take refuge at the Mysterious Altar, offering sincerity to the Purple Palace. We request to perform the fast and vigil, to convey our earnest prayers.

Following the ranked texts and observing the precepts and forms, we array the positions of the stars, emulating the round vault above; we open the altar’s gates of sun and moon, aligning with the true pattern at the sides. Incense, flowers, lamps, and candles attest to our faith and convey our sincerity. Dragon jades and patterned silks express the heart and display our rites. With concentrated thought and focused visualization, we hope to attain resonance and communion.

We pray that the Supreme Dharma King will shine forth his compassionate light to illumine below; that the Great Sage of the Mysterious Capital will extend his beneficent influence to descend afar. May he command the flying heavenly spirit-kings to proclaim the covenant to the Three Realms; may he open the palaces of the Cold Court to release the hidden souls. May the numinous essences of generations past all receive deliverance and elevation. Bathed in the divine fluid, may they ascend beyond the Southern Palace. Hearing the Dharma-sound, may they transform and be born in the immortal realms.

Above, we pray for the eternal life of the sagely lord, for the imperial enterprise to know no bounds. May the waves of the Eight Seas all become imperial grace; may the mountains and rivers of the Nine Enclosures all become royal domains. May the tracks of chariots be wholly unified, the celestial motions all harmonious. May the Eight Winds blow gently, the Five Grains ripen abundantly. May weapons of war not be raised, beacon fires forever stilled. May the people know no disease, and customs abound in auspicious signs. May our family, kin, and clan all partake of vast fortune. May the Three Paths and Nine Nights, the moving and the still, the floating and the hidden, all receive the compassion of the wondrous Dao, and together attain the fruits of spontaneity.

Above, may the Heavenly Worthies manifest their great compassion; below, may our sincere prayers be answered. We humbly present this petition for your hearing.

We make our vows:

First vow: May the Great Dao be serene and empty, tranquil and still, abiding in clarity. May it broadly open the Dharma-gates to instruct the stubborn. May all receive its beneficent influence and cultivate with diligent austerity. May we, with our fellow students, universally ascend to the void, preserving ourselves with Heaven, and abiding forever without care.

Second vow: May the various heavens congeal qi and become clear. May the high void broadly cover, preserving the true and securing the numinous. May the climate be harmonious, the four seasons balanced. May the state be secure and the people prosperous, the world universally at peace. May all be broadly saved, and beneficence reach all beings. May Heaven be preserved for long ages, enduring for kalpas without end.

Third vow: May the earth cover and support without limit. May it be stable and not sink, the seas not collapse. May it protect and secure family and state, the myriad people flourishing in accord. May it nourish the living and pacify the dead, its beneficence pervading the ten directions. May crops and plants flourish, daily increasing in abundance. May all receive its generous support, the myriad kinds all following.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, be lofty and bright. May they know no dimming or eclipse, their waxing and waning peaceful and clear. May their light illumine the various heavens, penetrating and dispelling the dark and obscure. May they secure the kalpic destiny, the world’s reign peaceful. May they universally bestow moistening grace, showering blessings upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars and constellations shine with the same brilliance as the sun. May their revolving torches illumine, brightly reflecting the ten directions. May each abide in its proper place, their paths straight and true. May they protect and secure family and state, sparing them from calamity and harm. May the Four Seas be tranquil and unified, the world universally flourishing.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons follow their nodes in succession. May the seasonal qi be harmonious and balanced, without calamity or affliction. May pestilence and poison be extinguished, the world universally at peace. May the Five Grains ripen abundantly, the state prosperous and the people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds congeal qi and gather mist. May they soar high and become clear, shading the mysterious and profound. When hidden, they are without action; when dispersed, they fill the heavens. May immortals and transcendents dwell together, forming friendships with the host of perfected. May beneficence flow to all, loving the state and cherishing the people. May all beings be universally saved, humanity enduring kalpas together.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and shower without limit. May they universally bestow and release, receiving their flourishing. May the myriad things flourish, the state’s stores and the people’s abundance increase.

Ninth vow: May the Five Marchmounts each abide in their proper place. May they tower majestically, containing and concealing, forever serving as immortal palaces. May they secure the state’s destiny, preserving Heaven without end. May they protect and deliver all, none not looking up in reverence.

Tenth vow: May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless. May they contain and embrace, expansive and broad, nurturing even the smallest. May their depths be profound and their kindness gentle, moistening all that wriggles and breathes. May Heaven and humanity protect and bless, their years enduring like kalpic stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor’s state daily flourish. May the Four Quarters be peaceful and harmonious, weapons of war not raised. May Heaven and humanity sing in praise, auspicious responses arriving in flight. May teachings be widely disseminated, majestic transformations overflowing. May the myriad people rejoice, eternal joy without end.

Twelfth vow: May the crawling and flying, the moving and stirring, those already born and those yet to be born, all receive safety and universally attain life. May all see the primordial qi and receive the forms of yang. May grasses and trees, fruits and forests endure winter without withering. May all be delivered and saved, none not flourishing and radiant.

Harmonizing with the Dao, uniting in perfected truth.

The incense is offered again.

Fragrant Official Messengers, the Lords of Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all Attendant Fragrance Spirits: may this place where your servant ascends the altar to perform the Dao naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones gather here, where incense and flame illuminate the altar’s censer.

May the disciple of the fast, so-and-so, whether living or deceased, receive blessings; may the hidden and manifest be graced with favor. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the fragrant smoke, conveying all that your servant has just petitioned directly to the August Jade Emperor of the Utmost Real and Boundless Dao.

Exiting the chamber.
*Taishang Huanglu Fast Ritual*, Scroll Five concludes.

*Taishang Huanglu Fast Ritual*, Scroll Six
Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang Guangcheng

**Second Day: Twilight Procession of the Dao**

Entering the chamber.
Each pays respects to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guarding the Spirits**
The perfected of the Golden Void descend; divine tigers patrol the encampment.
The Jade Emperor dons auroral radiance; the deities of all heavens command the numinous.
The Nine Dawns turn their chariots; the myriad demons bind their forms.
Ninefold subtle flames burst forth; divine might seizes essences.
Molten gold hurls fire; all evils dissolve together.
Divine splendor illumines the night; profound mystery endures eternal spring.
The sagely Dao flows boundless; the ten directions stand solemn and clear.
Preserving and governing the kalpa’s fate, primordial harmony prevails—*yuan heng li zhen*.

The Twenty-Four Rolls of the Dharma Drum Resound

From the Supreme Three Heavens, the Primordial Origin of the Three Qi, the Most High Lord Lao, summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attending Envoys, the Left and Right Incense-Bearing Dragon-Riding Scribes, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Thirty-Six Officers of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Daily Incense—each in their thirty-sixfold ranks. Summon now the local earth deities and domain guardians, the true officials and correct spirits, to swiftly emerge and open the passes.

We now burn incense in proper ritual, dedicating this to so-and-so official, so-and-so person, for state and family, as we undertake the Supreme Yellow Register Grand Fast for so many days and nights. On this second day, at twilight, we ascend the altar, burn incense, and perform the Dao-procession. May the life-generating qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions and Correct Perfected Ones descend and flow into our bodies, that our supplications swiftly reach the presence of the Jade Thearch, the August Emperor of the Supreme Dao of the Utmost Real and Infinite.

Each proclaims their dharma-rank:

Disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mystic Capital, we, so-and-so, humbly and with one mind, reverently address the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous Origin, the Infinite Dao, the Most High Great Dao Lord, the Great Sagely Ancestor, the Highest Great Dao, the Golden Watchtower, the Mysterious Origin, the Heavenly Thearch of the August Emperor, the Most High Lord Lao, the Supreme Mysterious Elder, the Great Sages of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the Perfected Lords and Venerable Masters, the Thirty-Six Heavenly Thearchs, the Jade Void Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, the Southern Culmen, the Western Numinous, the Northern Perfected, the Mystic Capital, the Golden Watchtower, the Seven-Treasure Mystic Terrace, the Purple Tenuity, the Supreme Palace, the Numinous Treasure, the Perfected and Radiant August Dao Lord, the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Center, the Supreme Minister of the Eastern Marchmount, the Director of Destinies Perfected Lord, the King of Total Perfection of the Western Culmen, the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lower Teaching, the Thirty-Six Revered Scriptures of the Departments, the True Officials of the Five Marchmounts, the Grottoes and Caverns of the Numinous Mountains, the responsive and perceptive deities of the Three Realms, and all the mysterious bureaus.

We have long been endowed with the true vehicle and born in an age of Dao-transformations. The Vermilion Writs govern fate; the Mysterious Teaching spreads widely. We have presumptuously received the grace of masters and transmitted the secret registers. Yet we have not been able to lodge our spirits in the famous peaks, fix our thoughts on the Central Void, or befriend the Supreme Perfected. Thus, while we vow to deliver the departed according to the mysterious statutes, our first duty is to aid the state, expound the Dharma to save people, and establish merit as our foundation. In all our petitions, how dare we not make this known above?

Recitation of the Words

Following the recited words, we truly and earnestly pray. May this benefit the state and family, universally extending to the living and the dead. We reverently invoke the imperial altar, looking up to implore the mysterious blessings.

We, in accordance with the Purple Yang Jade Writs and the Yellow Register’s precious texts, the karmic conditions of sin and fortune, and the deliverance statutes, present silk as ritual sincerity, dragon jades, incense, and flowers, offering our sincere hearts as we perform the fast and vigil. We prostrate ourselves, hoping the Great Sages of the Ten Directions and the Most High’s host of venerables will condescend to descend their majestic radiance and graciously turn their wise gaze. May they broadly bestow blessings and favor, fulfilling our heartfelt sincerity.

On this twilight procession of the Dao, we request the Dharma assembly to offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to rely on the Three Venerables of the Most High. May these merits be dedicated to the ancestral temples and the august spirits of the altars of soil and grain, ascending to the Great Clarity, roaming the Purple Watchtower. May the emperor’s august brilliance, together with the encompassing of heaven and earth, equally honor transformations, pervade the boundless, and extend benevolence to all without exception. May the empress, inner officials, and the six palaces be suffused with goodness. May the crown prince and the various princes have blessings extending for ten thousand generations. May the myriad officials, ministers, the Four Companions, and the Three Masters all enter non-action and fully attain the fruits of the Real.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely host of masters and the virtues of the Perfected. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

On this twilight procession of the Dao, we request the Dharma assembly to offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.

We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to rely on the Most High’s Venerable Scriptures. May these merits bring blessings to such-and-such a family, the ninefold ancestors and sevenfold forebears, the departed spirits. May the transgressions of kalpas be washed away, receiving the registers of the Three Caverns; may the karmic retributions of accumulated lives be dissolved, escaping the ninefold darknesses of suffering. May their essences be refined in the Southern Palace, their spirits ascend to the upper realms.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely host of masters and the virtues of the Perfected. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

On this twilight procession of the Dao, we request the Dharma assembly to offer the third pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.

We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to rely on the Three Venerables of the Most High. May these merits bring blessings to such-and-such a family, the six relations and five clans, the inner and outer kin. May good fortune be ever renewed, and calamities and misfortunes naturally cease. May the Valley Spirit embrace the wondrous, and the Supreme Dao bestow its grace. In all actions and thoughts, may they all receive primordial auspiciousness. Then may the three paths and six destinies, all sentient beings, have the waves of the sea of suffering stilled and the flames of the furnace of craving quelled. May the true wind spread widely, and the rain of kindness universally moisten. May all fully realize the stages of the Dao and attain the fruits of the Real.

Thus we burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely host of masters and the virtues of the Perfected. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Salutation to the Directions

Repentance

**Pacing the Void**

The Great Dao’s Master is profound and quiescent,
Ascended immortals and friends, Wu Ying.
The Noble Scion transmits the numinous talisman,
The Great One bears the Cavern Scripture.
The śarīra radiates golden splendor,
The dragon chariot swiftly arrives to welcome.
The Heavenly Worthy gazes upon the cloud-borne carriage,
Soaring lightly through the void.
Incense and flowers drift like flying snow,
Mystic vapors flourish upon the dark beams.

**Three Invocations, Three Bows**

We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
To the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reiterating the Dharma Titles**

Disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mystic Capital, your servants [names],
Humbly and earnestly reaffirm our devotion, reverently invoking:
The Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin;
The Supreme Lord of the Great Dao;
The Supreme Lord Lao;
The Most High Mystic Elder;
The Boundless Great Dao of the Ten Directions and the Host of Sages of Virtue and Power;
The Heavenly Worthies and Perfected;
The August Thearchs and Heavenly Emperors;
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
The Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
The High Ministers and Prime Ministers;
The Four Officiants and Five Emperors;
The Perfected Immortals who attained the Dao in the sacred mountains and grotto-heavens;
All responsive and perceptive spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have heard that the Compassionate Worthy of the Golden Portal and the August Sage of the Jade Capital,
First spread transformation amidst primordial chaos,
And after countless kalpas, welcomed the true.
Opening the ninety thousand Dharma gates, a ladder for all beings;
Revealing the profound purport of the Three Vehicles, drawing forth the benighted and lost.

We, your servants, contemplate the true essence and open our hearts to the sacred canon,
Aspiring to propagate the sagely intent to bless all sentient beings.
Your disciples [names] reflect with reverence upon the nine generations of ancestral spirits in darkness,
And the six relations bound in deluded consciousness.
From past kalpas to this present life,
We have indulged the six emotions and pursued the three karmic actions,
Violating the wondrous teachings of the Five Constants,
Accumulating deep transgressions in the Four Great Elements.
Our sins inscribed in the Black Book,
Our spirits confined in the nether courts.
Wind-blades and water-fires examine past wrongs,
Frost and ice in the night courts detain us in evil destinies.
For countless kalpas, we have not beheld the light,
Wandering in the abyssal springs, enduring every suffering.
Without the great sagely aid, there is no means of deliverance.

Of old, the Heavenly Worthy, in vast compassion, took pity on all beings.
Expounding the Dharma through the Eight Gates, the Eight Sufferings were thereby dispelled;
Radiating the Ninefold Light, the Nine Nether Realms were thereby opened and prospered.
Emboldened by this intent, we dare to pour forth our sincere devotion,
Earnestly beseeching the imperial altar, secretly imploring the mystic grace.
Burning incense and practicing the Dao, we repent our sins and beg for mercy.

We humbly pray that the sagely gaze may descend and the divine radiance universally illumine,
That all may be cleansed and behold the luminous splendor.
May ten thousand sins be purged, and we bathe in the gardens of Vermilion Mound;
May the five spirits undergo refinement, and we roam freely in the heavens of Cinnabar and Huo.
May blessings and benefits be manifest in the present,
And all attain purity and auspiciousness.
May the karmic hindrances of [name] be eradicated,
And virtuous deeds flourish.
May wisdom be complete and perfect,
Body and mind purified.
May our names be inscribed on the Cinnabar Terrace,
And our years increased in the Azure Register.
May all our relations equally partake of the Dharma’s nectar.

Above, we pray that the jade charts of imperial enterprise surpass the Three and Five in majesty;
That the sagely sovereign of the Golden Portal transmit boundless blessings through myriad generations.
May the flames of border beacons be extinguished,
And distant frontiers return to benevolence.
May the hundred grains flourish in abundance,
And the Three Luminaries shine brightly.
May propitious clouds and auspicious dew envelop heaven and earth in omens;
May steeds of blessing and chariots of jade emerge from mountains and rivers in celebration.

Extending to all beings and creatures,
The nether gates and dark passes,
All forms of life, whether moving or still,
And all destinies, whether flying or sinking,
From the Nine Abysses below to the myriad heavens above,
May all equally receive the vast compassion and together ascend to ultimate bliss.

Above, the boundless grace of the Heavenly Worthy is made manifest;
Below, it accords with the sincere devotion of your servants.
We reverently present this petition.

**Vows**

First, may the Great Dao flow freely, and all under heaven embrace virtue.
Second, may all sentient beings awaken to the Dao.
Third, may the sorrowful souls of the Nine Nights all attain liberation.
Fourth, may the orphaned and unattached spirits all receive rebirth.
Fifth, may the world know great peace, and the five grains ripen in abundance.
Sixth, may ministers be loyal and children filial, rulers benevolent and fathers kind.
Seventh, may the four seas be united, and enmity and kinship be reconciled.
Eighth, may those in hidden wombs and eggs all be born and grow.
Ninth, may chronic and recent illnesses swiftly be healed.
Tenth, may the destitute and exposed be clothed and fed.

**Replenishing the Censer**

Incense Officials and Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, the Attending Incense Spirits,
At this place where your servants practice the Dao and ascend the altar,
May golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms naturally arise.
May the hundred numinous Perfected gather here,
Before the incense burner.
May your disciples, living and deceased, receive blessings,
And the state and family be graced with favor.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions,
Guard the incense smoke and transmit the petitions just presented,
Directly to the presence of the Most True, Boundless Great Dao, the Jade Thearch and Supreme Emperor.

**Exiting the Chamber**

Here concludes the sixth fascicle of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

**Fascicle Seven of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*
Compiled by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting**

**Third Day at Dawn: Circumambulating the Dao**

**Entering the Chamber**
Each performs the rites, visualizing the masters as prescribed.
**Invoking the Protective Spirits**

Celestial scriptures spread in array, gazing down upon the Grand Tenuity.
Primal transformation gives rise to all,
Nine-fold coils of numinous smoke.
Eight luminaries and six revolutions,
Sustained by the sagely course.
To the left, the Vermilion Quarter receives the guests;
To the right, the Imperial Gates swing open.
Eastern Florescence and Southern Palace,
Refine and purge all that is false.
The wheeling sun casts its gaze,
The turning moon radiates its glow.
Today is a day of great celebration,
Myriad Ways converge as one.
The true *qi* of the numinous altar
Preserves Heaven from decline.
Proclaimed throughout the Three Realms,
Swift as dragons borne on the wind.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

O Most Supreme Three Heavens, Primal Origin, Three *Qi* of the Great Supreme Venerable Lord Lao,
Summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officers,
The Left and Right Envoys,
The Left and Right Incense-Bearing Dragon Couriers,
The Golden Lads Attending Incense,
The Jade Maidens Transmitting Words,
The Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants,
The Incense Officials of the Day—
Each thirty-six in number—emerge.
Now summon the local earth deities and territorial spirits,
The true officials and rightful gods,
To swiftly prepare and open the gates.

We now burn incense,
Offering it on behalf of so-and-so, for the state and the family,
As we undertake the supreme *Yellow Register* grand fast for so many days and nights.
On this third day at dawn, we ascend the altar,
Burn incense, and circumambulate the Dao.
May the primal *qi* of the Most High’s ten directions and true Perfected
Descend and flow into our bodies,
That our petitions swiftly reach the presence of the Most True, Boundless Great Dao,
The Jade Thearch and Supreme Emperor.

**Each Declares Their Dharma Rank**

Disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mystic Capital,
With one heart, we reverently address the Void and Spontaneous,
The Primal Origin Heavenly Worthy,
The Boundless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao,
The Great Sagely Ancestor, Highest Great Dao, Golden Portal, Chaos-Uniting Heavenly Sovereign Thearch,
The Supreme Venerable Lord Lao,
The Highest Jade Thearch,
The Perfected and Sages of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao,
The Lords and Elders of the Myriad Realized,
The Thirty-Six Heavenly Thearchs,
The Jade Tenuity Thearch,
The Jade Thearch and Grand Thearch,
Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection,
Mystic Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Portal, Seven Treasures, Mystic Terrace,
Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace,
The Numinous Treasure, Most True, Radiant August Dao Lord,
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
The Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Center,
The True Lord of Life, Minister of the Eastern Marchmount,
The King of Total Perfection of the Western Culmination,
The Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lower Teaching,
The numinous palaces of the Five Marchmounts,
The grotto-heavens of the famous mountains,
The realized immortals and divine transcendents,
The true numina of the Three Realms.

We prostrate ourselves, having heard:
The Great Vastness merges in unity,
The Most True settles in stillness.
The Primal Honored One nurtures transformation,
The Great Dao governs Heaven.
Exalting the mysterious workings that do not act,
Unlocking the secret bolt of long life.
Principles emerge in the realm of response and welcome,
Teachings endure since eons past.
Universally delivering all beings,
Greatly propagating numinous transformation.

We, your disciples, have long relied on fortune’s favor,
Born with a foundation of tranquility.
Having received the numinous writs,
We uphold and follow the wondrous decrees.
Establishing merit and practicing the teachings,
We prioritize aiding the state.
Whatever we pray for,
It is fitting to present in petition.
Now, following the edict,
We dare to make this known.

**Reading the Petition**

As the words declare,
We deeply cultivate and offer.
Reverently for the state and family,
Universally for the living and deceased,
We bow our heads to the Mystic Void,
Our hearts earnest and sincere.
May what ought to be drawn forth
Be conveyed to fulfill our prayers.

Thus, we dare to follow the mystic statutes,
Establishing the *Yellow Register* fast.
Adopting the ranks of the Lower Primordial,
Unfolding the sacred texts of the Upper Sages.
Refining and bathing body and spirit,
Diligently observing the fast.
On this dawn of circumambulating the Dao,
We invite the Dharma assembly
To offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly to offer reverence to the Most Supreme, Most True Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives,
Prostrating ourselves,
Looking up to the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May these merits
Ascend to aid the august spirits of our ancestral temples,
Attaining the ranks of the Great Void,
Dwelling in the Mystic Culmination.
May the Emperor’s purple chambers continue sagely rule,
His cinnabar palace face the Primal Origin.
Welcoming the lords of the realm in the land of Hua,
Embracing the myriad regions in benevolence and longevity.
May the Empress manifest the Four Virtues,
Safeguarding the Six Palaces.
May the mountains and rivers form the Son of Heaven’s domain,
The bedrock secure the state of the dynastic ministers.
May the dukes, marquises, ministers, and assistants,
The officials within and without,
All affairs be true,
All beings receive blessings.

For this, we burn incense,
Taking refuge in the Great Sages, the Perfected,
Whose virtue, after attaining the Dao,
Ascends to merge with the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

On this dawn of circumambulating the Dao,
We invite the Dharma assembly
To offer the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly to offer reverence to the Most Supreme, Most True Treasure of the Scriptures.

We dedicate our bodies and lives,
Prostrating ourselves,
Looking up to the Venerable Scriptures of the Most High.
May these merits
Flow to the nine generations of our family’s hidden souls,
The six relations’ lingering consciousness.
In the Northern Palace, release the *po* souls;
In the Southern Palace, refine the spirit.
Bathe in the Pool of Flowing Fire,
Ranked in the Hall of Flying Fragrance.
Reborn in the Pure Land,
Transformed in the Jasper Capital.

For this, we burn incense,
Taking refuge in the Great Sages, the Perfected,
Whose virtue, after attaining the Dao,
Ascends to merge with the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

On this dawn of circumambulating the Dao,
We invite the Dharma assembly
To offer the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly to offer reverence to the Most Supreme, Most True Treasure of the Masters.

We dedicate our bodies and lives,
Prostrating ourselves,
Looking up to the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May these merits
Bestow blessings upon the state and family.
May our kin and relatives
All receive abundant grace.
Bathed in the numinous stream to nurture longevity,
Rinsed with jasper nectar to calm the spirit.
May myriad virtues converge,
A hundred numina together guard.
Encompassing all ranks,
Universally reaching the four kinds of beings.
Wherever the sagely grace touches,
May all ascend to the true Dao.

For this, we burn incense,
Taking refuge in the Great Sages, the Perfected,
Whose virtue, after attaining the Dao,
Ascends to merge with the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

**Worshiping the Directions**
**Confession**

**Pacing the Void**

We bow our heads to the Golden Gates,
Hand in hand we roam the Jade Capital.
The soaring trees encircle the Garden of Rounded Light,
The Seven Treasures’ Grove shines resplendent.
Three hundred celestial beasts by name,
Lions vast as ten thousand *xun*.
Flying dragons pace and chant,
Divine phoenixes sing in measured harmony.
A numinous breeze fans wondrous blossoms,
Pure fragrance scatters upon our robes.
Without the talent of lofty immortals,
How could we indulge such a heart?

**Three Invocations**
**Three Bows**

We, your servants, with utmost sincerity prostrate ourselves in reverence,
To the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity prostrate ourselves in reverence,
To the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity prostrate ourselves in reverence,
To the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reverently Reciting the Dignities**

We, disciples of the Supreme Mystery and Mystic Capital, your servants [names],
do hereby solemnly and earnestly invoke:
The Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning,
The Supreme Great Dao Lord,
The Supreme Lord Lao,
The Celestial Worthies of the Ten Directions’ Boundless Great Dao and Virtue,
The Most Perfect Celestial Emperor,
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
The Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm,
The High Ministers and Prime Chancellors,
The Four Offices and Five Emperors,
The Responsive and Perceptive of the Three Realms,
And all true numina.

We have heard:
There is a thing formed in chaos,
Preceding heaven and earth in its traces;
Its ceaseless circulation illumines alongside sun and moon.
It drums the six *qi* in the Void,
Fans the eight winds across the vast expanse.
It engenders and completes all beings,
Nurtures and enfolds all living things.
From ancient times to the present,
It has stabilized households and succored states.
We, inheriting the transformative power of the Dao,
Have long borne its profound merit.
Seeking to repay ruler and kin,
Nothing precedes this fast and vigil.

We reflect with reverence:
The countless past lives,
And present karmic bonds of our kin,
Have accumulated transgressions before the Three Officials,
And amassed faults in the Nine Realms.
Unpardoned, they remain bound in dark confinement.
Following the canonical rites,
We refine our sincerity to venerate this blessing.

We humbly pray:
May the perfected immortals gather in abundance,
May numinous grace extend afar.
May the Five Emperors, Four Offices,
Three Officials, and Nine Bureaus,
Their majestic radiance descending to illuminate,
Open the path to deliver our divine forms.
For all past and present transgressions,
In body, speech, and mind,
By this blessed aid,
May they all be washed away.

Our highest愿:
May the august spirits of our ancestral temples
Ascend to the Azure Heavens.
May the sagely body be harmonious and at ease,
The imperial Dao resplendent and clear.
May the written script and axle-widths unite,
China and the barbarians dwell in tranquility.
May frontier beacons remain unlit,
Border watchtowers free from peril.
May the hundred grains flourish,
The Three Luminaries shine bright and serene.
May outer vassals and inner screens,
Loyal ministers and meritorious officials,
All assist in fostering harmony,
Eternally glorifying the sagely destiny.

Then may the Nine Dark Springs,
The Six Paths and Three Ways,
All crawling, flying, sinking, and floating beings,
Ascend to the realm of the Dao.
Above, may the radiant Celestial Worthy’s vast compassion be manifest;
Below, may our sincerity in taking refuge be fulfilled.

We reverently make this petition known.

**Generating the Resolve**

First resolve: For the Dao,
The four great elements unite in virtue.
May the donor’s seven generations of parents
Be spared from falling into sorrow and suffering,
Ascend to the Heavenly Halls,
And enjoy sustenance by nature.

Second resolve: For the emperor and sovereign,
May the transformative power of the Dao flourish.
May academies and schools thrive,
The imperial teachings expand.
May majestic decorum be revered,
The world gaze in awe.
May the people proclaim great peace,
The four barbarians submit.
May evil and malevolence vanish of themselves,
Sages and worthies arise daily.

Third resolve: For the Dharma Master,
May great merit be established.
May teachings be clear and far-reaching,
All attain the flight of immortals.

Fourth resolve: For fellow aspirants,
May they swiftly attain the immortal Dao,
And mutually guide one another.

Fifth resolve: For the harmony of the nine relations,
May they esteem benevolence and righteousness,
Value the Dao and scorn wealth,
Their conduct a model for all.

Sixth resolve: To diminish the self,
To bestow alms upon Daoist priests and the hungry and cold.
May all people under heaven
Each find their rightful place.

Seventh resolve: For crawling and creeping beings,
May all sentient beings
Be perfected and accomplished.

Eighth resolve: To pardon past lives’ karmic retributions in this present existence,
To establish merit and redress transgressions.

Ninth resolve: For the prosperity of family and state,
May ancestral temples have descendants,
The world produce worthy talent.

Tenth resolve: To honor and receive the scriptural masters,
Never daring to slacken in equanimity.
With one heart, broadly deliver all,
Attain the rank of superior immortals,
Ascend to heaven in broad daylight,
Pay homage to the Supreme,
Eternally become perfected beings,
Riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages.
Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

**Returning to the Censer**

The Incense Official Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all the Attending Incense Spirits—may they cause the places where I perform the Dao to naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred spirits and assembled perfected beings gather here before the incense burner. Humbly I pray that the living and the dead, the household and the state, receive blessings, and that the ten directions be suffused with grace.

May the jade lads and maidens attend the incense smoke, conveying and presenting all that I have just petitioned, directly to the presence of the Most Perfect, Boundless, and Great Dao—the Jade Emperor Supreme.

[Exiting the chamber]

*End of the Seventh Scroll of the* **Highest Clarity Yellow Register Retreat Rites**
*Beginning of the Eighth Scroll of the* **Highest Clarity Yellow Register Retreat Rites**

*Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang, the Vast Accomplishment*

**Third Day: Midday Procession of the Dao**

[Entering the chamber]
Each pays homage to the master, contemplating the visualization as prescribed.

**Guarding the Spirits**
The Primordial Sovereign of the Void, gathering qi, abides at the center.
The Three Realms stretch into profound obscurity,
Giving rise to the vault of heaven.
Seven revolutions and nine voids,
Merging with the whirling winds.
Transforming into ten thousand spirits,
Heaven and earth open and connect.
On this auspicious day, the procession of the Dao proceeds,
Myriad demons pay reverent homage.
The radiance of dawn shines brightly,
Silently enacting the primal work.

Holding the staff and raising the banner,
Scattering flowers into the vast sky.
The ten directions universally rejoice,
The kalpas’ turning knows no end.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

The Most High Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Three Qi, Supreme Venerable Lord Lao, summon forth from within us, our thirty-six attendants of the Three and Five Merit Officers, the left and right official messengers, the left and right incense-bearing dragon-riding couriers, the Golden Lads attending incense, the Jade Maidens transmitting words, and the thirty-six incense officials of the Five Thearchs’ direct registers and appointed days. Let the local earth deities and territorial true officials swiftly emerge to open the passes.

We now, in this very moment, burn incense and perform the Dao-procession, dedicating it to such-and-such an official or such-and-such a person, for the state and for the household, in the offering of the Most High Yellow Register Grand Fast for so many days and nights. On this third day’s midday ascent to the altar to pay homage to the Perfected and perform the Dao-procession, may we receive the life-generating qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions’ true and correct Perfected, descending into our bodies, that our prayers swiftly ascend and directly reach the presence of the Jade Thearch of the Supreme Dao, the Limitless Great Dao.

Each declares their dharma-rank:

Disciples of the Mysterious Capital of Supreme Purity, we, so-and-so and others, reverently and with unified sincerity, address the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous, the Limitless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Highest August Thearch of the Golden Watchtower, the Mysterious Primordial Heavenly Sovereign, the Supreme Venerable Lord Lao, the Highest Jade Thearch, the great holy and perfected hosts of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Heavenly Lords, the Jade Void Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Florescence and Southern Culmen, the Western Numinous and Northern Perfected, the Mysterious Capital and Jade Metropolis, the Golden Watchtower and Seven-Jewel Mysterious Terrace, the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure’s Perfected Radiant August Lord of the Dao, the thirty-six divisions of the venerable scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the True Lord of Life and Minister of the Eastern Marchmount, the King of Total Perfection of the Western Ultimate, the twenty-four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lesser Teaching, the numinous palaces of the Five Marchmounts, the grotto-heavens of the famous mountains, and the perfected transcendents of the Three Realms who respond to invocations.

We prostrate and have heard: the Supreme Dao is profoundly empty, its mysterious workings congeal in stillness. It embraces the ten thousand images, nurtures the hundred spirits. Its grace extends to the living and the dead, its benevolence embraces household and state. By the kindness of masters and companions, we have received transmission of the utmost Perfected. We ought to assist the state in establishing merit, delivering people and rescuing beings. In all our prayers and supplications, how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
In accordance with the petition’s intent, we earnestly cultivate reverence. We repay the nurturing kindness of heaven and earth, reciprocate the beneficent gifts of the state. Above, we dedicate this to the nine generations; broadly, we extend it to all beings. We offer jade disks to express our sincerity, prepare incense and flowers to demonstrate our faith. Our minds are solely devoted and pure, hoping to attain resonance and communion.

We reverently follow the Yellow Register’s scriptural texts and the numinous transcendents’ ritual codes. We concentrate our spirits at the cinnabar watchtower, contemplate the Purple Tenuity in profound meditation. We arrange the altar’s array, turn our hearts to entreat the mandate. We humbly pray that the ninefold radiance may shine from afar, that the ten thousand sages may bestow their compassion. May they take pity on and witness our sincere devotion, broadly bestowing vast blessings.

On this midday performance of the Dao-procession, we, the assembly of dharma-practitioners, now offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the sky, directly offering reverence to the Most High and Utmost Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Supreme. May this merit, above, benefit the august spirits of the nine ancestral temples and the ancestral sages of the imperial lineage. May they ascend to the Jade Watchtower of Primordial Purity, shed their forms in the Jasper Palace. May the Emperor’s virtue extend to the eight seas, his longevity equal the Five Marchmounts. May his precious chart grow ever more secure, his jade calendar ever more prolonged. May the consorts and six palaces receive the splendor of Hua and divine protection. May the princes and crown princes be blessed with extended years. May the marquises, earls, dukes, ministers, and worthy assistants assist in perfecting the sagely transformation, aiding and supporting the imperial enterprise.

Now, therefore, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Master Venerables, whose virtue is most perfect. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the True.

At this midpoint of the ritual, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer this second pinch of incense. May its fragrant smoke rise to the heavens, directly ascending to make offering to the Supreme and Most Perfect Sutra-Treasure. We prostrate ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Supreme. May this merit flow back to the nine generations of ancestors and all departed spirits of such-and-such a family. May their records of transgression be stricken from the registers of Fengdu, their souls refined in the Southern Flame. Calamities dissolve across kalpas, forever transcending the realm of the Five Sufferings; sins vanish without end, opening the path to deliverance from the Four Delusions. Those who suffer in the cold courts of night shall all behold the radiant light.

Now, therefore, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Master Venerables, whose virtue is most perfect. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the True.

At this midpoint of the ritual, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer this third pinch of incense. May its fragrant smoke rise to the heavens, directly ascending to make offering to the Supreme and Most Perfect Master-Treasure. We prostrate ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Supreme. May this merit confer blessings upon such-and-such a family and all their kin. May their years be inscribed on the Tortoise Terrace, their longevity extended in the Phoenix Register. The clouds of the Five Turbidities disperse, the mists of the Four Demons vanish. Blessings extend without limit, misfortunes cease before they take form. May it extend to all beings, encompassing every sentient existence. May all escape the fruits of samsara, ascending together to the realm of wealth and longevity.

Now, therefore, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of Master Venerables, whose virtue is most perfect. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the True.

We complete the rites and make our repentance.

**The Hymn of Pacing the Void**

We array our Nine-Dragon Chariot,
Riding the void in carefree flight.
The Eight Heavens lie like palm and fingers,
The Six Directions—how could they be distant?
The host of perfected ones chant the Mystic Profound,
The Most High sings the pure hymn.
Incense and blossoms scatter on the wind,
Jade tones ascend to form the Purple Empyrean.
The Five Sufferings shatter in an instant,
The Eight Difficulties dissolve like sparse scripture.
Wondrous is the Garden of Numinous Treasure,
Raising this great Dharma Bridge.

**Three Invocations, Three Bows**
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Supreme Boundless Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Declaring Rank and Title**
The disciple of the Supreme Clarity and Mystic Capital, your servant [Name], together with others of like devotion, humbly and with one heart petitions the Supreme Boundless Dao, the Three Supreme Ones, the Ten Directions’ Great Sages, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm, the Prime Ministers and High Chancellors, the Four Offices and Five Emperors, the officials and attendants of the Three Realms, and all revered spirits.

We have been bathed in the Mystic Merit,
Reverently receiving the transformation of the Dao.
Master and disciple open the path to salvation,
Imbibing and bearing the precious texts.
The Jade Scriptures of the Three Caverns,
The Secret Registers of the Nine Clarities—
The principles of delivering the world and long life,
The writings of ascending to heaven and enduring vision.
We ought to raise our aspirations to misty cliffs,
To nest our spirits in numinous valleys.
We vow to soar aloft,
Renouncing the dust’s confusion to tread the lofty path,
Yet we have not been able to purify our hearts in the Grotto Palaces,
To conceal our light among the forests and springs.
Our actions touch upon transgressions,
As though treading thin ice while pledging our first vows,
Bound to deliver others.
We assist the state and establish merit,
Upholding the Mystic Teachings above.
For every prayer and aspiration,
We now dare to lay bare our plea.

[Name] seeks to repay the profound kindness of sovereign and parents,
And hopes for the nation’s and family’s purity and peace.
With sincere devotion, we await the descent of great blessings.
Lamps, candles, incense, and blossoms
Express our sincerity to the Three Realms.
Silken offerings and Dharma tokens
Convey our pleas to the myriad heavens.
We implore the Great Sages and Lofty Ones
To turn their compassionate gaze upon us.
Command the Three Officials, Five Emperors,
Nine Bureaus, and Four Offices
To unlock the hidden gates of springs and dark prisons,
To absolve the long-suffering souls of the Yellow Springs.
Let the nine generations of ancestral spirits
All emerge from the depths of darkness,
Bathed in the numinous streams,
Roaming freely upon the celestial paths.
May the Ten Immortals draw them forth,
The host of sages serve as their bridge.
Awakening to the Dao, hearing the scriptures,
They shall forever transcend birth and death.
May [Name]’s family, kin, and relations
Enjoy boundless blessings.
All who receive this beneficent grace
Shall be blessed with primal fortune.
May heaven spare them from exile and conscription,
May their oaths remain unbroken as ice.
May ghostly calamities cease their flow,
May earth annul their ledgers of judgment.
In the hells of Mount Feng,
At the gates of Mount Tai’s Yellow Springs,
May lawsuits not arise,
May blessings and descendants know peace.
Above, may wind and rain be bright and clear,
Sun and moon steadfast in their splendor.
May heaven display auspicious stars,
May people be free from plague and blight.
May the sagely reign endure,
The great enterprise flourish.
May the hundred grains ripen in abundance,
The five weapons be stilled.
May the times be harmonious, customs prosperous,
Nation wealthy, family at peace.
In the Nine Nights and Three Paths,
All sentient beings
Shall receive the wondrous teachings,
Together attaining the formless.
Above, may the Heavenly Worthy’s vast salvation be manifest,
Below, may our humble devotion be answered.

**Petitioning the Vows**

First vow: May the Great Dao
Abide in tranquil emptiness,
Dwelling in serene stillness,
Clearing all to reside in purity.
May it widely open the gates of Dharma,
Instructing the stubborn and foolish.
All shall receive its beneficent grace,
Cultivating diligently with devotion.
May all fellow students
Together ascend to the void,
Preserving harmony with heaven,
Abiding forever without sorrow.

Second vow: May the myriad heavens
Congeal qi in clarity,
Vast and boundless in their embrace,
Preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the climate be harmonious,
The four seasons balanced in peace.
May the nation be secure, the people prosperous,
The world universally at peace.
May all be broadly delivered,
The beneficence reach all beings.
May heaven be preserved for eternity,
Unshaken through kalpas uncounted.

Third vow: May the earth
Bear its boundless load,
Stable and unshaken,
Seas and abysses uncollapsed.
May it protect and secure the nation,
The multitudes flourishing in accord.
Nurturing life, comforting the dead,
Its grace extending to the ten directions.
May crops and plants thrive,
Commerce and enterprise daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant support,
All things following in harmony.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon,
The two luminaries, shine on high,
Free from eclipse or dimming,
Their waxing and waning serene.
May their light illumine the heavens,
Dispelling all darkness and gloom.
May they safeguard the kalpas’ passage,
The world’s destiny peaceful.
May their moistening grace be universal,
Bestowing blessings upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars
Shine with brilliance equal to the sun,
Their revolving torches illuminating,
Radiant across the ten directions.
May each hold its proper place,
Their paths straight and true.
May they protect and secure the nation,
Free from calamity or harm.
May the four seas be united in peace,
The world universally flourishing.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons
Follow their appointed course,
Their climates harmonious and balanced,
Free from disaster or affliction.
May pestilence and plague vanish,
The world universally at peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance,
Nation wealthy, people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds
Congeal qi and gather mist,
Soaring high and settling in clarity,
Shading the profound and mysterious.
In concealment, they abide in non-action,
In dispersion, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and perfected ones dwell together,
Forming friendships with the host of transcendents.
May their grace flow to all,
Nurturing the nation and cherishing the people.
May they broadly deliver all beings,
People and kalpas sharing longevity.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain
Flow and scatter without end,
Universally bestowing their bounty,
Nurturing all growth.
May the myriad things flourish,
Nation’s stores and people’s wealth abundant.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks
Each abide in its proper place,
Towering and encompassing,
Ever serving as palaces of immortals.
May they secure the nation’s destiny,
Preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all,
None who do not revere them as their foundation.

Tenth vow: May the vast seas
Stretch boundlessly,
Containing and embracing all,
Nurturing even the tiniest life.
Profound and gentle in their grace,
Moistening all crawling and creeping things.
May heaven and humanity receive blessings,
Their years enduring like the kalpas’ stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor
See his lands daily prosper,
The four frontiers at peace,
Weapons of war stilled.
May heaven and humanity sing in praise,
Auspicious omens soaring forth.
May teachings be widely spread,
Transformative virtue overflowing.
May the multitudes rejoice,
Their joy unending.

Twelfth vow: May all crawling and creeping things,
Born and unborn,
All receive safety,
Universally attain life and growth.
May they all behold the primal qi,
Assuming forms of sinew and bone.
May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests
Not wither through winter.
May all be delivered,
None not flourishing in fresh glory.

Harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the True.

Once more at the incense burner, may the Fragrant Palace Attendants, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all spirit-officials of incense-watching cause the places where this servant treads the Dao to spontaneously yield golden liquor, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred numinous perfected and all assembled immortals gather here before the incense burner. Humbly we pray that the living and the dead alike receive blessings, and that both family and state be graced with favor. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the rising incense smoke, conveying this servant’s supplications directly to the Most High Jade Emperor of the Boundless Dao before the Throne.

Exiting the chamber
*End of the Eighth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites*
*Beginning of the Ninth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites*
Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang Guangcheng

Third Day: Twilight Procession of the Dao
Entering the chamber
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed

Guardian Spirits
The Seven Spirits of Mysterious Yin, the Nine Qi uniting in form,
Soul-essence and spirit-brilliance, the Two Radiant Ones revolving in their cycles.
Flying light blazes resplendent, everlasting splendor unfading;
Sun and moon pour forth their radiance, converging in blossoming glory.
The Great Brahma’s influence spreads wide, fire-bells soaring in flight.
Demon-kings receive their charge, journeying to the imperial capital in audience.
All beings universally succored, vast kindness extended to the hidden and dark.
Jade scriptures proclaimed, myriad joys ascending in exultation.
The Dharma drum resounds twenty-four times.

The Most High Three Heavens’ Primordial Origin and Three Qi, Supreme Lord Lao,
Summon forth from within us, our attendants:
The Three and Five Merit Officials, Left and Right Envoys,
Left and Right Incense-Bearers, Dragon-Messenger Couriers,
Incense-Attending Golden Youths, Jade Maidens of Transmission,
True Talismans of the Five Thearchs, and the Day-Officers of Incense—
thirty-six of each, emerge.
At this moment, summon the local earth deities and territorial spirits,
the true officials and proper divinities, to swiftly depart and present their reports.
We now, in this act of burning incense, dedicate ourselves on behalf of Official So-and-So and Person So-and-So,
for state and family, in the performance of the Most High Yellow Register Grand Retreat for such-and-such days and nights.
On this third day, at twilight, ascending the altar to pay homage to the Perfected and perform the Dao,
we pray that the life-qi of the Most High’s Ten Directions’ True Perfected may descend and flow into our bodies,
that our petitions may swiftly reach the presence of the Peerless Great Dao, the Jade Emperor, the Supreme Lord of the Most High.

Each declares their dharma rank:
Disciples of the Upper Clarity Mysterious Capital, we, your subjects,
humbly and with one heart, reverently address the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy,
the Peerless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao,
the Sacred Ancestor, the August Emperor of the Golden Watchtower Mysterious Origin Heavenly Thearch,
the Supreme Lord Lao, the August Jade Emperor,
the Perfected and Sages of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao,
the Lords and Elders of the Myriad Perfected,
the Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors,
the Jade Void Emperor, the Jade Emperor, the Supreme Emperor,
the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern True, and Mysterious Capital Jade Metropolis,
the Golden Watchtower Seven-Treasured Mysterious Terrace, the Purple Tenuity Upper Palace,
the Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Lord of the Dao,
the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center,
the Eastern Minister of Fate, the Supreme Perfected of the Great Origin,
the Western Culmen Lord of Total Perfection,
the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lower Teaching,
the Sacred Palaces of the Five Marchmounts, the Divine Immortals who have attained the Dao,
and all responsive and perceptive Perfected of the Three Realms.

We have heard that the vast and subtle Great Dao
embraces the Three Realms to congeal the Perfected;
the boundless and profound Mysterious Wind
crowns the myriad dharmas to bestow transformation.
By good fortune, we have received blessed favor and obtained the precious scriptures:
Dragon Script of the Three Realms, Phoenix Seal of the Eight Heavens.
We command and summon, invoking the Perfected and descending the numinous.
Yet we have not been able to retreat to secluded groves, renew ourselves, and ascend in deliverance;
thus, we should proclaim and expound the wondrous teachings, spreading the Dharma’s sound.
Above, we assist the emperor, universally blessing the seas and lands.
In all our aspirations, dare we not make this known above?

Reading the Petition:
In accordance with the petition’s words, its meaning profound, we reverently offer it.
Above, for state and family, we pray for the descent of blessings and auspiciousness.
Presenting the petition with sincerity, we lay bare our hearts to entreat the mandate.
Exhausting our cinnabar sincerity in the lower realm, we look up to the myriad sages in the upper mystery.

We, leading the Dharma assembly, follow the scriptures’ intent,
purifying our spirits and quieting our thoughts, focusing our minds on the subtle and imperceptible.
We have established the retreat altar, turning the scriptures and performing the Dao.
At this twilight performance of the Dao, we invite the Dharma assembly
to offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most High Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
We surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground,
looking up to the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May this merit, above, benefit the ancestral temples and former sages, the august spirits of the altars of soil and grain.
May they repose in the Mysterious Capital, their blessings flowing to the imperial pole.
May the jade charts endure forever, the great treasure flourish abundantly.
May the emperor’s sagely virtue abide in the imperial residence, as enduring as heaven and earth.
May his years surpass the Song and Hua mountains, his beneficence vast as the deep blue sea.
May he join hands with Cheng and Kang, lean upon Yao and Yu.
May the empress and consorts call forth blessings from the six palaces,
the various princes transmit the glory of the ten thousand chariots.
May court and countryside be loyal and steadfast, the frontier walls harmonious.
May the myriad officials and hundred ministers assist and support the grand foundation.
May all within the seas and lands together ascend the realm of longevity.

At this moment, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Perfected and Sages of our masters and teachers,
their virtue of having attained the Dao and ascended into the formless.
May we harmonize with the Dao and unite with the Perfected.

At this twilight performance of the Dao, we invite the Dharma assembly
to offer the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most High Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
We surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground,
looking up to the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the nine ancestors and seven generations of such-and-such a family,
and all the hidden and obscure spirits.
May they tread upon lotus pedestals, roam the divine immortal palaces.
May the Nine Dragons’ talismanic commands erase the records of sins in Fengdu;
may the Five Thearchs’ supervisory covenants inscribe their names in the jade tablets of life.
May they soar through the Three Realms, revolve through the Ten Floras.
May blessings be transmitted and prosperity perpetuated, their glory forever illuminating descendants.

At this moment, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Perfected and Sages of our masters and teachers,
their virtue of having attained the Dao and ascended into the formless.
May we harmonize with the Dao and unite with the Perfected.

At this twilight performance of the Dao, we invite the Dharma assembly
to offer the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most High Perfected Treasure of the Masters.
We surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground,
looking up to the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May this merit bless such-and-such a family, their kin and relations,
together ascending to superior goodness.
May their blessings rival the lofty mountains, their years equal the vast seas.
May they inherit the wind of loyalty and filial piety, call forth the beauty of warmth and reverence.
May all calamities cease, the myriad practices be cultivated.
May fellow students, perfected beings, the three masters and four companions,
all those with awareness, universally all sentient beings,
together bathe in the mysterious merit, all ascend the shore of blessings.

At this moment, we burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Perfected and Sages of our masters and teachers,
their virtue of having attained the Dao and ascended into the formless.
May we harmonize with the Dao and unite with the Perfected.

Homage to the Directions
Repentance

**Triple Invocation, Triple Bow**

To the Heavenly True Unity Palace of the Celestial Perfected,
radiant and resplendent in its crown of glory.
The Wheel of the Dharma turns in luminous order,
spiraling through empty space to enter the formless.
The August Sovereign strokes the clouds with pride,
while the host of Perfected recite the Cavern Scriptures.
Lofty Immortals stand in solemn praise,
preserving purity through endless kalpas.

We prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Ranks**

Disciples of the Supreme Mystery Metropolis, your servants [names],
with reverent sincerity, humbly re-invoke and supplicate:
the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning;
the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao;
the Supreme Lord Lao;
the Venerable Celestial Worthies of the Dao and its Power;
the Most True Great Emperor;
the Heavenly Thearch;
the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
the Jade Assistants and High Ministers;
the True Kings of the Four Poles;
the Five Emperors of the Three Realms;
the Grotto-Palaces of the Sacred Mountains;
all responsive and manifesting Perfected Spirits who answer according to karmic conditions.

By past good affinity, we have turned the wheel within the realm of the Dao.
Reverently receiving the Supreme Way, we have studied and embraced the Mystic Scriptures.
At the opening of the Primordial Charts, the numinous texts unfolded their teachings,
their blessings flowing to the ten thousand kinds, their spiritual signs manifesting in the five directions.
We have crossed the Mystic Ford, gazing upward to explore the profound mysteries.
Yet the celestial writ remains secret and weighty, its cultivation deep and subtle.
It is fitting to dwell in secluded mounds, refining the body in remote crags.
Yet we linger within the world, drifting through the dusty realm.
We aspire to establish meritorious deeds, repaying the celestial blessings,
aiding the people and assisting the state, bestowing fortune upon all beings.

Your disciples, reflecting upon past causes,
stretching back through accumulated kalpas—
the nine generations and seven ancestors,
all manner of karmic kin—
have accrued inner defilements through the three karmas,
and outer entanglements through the six senses.
The five sounds assail the ears,
the ten thousand things agitate the heart.
The nose delights in fragrance, the mouth savors fine delicacies,
the body indulges in splendor, the nature sinks into extravagance.
The eyes cling to forms, the mind strays into deviant realms.
The six dusts and six desires obstruct the gate of purity;
the ten sufferings and ten fetters sever the subtle root of the Dao.
Through these manifold transgressions, we remain mired in the three evil destinies.
Faults congeal into dense darkness, souls confined in endless night,
yet to receive pardon, still bound within the gates of darkness.

We have heard that the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning,
in great compassion, broadly delivers all.
His radiance pervades the three realms,
his gaze surveys the eight gates.
Witnessing the causes of sin and blessing,
he extends the statutes of salvation.
Thus, we present the Dharma tokens, establishing this sacred altar,
repenting of sins and praying for grace,
following the ranks of the numinous immortals;
reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao,
in accordance with the sacred writ of the Supreme Sages.
We pour forth our sincerity before the imperial altar,
focusing our minds upon the Mystic Ultimate.

We humbly beseech the Most True Great Sages,
the Supreme Dharma Kings,
to emit the five-colored divine light,
illuminating the nine dark hells.
To send down the nine-dragon talismanic decrees,
commanding the Three Officials
to deliver and rescue sinful souls,
freeing them from eternal night.
For the nine generations and seven ancestors of [name]’s family,
may they transcend the gates of the Yellow Springs.
May all karmic adversaries and roots of sin,
boundless and immeasurable,
those drifting in the three evil destinies,
those revolving in the six paths of rebirth,
all past retributions and present conditions,
be cleansed and purified.
May the nine kinds of kin and relations
together enjoy the causes of fortune.
May accumulated transgressions and infinite offenses
be dissolved and released,
all emerging from the bonds of desire.
May unmanifested disasters be dispelled,
and future blessings descend.
May longevity extend and blessings endure,
misfortunes vanish and calamities be removed.

Above, may the imperial enterprise flourish,
the royal domain endure for ages.
May mountains equal the Sage’s longevity,
the sun match the Sovereign’s wisdom.
May the six qi harmonize and the hundred grains ripen,
the Jade Candle be regulated and the Golden Mirror shine clear.
May ritual splendor illuminate all,
seas and mountains be tranquil.
May the Hua and Xia be at peace,
the stars and planets follow their courses.
May mountains, rivers, peaks, and streams,
all officials within and without,
protect the state and pacify the people,
