Let them, in solemn array, report to the Mysterious Altar’s Celestial Thearch and Divine Lords, urgently commanding this land’s local deities and true officials to ascend and receive the report.
This minister now, on behalf of the stated intent, performs the dawn’s *qi*-uniting and Dao-pursuing rites. May the Jade Clarity’s Dao *qi* and Numinous Treasure’s wondrous radiance descend, flowing into our bodies.
Thus shall the Mysterious Altar be purified, inner and outer made true.
Heaven freed of miasmic filth,
Earth cut off from demonic dust.
Jade chimes resound—
The Ten Directions grow solemn and clear.
No myriad demons shall intrude,
True sincerity ascends.
May this minister’s petition swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Most Perfect Jade Emperor.

**Each Declares Their Dharma Rank**
We, disciples of the Mysterious Capital of Supreme Clarity, jointly and sincerely petition the Self-So, Natural Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Boundless Great Dao’s Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Lofty Great Dao’s Golden Watchtower Mysterious Primordial Heavenly Thearch, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Thearch of the August Heaven, the Ten Directions’ Attained Great Sage Perfected Lords and Masters, the Thirty-Six Celestial Thearchs, the Jade Clarity Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Watchtower, Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace’s Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord, the Thirty-Six Divisions’ Venerable Scriptures, the Mysterious Center’s Great Dharma Masters, and all responsive and perceptive true numina of the Three Realms.
We prostrate and hear: the Great Dao’s proclamation spreads, the Three Powers establish their stations. Emperors set the ultimate standard, the Four Great Ones share equal reverence.

Thus are states inaugurated and lands governed, the multitudes shepherded and all beings tended. With regal tassels draped and screens of state behind, the sovereign presides over the myriad regions. Though sagely rule emulates Heaven, it must draw upon unseen aid; when times are harmonious and customs prosperous, it is truly by the work of numinous power. Therefore, we reverently observe the constant rites of suburban sacrifice and prepare the grand ceremonies of auspicious purification. Bearing Heaven and serving Earth, we manifestly honor the Supreme Mystery.

Now, as calamitous fate converges and adversity takes shape, we must pray for auspicious blessings to usher in peace and prosperity. So-and-so, such-and-such an official, deeply concerned for the sovereign and earnestly devoted to governing the realm, devoutly conducts purification rites and vigil, hoping to move the true numina. We, unworthy as we are in our offices of the Mysterious Bureau, deem it our duty to submit this memorial. Humbly receiving the imperial decree, how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the petition states, the matter concerns the altars of state and the fate of the realm. We feel the virtue of nurturing completion and bear the grace of encompassing sustenance. Without knocking at the Gate of Mystery, one cannot hope for radiant protection. Therefore, with solemn reverence and earnest devotion, we establish the imperial altar. Our hearts soar toward the Azure Vault, our prayers ascend to the Pure Capital.

At this dawn’s ritual, the assembly of Dharma-initiates and we raise the first incense pinch. May this fragrant smoke ascend to offer reverence to the Most High and Perfect Dao Treasure. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones of the Most High. May this merit flow to the august numina of the altars of state and the ancestral shrines of former sages, merging with the Mysterious Ultimate and feasting in the Cinnabar Terrace of Effulgent Light. In the Golden Watchtower and Jade Capital, we present the sagely designs to the Primordial Beginning; in the Jeweled Charts and Sacred Records, we extend great blessings to the divine descendants. When transformation prevails, seas will be calm and rivers clear; as blessings flow, Heaven will endure and Earth will last.

Now, we burn incense in devotion to the Great Sage Assembly of Master and Honored Ones, the virtue of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into formlessness, harmonizing with the true Dao.

At this dawn’s ritual, the assembly of Dharma-initiates and we raise the second incense pinch. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to offer reverence to the Most High and Perfect Scripture Treasure. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and look up in devotion to the Most High Venerable Scriptures. May this merit, above all, wish the emperor’s auspicious radiance to coalesce at the imperial throne and blessings to gather upon his sagely person. May he shine with the brightness of sun and moon, illuminating the ten thousand dwellings; may he emulate the virtue of Heaven and Earth, nurturing and sheltering all living beings. May the empress, consorts, and concubines gloriously uphold the great treasure; may the heir apparent and imperial princes harmoniously assist in the grand enterprise. May the ministers, officials, meritorious generals, and wise counselors—both civil and martial—together bring peace to the realm and its seas.

This day we kindle incense, surrendering body and life to the Great Sage Host of Venerable Masters, whose perfect virtue, having attained the Dao, preserves Heaven’s eternal abiding.

Harmony unites with the true Dao.

At this pure dawn of ritual practice, we invite the assembly of the Dharma to offer this three-pinch incense. May its fragrant smoke ascend through the void, directly upholding the Most High and Perfect Treasure of Masters. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves, and look up in devotion to the Three Supreme Masters. May this merit flow forth to the heavens above and below, to the Three Realms and Ten Directions, to the divine hosts of the Great Dao and all the sagely beings of the heavens.

We humbly pray for the stabilization and pacification of the imperial destiny, that the sagely dynasty be blessed with trust and protection. May their majesty shine with the awe of snow, frost, thunder, and lightning, rightly governing the seasons of spring, summer, autumn, and winter. May all things be nurtured and brought to fruition, while malevolent spirits and pernicious demons are vanquished. May calamities be swept away and the imperial lineage prolonged.

May the Five Sacred Peaks stand tall, the Eight Pillars remain steadfast. Ever encircling the imperial throne, may they eternally uphold the imperial pole. May the Nine Mysteries ascend and be delivered, and all beings revive in clarity. May the myriad multitudes enjoy peace and well-being, and weapons of war be stilled. May all creatures—whether soaring or sinking, endowed with consciousness—together partake in prosperity and uprightness.

This day we kindle incense, surrendering body and life to the Great Sage Host of Venerable Masters, whose perfect virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into the formless.

Harmony unites with the true Dao.

The rite is complete. We repent.

The "Threefold Invocation Hymn"

To take the Dharma as one’s wife,
To cherish the sutras as pearls and jade.
By upholding precepts, the six passions are restrained;
Through mindfulness of the Dao, desires are dispelled.
In purity, the true qi abides;
In serenity, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
And through every life, great blessings are received.

The Threefold Prostration
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reaffirming the Dharma Ranks
We, your disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mystic Capital, servants [Name] and others, with deepest sincerity, once more reverently invoke:
The Most High, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin;
The Most High Lord of the Great Dao;
The Most High Lord Lao;
The Perfect and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
The Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
The High Ministers and Prime Chancellors, the Four Directors and Five Emperors, and all the divine officials and spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, humbly recall:
The Three Venerables established the teachings, prioritizing sincerity and resonance;
The Supreme Sages transmitted the precepts, holding solemnity and reverence as their foundation.

Should we express our unadorned sincerity, it shall surely reach the august spirits.

We reflect that from the inception of creation to this very day, the sovereign cannot spread transformation without the people, nor can the people attain tranquility without the sovereign. The sovereign aligns with Heaven, and the king establishes the ultimate standard. How could they not draw upon the power of creation and rely upon divine efficacy? Only then can they transmit glory through generations and perpetuate blessings across the ages.

Since the primordial past, states and households have endured. Those who faithfully adhere to the principles of purity and quiescence are graced by the profound blessings of the Mysterious Origin. The Emperor, upholding Heaven’s mandate and grasping the cosmic order, has assumed the throne in accordance with destiny. Reverent, frugal, benevolent, and harmonious, he labors diligently over all affairs of state, ever more vigilant with each passing day. Yet even as he governs with ceaseless diligence, darkness and adversity still afflict the realm. Without recourse to the Supreme Dao, how could peace and deliverance be achieved?

The official [Name], long renowned for his great merit, redoubles his earnest devotion. Devoted to the sovereign and the state, he knows no rest. Thus, with utmost reverence, he prepares fragrant flowers, abundant offerings, and solemn pledges of faith. Laying bare his heart before the Three Realms, he bows in homage to the heavens. He exhausts his luminous sincerity, humbly beseeching auspicious protection.

May his crimson petition ascend, and the profound grace of the Mysterious descend. May the awe-inspiring power of transformation be bestowed, preserving the Emperor’s distant and enduring reign. Let the decree command the Nine Heavens, and the celestial hosts patrol the Eight Extremities. May wind and thunder sweep away the miasmic vapors, clearing the cosmos, and annihilate calamities to secure the altars of state. Let treacherous omens be purged, the sun and moon shine with steadfast clarity, and comets and baleful stars be driven away. May weapons of war melt like ice, rebellious ministers and their factions reform their hearts, and epidemic plagues and malevolent spirits vanish like clouds dispersed by lightning.

May the Hua and Yi peoples alike joyfully follow the winds of virtue, and the entire realm delight in the radiance of sagely governance. May the official [Name] enjoy emoluments as lofty as Mount Song and Mount Heng, and years as enduring as the pine and cassia. May he forever uphold loyalty and filial piety in service to his sovereign and parents. May the Emperor’s sagely longevity rise like the North Star and Mount Tai, his illustrious reign extend as far as the heavens and earth endure. May all beings, seen and unseen, ascend to the realm of longevity.

Thus, the transformative compassion of the Most High Heavenly Worthy is made manifest, and the sincerity of your servants’ devotion is answered.

With reverence, we make this declaration.

**Invocation of Intentions**

First intention: For the Dao, the Four Great Elements unite in virtue. May the seven generations of the retreat’s sponsor be freed from sorrow and suffering, ascend to the heavenly halls, and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second intention: For the Emperor and rulers of states, may the Dao’s transformation flourish. May schools and academies thrive, the imperial teachings expand, and solemn decorum be universally observed. May the people praise great peace, the four barbarians submit in reverence, evil vanish of itself, and sages and worthies arise daily.

Third intention: For the Dharma Master, may great merit be established. May teachings be luminous and enlightened, and all attain transcendence.

Fourth intention: For fellow practitioners of the Dao, may they swiftly attain immortality and mutually guide one another.

Fifth intention: For the nine relations to live in harmony, esteeming benevolence and righteousness, prizing the Dao and despising wealth, serving as models for all.

Sixth intention: For those who humble themselves to bestow alms, Daoists and the hungry and cold. May all people under heaven find their rightful place.

Seventh intention: For crawling and creeping creatures, all sentient beings, may they all achieve fulfillment.

Eighth intention: For the pardon of past lives’ transgressions. May this life’s karmic retribution be redressed through meritorious deeds.

Ninth intention: For the prosperity of family and state. May ancestral temples be maintained, and worthy talents arise in every generation.

Tenth intention: For revering the master and the scriptures. May we never falter in devotion, cultivating equanimity and single-mindedness. May all beings be broadly delivered, attaining the rank of immortals, ascending to heaven in broad daylight, and paying homage to the Most High. May we forever become perfected beings, riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the Real.

**Replenishing the Incense Burner**

To the Incense Officials and Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attendant Incense Spirits: May this

By this the high and low are fixed, and kingdoms rise.
The sovereign is the head, governing both the unseen and the manifest.
Exercising the power of yin and yang to nurture all things,
holding the reins of joy and sorrow for the myriad people.
Accordant with Heaven, embodying the Dao, sheltering the realm entire.
Yet should the times grow dark and murky, and all things suffer adversity,
if even one man remains unblessed, the multitude shares in sorrow.

We, the officials [Name] and [Name], earnestly seek to rectify the age,
our hearts deeply devoted to praying for blessings.
We now beseech auspicious favor to aid and sustain the sacred dynasty.
As our duty lies in propagating and magnifying the Dao, we must submit this petition.
Having received the imperial command, how dare we not make it known?

**Reading the Petition**
As the words herein bear profound meaning of vast salvation,
we now follow the mystic rites and solemnly open the imperial altar.
We prepare the ceremonies for the descent of the perfected and the advent of the sagely,
examining the forms of the Three Registers and the Nine Purities.
With fragrant flowers we offer our sincerity, and with tokens of faith we convey our devotion.
We pour forth our crimson sincerity in the mortal realm, awaiting the mysterious blessings of the celestial palace.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May these merits flow to the august spirits of the altars of state and the ancestral temples,
ascending to the Three Realms, treading the Ten Flowers.
Bestowing great blessings to enrich the grand design,
granting extraordinary omens to prosper the sacred lineage.
In the lands of fire-mice and ice-silkworms, may no corner lack the imperial calendar;
among the ministers of Cock Forest and Child Tree, may songs of praise resound in harmony.
Surpassing the millennial reigns of old, exceeding the boundaries of Yu’s domain.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May these merits ascend as prayers for the Emperor.
We humbly hope that blessings flow to the mysterious extremity, and grace suffuses the purple imperial chambers.
May the eight seas settle into tranquil waves, their vastness equaling the sovereign’s benevolence.
May the ten mountains rise in verdant splendor, their heights matching the sagely years.
Harmonizing the jade candle of the four seasons, spreading jeweled branches through ten thousand generations.
May the empress, consorts, and imperial concubines, the crown prince and the various princes,
all receive vast blessings and together uphold the imperial throne.
May the civil ranks and military posts, the worthy ministers and meritorious officials,
proclaim the seven virtues to pacify the nine regions, upholding the Three Absences to bring peace to the four seas.
May the five weapons be sheathed, and the hundred grains flourish.
May auspicious portents fill the records, overflowing the pages.
May all under heaven, in perfect accord, enjoy harmony and prosperity.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, preserve the heavens and endure forever.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

At this moment, as the Dao is practiced in the midst of the ritual,
we, the assembled ritualists, now raise the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Masters of the Most High.
May these merits flow to the boundless expanse, within the domains of the Dao,
to the utmost Three Purities above, and the deepest Nine Ramparts below,
to the lords of yin and yang, the administrators of Heaven and Earth.
May the vast compassion of the Heavenly Worthies extend their salvation,
and the encompassing virtue of the Sagely Hosts manifest their embrace.
Washing away pestilence and calamity, eradicating disasters and misfortunes.
Secretly blessing the imperial enterprise, eternally securing the nation’s destiny.
Bringing forth the transformation of Great Peace, opening the court of benevolence and longevity.
May the officials [Name] and [Name] widely spread blessings and felicity,
renewing their longevity and emoluments.
May they ever deeply partake of the sovereign’s grace, long aiding his sagely brilliance.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sagely Hosts, the Perfected Ones,
who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the formless.
Harmonized and united with the true Dao.

**Ritual Concludes**
**Confession**

**Threefold Invocation Hymn**
Abundant flourishes the house and state,
Majestic thrives the Dao’s transmission.
Heaven and humankind share one aspiration,
In subtle vastness entering the Great Vehicle.
From the heart’s resolve the field of blessings is established,
The Dharma-wheel ascends in boundless ascent.
Seven generations ascend to celestial halls,
My own body soars in the white sun’s radiance.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence,
to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Titles**
Disciple of the Supreme Mystery and Mysterious Capital, your servant [Name],
with due reverence, once more addresses and invokes:
the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Origin;
the Supreme Great Dao Lord; the Supreme Lord Lao;
the Perfect and Most High Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center;
the High Ministers and Prime Chancellors, the Four Directors and Five Emperors,
all divine officials and spirits of the Three Realms.

By karmic conditions of former lives, we have personally encountered the turning of the Dao’s fortune.
Jade tablets and golden writs descend from the celestial gates,
tortoise-shell registers and tiger tallies circulate through the world’s domains.
Through the transmission of master and disciple, we have received and cultivated the teachings.
Yet our bodies dwell far from cloudy springs, our traces lost in the dusty sea.
Our merits have not yet aided the state, our Dao has not yet attained ascension.
We can but rouse our cinnabar resolve, hoping to repay the mysterious creation.

Moreover, in establishing merit and propagating the teachings, aiding the state takes precedence.
In all sincere supplications, how dare we fail to comply?
Officials [Name] and [Name], encountering times of calamity and adversity,
grieve for the nation in their hearts.
With devout preparation of offerings and utmost sincerity, they diligently perform the fast and vigil.
Following the decrees of the Supreme Ultimate and Ninefold Purity,
adhering to the texts of the Golden Clarity and Three Caverns,
they burn incense, light lamps, recite scriptures, and perform the Dao-circuits.

We humbly consider that the Great Teaching of Non-Action takes luminous response as foremost;
the unfathomable divine efficacy takes utmost sincerity as its foundation.
Exhausting sincerity in the earthly realm, it must evoke response from the Supreme Mystery.
We prostrate ourselves in reverence before the Three Supreme Worthies,
the hosts of saints in the ten directions,
the deities of all heavens and earths,
the responsive and efficacious divine spirits.
May they open the grace of great pardon, bestow boundless blessings.
Release and absolve the ancestral temples and former sages,
extending to the imperial person,
the accumulated transgressions and deep faults,
the limitless errors and offenses.
May the divine source be serene and pure, the Dao’s kindness luminous and radiant.
May the earth’s records and heaven’s origins halt the reckoning of disasters and blessings;
may the eight vast realms and ten thousand states spread the winds of harmony and joy.
May the two images be at peace, the three luminaries bright and clear.
May weapons be sheathed and stilled, pestilence and poison dissolved and submerged.
May fierce and violent beings be vanquished, dragons and spirits reconciled in harmony.
May the celestial armies and their mounts punish and eradicate wicked demons.
May the rebellious factions and malevolent followers be annihilated in due time.
May wind and rain be harmonious and timely, crops and grains abundant and flourishing.
May all creatures of diverse forms, flying and submerged beings of varied endowments,
the suffering souls of the three paths, the imprisoned spirits of the six destinies,
by the condition of this confession and supplication, attain their desire for freedom.
May they not be afflicted by plagues, ever preserving safety and integrity.
May the eight seas be free from perilous waves, the ten thousand streams flow in perfect accord.
May the manifest and hidden alike universally witness the advent of Great Peace.
May all living beings together attain the transformation of the Dao.

Above, may the Heavenly Worthy’s vast salvific blessings be made manifest;
below, may they correspond to the sincerity of we, your servants, who take refuge in the mandate.
We respectfully present this invocation for your hearing.

**Vows**
First vow: May the Great Dao be serene in quiescence and emptiness,
abiding in tranquility and stillness, dwelling in clarity and purity.
May it widely open the gates of the Dharma, instructing the obstinate.
May all receive its beneficent blessings, cultivating with diligence and austerity.
May those who study together universally ascend to the void,
preserving harmony with heaven, enduring without care.

Second vow: May the myriad heavens condense qi and attain clarity,
their lofty vastness broadly sheltering, preserving the true and securing the numinous.
May the seasons of qi be harmoniously regulated, the four movements at peace.
May the state be secure and the people prosperous, the world universally at rest.
May all be broadly saved, blessings extending to all living beings.
May heaven be preserved for eternity, enduring through kalpas without decline.

Third vow: May the earth bear and sustain without end,
stable and unshaken, seas and abysses uncollapsed.
May it protect and secure the house and state, the multitudes flourishing in accord.
May the living be nurtured and the dead at peace, blessings encompassing the ten directions.
May crops and grains flourish and grow, enterprises daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant sustenance, the myriad beings universally accord.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, be lofty and bright,
free from eclipses or dimming, their waxing and waning serene and clear.
May their light illumine all heavens, dispelling darkness and obscurity.
May they preserve the kalpas’ destiny, the world’s mandate at peace.
May they universally bestow moistening blessings, showering grace upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars and constellations shine with the brilliance of the sun and moon,
their revolving torches illuminating, casting radiance through the ten directions.
May each abide in its proper place, their paths straight and true.
May they protect and secure the house and state, free from calamity or harm.
May the four seas be at peace as one, the world universally flourish.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons progress in accord with their nodes,
their qi harmonious and regulated, free from disasters or afflictions.
May pestilence and poison be eradicated, the world universally at peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance, the state prosperous and the people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds condense qi and gather mist,
soaring high and clear in the sky, casting shade over the profound mystery.
When concealed, they are non-active; when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the hosts of perfected beings.
May blessings flow universally, aiding the state and cherishing the people.
May all beings be universally saved, their years equal to the kalpas.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and shower without end,
universally bestowing their release, receiving their flourishing.
May the myriad things flourish and grow, the state’s stores and people’s wealth abundant.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks each abide in their proper direction,
their towering majesty encompassing and sheltering, ever serving as immortal palaces.
May they secure the state’s destiny, preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none who do not revere and honor them.

Tenth vow: May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless,
containing and embracing with magnanimity, nurturing even the smallest beings.
Profound and gentle, their moisture bestowing blessings upon all creatures.
May heaven and humankind receive felicity, their years equal to the kalpas’ stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor and lord of the state daily prosper,
the four frontiers at peace, weapons and warfare stilled.
May heaven and humankind sing in praise, auspicious omens alighting.
May the teachings be widely disseminated, majestic transformations overflowing.
May the multitudes rejoice in celebration, enduring joy without end.

Twelfth vow: May crawling and flying creatures, born and unborn alike,
universally receive safety, universally attain generation and growth.
May all perceive the primordial qi, receiving the forms of yang.
May grasses and trees, fruits and forests endure winter without withering.
May all be delivered and saved, none who do not flourish in brilliance.

Harmony unites with the true Dao.

Return to the furnace. O Fragrance-Official Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attending Fragrance Spirits, may this place of my audience with the Primordial cause golden liquid elixir and azure mushroom blossoms to arise spontaneously. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones gather here before the incense burner. May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the state receive felicity, and both the hidden and manifest realms partake in grace.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend upon the orchid-scented smoke. Convey my supplications just uttered swiftly and directly to the presence of the Most High, Boundless, and Great Dao—the Perfect and True Jade Sovereign of the August Heaven.

Exiting the chamber.
*End of the Twentieth Scroll of the Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Most High*

*Beginning of the Twenty-First Scroll of the Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Most High*
Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang, the Broadly Accomplished

For ministers to eliminate disasters and perform the *Luo Jing* Daoist rites for the state:

Entering the chamber.
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

Guarding the Spirits:
The five stars shine brightly, auspicious qi soars and floats.
The Primordial Origin gathers the gods, heaven and earth unite in harmony.
Jade talismans and precious seals command the subtle and hidden.
Fire is cast and might displayed—no treachery or evil lingers.
The ten thousand demons tremble and submit, their malevolence dissolved.
Monsters are subdued, wickedness vanquished, the Dao’s qi flows as one.
Divine radiance illuminates the night, shadows and darkness wholly withdrawn.
The myriad immortals descend in state, riding the winds on billowing light.
All beings attain fulfillment, grace pervading the divine lands.
The dharma drum is sounded twenty-four times.

The Most High Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Origin, the Three Qi’s Supreme Dao Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officials, the Attendants of the Left and Right, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Incense Officials of the Day—thirty-two each in number—to emerge. As they emerge, let them solemnly prepare and report to the Divine Lord of the Mysterious Altar of the Heavenly Thearch. Let the local earth gods and territorial true officials of this realm be urgently summoned to ascend and report.

This servant now reverently acts on behalf of [the sponsor’s] intent, burning incense and performing the Dao rites, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Purity’s Dao qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend and flow into the bodies of this servant and all present. Thereby, may the Mysterious Altar be purified, and inner and outer realms become true. May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth rid of demonic dust. May the chiming of jade resound, and the ten directions be solemnly cleansed. May the ten thousand demons not intrude, and true sincerity ascend unobstructed. May this servant’s petition swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme Non-Ultimate Great Dao’s Most Perfect Jade Thearch of the August Heaven.

Each proclaims their dharma rank:
The disciples of the Supreme Clarity’s Mysterious Capital, this servant and others, with unified sincerity, reverently address the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Non-Ultimate Great Dao’s Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Highest Great Dao’s Golden Portal Mysterious Primordial August Thearch, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Thearch of the August Heaven, the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Heavenly Lords, the Jade Void Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection, the Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital, Golden Portal, Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity’s Supreme Palace, the Numinous Treasure’s Most Perfect Illuminated August Lord of the Dao, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, and all true numina of the three realms’ official retinues.

This servant has heard that when the three systems first divided and the myriad states spread like a chessboard, without emperors and kings, there would be none to govern and pacify; without the Dao and virtue, there would be none to secure and stabilize.

The Three Sovereigns embodied the Dao, ruling as lords over the Five Emperors, proclaiming virtue to perfect transformation. Thus the people cherished simplicity and sincerity, and customs attained pure harmony. The six qi were balanced and harmonious, the four seasons peaceful and prosperous. Thereafter, yin and yang fell into discord, the nine and six clashed in opposition. The Flame and Yellow Emperors saw the rise of military campaigns; Yao and Tang encountered the calamities of flood and drought. They relied upon the abundance of virtue, and leaned upon the numinous power of the gods. The myriad spirits of heaven and earth all lent their hidden assistance. When encountering adversity, it is fitting to pray to the true numina. Following the rites of reverent offering, may boundless blessings descend. Moreover, in accordance with the imperial decree, how dare we not report this above? The prayer is read.

According to the words of the prayer, the ritual concerns the state and the household. Official So-and-so, with utmost sincerity, aids and supports, yearning in reverence for the august numina. Presenting offerings of faith, he devoutly performs the fast and vigil. In accordance with the Three Primordials’ rank and the Numinous Treasure’s luminous statutes, he burns incense, lights lamps, recites scriptures, and performs the Dao-circumambulation. Traversing the myriad heavens to offer thanks, he circumambulates the ten thousand sages in homage. May it reach the Supreme Mystery, widely bestowing auspicious blessings.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Dao. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits flow to the august numina of the altars of soil and grain, the ancestral temples and former sages, ascending their spirits to the Purple Palaces, bestowing blessings upon the imperial domain. May they befriend the Five Emperors in the Jasper Palace, freely roaming in ease; may they bequeath a thousand auspicious signs to the imperial heirs, flourishing without end.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Scriptures. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits extend upward to bless the Emperor. We humbly pray that the precious calendar of the Nine Heavens may augment the sagely longevity without bound; that the jasper waves of the Eight Seas may widely expand boundless prosperity. May his brilliance surpass the sun and moon, illuminating all without partiality. May his virtue parallel the Two Modes, embracing and nurturing all things. May the Empress, consorts, and concubines spread their gentle virtue throughout the nine regions; may the Crown Prince and the various princes radiate their illustrious splendor through ten thousand generations. May the civil and military ministers, the officials within and without, propagate and disseminate the imperial designs, vigorously promoting the grand transformation. Extending to the distant frontiers and foreign lands, may all realms constantly enjoy harmony and peace, attaining the perfection of the Dao.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao preserved the heavens and endured eternally, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

Tonight, during the evening audience and Dao-circumambulation, the dharma assembly is invited to offer the third pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Perfect and True Treasure of the Master. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up in reliance upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits extend throughout the Three Realms, universally reaching all directions. Together may they spread the mysterious merit, jointly proclaiming the vast blessings. Invoking the upright qi of the Three Heavens, may they cleanse and eliminate the treacherous and malevolent; summoning the divine soldiers of the Eight Poles, may they annihilate and pacify demonic afflictions. May the great enterprise flourish, the grand foundation be firmly established. May Official So-and-so be divinely aided with auspicious blessings, his heavenly endowment of longevity enduring. May he forever revere loyalty and filial piety, constantly serving the sagely brilliance.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the virtue of the Great Sage Assembly of the Master and the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

The rites are concluded.
Confession and repentance.

**Threefold Invocation Hymn**
The Great Dao pervades the mysterious void,
With thought, none fails to harmonize.
Refining the form to enter immortality,
Thus attaining the adamantine body.
Transcending the three realms’ tribulations,
Hell’s five sufferings are dissolved.
All return to the Supreme Scriptures—
In stillness, we bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Ranks**
Disciples of the Supreme Clarity and Mysterious Capital, your servants [Name] et al., now reverently reaffirm our supplication to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Origin; the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Supreme Lord Lao; the Perfected and Utmost Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center; the High Ministers and Prime Chancellors; the Four Directors and Five Emperors; and all divine officials and venerated spirits of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have heard that the sagely sovereign, robed in grace, governs the multitudes of the realm. Upholding Heaven’s transformative mandate, embodying the Dao to rule the seasons, he must manifest reverence for the Supreme Mystery to secure radiant blessings, and foster harmony in the lands below to perpetuate the grand design. Thus, the Dao of Heaven subtly sustains, while divine spirits secretly assist. Heaven and humanity interact in resonance, and the seas and lands enjoy tranquility.

Recently, as the cyclical nine and six converge, yin and yang fall into discord. Calamities arise in the course of destiny, causing inner and outer realms to share in sorrow. Official So-and-so, deeply committed to governing the state and earnestly devoted to serving the sovereign, seeks to amplify supreme blessings and reverently serve the sagely court. He has examined and adhered to canonical rites, meticulously upholding the Dharma’s sanctity. His heart races toward the Three Realms, his thoughts fixed upon the myriad heavens. Reverently establishing the altar, he devoutly conducts the fast and vigil.

We, your servants, purify our hearts and still our thoughts, bathing in clarity and emptiness. We burn incense and light lamps, recite scriptures, and circumambulate the Dao. Our sincere words ascend to the Ten Poles, our prayers for protection directed to the Three Clarities. We humbly beseech the Supreme Dharma King and the assembly of Perfected Sages: gazing down from jade pavilions, may you bestow vast blessings to universally bestow grace. Rectify the celestial origins, harmonize the earthly principles. Let the Three Luminaries shine brightly, the Five Planets follow their courses. Comets and baleful stars conceal their forms, while auspicious stars manifest their blessings. The eight winds align in sequence, the six qi balance in harmony. Drought and flood are averted, disasters and malevolent forces eradicated. Mountains and rivers remain serene, fierce beasts retreat and vanish. Customs become pure and virtuous, creatures free from plague. Ghosts and demons flee without trace, evil and perverse forces are crushed and destroyed. Barbarians submit in reverence, borderlands enjoy peace. Treacherous ministers and rebellious sons offer loyalty and devotion. Beacons remain unlit, weapons fall silent. The imperial enterprise flourishes, the sagely lifespan endures. The court abounds in loyal and worthy officials, the countryside harbors no neglected talents. The six palaces and hundred ministers together propagate the wind of virtue and power; the crown prince and various kings jointly support the vast and grand enterprise. Ships and caravans gather in full, harvests are ever abundant. May Official So-and-so be truly blessed with auspicious fortune, his official emoluments and state sacrifices renewed.

May even those in the dark springs and cold underworld, the six destinies and three paths, be illuminated by the radiance of wisdom, forever dispelling gloom and obscurity. May the divine wind cleanse impurities, attaining perfect coolness and purity. May all crawling, flying, sinking, and soaring beings ascend to the Dharma realm. Above, may the great compassion of the Heavenly Worthy be manifest; below, may the sincerity of our repentance and gratitude be fulfilled.

We respectfully present this supplication for your hearing.

**Vows**
First vow: May the Great Dao flow universally, and all under Heaven embrace virtue.
Second vow: May all sentient beings awaken to the Dao.
Third vow: May the souls in the nine nights of darkness attain liberation at once.
Fourth vow: May the lonely and unsupported spirits all receive rebirth.
Fifth vow: May the world enjoy great peace and the five grains abundant harvests.
Sixth vow: May ministers be loyal and sons filial, rulers benevolent and fathers kind.
Seventh vow: May the four seas be united, and enmities and affections reconciled.
Eighth vow: May those in hidden wombs and eggs all attain birth and completion.
Ninth vow: May chronic and recent illnesses swiftly be healed.
Tenth vow: May orphaned and destitute beings enjoy ample clothing and food.

**Replenishing the Incense Burner**
Incense Official Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, Attendant Incense Spirits, and all divine officials: at the place where we conduct the Dao, may golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms naturally arise. May the hundred spirits and host of Perfected Ones gather here before the incense burner and sacred flame. May we, your servants, who study the Dao attain the Dao, and those who seek immortality attain immortality. May the nation receive blessings, and both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions, attending the orchid-scented smoke, swiftly transmit our recent supplications directly to the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Utmost Perfected Jade Emperor.

**Exiting the Chamber**
Here concludes the twenty-first scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*.

**Scroll Twenty-Two of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast*
Revised by Master Du Guangting of Tang Dynasty’s Guangcheng**

**Morning Dao Practice for Pacifying the Dwelling**
**Entering the Chamber**
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Invoking the Protective Spirits**
Azure radiance illumines the void, sunlight revolves with numinous power.
Divine tigers repel evil,
Flying immortals stream with ringing bells.
Crushing treachery and dispelling trials,
All demons bind their forms.
Ninefold subtle lights return the Dao,
Eightfold might seizes essence.
A thousand Perfected Ones verify records,
The Three Primes purify all.
To the left, the Central Yellow roars;
To the right, the Six Dings are commanded.
Seven cycles, eight unions,
Revolving through the celestial scriptures.
The sagely transformation towers sublime,
The Three Ways proceed in harmony.
Auspicious clouds flow and spread,
Merging with the Yellow Court of the luminous scene.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
O Supreme Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Three *Qi* of the Most High Lord Lao, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Incense-Bearing Golden Youths, the Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans, and the Daily Incense Officials—thirty-two of each—to emerge.
Let them solemnly prepare and report to the Divine Lords of the Mysterious Altar of the Celestial Emperor. Summon this land’s local earth deities and true officials to swiftly ascend and make their report.
Your servant now acts on behalf of the intent herein, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao *qi* and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend and flow into the bodies of your servants, thereby purifying the Mysterious Altar within and without, making all real.
May the heavens be free of defilement,
The earth rid of demonic dust.
Jade chimes resound,
The ten directions grow solemn and clear.
Let no demon intrude,
Let true sincerity ascend.
May the supplications of your servant swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Self-So and Spontaneous Golden Gate and Jade Steps of the Celestial Emperor.

**Declaring the Dharma Positions**
Your servants, [Names], with utmost sincerity jointly address the Self-So and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Boundless Great Dao’s Most High Lord of the Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven, the host of Perfected Ones who have attained the Dao in the ten directions, the Thirty-Six Celestial Emperors, the Jade Clarity Emperor, the Great Emperor of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Flowery, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, and Northern Perfected Lords of the Mysterious Capital, the Golden Gate and Jade Steps of the Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace, the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure’s Perfected Radiant August Lord of the Dao, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the Five Primordial Emperors, the Nine Lands’ Jade Emperors, and all responsive and perceptive true numina of yin and yang.

Your servants have heard that the Heavenly Venerable conceived and transformed the Great Dao, bestowing the merit of the Two *Qi*.
Shaping the myriad numina,
It provided the origin and perfected purity.
Above, it bound the suspended sun and moon,
Arranging the stars and constellations across the four turbid realms;
Below, it congealed and spread the mountains and rivers,
Merging the seas and watercourses.
Thus, the hundred spirits received their offices,
Fixing the boundaries of the four directions.
The Five Emperors governed their divisions,
Each securing their proper place.
Even the Purple Capital’s hundred towers and ninefold walls,
The commanderies, cities, and moats,
The human dwellings and abodes—
All possess their dharma images,
Corresponding to Heaven and Earth.
Relying on the merit of pacification and stabilization,
They harmonize with the blessings of governance and peace.
Your servants, charged with propagating the teachings and assisting the state in establishing merit,
In all matters of prayer, properly submit reports.
How much more so when following imperial decrees—
Dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the words state, our sincerity is earnest and sincere.
May it, through the power of concentrated devotion, ascend to the true numina.

Your servants, leading the Dharma assembly and adhering to the ritual codes,
Arrange the altar and array the scriptures,
Modeling earth after heaven.
We adorn the ten directions with dragon banners,
Presenting our sincere words to the Three Realms.
At this morning’s Dao practice, we, the Dharma assembly, now offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
Your servants surrender body and life,
Prostrating body and head,
Reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the Emperor.
We humbly pray that the five mountains stabilize the earth,
Eternally matching the grand design;
The eight seas float the heavens,
Ever equaling the phoenix’s reign.
May the imperial fortune surpass that of Zhou and Han,
The sagely virtue exceed that of Fuxi and Shennong.
May the empress and crown prince
Illumine their wise virtue;
The princes and princesses
Harmonize with auspicious signs.
May the nine regions unite under one chariot,
The myriad lands gather through ships and bridges.
For this reason, we now burn incense,
Returning to the great sagely host of our masters and venerables,
The virtue of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
We shall ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

At this morning’s Dao practice, we, the Dharma assembly, now offer the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
Your servants surrender body and life,
Prostrating body and head,
Reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the household of the fast’s sponsor.
May nine generations and seven lineages
All transcend the night’s abode;
The six relations and five clans
Together realize the immortal ranks.
May the dwelling be peaceful and secure,
Dragon spirits guard it.
May misfortunes and disasters cease,
Evil and demonic forces not arise.
For this reason, we now burn incense,
Returning to the great sagely host of our masters and venerables,
The virtue of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
We shall ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

At this morning’s Dao practice, we, the Dharma assembly, now offer the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.
Your servants surrender body and life,
Prostrating body and head,
Reverently relying on the Three Venerables of the Most High.
May this merit flow to all sentient beings within Heaven and Earth.
May all bathe in the Dao’s breeze,
Attaining the fruit of Perfection.
May the fast’s sponsor, [Name], have disasters dispelled before they manifest,
Blessings descend without limit.
May all together receive the merit of the wondrous Dao,
Forever realizing the rank of long life.
For this reason, we now burn incense,
Returning to the great sagely host of our masters and venerables,
The virtue of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
We shall ascend into the formless,
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

**Bowing to the Directions**
**Confession**

Let each contemplate the nine-colored perfect image, swallow the saliva, and recite the secret incantation to command demons.
Step into the void, circumambulate,
Prostrate and bow to the Most High,
Burn incense and return to emptiness.
Luminous radiance follows my return,
The Dharma-wheel likewise turns thrice.
Mysterious vows arise in the four directions,
Blessings extend to kings and lords.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven,
Resplendent, their glory unfurls.
Chanting and singing crown the vast desert,
Heavenly music delights my joy.
Together we offer fragrant incense to the supreme virtue,
Lesser immortals cannot compare.
Wondrous thoughts illumine profound awakening,
In throngs they ride the void in flight.
Circumambulating, treading the cloud-net,
Mounting the void, pacing the mysterious register.
Chanting the hymns of the Supreme Unity,
A hundred passages naturally harmonize.
Below, I command the youths of the Eight Seas;
Above, I escort the lofty immortals.
All heavens scatter flowers of incense,
A serene numinous wind arises.
Long-held vows secure the root of destiny,
Thus attaining lofty eminence.
Rejoicing before the Most High,
Even ten thousand kalpas are but a beginning.
The towering Mysterious Capital Mountain,
Revered by the ten directions as the One Sovereign.
The soaring Heavenly Treasure Terrace,
Its radiance flames like the flowing sun.
Resplendent jade-forest blossoms,
Vermilion fruits gleam in brilliance.
Ever mindful to consume primordial essence,
Refine the fluid to solidify form and substance.
Golden light scatters in the Purple Tenuity,
Graceful and free, the Great Vehicle soars.

**Three Bows**
Your servants prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Most High and Boundless Dao.
Your servants prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
Your servants prostrate with utmost sincerity,
Bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Ranks**
Your servants, [Names], in all humility reaffirm and address:
The Most High and Boundless Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning,
The Most High Lord of the Dao,
The Celestial Venerables of the Boundless Dao in the Ten Directions,
The Perfect Great Emperor and Heavenly Thearch,
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
The Heavenly Master and Lord of the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center,
The Supreme Ministers and Prime Ministers, the Four Offices and Five Emperors,
The responsive and perceptive spirits of Heaven and Earth, and all true numina.

Your servants have heard:
Before the Dao’s transformation divided, it was the primordial body of the Undifferentiated;
The mysterious workings do not govern, entrusting the True Unity to non-action.
Thereupon, the two images divided and the numinous arose,
The three powers established their positions.
Purity and turbidity matched the qualities of Qian and Kun,
Obscurity and brightness manifested the distinction of day and night.
The spirits of yin and yang each administered their offices.
Thus, we constructed these halls to replace the layered nests.
Having taken the celestial gates as our model,
We thereby presided over the tally of hidden merits.
Thus, Qian Heaven and Dui Marsh each have their overseeing governance;
Li Fire and Xun Wind mutually reveal decline and prosperity.
To follow them is to surely accord with uprightness and fortune;
To oppose them is to invite regret and blame.
From ancient times to the present, all have followed this Way.

The fast’s sponsor, [Name], having chosen this site for construction,
Feared transgressions and violations.
The ways of spirits are difficult to fathom,
Common understanding cannot plumb them.
Now that the work of earth and timber is complete,
We shall perform the rites of incense and lamps.
We confess our sins and seek grace,
Dispelling calamities and repenting transgressions.
Greatly expanding the fast’s offerings,
We reach upward to the Perfected.
For this reason, we array the Dharma altar,
Adhering to the ritual codes.
Orchid lamps scatter their light,
Illuminating the Nine Netherworlds below.
Fragrant stalks congeal their smoke,
Communicating with the Three Realms above.
Turning scriptures and practicing the Dao,
We universally perform repentance and prayer.
Perhaps we have offended numinous spirits,
Or harmed the earthly courts.
Perhaps we have taken lives or defiled sacred traces,
Or disturbed dragon deities, violating various prohibitions.
Perhaps through forced labor, we have incurred resentment,
Or by relocating without choosing an auspicious site,
Accumulated transgressions and faults,
Thereby binding ourselves in calamity’s coils.
Perhaps within the Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams,
Or within the Ten Stems and Twelve Branches,
We have violated the punishments of yin and yang,
Or the seventy-two spirits.
Below, this is reported to the Earthly Offices;
Above, it is declared to the Heavenly Courts.
Relying on this repentance and confession,
We beseech the sweeping away of all offenses.
May the fast’s blessings universally extend,
Its virtuous merit widely spread,
Descending the Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands,
Proclaiming to all heavens;
Wielding the majestic power of the Three Treasures,
Commanding the Three Realms.
Rescuing these nightly courts,
Opening all radiant illuminations.
Stabilizing the imperial enterprise within the Ninefold Palace,
Disseminating mysterious blessings to the myriad states.
The five weapons laid to rest,
The hundred grains abundantly harvested.
The fast’s sponsor, [Name], and their household,
Living and deceased, are at peace;
Their clan and kin flourish in prosperity.
Children and grandchildren are loyal and filial,
Their posterity and descendants multiply in splendor.
Sins are expunged from the records of the netherworld,
Their names inscribed among the immortals in the true realm.
The offices of yin and yang,
The inner and outer spirits,
Protect the Dharma and pacify people,
Aid people and benefit beings.
Together they propagate the Dao’s transformation,
Assisting the upright and repelling the perverse.
Extending to the hidden and the manifest,
All together attain the wondrous Dao.
Above, we manifest the Celestial Venerable’s vast salvific grace;
Below, we fulfill your servants’ sincerity in surrendering our lives.

**Initiating the Vows**
First vow: For the sake of the Dao’s four great elements,
Uniting in virtue with the fast’s sponsor.
Seven generations of parents,
Freed from falling into sorrow and suffering,
Ascend to heaven,
Clothed and fed by nature.

Second vow: May the emperor and lords of states,
See the Dao’s transformation flourish and prosper.
Schools and academies teem,
The imperial teachings expand.
Majestic deportment is revered,
Universally observed.
The people praise great peace,
The six barbarians submit as guests.
Evil and perversity self-destruct,
Sages and worthies daily arise.

Third vow: May the Dharma master,
Establish great merit and virtue.
Teachings clearly propagated,
All together attain flying immortality.

Fourth vow: May fellow practitioners of the Dao,
Swiftly attain immortality,
Mutually guiding and delivering one another.

Fifth vow: May the nine relations live in harmony,
Esteeming benevolence and righteousness.
Valuing the Dao and deprecating wealth,
Their conduct a model for all beings.

Sixth vow: May those who diminish themselves in giving,
To Daoists and the hungry and cold,
And all people under heaven,
Each attain their rightful place.

Seventh vow: May crawling and creeping creatures,
All sentient beings,
Universally receive accomplishment.

Eighth vow: May past-life debts be forgiven,
This life’s karmic retributions,
Establish merit to compensate for transgressions.

Ninth vow: May the household flourish,
Ancestral temples have descendants,
Generations produce worthy talents.

Tenth vow: May we revere and receive the masters’ teachings,
Never daring to slacken in the middle,
With equanimity and single-mindedness,
Universally deliver all beings,
Attaining the rank of superior immortals.
Ascend to heaven in broad daylight,
Bow before the Most High,
Forever becoming Perfected Ones,
Riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages.
Harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

**Closing the Censer**

**Incense Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attendant Incense Spirits,**
may this place where I offer incense
naturally produce golden liquid elixirs, cinnabar mushrooms, and azure lingzhi blossoms.
May the hundred spirits and host of Perfected Ones
gather here before the incense burner.
May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao;
in seeking immortality, attain immortality.
May the ritual sponsor receive blessings,
and may both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor.

**Ten Directions’ Immortal Boys and Jade Maidens,**
attend the orchid-scented smoke,
convey my entreaties swiftly,
directly to the Throne of the Supreme Vast Dao—
the Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Golden Portal Jade Palace.

**Exiting the Chamber**
*End of the Twenty-Second Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat Rites*
*Beginning of the Twenty-Third Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat Rites*
*Revised by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting*

**Pacifying the Dwelling and Circulating the Dao**
**Entering the Chamber**
Each bows to the master, contemplating as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
Cinnabar spirits and vermilion fire,
flaming auroras and surging winds.
The crimson wheel turns with刚 force,
heaven’s light radiating in eight directions.
Bursting might envelops all,
transforming myriad realms.
Molten gold scatters, demons vanish without trace.
Evil dispelled, malevolence shattered,
illuminating primordial merit.
Golden talismans summon and command,
treading clouds and riding dragons.
Chants and songs celebrate the assembly,
flowers scattered across the vast sky.
Spirits work in hidden motion,
the four extremities secure and prosperous.
Prostrate before the Emperor,
none dare be disrespectful.

**Strike the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
O Supreme Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Three Qi, Supreme Dao Lord,
summon forth from within my body
the Three and Five Merit Officers,
Left and Right Attendant Messengers,
Incense-Bearing Golden Boys,
Message-Transmitting Jade Maidens,
Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans,
and Daily Incense Officials—
thirty-two each—
to emerge.
Let them, in solemn attire, open the gates and report to the Heavenly Thearchs of the Mysterious Altar.
Summon this land’s earth gods and territorial deities,
true officials and righteous spirits,
to swiftly ascend and report.

I now offer this prayer:
May the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao Qi and Numinous Treasure descend,
flowing into our bodies,
rendering the Mysterious Altar pure,
both within and without, perfected.
May the heavens be free of defilement,
the earth cleansed of demonic dust.
Jade chimes resound, the ten directions solemn and clear.
No demon dares intrude;
sincerity ascends.
May my entreaties swiftly reach
the Throne of the Supreme Vast Dao—
the Void and Spontaneous Golden Portal Jade Palace.

**Each States Their Dharma Rank**
We, your humble servants, [Names] and others,
with utmost sincerity, jointly address
the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous,
the Supreme Vast Dao, the Supreme Dao Lord,
the Supreme Lord Lao,
the Supreme Mysterious Elder,
the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao,
the thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs,
the Jade Clarity Highest Emperor,
the Jade Emperor Great Emperor,
the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected,
the Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Portal, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity Upper Palace,
the Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord,
the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures,
the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious,
the Earthly Thearchs of the Earthly Palaces,
the Four Controllers, Five Thearchs,
the Eight Abysses, Nine Ramparts,
and all true spirits.

We have long been favored with profound blessings,
personally encountering the transformative power of the Dao.
The five scriptures scatter their radiance,
the three caverns shine forth.
Expounding the profound principle of the Double Mystery,
unfolding divine efficacy in wondrous application.
We have gained access to secret depths,
able to receive and cultivate.
Yet from the outset of our covenants,
establishing merit has been our foundation.
For all who turn toward the Dao,
how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
In accordance with the petition’s intent,
we earnestly cultivate and revere.
We, unworthy as we are of our roles in the Mysterious Regulations,
are duty-bound to open the path to salvation.
The ritual sponsor, [Name], has recently undertaken construction,
raising earth and timber.
Fearing offense to the true spirits,
he wishes to present prayers and repentance.
Thus, we follow the protocols of the Three Clarities,
unfold the rites of the Nine Memorials.
With faith, we present this petition,
requesting to perform the retreat vigil.
Hoping, through this memorial,
to reach the Perfected Ones above.

**This Noon’s Circulation of the Dao**
We, the Dharma assembly,
now offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.
We dedicate our bodies and lives,
prostrating ourselves,
relying upon the Supreme Three Worthies.
May these merits
ascend to the august spirits of our ancestral temples,
the illustrious sages of past generations.
May they ascend to the sagely ranks,
and below, bless the imperial lineage.
May the Emperor’s virtue continue that of Fuxi and Shennong,
his brilliance equaling sun and moon.
Holding the golden mirror, he governs the four seas;
adjusting the jade candle, he nurtures the ten thousand regions.
At court, loyal and worthy ministers;
in the countryside, none left behind.
Thus, we now burn incense,
returning to the great sagely hosts of our masters,
the virtues of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
may we ascend into the formless,
harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

**This Noon’s Circulation of the Dao**
We, the Dharma assembly,
now offer the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.
We dedicate our bodies and lives,
prostrating ourselves,
relying upon the Supreme Three Worthies.
May these merits
flow to the ritual sponsor’s household.
May the nine generations of hidden ancestors
be reborn in heaven and awaken to the Dao;
may the seven lineages of departed spirits
attain ranks and ascend as Perfected.
May the dragon spirits of the dwelling,
the yin-yang generals and officials,
each be settled in their domains,
together attaining non-action.
May their spiritual ranks be elevated,
their merits counted toward the Dao’s fruition.
Thus, we now burn incense,
returning to the great sagely hosts of our masters,
the virtues of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
may we ascend into the formless,
harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

**This Noon’s Circulation of the Dao**
We, the Dharma assembly,
now offer the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.
We dedicate our bodies and lives,
prostrating ourselves,
relying upon the Supreme Three Worthies.
May these merits
flow to the ritual sponsor, [Name].
May blessings flourish like eternal spring,
the Dao’s influence spread far and wide.
May his life be long, his emoluments enduring,
his sins extinguished, his calamities dissolved.
Then, may the cold courts of the night prisons,
the three paths and six destinies,
all transcend their depths,
together attaining union with the Perfected.
Thus, we now burn incense,
returning to the great sagely hosts of our masters,
the virtues of the Perfected Ones.
After attaining the Dao,
may we ascend into the formless,
harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as real.

**Bowing to the Directions**

**Confession**

Each reflects upon the nine-hued perfect image,
swallows saliva, and recites the demon-subduing esoteric incantation.
Pacing the void, circumambulating,
bowing and rising, we visualize the Supreme,
where blossoming radiance adorns the cinnabar path.
Turning left, we grasp the Dark Essence;
glancing right, we hold the Bright Pearl.
The Six Perfections crown the pure practice,
while virtue and power renew with the sun.
Lifetimes of accumulated merit respond,
and hearing the scriptures feels like meeting kin.
Heaven-endowed with transcendent talent,
we joyfully chant the subtle and profound texts.
In emptiness, the Great Harmony’s qi,
we exhale and inhale the essence of streaming clouds.
Fetal breathing stills the hundred channels,
in profound solitude, we master the Three Conveniences.
The Mud Pill Palace gleams with luminous radiance,
and we attain the Golden Flower Immortals.
The Demon Kings respectfully receive their charge,
thus enabling our ascent to the heavens.
All begins with fasting and precepts,
layered merit forging karmic ties of old.
Soaring through the Great Void,
we uplift the loftiest adepts.
Guiding the reins to the ten directions,
we pause to rest on the dark radiance’s slope.
Gazing up at the Kalpa Terrace,
looking down upon the purple cloud net.
Carefree in the Supreme Capital,
we sit together upon lotus blossoms.
Through accumulated study, we become Perfected Ones,
serene, with harmonized defense and nourishment.
Forever enjoying boundless life,
why count the myriad aeons?
The Great Dao’s master is profound stillness,
ascending immortals befriend the peerless.
The Noble Scion bestows the numinous talisman,
the Supreme holds the Cavern Scripture.
The relics gleam with golden splendor,
the dragon chariot swiftly arrives to welcome.
The Heavenly Worthy gazes upon the cloud carriage,
floating, soaring through the void.
Fragrant flowers fall like snow,
mist and haze flourish upon the dark beams.

**Three Bows**

We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Ranks**

We, your humble servants [Names], respectfully reaffirm our address to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin;
the Supreme Dao Lord;
the Supreme Lord Lao;
the Heavenly Worthies of the Ten Directions’ Boundless Great Dao and Virtuous Hosts;
the Perfected Great Emperors and Celestial Emperors;
the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures;
the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
the Earthly Mansion’s Supreme August One;
the Five Emperors of the Great Beginning;
and the Responsive Numinous Spirits of the Central Yellow and Earthly Branches.

We prostrate ourselves, having heard:
When the Great Dao divided,
the sages established teachings.
Drawing from the *Yijing*’s images,
they modeled themselves upon the Supreme Mystery.

Having established the norms for constructing halls and beams, they replaced the ancient nests and caves. To benefit all under Heaven and shelter the multitudes of beings, they commanded the deities of Heaven and Earth, the marshals of yin and yang. They divided ranks and arranged hierarchies, each with its proper charge. From ancient times to the present, these have been reverently observed, and no deviation has marred fortune or misfortune.

The patron of this retreat, [Name], having recently undertaken construction and renovation, fears that excavation may disturb sacred traces or encroach upon the abodes of spirits; that it may offend the qi of repose and prosperity or transgress the directions of taboo. Thus, an altar has been prepared to offer repentance and supplication.

We, your servants, consulting the *Hetu*’s graded standards and unfolding the ritual canons of the Three Caverns, lead the Dharma assembly in earnestly conducting this retreat. We prostrate ourselves beneath the Three Luminaries and lay bare our hearts before the myriad sages. We repent our transgressions and faults, beseeching grace and pardon. May our sincere devotion move the true numina to descend.

We respectfully invoke for the disciple [Name]:
**Cangming Jiubai Jun**, **Anque Tianxuan Jun**, **Tianxiu Tianyang Jun**, **Jiehuan Dunyuan Jun**, **Chisha Tianguan Jun**, **Xianguan Jiping Jun**, and **Shiyang Shanzhi Jun**;
**Qinglong Daoyuan Jun**, who presides over the peace of dwellings and the prosperity of residences, dispels calamities and averts anomalies, subdues pernicious qi, and suppresses wayward spirits;
who breaks the edge of poisonous curses and extinguishes inauspicious omens.

We further invoke:
**Hanming Dihuang Jun**, **Wushang Jianqi Jun**, the **Furnace and Fire Jade Maidens**, and the **Vanguard Inspectors of the Great Hosts**, who govern the collection of ghosts dwelling in wells and hearths within the residence.

We also invoke:
**Yang Fangping Shijun**, who governs the collection of qi from mounds and tombs beneath the earth and the deities of taboo, ensuring the free flow of upright qi and the suppression of malevolent forces. May the dwelling abide in purity and peace, ever secure in well-being; may the household enjoy auspicious omens and the gate know no untimely misfortune.

May the six relations be blessed with fortune, and the nine generations of ancestors ascend to heaven.
May longevity and prosperity be extended, and transgressions and faults dissolved.
May grievances and enmities be reconciled, and legal entanglements sink into oblivion.
May inner and outer realms know purity and peace, and all movements and stillness be luminously unimpeded.

Above, may the sagely enterprise endure long, and the imperial destiny stretch far into the distance.
May the myriad states rest in harmony, and the eight directions submit to transformation.
May heaven be clear and earth bright, the nation prosperous and the people joyful.
May auspicious omens and felicitous signs be recorded day by day and month by month.
May wind and clouds bestow their blessings, and seas and mountains relax in ease.

Extending even to the six destinies and nine nether realms, to all sentient beings with consciousness,
may they all partake in vast fortune and each attain carefree bliss.
May the dragon spirits of the dwelling and the yin-yang officials of their ranks
be rewarded for their merits and stationed securely in their domains.
From the hidden to the manifest, may all universally attain flourishing peace.

Above, may the radiant Heavenly Worthy grant great mercy;
below, may the sincerity of this assembly’s devotion be answered.
We reverently make this declaration known.

We now offer our vows:

**First Vow:** May the Great Dao abide in tranquil emptiness, serene and still, dwelling in clarity of its own accord.
May the gates of the Dharma be widely opened to instruct the stubborn and deluded.
May all receive its beneficent grace and cultivate with diligent austerity.
May those who study together universally ascend to the void,
preserving harmony with heaven and abiding in perpetual freedom from care.

**Second Vow:** May the various heavens condense their qi into purity,
their vast expanse high and encompassing, preserving truth and securing the numinous.
May the seasons be harmoniously regulated, the four movements balanced in peace.
May the nation be secure and the people prosperous, the world universally tranquil.
May all be broadly succored, and beneficence extend to all living beings.
May the heavens be preserved for eternity, unshaken through kalpas without end.

**Third Vow:** May the earth’s capacity to bear and sustain be boundless,
stable and unyielding, its seas and abysses unshaken.
May it securely guard the nation and the people flourish in accord.
May the living be nurtured and the dead rest in peace, beneficence pervading the ten directions.
May crops and grains thrive, and commerce daily prosper.
May all receive its abundant support, and the myriad beings follow in harmony.

**Fourth Vow:** May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, shine in lofty brilliance,
free from eclipses or dimming, their waxing and waning serene and clear.
May their light illumine the heavens, dispelling all darkness.
May they safeguard the kalpic destiny and the world’s destiny know peace.
May their beneficent moisture be universally bestowed, showering grace upon all beings.

**Fifth Vow:** May the stars shine with brilliance equal to the sun,
their revolving radiance illuminating the ten directions.
May each abide in its proper place, their paths straight and true.
May they securely guard the nation, free from calamity or harm.
May the four seas be united in tranquility, and the world universally prosper.

**Sixth Vow:** May the four seasons progress in accord with their nodes,
their qi harmonious and balanced, free from disaster or affliction.
May pestilence and poison be extinguished, and the world know universal peace.
May the five grains ripen in abundance, the nation prosperous and the people joyful.

**Seventh Vow:** May floating clouds gather their qi and amass their mists,
soaring high in the empty sky, casting their shadow over the profound.
When concealed, they abide in non-action; when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the host of perfected beings.
May their beneficence flow to all, fostering the nation and cherishing the people.
May they universally succor all beings, and humanity share in kalpic longevity.

**Eighth Vow:** May wind and rain flow and shower without end,
their bounty universally bestowed, nurturing growth and flourishing.
May the myriad things thrive, the nation’s stores abundant and the people prosperous.

**Ninth Vow:** May the Five Peaks each abide in their proper direction,
their towering majesty encompassing all, ever serving as palaces of immortals.
May they securely guard the imperial destiny, preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none who do not look to them in reverence.

**Tenth Vow:** May the rivers and seas be vast and boundless,
containing and embracing all, nurturing even the smallest beings.
May their depths be gentle and beneficent, moistening all that wriggles and breathes.
May heaven and humanity receive their blessings, their years enduring like kalpic stone.

**Eleventh Vow:** May the emperor’s domain daily flourish,
its four frontiers secure and harmonious, weapons of war laid to rest.
May heaven and humanity sing in praise, auspicious signs descending in flight.
May teachings be widely disseminated, their majestic transformation overflowing.
May the multitudes rejoice, their joy unending.
