**Twelfth Vow:** May all creatures—those that fly and crawl, born and unborn—
universally know safety and be brought to completion.
May all behold the primordial qi and receive the form of yang.
May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests endure winter without withering.
May all be delivered and none fail to flourish in fresh brilliance.

May harmony unite with the Dao and attain truth.
The furnace is restored.

O Fragrant Bureau Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attendant Fragrance Spirits,
may the place where this servant offers incense spontaneously yield golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine blossoms.
May the hundred numinous perfected ones gather here before the incense burner.
May this servant study the Dao and attain the Dao, seek immortality and attain immortality.
May the patron of the fast receive blessings, and may the hidden and manifest alike be graced with favor.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions, who attend the orchid-scented smoke,
convey this servant’s petition swiftly to the Jade Threshold of the Most High Limitless Dao’s Golden Palace.

**Pacifying the Dwelling and Performing the Twilight Dao Rites**
*Entering the chamber*
Each pays homage to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
The five stars blaze on high, auspicious qi soars and drifts.
The Primordial Origin gathers the spirits, heaven and earth unite in harmony.
Jade talismans and precious seals summon the subtle and the hidden.
Fire is cast and might displayed—no treachery or evil lingers.
The ten thousand demons tremble and submit, their malevolent blossoms recede.
Monsters are crushed, wickedness felled, the qi of the Dao flows as one.
Divine radiance illumines the night, shadows and darkness are wholly gathered.
The myriad immortals descend in state, riding the wind on fans of light.
All beings attain fulfillment, grace pervades the divine realm.
The dharma drum is sounded twenty-four times.

**The Most Supreme Three Heavens’ Mysterious Primordial Three Qi’s Most High Dao Lord** summons forth from within this servant’s body the **Three-Five Merit Officers**, the **Left and Right Attendant Envoys**, the **Incense-Bearing Golden Youth**, the **Message-Transmitting Jade Maiden**, and the **Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Incense Officials of the Day**, each thirty-two in number, to emerge. As they emerge, they solemnly prepare and open the gates of the **Mysterious Altar’s Heavenly Thearch Divine Lords**, commanding the **Local Earth Gods and Domain Spirits**, the **True Officials and Righteous Deities** of this place, to swiftly ascend and open the gates. This servant now reverently acts on behalf of the intent herein, praying that the **Jade Purity’s Dao Qi and Numinous Treasure’s Wondrous Light** descend and flow into the bodies of this servant and all present, thereby rendering the **Mysterious Altar pure and still**, both within and without perfected in truth.

May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth purged of demonic dust. May the chiming of jade resound, the ten directions solemn and clear. May the ten thousand demons not intrude, and true sincerity ascend above. May this servant’s petition swiftly reach the **Most High and Boundless Great Dao’s Golden Portal and Jade Steps of the Supreme Emperor**.

Each proclaims their dharma rank:
**Servants of such-and-such rank**, we humbly and with one mind reverently petition the **Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Boundless Great Dao**, the **Most High Great Dao Lord**, the **Great Sage Ancestor, Supreme and Lofty Great Dao’s Golden Portal and Mysterious Primordial Heavenly August Emperor, the Most High Lord Lao**, the **Supreme Jade Thearch**, the **Great Sage Perfected Ones of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao**, the **Thirty-Six Heavenly Thearch Lords**, the **Jade Void Highest Emperor**, the **Jade Thearch Great Emperor**, the **Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, and Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital and Golden Portal’s Seven Treasures’ Mysterious Terrace and Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace’s Numinous Treasure’s Most True Radiant August Dao Lord**, the **Thirty-Six Divisions’ Venerable Scriptures**, the **Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center**, the **Earth Mansion’s Supreme Thearch**, the **Nine Earths’ Five Thearchs**, and the **Central Yellow’s Wu-Ji Responsive True Spirits**.

This servant and all present prostrate ourselves, having heard that the **Most High has transmitted the texts**, the **Primordial August One established the teachings**, **fashioning and harmonizing the ten thousand existences**, **nurturing and sustaining all regions**.

The **Three Caverns’ Jade Scriptures** descend from the **Ninefold Purity** to unfold their mysteries; the **Great Saints of the Myriad Heavens** propagate the **Supreme Dao** to deliver humankind. Assisting the state is foremost, compassionate salvation the foundation. Should there be any petition, how dare we not report it above?

**Reading the Petition**
We, your servants, having examined the sincerity of the petition, find it proper to submit for imperial consideration. The **fast-master** [Name], regarding his dwelling, has undertaken repairs and renovations, yet fears transgressing against the divine or violating taboos. Earnestly he offers repentance and purification to atone for faults and flaws. Thus, in accordance with canonical rites, he reverently establishes the altar, unfolds the **Mysterious Capital’s Jade Tome**, and follows the **Yellow Register’s** scriptural texts. Modeling earth upon heaven, he conducts the fast and performs the Dao.

Tonight, at the evening audience, as the ritual proceeds, we, the **Dharma assembly**, now present the **first pinch of incense**. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the **Most High, Perfect, and True Dao-Treasure**. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying upon the **Three Honored Ones of the Most High**. May this merit flow to the ancestral spirits of the imperial lineage and the luminous ranks of former sages. May the Emperor ascend to the highest realms, securely establishing his grand destiny. May it illuminate all directions like the sun and moon, nurturing all beings like the three luminaries. May the Crown Prince, consorts, and empresses radiantly assist in this flourishing. May civil and military officials aid in the perfection of sagely transformation.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the **Great Saints, the Perfected**, and the virtue of those who, having attained the Dao, ascend beyond form, harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

Tonight, at the evening audience, as the ritual proceeds, we, the **Dharma assembly**, now present the **second pinch of incense**. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the **Most High, Perfect, and True Scripture-Treasure**. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying upon the **Three Honored Ones of the Most High**. May this merit flow to the household of the **fast-master** [Name]. May the nine generations of departed spirits wander the azure heavens; may the six relations of kin attain ranks in the immortal realms. Within his dwelling, may the dragon deities and divine officers securely occupy their stations. May malevolent forces be purged, harmony achieved, and eternal peace and auspiciousness prevail.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the **Great Saints, the Perfected**, and the virtue of those who, having attained the Dao, ascend beyond form, harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

Tonight, at the evening audience, as the ritual proceeds, we, the **Dharma assembly**, now present the **third pinch of incense**. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to offer homage to the **Most High, Perfect, and True Master-Treasure**. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying upon the **Three Honored Ones of the Most High**. May this merit flow to all under heaven, to all sentient beings. May it universally extend to the hidden and manifest, equally bestowing blessings and protection. May the household of the **fast-master** [Name] see misfortune cease and fortune prolonged. May all rightly inherit the winds of virtue and together realize the fruits of true immortality.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the **Great Saints, the Perfected**, and the virtue of those who, having attained the Dao, ascend beyond form, harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

**Ritual Directions**
**Confession**

**Procession of the Void**

We circumambulate, encircling—
heads bowed in homage to the Golden Gates,
craning necks to roam the Jade Capital.
The *qian*-tree stands in the Garden of Rounded Radiance,
resplendent, the Seven Jeweled Grove aflame.
Three hundred celestial beasts bear names,
lions vast as ten thousand *xun*.
Flying dragons chant in lingering song,
divine phoenixes cry in measured harmony.
A numinous breeze fans wondrous blossoms,
pure fragrance scattering upon mortal robes.
Without the talent of lofty immortals,
how could one indulge such a heart?

We array our Nine-Dragon Chariot,
mounting the void to roam free.
The Eight Heavens lie like a palm’s span,
the Six Directions—how could they be distant?
The host of perfected chant the *Dongxuan*,
the Most High intones pure hymns.
Incense and flowers scatter upon the wind,
jade tones form in the Purple Empyrean.
The Five Sufferings burst forth at once,
the Eight Perils dissolve into scriptural emptiness.
Wondrous, the precincts of the Numinous Treasure—
here arises the great Dharma Bridge.
The Palace of the Celestial Thearch Unity,
luminous, crowned with radiant numen.
The Wheel of the Dharma’s net flows and shines,
spiraling into formlessness through the void.
The August Sovereign plucks the cloud-zither,
the host of perfected chant the *Dongjing*.
Lofty immortals stand in solemn praise,
through kalpas preserving purity and integrity.

**Three Prostrations**
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in homage,
to the **Most High, Boundless Great Dao**.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in homage,
to the **Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures**.
We, your servants, with utmost sincerity bow our heads in homage,
to the **Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center**.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Rank**
We, your servants of proper rank, [Names], reverently reaffirm our address,
supplicating the **Most High, Boundless Great Dao, Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin**,
the **Most High Great Dao Lord**,
the **Most High Lord Lao**,
the **Boundless Great Dao and Virtue’s Host of Sagely Heavenly Worthies, Perfected Great Emperors, and Celestial Thearchs of the Ten Directions**,
the **Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures**,
the **Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center**,
the **Jade Thearch of the Nine Lands**,
the **Five Primordial Emperors of the Great Beginning**,
the **Twelve Perfected Lords of the Central Yellow and Earthly Branches**,
and all responsive numina of the Three Realms.

We, having been privileged to serve the Perfected,
have partaken in the cultivation of secret wonders.
Yet no merit surpasses that of moving and nourishing,
nor has transformation fully pervaded living beings.
Ever mindful of aiding the state and transforming people,
we propagate the Dao and extol the Dharma,
upholding the profound mysteries to broadly succor humans and devas.

The **fast-master** [Name], in renovating his dwelling,
has initiated construction and labor.
Perhaps in hauling timber or moving stone,
he startled or disturbed dragon spirits.
Perhaps in raising low or lowering high,
he violated prohibitions and taboos.
Perhaps the land of his dwelling
holds ancient traces or numinous ruins.
Perhaps the site of excavation
contains abandoned shrines or crumbling ramparts.
Perhaps he has defiled immortal precincts
or encroached upon renowned sites.
Perhaps he has failed to suit the Five Surnames’ harmony
or contravened the Two Dwellings’ advantage.
Through these renovations,
misfortune and calamity have arisen.
Reverently establishing the altar,
we now present our prayers and confessions.

Following the **Celestial Master’s Grades and Ranks**,
in accordance with the **Orthodox Unity Dharma Texts**,
we invoke the **Twelve Divisions of Heavenly Officials, Generals, Officers, and Soldiers of the Salvation-from-Ruin Bureau**,
to expel residual qi and purify pernicious influences.
Banish the earth’s wood-and-stone spirits,
along with wandering corpses and malevolent ghosts.
Dissolve the harm of the Earth Lord’s encroachment,
dispel the disasters of the Five Directions’ prohibitions.
May all inauspicious specters
be utterly eradicated.
Let auspicious mists gather,
and misfortunes melt like ice.

We humbly pray the **Most High and Host of Worthies**
to deign to gaze upon us with compassion,
sending forth true qi to overshadow and protect this place.
Command the proper spirits to secure and stabilize their positions,
ever upholding purity and fortune,
eternally preserving peace and well-being.

May the **imperial Dao flourish and prosper**,
the **august winds spread far**.
May the **Three Frontiers know peace**,
the **Eight Seas remain waveless**.
May **epidemics and poisons not intrude**,
the **stars and constellations align with their measures**.
Even to the **nightly treasuries of the Yellow Springs**,
may light ever be beheld.
May all **creeping and living beings**
not lose their proper place.

May the **fast-master** [Name]’s **Seven Ancestral Spirits** attain ranks and ascend to heaven.
May his descendants transmit the norms of loyalty and filial piety,
and near and far enjoy the blessings of peace and security.
May dragon spirits secretly guard him,
his every movement harmonious and tranquil.
May all bathe in the **mysterious merit**,
together ascending to the realm of the Perfected.
Above, may the **Heavenly Worthy’s merciful grace** be manifest;
below, may our **repentant sincerity** be answered.

**Vows**
First, may heaven and earth be bright and pure.
Second, may the atmosphere be clear and mysterious.
Third, may the Sage enjoy myriad years.
Fourth, may transformation pervade the Eight Extremities.
Fifth, may heaven bestow sweet dew.
Sixth, may earth emit auspicious mists.
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their courses.
Eighth, may the myriad beings thrive in wholeness.
Ninth, may households abound in filial piety and fraternity.
Tenth, may the state teem with talent and worthies.
Eleventh, may the merit of this fast spread widely.
Twelfth, may good omens daily increase.

Harmonizing with the Dao in truth.
**Returning the incense.**

**Incense Officials, Envoys, and Attendant Spirits**

May the **Incense Official Envoys**, the **Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords**, and all **Attendant Spirit-Officials of the Incense** ensure that where this servant’s incense rises, golden elixir, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs spontaneously flourish. May the **Hundred Spirits and Perfected Beings** gather here before the incense burner. May this servant, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the **fast’s sponsor** receive blessings, and may both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor.

May the **Jade Maidens and Immortal Youths of the Ten Directions**, attending the orchid-scented smoke, swiftly convey this servant’s words directly to the **Jade Throne of the Supreme Vast Dao, the Peerless Great Way, in the Golden Palace**.

*Exiting the chamber*
**End of the Twenty-Fourth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites**
**Beginning of the Twenty-Fifth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites**
*Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting*

**Rites for Pacifying the Dwelling, Applicable at All Three Times of Day**
*Entering the chamber*

**Bowing to the Master, Visualizing as Prescribed**

**Guardian Spirits**
The Five Stars array their radiance, illuminating the Five Directions.
The **Water Star** averts calamity;
the **Wood Virtue** brings prosperity.
**Mars** dissolves misfortune;
**Venus** repels warfare.
The **Earth Star** governs the four [quarters], benefiting household and state.
Names inscribed on jade tablets,
characters recorded in the imperial chambers.
Riding the whirlwind, fanning the light,
soaring through the Great Void.
Entering and exiting the unseen,
roaming and feasting in the Ten Directions.
Five-colored clouds form canopies,
summoning spirits and commanding winds.
Commanding the myriad spirits,
to protect and guard the immortal assembly.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

**Supreme Three Heavens, Primordial Three Qi of the Mysterious Origin, Supreme Dao Lord**, summon forth from within this servant’s body the **Three and Five Merit Officers**, the **Left and Right Envoys**, the **Incense-Bearing Golden Youths**, the **Jade Maidens of Transmission**, and the **Incense Officials of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendance**, thirty-two each, to emerge.

Let them, in solemn array, report to the **Celestial Thearchs and Divine Lords of the Mysterious Altar**, and urgently summon the **Local Earth Gods and True Officials of this realm** to ascend and make their report.

This servant now humbly offers prayers for the intended purpose, beseeching the **Lingbao Wondrous Light of the Jade Clarity’s Dao Qi** to descend and flow into the bodies of this assembly, rendering the **Mysterious Altar** pure and the inner and outer realms perfected. May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth devoid of inauspicious dust. May the chiming of jade resound, and the Ten Directions be solemnly reverent. May the myriad demons not intrude, and true sincerity ascend. May this servant’s words swiftly reach the **Jade Throne of the Supreme Vast Dao, the Formless and Nameless, the Void and Spontaneous, in the Golden Palace**.

**Each Declares Their Dharma Rank**

We, your humble servants, [names] and all present, with one heart offer this petition to the **Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin**, the **Peerless Great Dao, Supreme Great Dao Lord**, the **Supreme Lord Lao**, the **August Jade Emperor**, the **Perfected and Sages of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao**, the **Thirty-Six Celestial Thearchs**, the **Jade Clarity Supreme Emperor**, the **Great Emperor of the Jade Thearch**, the **Eastern Flower, Southern Ultimate, Western Numinous, Northern True, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Palace, Seven-Jewel Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace, Lingbao Perfected and Radiant August Dao Lord**, the **Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures**, the **Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center**, the **Nine Lands’ Jade Emperors**, the **Four Offices and Five Thearchs**, and all responsive and perceptive true spirits of the Three Realms.

We have heard that at the inception of heaven and earth, the transformations of yin and yang gave rise to all things. They fashioned the myriad forms and governed the myriad regions, all bearing the ungoverned work of the Dao and harmonizing with the principle of non-action. Yet when the Great Dao receded, pure transformation ceased to flow. Dwellings replaced nests and caves, and the omens of extravagance arose from earth and wood. Thus, both the manifest and hidden realms transgressed divine prohibitions. Therefore, the rites of repentance and gratitude were established, eliciting the wondrous response of resonance.

For this reason, the **Three Honored Ones** expounded the teachings, and the **Ten Thousand Sages** suspended the statutes. The **Five Talismans** revealed the mechanisms of exorcism and pacification; the **Three Treasures** opened the instructions of repentance and prayer. This servant, having been permitted to partake in the true teachings, has presumptuously assumed this office. It is fitting to assist the state, establish merit, rescue the perilous, and aid the common folk. Whatever words are herein contained, we dare to present them fully.

**Reading the Petition**
In accordance with the words of the petition, it is fitting to make this report.

Disciples of such-and-such, considering the unsuitability of our dwelling’s construction, contemplate establishing the merit of a purification rite to express expiation and gratitude. Reverently following the statutes and canons, we erect an altar and precinct. We burn incense, kindle lamps, recite scriptures, and circumambulate the Dao. May our petition ascend, thereby eliciting wondrous resonance.

On this day, as such-and-such officiates the circumambulation, we, the assembled ritualists, offer the first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the Supreme and Most Perfect Dao-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, and look up in reliance upon the Most High Three Honored Ones. May this merit flow to the ancestral temples and altars of the sacred dynasty, to the numinous spirits of the soil and grain. May its radiance ascend to the Ninefold Purity and its blessings extend to the myriad realms. May it safeguard the flourishing fortune of the realm and subtly assist the sagely designs. May the Emperor’s virtue embrace the Two Modes and his illumination equal the Two Luminaries. May no one be left destitute in the wilds, and may the court abound in loyalty and integrity. May the Empress and consorts inherit winds of well-being, and may the inner and outer realms together partake of the transformation of peace.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Most Perfect and True, whose virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

On this day, as such-and-such officiates the circumambulation, we, the assembled ritualists, offer the second pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the Supreme and Most Perfect Scripture-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, and look up in reliance upon the Most High Three Honored Ones. May this merit flow to the household of disciple so-and-so. May the nine generations and seven lineages, the myriad ancestors and ten thousand forebears, transcend the dark night and ascend to behold the light. May they refine their essences in the Southern Palace and be born into the celestial realms. Moreover, may all beings in the three wretched destinies and six paths of rebirth, though differing in kind, together bathe in the fragrance of cultivation and ascend the path of fortune.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Most Perfect and True, whose virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

On this day, as such-and-such officiates the circumambulation, we, the assembled ritualists, offer the third pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to the heavens, offering reverence to the Supreme and Most Perfect Master-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, and look up in reliance upon the Most High Three Honored Ones. May this merit flow to the household of the purification rite’s sponsor, so-and-so. May the six affinities and five clans, all kin and relations, avert future calamities, absolve past transgressions, renew their blessed destiny, and prolong their years. May their dwellings be fittingly situated and the dragon spirits securely pacified. Thereafter, may all beings—whether soaring or sinking, animate or inanimate—together receive the mysterious grace and universally partake of the vast beneficence.

Thus we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Host of the Most Perfect and True, whose virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the True Dao.

**Paying Homage to the Quarters**
**Repentance**

**Threefold Invocation Hymn**
The Law is taken as wife,
the scriptures cherished as pearls and jade.
Holding fast to precepts to restrain the six passions,
mindful of the Dao to dispel desires.
In purity, the upright qi abides;
in serenity, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
life after life receiving great fortune.
The household and state flourish in abundance,
the scriptures and Dao thrive in splendor.
Heaven and humankind share this aspiration,
floating into the Great Vehicle.
By the heart’s resolve, the field of merit is established;
the Wheel of Dharma ascends in boundless ascent.
Seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven,
while this body soars in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the mysterious void—
with thought, nothing fails to align.
Refining the substance to enter immortality,
thus attaining the adamantine body.
Transcending the three realms’ tribulations,
the five sufferings of hell are dissolved.
All return to the scriptures of the Most High;
in stillness, we bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
We prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao.
We prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Titles**
We, your humble servants, so-and-so and others,
now reverently reaffirm our supplication to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao—
the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin,
the Most High Lord of the Great Dao,
the Most High Lord Lao,
the Perfected and Great Sage Hosts of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao,
the Heavenly Emperors and Celestial Thearchs,
the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center,
the Supreme August One of the Earthly Palace,
the Five Emperors of the Underworld,
the Great Dharma Masters of the Three Heavens,
the Orthodox Unity Perfected,
and all responsive numinous spirits of the three realms’ official retinues.

We have heard that the mysterious transformation is proclaimed and the Dao’s influence spreads afar,
bestowing grace upon the three realms and extending benevolence to all beings.
The covenants of majestic authority uphold the statutes of state assistance,
while the Numinous Treasure reveals the rites of repentance and supplication.
Whatever is sought is met with responsive communion.

Your disciple, so-and-so, dwelling amidst the dust of the world,
has yet to fathom the profound and wondrous,
and in choosing a site for construction, the dwelling is not auspiciously situated.
Fearing offense against the numinous spirits and transgression of taboos,
deviating from the signs of the eight dwellings and five phases,
and failing in the balance of yin-yang and the directions of punishment and virtue,
I am deeply troubled and full of doubt,
and thus wish to offer prayers and expiation.
For this purpose, we solemnly prepare the altar,
meticulously following the canonical rites.
With reverence, we present incense and flowers,
devoutly conducting the purification fast.
We turn our hearts toward the ten poles,
repenting sins before all heavens.
In accordance with the Orthodox Unity Dharma texts and the Celestial Master’s prescribed forms,
we invoke the three and five official retinues, the Heavenly Lords, and their officers and soldiers,
to dispel inauspicious spirits and dissolve disasters and misfortunes.

We humbly beseech on behalf of so-and-so:
the Supreme High Granary Lord,
the Capital Bureau Upright Qi Lord,
the Plain Chariot White Horse Lord,
the Summoning Lord,
the Lord of Qi Circulation and Disaster Relief who guards the dwelling,
the Heavenly Lord of Faults and Transgressions,
the Vast Controller Lord,
the Northern Citadel Edict-Command Transformation-Admonition Deliberation Lord,
the Heavenly Heart Censor and Attendant Pacifying Heaven Lord,
the Supreme Great Harmony Lord,
the Spirit-Gathering Illuminating Lord,
the Upper Prime Earth Lord,
the Great General Covering Heaven Supreme Heavenly Lord,
the Red Heaven Granary Qi Lord,
the Four Hu Lords,
the Earth-Restraining Lord,
the Heavenly Prosperity Lord,
and the Five Great Generals of the Garrisons—
to resolve for this household the three mounds and five graves,
the myriad spirits beneath the earth,
the lunar eclipse’s earthly qi,
the hundred maladies and malevolent reversals,
the depredations of thieves and harm,
and the qi of punishment, killing, and misfortune.
May the five pestilences and hundred diseases,
the spirits of curses and demonic disturbances,
the destructive influences from the four directions,
the military and hunting forces of the five divisions,
the curses of ancestral halls,
the manifold trials and all demonic entities,
the qi of five-phase retaliation,
the lingering and concealed spirits,
the accumulated misfortunes of past lives,
the calamities of the current year,
the twelve punishments and harms,
the internal and external oppressive forces,
and all malevolent spirits be entirely dissolved and dispelled.

Should there be any transport of timber or quarrying of stone,
or any groundbreaking or construction,
offending the true spirits of heaven and earth,
deviating from the true qi of yin and yang,
infringing upon the earthly palace,
or transgressing against the divine luminaries—
though the seen and unseen differ,
and common understanding cannot fathom—
we now repent and seek expiation,
praying for their complete eradication.
May the upright qi be proclaimed and spread,
the dragon spirits securely pacified.
May disasters and misfortunes be extinguished,
and blessings and goodness come forth.
May dwellings be peaceful and secure,
movement and stillness harmonious and tranquil.
May kin and clan alike
be bathed in the blessings of integrity.
May the seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven,
the three paths be purified and serene.
May the nine dark realms cease their accusations,
the long night be illuminated.
May grievances and debts be reconciled,
schemes and plots stilled.
May the lingering corpses and old qi,
the stagnant souls and hidden spirits,
all receive the blessings of this merit,
each attaining liberation and prosperity.
May they abandon the perverse and return to the correct,
aligning with the Dao and communing with the true.
May the imperial destiny be long and enduring,
the vitality of all beings radiant and flourishing.
May all under heaven be fully delivered,
and all creatures partake of glory.

May the vast beneficence of the Illuminating Heavenly Worthy
respond to the sincerity of our repentance and supplication.
We reverently submit this for your consideration.

**Vows**
First, may heaven and earth be bright and pure.
Second, may the atmosphere be clear and mysterious.
Third, may the sage live ten thousand years.
Fourth, may transformation reach the eight limits.
Fifth, may heaven bestow sweet dew.
Sixth, may earth emit auspicious mist.
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their course.
Eighth, may all things grow in perfection.
Ninth, may households abound in filial piety and fraternal duty.
Tenth, may the state flourish with talent and worthies.
Eleventh, may the merit of the fast spread widely.
Twelfth, may good omens daily increase.

**Replenishing the Censer**
Incense Official Envoys,
Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
and all Attendant Numinous Officers,
wherever this incense is offered,
may golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms naturally arise.
May the hundred spirits and host of Perfected gather here,
before the incense burner.
May we who study the Dao attain the Dao,
and those who seek immortality attain immortality.
May the sponsor of the fast receive blessings,
and the seen and unseen partake of grace.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions
attend the orchid-scented smoke,
so that the words we have uttered
swiftly reach the Jade Palace beneath the Most High, Boundless Great Dao—
the Void and Spontaneous Golden Gate.

**Exiting the Chamber**
Here concludes the twenty-fifth fascicle of the *Rites of the Most High Yellow Register Fast*.

**Fascicle Twenty-Six of the *Rites of the Most High Yellow Register Fast*
Revised by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting
*Morning Dao-Observance for Disaster Dispelling***

**Entering the Chamber**
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Numinosity**
The Five Stars gleam in empty radiance, illuminating the divine court.
Encompassing the formless, they harmonize the qi of the host of spirits.
Concealed in profound silence, they traverse the Five Classics.
Displaying majesty to outshine the sun, they command the ranks of Jia and Ding.
Repelling demons and averting calamities, they purge filth and dissolve baleful vapors.
The myriad demons tremble in fear; dragons and tigers take flight.
Purple clouds interweave in shelter; the ten thousand qi unite as one.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
Most High Mysterious Prime, Supreme Lord of the Dao, summon forth from within this servant’s body:
the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Attendant Officers of the Left and Right,
the Incense-Bearing Golden Youths, the Petition-Conveying and Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens,
and the Thirty-Two Fragrance Officers of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Direct Days.
Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to report to the Divine Lords of the Mysterious Altar and Heavenly Thearchs.
Summon now the local Earth Gods and Territorial True Officers,
that they may receive this servant’s intent and prayers:
may the wondrous luminous radiance of the Jade Clarity Dao-qi and Numinous Treasure descend,
flowing into the bodies of this assembly,
so that the words this servant has uttered
swiftly reach the Jade Palace beneath the Most High, Boundless Great Dao—
the Formless and Nameless, Void and Spontaneous Golden Gate.

**Each States Their Dharma Position**
We, your servants [names stated], in solemn unity, reverently address:
the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Celestial Worthy of Original Commencement,
the Boundless Great Dao, Supreme Lord of the Great Dao,
the Most High Lord Lao,
August Jade Thearch of the Vast Heaven,
the Perfected and Divine Lords of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao,
the Thirty-Six Heavenly Thearchs,
the Jade Clarity Thearch,
the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor,
the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, and Northern Perfection,
the Golden Gate of the Mysterious Capital and Seven-Jewel Palace of the Jade Metropolis,
the Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace,
the Numinous Treasure Perfected and Radiant August Lord of the Dao,
the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center,
and all divine officials of the Three Realms.

We humbly observe:
the Two Modes weave the warp of existence; the Five Agents engender transformation.
Fortune and misfortune intertwine; cold and heat alternate in succession.

The cycles of prosperity and decline know no constancy; the gates of calamity and fortune stand ever open.
In their greatest manifestation, Heaven and Earth may conjoin or obstruct, and kalpas shift through transformation.
At the next level, good and evil intertwine in turmoil, stirring dread and peril.
Yet this Supreme Dao encompasses the Void and Non-Being.
Without beginning or end, it attains the wondrous subtlety of the imperceptible;
boundless in compassion and love, it extends the statutes of salvation.
All evils are dispelled; no disaster remains unresolved.
We, your humble servants, have been granted access to the profound mysteries and partaken of the subtle essence of the Dao.
Our resolve is to establish merit and assist in the unfolding of transformation through the ages.
On the day we received the Dharma, we ascended the altar and pledged our vows:
to protect the state and deliver the people, and to widely proclaim the grace of compassion.
For all who turn toward the Dao, how dare we fail to bring this before the divine?
We recite the words, presenting them in utmost sincerity.

We establish the altar and ritual space to dissolve misfortune and transgressions.
Searching the scriptural teachings and adhering to canonical rites,
we invoke the Jade Decrees and True Scriptures, the dragon-script and phoenix-seal,
condensing clouds and coalescing qi to form sacred writ.
We safeguard and stabilize the Emperor, pacifying calamitous destinies,
governing the turning of kalpas, and subduing demonic forces.
Universally delivering all beings, we greatly propagate the divine transformation.

In accordance with this intent, we join in earnest supplication,
burning incense and kindling lamps to beseech blessings.
Now, at this morning audience in the performance of the Dao,
we, the assembled Dharma practitioners, offer the first pinch of incense.
May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to honor the Supreme Treasure of the Perfect Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in reverence,
and look up to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to the august spirits of the state and ancestral temples,
to the divine ancestors of the imperial lineage, and to the numinous vastness of the Great Silence,
where they may repose in the Ninefold Purity.
Roaming the Purple Courts in freedom, ascending the Vermilion Mound in joy,
may they bestow auspicious blessings for countless generations.
For the Emperor and Empress, the imperial consorts and princes,
the dukes, ministers, civil and military officials,
we pray for the stability of the imperial reign and the longevity of the Sacred One.
May the loyal and righteous assist in the sagely enterprise,
the inner and outer domains flourishing in the splendor of imperial rule.
May all quarters know peace, the eight directions be free from peril,
and the winds of the Primordial and Pure spread far,
returning all to the harmonious transformation of the Great Dao.

Now, we burn incense in devotion to the Great Sage Masters,
the Perfected and Divine Ones, whose virtue attained the Dao,
ascending beyond form to merge in harmony with the True.

At this morning audience in the performance of the Dao,
we, the assembled Dharma practitioners, offer the second pinch of incense.
May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to honor the Supreme Treasure of the Perfect Scriptures.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in reverence,
and look up to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to our own families,
to the nine generations of ancestors and the sevenfold lineage,
to the lingering spirits and obstructed consciousnesses.
May they be reborn in the Cinnabar Mound, shedding their mortal forms,
their earthly disputes resolved, their posthumous trials ended.
May they roam the celestial realms and dwell in the courts of bliss.

Now, we burn incense in devotion to the Great Sage Masters,
the Perfected and Divine Ones, whose virtue attained the Dao,
ascending beyond form to merge in harmony with the True.

At this morning audience in the performance of the Dao,
we, the assembled Dharma practitioners, offer the third pinch of incense.
May this fragrant smoke ascend directly to honor the Supreme Treasure of the Perfect Masters.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in reverence,
and look up to the Three Supreme Ones.
May these merits flow to all beings under Heaven, to all who possess consciousness,
reaching even the depths of the Yellow Springs and the hidden recesses of the unseen.
May distant blessings suffuse all, and every heart know peace.
May the disciple [Name]’s misfortunes cease, their adversities dissolve,
their longevity and fortune increase, and blessings gather abundantly.

Now, we burn incense in devotion to the Great Sage Masters,
the Perfected and Divine Ones, whose virtue attained the Dao,
ascending beyond form to merge in harmony with the True.

The Rites Conclude
Repentance

Let each meditate upon the nine-hued perfect image, swallow the divine saliva, and intone the secret incantation to command demons. Step into the void, circling the Supreme Ultimate—its height and depth divide, the light and pure ascending to join Heaven.

Should one cultivate the utmost Dao,
the body becomes a true immortal.
Their deeds surpass the three thousand,
their time spans forty thousand years.
The cinnabar terrace opens its treasure scrolls,
the golden mouth transmits the flow.
The Great Brahmā, Lord of the Three Heavens,
the Five Venerable Ones of the Void Sovereign—
even they scarcely glimpse its wondrous subtlety,
how much less can it be captured in words.
The jeweled throne descends upon the golden hall,
the rosy crown illumines the jade pavilion.
Myriad perfected ones attend the imperial court,
their flying sandals treading the roots of clouds.
Misty as fine mist, drifting,
their gossamer robes trail gently.
Exquisite, they ascend with auspicious smoke,
lightly following the soaring phoenix.
Having partaken in the jade chamber’s feast,
they suddenly point toward the grotto-heaven’s return.
Standing at Fusang’s shore,
they race toward the radiance of the Sun Emperor.

**Three Bows**
We, your servants, prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity to the Supreme and Boundless Dao of the Great Ultimate.
We, your servants, prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Ranks**
We, your humble servants [Name] and others, now reverently reaffirm and address the Supreme and Boundless Dao, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning; the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Most High Lord Lao and the host of sagely ones of virtue; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm; the High Ministers and Prime Chancellors, the Four Offices and Five Emperors, and all divine officials of the Three Realms.

We have heard that the Great Dao sheds its light, spreading harmony and transformation. It shapes and steeps the primordial qi, giving birth to the Three Powers. Yin and yang alternate in their cycles, kalpas rise and fall in their destined turns. Endowed with spirit and nurtured in form, beings take shape and flow into manifestation. Before transcending the mechanism of change, they are bound to signs of prosperity and decline. Without invoking the supreme sages, blessings are hard to bestow.

We reflect upon the jade books of the Three Caverns, the golden tablets of the Nine Heavens—turtle-scripted phoenix scrolls, dragon-sealed tiger tallies. These can stabilize emperors and kings, safeguarding the kalpas; embodying the boundless Dao, they endure with Heaven. Next, they can restore the celestial canon, altering the course of disasters; pacifying families and protecting nations, aiding beings and bringing peace to people. The netherworld receives their deliverance, and the distressed find means of expiation. When fragrant incense ascends, sincere prayers surely reach. When the true register is presented, the august spirits surely witness.

The disciple [Name], fearing misfortune in their fate and deeply troubled, presents offerings and petitions, praying for manifest protection. We, having received the luminous teachings, exhort and guide the Dharma stream. Following the mystic statutes, we undertake this fast to cultivate blessings, invoking the Three Realms and repenting to the Ten Directions. Pouring forth our sincerity, we turn the scriptures and perform the Dao. Lamps divide like crane flames, dispelling darkness with flowing radiance; incense scatters like dragon smoke, piercing the void to convey our faith.

We humbly pray that the Celestial Worthy and the Supreme Ones bestow their compassionate salvation; that the Golden Towers and Jade Capitals, the thousand perfected ones, extend their protective power. May decrees descend upon the Three Realms, universally proclaiming to all heavens. Bestow blessings, extend grace, deliver the living and ferry the dead. Reconcile grievances, dissolve disasters. Let the five phases avoid harmful clashes, and the three luminaries cease inauspicious conjunctions. Above, resolve the afflictions of celestial bodies and the twelve celestial mansions; below, resolve the calamities of mountains and rivers, the nine palaces, and the eight trigrams’ domains.

For accumulated transgressions and deep misfortunes, layered disasters; for past grievances and old debts, unintended killings and mistaken harms; for the three karmas and six emotions, boundless offenses—through this repentance, we beseech their complete eradication.

We pray that the nation’s destiny be prolonged, the sage’s longevity eternal; that the three luminaries shine brightly, the four seasons harmonize. May weapons of war not rise, beacon fires cease their warnings. May evil demons hide, auspicious omens arrive. Floods, fires, droughts, locusts, wars, and plagues—may none assail our borders, and may perfect peace be preserved.

We further pray that the seven generations of ancestors ascend to Heaven, the nine depths of darkness be released from confrontation. May all beings, flying and crawling, fulfill their natures and dwell in peace. May the earthly prisons and yin tribunals, the three paths and six destinies, all ascend to the shore of blessings, bathed in the wind of the Dao.

Above, may the Celestial Worthy’s vast salvific grace be manifest; below, may it match the sincerity of we, your servants, in our devotion. We reverently present this petition.

**Invoking the Ten Resolutions**
First resolve: For the four great elements of the Dao, in harmony with the virtue of the fast’s sponsor. May the seven generations of parents escape suffering and sorrow, ascend to Heaven’s halls, and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second resolve: For the emperor and sovereign, may the Dao’s transformation flourish. May academies thrive, the imperial teachings expand. May their majesty be awe-inspiring, witnessed by all under Heaven. May the people praise great peace, the four barbarians submit. May evil demons perish, sages and worthies be born daily.

Third resolve: For the Dharma masters, may their merit and virtue be greatly established. May their teachings be clear and far-reaching, all attaining immortality.

Fourth resolve: For fellow practitioners. May they swiftly attain the immortal Dao, mutually guiding and delivering one another.

Fifth resolve: For the nine relations to be harmonious, valuing benevolence and righteousness. May they honor the Dao and despise wealth, their conduct a model for all.

Sixth resolve: For self-denial, bestowing alms upon Daoists and the hungry and cold. May all people under Heaven find their rightful place.

Seventh resolve: For crawling and creeping creatures, all sentient beings. May they all receive fulfillment.

Eighth resolve: For pardoning past lives’ debts. May this life’s karmic retribution be resolved through merit, amending past wrongs.

Ninth resolve: For the prosperity of family and nation. May ancestral temples have descendants, and worthy talents be born in every generation.

Tenth resolve: For honoring the scripture masters. May we never falter, maintaining equanimity and single-mindedness. May we broadly deliver all beings, attaining the highest immortality, ascending to Heaven in broad daylight, paying homage to the Supreme. May we forever become perfected ones, riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages, merging in harmony with the True.

**Returning to the Brazier**

To the Fragrant Office Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all attendant spirit-officials of incense: May the place where I offer this incense spontaneously generate golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred numinous perfected ones gather here, assembling before the brazier in the cavernous chamber. May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May I encounter those of karmic affinity and realize the fruit of non-action. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions receive this fragrant smoke and swiftly convey the words I have just uttered directly to the August Presence beneath the Jade Towers of the Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Golden Portal of the Supreme Limitless Dao.

*Exiting the chamber*
End of the Twenty-Sixth Scroll of the *Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Supreme*
Beginning of the Twenty-Seventh Scroll of the *Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Supreme*
Revised by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting

*Disaster-Dispelling Procession in Mid-Retreat*
*Entering the chamber*
Each pays homage to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian of the Numinous**
The Yellow Center commands qi, severing demonic traces.
It suppresses the sources of evil,
restrains and severs demonic tracks.
By the Supreme’s talismanic decree,
divine efficacy is summoned and controlled.
The myriad spirits are thus subdued,
averting calamity and dispelling misfortune.
The Three Wheels of Royal Qi
circulate the True Wind through the cavernous void.
The Purple Portal bestows jade,
conferring boundless deliverance.
To the left, the Azure Waist is commanded;
to the right, the Mushroom Youth is summoned.
Riding the carefree winds of light,
they govern the Nine Empyreans.
The Mystic Altar responds to the moment,
mounting qi in the void’s expanse.
The ten thousand perfected descend universally,
delivering without end.

*Strike the Dharma Drum twenty-four times*

The Supreme Mysterious Origin, the Most High Dao Lord, summons forth from within my body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Envoys, the Golden Youths attendant upon incense, the Jade Maidens who scatter flowers and convey words, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talisman and Daily Incense Officials—thirty-two each in number. Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to report to the Divine Lords of the Mystic Altar of the Heavenly Thearchs. Let them summon the local earth deities and territorial spirit-officials, that they may, in accordance with the present intent, receive the descent of the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure, flowing into our bodies. Thus shall the Purple Clarity’s luxuriance surge forth, and the Jade Towers blaze with brilliance. The Five Elders shall support the root, and the myriad thearchs shall gather the true. Bodies shall reflect the round pearl’s glow, riding the light to the imperial court. Golden radiance shall blaze resplendently, mounting qi to ascend the Upper Clarity. May the words I have uttered swiftly reach the August Presence beneath the Jade Towers of the Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Golden Portal of the Supreme Limitless Dao.

*Each states their dharma-rank*

We, your humble servants, [Names] and others, with utmost sincerity jointly address the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous Origin, the Supreme Limitless Dao and Most High Dao Lord, the Supreme Lord Lao, the August Jade Thearch, the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs, the Jade Clarity Supreme Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, and the Golden Portal of the Mystic Capital, the Seven Treasures, the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm, and all the spirit-officials of the Three Realms.

We humbly recall that as the Dao’s workings unfold and the Primordial August One bestows transformation, the true and numinous manifest their blessings, and heaven and earth respond with auspicious signs. The two correct qi are rectified in the Upper Mystery, and the three calamities are stilled in the lower realms. Thus are all things harmonized and at peace, and all living beings receive blessings and protection. The household and state are universally tranquil, and the dark and hidden realms are universally benefited. We have long received the mysterious grace, bathed in its vast blessings. We have studied and borne the precious texts, perused the true canons. Following the Supreme’s great compassionate decree and the Heavenly Worthy’s universal deliverance, we aspire to establish modest merit to aid the great transformation. We deliver beings and rescue creatures, relieving distress and aiding the imperiled. We assist the state and serve the times, hoping to offer our sincere devotion. For all our words and petitions, dare we not make them known above?

*Reading the Petition*
As the words declare, we deeply cultivate and reverently serve.

May we beseech the sagely grace to dissolve calamities and misfortunes. With reverence, we prepare fragrant flowers and present the ritual offerings. Our hearts pledge before the Three Realms, our lives surrender to the hosts of heaven. Following the mysterious canons, we undertake the fast and vigil. We purify our minds, still our thoughts, kindle lamps, and burn incense. We perform the rites of the *Fahe Tu* for expiation and thanksgiving, adhering to the litanies of the Great One for supplication. Our sincerity hastens to the Golden Gates, our contemplation reaches the Jade Capital. May we attain resonance and receive manifest protection.

At this noon audience, as we perform the Dao, the assembly of ritualists now offers the first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Dao-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Worthies of the Most High. May these merits flow to the imperial destiny and the august lineage, to the ancestral temples and the sagely succession. May the reign transcend the Three and Five, the Dao surpassing Fuxi and Shennong. May the sovereign roam the Purple Pole in spirit, repose in the Crimson Mound and shed his form. Ascending to the ranks of the perfected above, bestowing blessings upon the august lineage below. May the emperor’s longevity equal the Eight Seas, his radiance illumine the Two Effulgences. May Yao’s clouds broadly cover, Shun’s sun ever brighten. May the six palaces embody the rule of gentleness and compliance, the hundred officials uphold loyalty and steadfastness. May all directions be pure and prosperous, the four seas tranquil and orderly.

Now, as we burn incense, we take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtues of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

At this noon audience, as we perform the Dao, the assembly of ritualists now offers the second pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Scripture-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Worthies of the Most High. May these merits flow to the family of the fast’s sponsor, to their karmic bonds through kalpas, their accumulated generations of kin. May the ninefold darkness of lingering attachments and the sevenfold ancestors’ spiritual forms ascend to the sagely hosts in the heavens, escaping the long night’s entanglements. May their transgressions be forever erased, their immortal ranks attained.

Now, as we burn incense, we take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtues of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

At this noon audience, as we perform the Dao, the assembly of ritualists now offers the third pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most Supreme and Perfect Teacher-Treasure. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Worthies of the Most High. May these merits flow to the sponsor’s household. May past faults be absolved, calamities and misfortunes cease. May the living and deceased flourish, their kin secure and peaceful. Even in the cold realms of the earth-prison, may all receive deliverance. May the Three Paths and Nine Nights all behold the light. May the world enjoy harmony and well-being, the land know no disasters or pestilence. May those dwelling in mountains and valleys attain the Dao and ascend to perfection.

Now, as we burn incense, we take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtues of the Perfected, who after attaining the Dao ascended into the formless, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

*Ritual Concludes*
*Confession and Repentance*

Each visualizes the nine-hued perfect image, swallows saliva, and recites the secret incantation to command demons. Stepping into the void, circling and weaving—
cloud-net steps ascend, celestial winds suddenly blow.
Sleeves flutter past the Dipper’s handle, whisk in hand they bow to the Banner of Stars.
Lions bear cinnabar tassels, qilin lead jade-green chariots.
Soaring through the eight poles, how often do spring branches bloom?
Green wings tower in crimson headbands, azure mists entwine feathered robes.
At dawn they hasten to the knot of solar virtue, by night they arrive at the moon’s radiant gate.
They grasp and play with the fires of the celestial sphere, then conceal and stir the earth’s mechanisms.
The Jade Chamber cannot detain them—they soar back toward the nine heavens.

Long ago in the Hall of Extended Grace, at midnight the Nine August Ones descended.
Six Perfected divided left and right, yellow mist coiled through the galleries.
Within the vast palace, the divine lords were revered; immortal soldiers guarded the Daoist sanctuary.
Now the filial descendant continues this vow, face-to-face with the numinous light in an instant.

**Three Bows**
We, your servants, prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity to the Most High Boundless Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate ourselves with utmost sincerity to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Rank**
We, your humble servants, [names], respectfully reaffirm and address the Most High Boundless Dao, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning; the Most High Lord of the Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the boundless hosts of Dao and virtue, all sagely and perfected Celestial Worthies and Great Emperors; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm; the High Ministers and Prime Chancellors; the Four Directors and Five Emperors; and all divine officials and revered spirits of the Three Realms.

We have heard that when the Most High unfurled the charts, the myriad spirits received blessings.
When the Perfected expounded their grace, all beings flourished in glory.
The proper lodgings were measured by celestial reckoning, and calamities were stilled by earthly records.
Divine winds brought tranquility, and the hidden and manifest revived.

Moved by the urgency of disasters and decline, we earnestly seek purification through repentance.
We present offerings of incense, flowers, and ritual tokens, along with brocade and patterned silks.
We pledge our sincerity and offer our hearts, beseeching heaven to grant life.

Following the ritual codes, we have prepared the altar.
Burning incense and lighting lamps, we illuminate the Three Realms—
above, the boundless realms of the myriad heavens and the halls of eternal joy;
below, the deepest recesses of the nine earths and the darkest prisons of hell.
We deliver and liberate the suffering souls of countless kalpas.
May all karmic grievances of eons be universally absolved.
May the nine lineages receive deliverance and attain purity.

Then, may the disasters of stars, planets, sun, and moon—even the dark luminaries—be resolved above;
and may the afflictions of the nine palaces and regional calamities be eradicated below.
A thousand disasters and ten thousand transgressions, deep faults and grave errors—
through this repentance and prayer, may all be swept away.

**Supreme Vows**
May the Emperor enjoy boundless longevity, his reign enduring and prosperous.
May it be as steadfast as heaven and earth, as enduring as mountains and rivers.
May the Empress and inner court embody the virtue of earth’s receptivity.
May the Crown Prince and imperial kinsmen strengthen the sagely enterprise.
May civil and military officials, near and far, fulfill their duties with integrity.
May the hundred offices be rightly ordered, the nine virtues duly observed.
May heaven be clear and earth serene, the nation prosperous and the people harmonious.
May sun and moon shine doubly bright, clouds and mists display five hues.
May weapons be sheathed, grain and harvests abundant.
May the Yellow River yield its ninefold charts, and mountains resound with ten thousand years.

**For the Disciple**
May the disciple [name] open the deliverance of the nine lineages, his entire clan secure and peaceful.
May he propagate loyalty and filial piety to transmit his household, embody benevolence and harmony to continue his legacy.
May all sentient beings, even those in the hidden and dark realms, each attain their proper place.

**For Ourselves**
May we perfect the six virtues and realize the three expedients.
May we dwell in valleys and cold retreats, attaining the fruit of perfection.
Above, may we manifest the great compassion of the Celestial Worthies;
below, may we fulfill our earnest devotion.

**Petitions**
We humbly present our plea.

**Vows**
First vow: May the Great Dao abide in tranquil emptiness, serene and still, dwelling in clarity.
May it widely open the gates of the Dharma, guiding the stubborn and foolish.
May all receive its beneficence and cultivate themselves with diligence.
May those who study together universally ascend to the void,
preserving harmony with heaven, abiding forever without sorrow.

Second vow: May the myriad heavens condense qi and become pure.
May the vast expanse protect and secure the true and numinous.
May climates be harmonious, the four seasons balanced.
May nations be secure and people prosperous, the world at peace.
May all be universally aided, and all living beings receive grace.
May heaven endure eternally, unshaken for countless kalpas.

Third vow: May the earth bear and sustain without end.
May it remain stable and unshaken, seas and abysses uncollapsed.
May it protect and secure households and nations, the multitudes thriving in accord.
May the living be nurtured and the dead at peace, grace extending to the ten directions.
May crops flourish, enterprises prosper daily.
May all receive its abundant support, all beings following in harmony.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, shine brightly.
May they know no eclipses or dimming, remaining serene and clear.
May their light illuminate the heavens, dispelling all darkness.
May they safeguard the kalpic destiny, the world’s reign peaceful.
May they universally bestow moisture and grace, showering blessings upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars and constellations equal the sun in brilliance.
May their revolving light shine radiantly, illuminating the ten directions.
May each remain in its proper place, their paths straight and true.
May they protect and secure households and nations, free from disaster.
May the four seas be united, the world flourishing.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons follow their cycles in due order.
May climates be harmonious, free from calamity.
May epidemics vanish, the world at peace.
May the five grains ripen abundantly, nations wealthy and people joyful.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds gather qi and condense mist.
May they soar high and become pure, shading the mysterious.
When concealed, they embody non-action; when dispersed, they fill the heavens.
May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the host of Perfected.
May grace flow universally, benefiting nations and cherishing people.
May all beings be universally aided, sharing the kalpic age.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and shower without end.
May they universally bestow their bounty, nurturing growth.
May all things flourish, nations store wealth and people prosper.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks each remain in their proper place.
May they tower majestically, forever serving as immortal palaces.
May they secure the nation’s destiny, preserving heaven without end.
May they protect and deliver all, none failing to revere them.

Tenth vow: May rivers and seas be vast and boundless.
May they contain and embrace all, nurturing even the smallest beings.
May their depths be gentle and gracious, moistening all that wriggles and breathes.
May heavenly fires be blessed, and years endure like kalpic stone.

Eleventh vow: May emperors and kings see their lands flourish day by day.
May the Four Guardians remain in harmony, weapons of war never raised.
May heaven and humanity sing in chorus, auspicious omens descend in flight.
May teachings spread in abundance, majestic transformation overflow.
May the myriad people rejoice, their joy unending.

Twelfth vow: May all that flies and crawls, born or unborn,
Universally receive safety, universally attain life and growth.
May they all behold the primordial qi, receiving the form of yang.
May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests endure winter without withering.
May all be delivered and uplifted, none failing to flourish in brilliance.
In harmony, united with the true Dao.

Again, to the Fragrance Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and the Attendant Fragrance Spirits:
May this place where I offer incense naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs.
May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones gather here before the incense burner.
May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality.
May the patron of this retreat receive blessings, and may the hidden and manifest alike be graced with favor.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the orchid-scented smoke,
Conveying the words I have just uttered swiftly to the August Presence beneath the Golden Portal and Jade Steps of the Supreme Non-Ultimate, Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Great Dao.

Exiting the chamber.
The twenty-seventh scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat* concludes.

**The Twenty-Eighth Scroll of the *Rites of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat*
Revised by Master Du Guangting of the Tang**

**Dispelling Disasters and Conducting the Evening Dao Procession**

Entering the chamber. Each pays homage to the master, contemplating as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits:**
The Golden Perfected descend in emptiness; divine tigers patrol the encampment.
The Jade Emperor dons auroral robes; the hosts of heaven command the numinous.
The Nine Dawns turn their chariots; the myriad demons bind their forms.
Ninefold radiance scatters smoke; divine might seizes essence.
Molten gold hurls flame; a hundred evils dissolve as one.
Divine splendor illumines the night; profound darkness yields to eternal spring.
The sagely Dao flows boundless; the ten directions stand solemn and pure.
Preserving the kalpa’s course, primordial harmony prevails—*yuan heng li zhen*.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

O Supreme Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Three *Qi*, Most High Dao Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the left and right envoys, the Incense-Attending Golden Youths, the Message-Conveying Jade Maidens, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants and Daily Incense Officials—thirty-two each—to emerge.
Let those who emerge adorn themselves and report to the Celestial Thearchs of the Mysterious Altar. Let them urgently summon the local earth deities and true officials of this domain to ascend and make their report.
This servant now acts on behalf of the intent herein, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao *qi* and the wondrous light of the *Lingbao* descend and flow into the bodies of this assembly.
Thus shall the Mysterious Altar be purified, and inner and outer become true.
Let the heavens be free of defilement; let the earth be cleansed of demonic dust.
Let jade chimes resound; let the ten directions stand solemn and pure.
Let the myriad demons not intrude; let true sincerity ascend.
May the words this servant has uttered swiftly reach the August Presence before the Supreme Non-Ultimate Great Dao, the Utmost True Jade August Thearch.

**Each Declares Their Dharma Rank**

We, your humble servants, [names], with utmost sincerity jointly proclaim to the Primordial Celestial Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous, the Non-Ultimate Great Dao’s Most High Lord of the Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the August Jade Thearch, the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Celestial Thearchs, the Jade Clarity Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence and Southern Culmen, the Western Numinous and Northern Perfected, the Mysterious Capital and Jade Metropolis, the Golden Portal and Seven-Jewel Mysterious Terrace, the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the *Lingbao*’s Utmost True Radiant August Dao Lord, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, and all the true numina of the three realms’ official retinues:

We have heard that when the Five Vastnesses had yet to shine and the Three Numinous Ones first initiated the work of primordial function, the wondrousness of the undifferentiated had already been established.
When the prior earth and prior heaven were divided, the August Dao alone remained neither bright nor dim.
It first emerged among the multitudes of beings, thus endlessly transforming and tirelessly adapting to conditions.
Emperors and kings revered it to attain governance; dynastic fortunes relied on it for great peace.
Blessings return to the good; calamities and disasters naturally cease.
We early glimpsed the true standards and reverently received the numinous ordinances.
We aspire to establish meritorious deeds, aiding people and assisting the state.
Moreover, having received the imperial decree, how dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the words of the petition state, our sincerity is earnest and our devotion profound.
We reverently uphold the Dharma tokens and solemnly open the altar.
May our transgressions be absolved; may disasters and misfortunes be dispelled.
As we ascend the altar to receive the Dharma and make our initial vows, may the Five Thearchs witness our covenant and the Three Officials attest to our sincerity.
Aiding the state and enacting transformation, salvation shall come first.
Thus do we dare to unfold and consult the mysterious scriptures, proclaiming the compassionate decrees.
Conducting the retreat and practicing the Dao, we emulate earth and model heaven.
We present the brocade of tenfold splendor; we exhaust our sincerity in prayer to the eight directions.
Hoping that through this red petition, our words may ascend to the Mysterious Void.

Tonight, as we conduct the evening Dao procession, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Utmost True *Dao* Treasure.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the august spirits of our ancestral temples, to the enlightened ancestors of successive generations.
May they condense their spirits upon the cloud paths, transcending the constellations’ courses.
May they ride the Dipper’s handle to bestow auspiciousness, ascend the imperial chariot to manifest favor.
May jade charts and divine records align with the eternal heavens and earth.
May their blessings moisten the celestial waves, rivaling the depths of the abyssal seas.
May the emperor’s transformative influence be complete and decisive, his Dao harmonizing with non-action.
May he stand alongside the Three and Five, pointing to Mount Song and Mount Heng as eternal as they.
May his dominion embrace the myriad lands; may his chariot tracks unify all under heaven.
May inner and outer realms be harmonious and peaceful; may the constant norms be properly ordered.

Thus do we now burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely hosts, the perfected and true virtues, that after attaining the Dao, we may ascend into the formless.
Harmonizing with the Dao, we attain the true.

Tonight, as we conduct the evening Dao procession, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the second pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Utmost True *Scripture* Treasure.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the disciple [name]’s household.
May their numinous essence endure for a hundred million generations; may the ninefold mysteries of the hidden be awakened.
May they transcend and ascend to the Northern Mansion, refining and transforming in the Southern Palace.
May they bathe in the flowing fire to partake in the true; may they enter the luminous clouds to realize the Dao.
May auspicious blessings descend; may all the living be universally graced.
Thus do we now burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely hosts, the perfected and true virtues, that after attaining the Dao, we may ascend into the formless.
Harmonizing with the Dao, we attain the true.

Tonight, as we conduct the evening Dao procession, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the third pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Utmost True *Master* Treasure.
We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying on the Three Honored Ones of the Most High.
May this merit flow to the disciple [name]’s household, their kin and relatives, the ninefold affines and sixfold clans.
May disasters be dispelled before they manifest; may blessings descend without limit.
May misfortunes be dissolved in purity; may calamities and miseries cease.
May longevity extend and emoluments endure; may misfortune vanish and blessings arise.
May all beings be universally graced; may the multitudes of billions be aided.
May they all tread the path of integrity and auspiciousness, universally partaking in felicity.
May the nine nights be illuminated; may the three paths be bright and clear.
May all under heaven be wholly saved; may all receive favor.
Thus do we now burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely hosts, the perfected and true virtues, that after attaining the Dao, we may ascend into the formless.
Harmonizing with the Dao, we attain the true.

**Paying Homage to the Directions**
**Repentance**

**Procession of the Void**

In circling steps, we revolve around the sacred register’s path of true cultivation;
With cinnabar sincerity, we offer our supplications to the heavens above.
Before the icy abyss, the multitudes stand poised;
Through vigilant dawn and dusk, we bring forth peace and well-being.
All things dissolve their afflictions and pestilence;
The three dawns manifest their auspicious signs.
The chant of the *Step of the Void* now resounds;
We further intone the *Profound Mystery’s* verses.
Gently unfolds the land of divine realms;
Majestically stands the altar of myriad wonders.
Crane-robed feathered adepts descend;
Duck-sandaled immortals alight as celestial officials.
Jade goblets pour the primal nectar;
Jasper caskets unveil the great elixir.
With utmost sincerity, how shall we pray?
May the four seas remain forever serene.
Water sprayed subdues the demonic palaces;
Lamps kindled illuminate the nocturnal courts.
The winds of the nine heavens fall silent;
The qi of the four extremities turns crystalline.
We chant and soar through the Vermilion Mound’s domain;
We wheel and glide above the White Jade Capital.
With utmost sincerity, how shall we pray?
May the nation’s fortune endure in eternal peace and glory.

**Threefold Reverence**
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost devotion and bow our heads in homage to the Supreme Boundless Dao of the Great Ultimate.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost devotion and bow our heads in homage to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost devotion and bow our heads in homage to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Ranks**
We, your humble servants, [names], now reverently reaffirm our address to:
The Supreme Boundless Dao of the Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Origin,
The Supreme Lord of the Great Dao,
The Supreme Lord Lao,
The Perfected and Boundless Supreme Dao,
The Host of Sagely and Virtuous Heavenly Venerables,
The Celestial Emperors,
The Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures,
The Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm,
The High Ministers and Prime Chancellors,
The Four Directors and Five Emperors,
And all the revered numina of the Three Realms who respond to invocation.

We, your servants, receive transformation from the Supreme Mystery,
And are elevated in form within the Middle Land.
We revere and cultivate the supreme Dao,
And partake in the study of the numinous texts.

May we conceal our traces among cliffs and peaks,
And nest our spirits in the void and stillness.
We aspire to ascend and transcend,
To rise high and leave the dusty world behind.

Yet the Dharma permits the building of merit,
And the Dao takes precedence in aiding the state.
We ferry beings across and relieve the suffering,
Rescuing the distressed and upholding the imperiled.
We propagate the Heavenly Venerable’s compassion of salvation and protection,
And reveal the path for the multitudes to take refuge.

In Heaven above and Earth below,
All may attain what is fitting.

Your disciple [name], bound by adverse fate,
Is deeply troubled by peril and distress.
Wishing to present this petition through the proper channels,
I hope to convey my sincere prayers.

I pledge my heart with silk and brocade,
And offer incense and flowers as tokens of faith.
Looking up, I pray for the state and its people,
Extending blessings to both the living and the departed.

I repent and seek grace,
To dissolve calamities and invoke fortune.

Reflecting upon the consequences of past lives,
And the transgressions accumulated over countless kalpas—
Unawakened to the true and real,
Unmindful of precepts and statutes,
I have defied Heaven and violated Earth,
Piling grave errors upon deep faults.
Intentional killing, accidental harm,
New grudges and old debts,
Arising from the six senses,
Committed by the three karmic actions—
Boundless and immeasurable,
Beyond reckoning or recall.

The registers of the Nine Bureaus and Three Officials,
The courts of the Four Directors and Five Emperors—
Where sins are easily accrued,
And meritorious deeds are hard to establish.

The Seven Mysteries and Nine Netherworlds bear records of scrutiny,
While karmic debts from past lives carry registers of lingering misfortune.
