Some suffer calamities from celestial omens and stellar transits,
Others face tribulations in their fateful years and cyclical fortunes.
The Nine Palaces bring punishment and severance,
The Eight Trigrams clash and obstruct.
The categories of yin and yang are boundless,
The profound mysteries of the divine Dao are unfathomable.
Thus, disasters and faults arise,
And my resolve to repent and pray is earnest.
I array the altar and invoke the descent of true sages,
Offering hearth incense to convey my sincerity,
Bowing in reverence and baring my heart.
I humbly beseech the exalted saints and venerated hosts to cast their radiant gaze in mercy.
May the thousand disasters and myriad tribulations all be swept away.
Above, I pray for the eternal prosperity of the state,
And the boundless virtue of the sovereign.
May the Five Planets follow their proper courses,
And the Two Luminaries shine with doubled brilliance.
May the passes and cities know no toil of garrison,
And the frontier fortresses be free from beacon fires of alarm.
May the Five Mountains and Eight Seas secure the four quarters,
And the steepest peaks and deepest waters submit to the transforming influence of virtue.
May auspicious clouds drift in vibrant hues,
And sweet dew condense in abundance.
May the year yield a bountiful harvest of fine grain,
And felicitous omens arrive day by day.
May I, your disciple, along with my nine ancestral generations and seven familial lines,
Ride the grace of blessings to roam freely;
May my five clans and six relations
Bathe in the divine favor and enjoy peace and prosperity.
May the borders be tranquil,
And weapons of war laid to rest.
May plagues and poisons vanish,
And malevolent forces be eradicated.
May the Nine Dark Hells of the underworld
Behold the compassionate light of the Most High;
May the sinful souls of the Six Realms
Receive the beneficent power of the Heavenly Perfected.
Together, may they all attain deliverance
And ascend to liberation.
May all beings—moving and still, flying and submerged—
Attain the eternal Dao.
Above, may the great mercy of the Heavenly Worthy be made manifest;
Below, may the sincerity of this disciple and assembly in repentance be fulfilled.
I respectfully present this petition for your hearing.

**Vows**
First, may the Great Dao flow freely, and all under heaven embrace virtue.
Second, may all sentient beings awaken to the Dao.
Third, may the sorrowful souls of the Nine Nights attain liberation at once.
Fourth, may the orphaned and unattached spirits all receive rebirth.
Fifth, may the world know peace, and the five grains ripen in abundance.
Sixth, may ministers be loyal and children filial, rulers benevolent and fathers kind.
Seventh, may the four seas unite in harmony, and enmity and kinship be reconciled.
Eighth, may those concealed in wombs or encased in eggs all attain birth and growth.
Ninth, may chronic and recent ailments swiftly be healed.
Tenth, may the destitute and orphaned enjoy ample clothing and food.

**Replenishing the Incense Burner**
Incense Official Messengers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, Attendant Incense Spirits—
At this place where I offer incense,
May golden elixir, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms naturally arise.
May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones
Gather here before the incense burner.
May I, in seeking the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality.
May the patron of this retreat receive blessings,
And both the living and the departed partake in grace.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions,
Attending the orchid-scented smoke,
Convey my earlier petition
And swiftly deliver it to the Celestial Throne of the Most High, Boundless, Formless, Nameless,
Vacuous, and Spontaneous Great Dao.

**Exiting the Chamber**
Here concludes the twenty-eighth scroll of the *Rites of the Yellow Register Retreat of the Most High*.

**Scroll Twenty-Nine of the *Rites of the Yellow Register Retreat*
Revised by Tang Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting
Morning Dao-Observance for Repentance and Disease-Averting**

**Entering the Chamber**
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
Golden perfected ones and verdant mists
Radiate through the Three Heavens.
Crimson clouds traverse the cinnabar skies,
While the host of heavens reins in their chariots.
Dawn’s splendor dispels the gloom,
And shadows vanish at morning’s glow.
The Ninefold Subtleties shake the void,
As the Five Stars wheel in their courses.
Myriad immortals respond to the resonance,
In the mystery of spontaneity.
From the fathomless depths, light scatters,
And forms divide into billions.
Jeweled pearls gleam with brilliance,
Auspicious signs descend upon the altar’s domain.
The living and the dead receive grace,
Bathed in the refining springs of gold.
Demon kings tremble in fear,
As the Three Fields merge with the luminous.

**Strike the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
O Most High Three Heavens, Mysterious Primordial Three *Qi* of the Supreme Dao Lord,
Summon forth from within this servant’s body:
The Three and Five Merit Officers,
Left and right attendant messengers,
Incense-bearing golden youths,
Message-conveying jade maidens,
Five Emperors’ direct talismans,
And incense officials of the day—
Each in thirty-two ranks, now emerge.
As they depart, arrayed in solemn vestments,
They unlock the gates of the numinous altar,
Invoking the celestial deities and earthly gods of this land and domain.

This servant now humbly petitions:
May the wondrous light of the Jade Clarity Dao *qi* and Numinous Treasure
Descend and flow into our bodies,
That the words we now utter
Be swiftly conveyed to the Celestial Throne of the Most High, Boundless, Formless, Nameless,
Vacuous, and Spontaneous Great Dao.

**Each States Their Dharma Rank**
We, your humble servants, together in sincerity, reverently address
The Vacuous and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy,
The Boundless Great Dao, Supreme Lord of the Great Dao,
The Most High Lord Lao,
The Jade Emperor of the August Heaven,
The perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao,
The thirty-six Heavenly Lords,
The Jade Clarity Emperor,
The Great Emperor of the Jade Clarity,
The Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected,
The Golden Portal of the Mystic Capital, the Seven-Treasured Mystic Terrace,
The Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace,
The Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord,
The thirty-six divisions of the revered scriptures,
The Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm,
And all the divine officials of the Three Realms.

We prostrate ourselves, having heard:
The movements of *qi* and celestial signs,
The manifest and hidden workings of yin and yang.
Rise and fall follow the cycles of fortune,
While waxing and waning mark the thresholds of blessing and calamity.
How much more so in this dusty world,
Where none escape the crucible of fate?
Yet the Three Worthies expound the teachings,
Bestowing the ordinances to save the living and deliver the dead;
The myriad sages extend their compassion,
Revealing the methods to rescue beings and succor the imperiled.
Their divine transformations widely spread,
Sheltering all living things.
We, having trodden the gateway of the Dharma,
Have early received the merciful instructions.
Thus, we ought to avert disasters and extricate hardships,
Praying for blessings upon the people.
To propagate the teachings and establish merit,
Thereby manifesting the profound mysteries.
Now, in obedience to the edict,
How dare we not make this known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the words declare, our sincerity is urgent.
May the great protection be extended,
That our devout prayers be conveyed.

The retreat’s patron, [Name],
Has been stained by the six dusts,
Molded by the four great elements.
Water and fire vary in their abundance,
While darkness and light differ in their joy and sorrow.
At times, harmony is disrupted,
Suddenly giving rise to illness and misfortune.
Body and spirit race in panic,
Life and destiny hang in peril.
Only by knocking upon the gates of the true and numinous
May deliverance be hoped for.

We, your servants, reverently follow the ritual codes,
Arranging the altar’s precincts.
We bow our heads to implore grace,
Gazing heavenward to beseech the mandate.
At this early morning observance,
We, the assembled Dharma practitioners,
Now offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens,
Directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives,
Prostrating ourselves to the ground,
Relying upon the Three Worthies of the Most High.
May these merits and virtues
Flow to the emperor, the lord of the realm, and the sacred spirits of the altars of soil and grain.
May the phoenix’s records and dragon’s charts
Endure with heaven and earth;
May the imperial virtue and sagely influence
Shine as long as the sun and moon.
May wisdom illuminate the ten thousand directions,
And benevolence extend to the eight extremities.
May the heir apparent, the empress, and the consorts,
Along with the ministers within and without,
Together foster harmony and prosperity,
Bringing peace to the realm.
Within the eight limits of the world,
May rulers, ministers, officials, and people
All be overspread by boundless blessings,
And the whole earth bask in radiant peace.

Now therefore we kindle incense,
Taking refuge in the Perfected Virtue of the Great Sage Masters and the Host of the Most Real,
Who, having attained the Dao,
Ascend into the Formless.
Harmony unites with the True Dao.

On this morning audience in the Dao,
We, the ritual assembly, offer this second pinch of incense.
May its fragrant smoke ascend through the heavens,
Directly to present offerings to the Most High and Perfect Scriptural Treasure.
We prostrate ourselves, body and life,
Bowing our heads to the ground,
Relying upon the Three Worthies of the Most High.
May these merits and virtues
Flow to the patron of this retreat, the household of so-and-so.
May the nine generations and seven lineages,
The hundred thousand myriad ancestors,
Kin and affinal relations,
And the departed spirits of the departed,
By the mysterious power of the Yellow Register,
Ascend to the Vermilion Mound’s immortal realm.
May their yang radiance refine their forms,
As fire tempers essence.
May their names be stricken from the Black Ledger,
And their registers inscribed in the Azure Palace.
In the carefree realm of the Real,
May they forever cast off the calamities of lingering afflictions;
May those yet living receive blessings,
And enjoy the fortune of peace and integrity.

Now therefore we kindle incense,
Taking refuge in the Perfected Virtue of the Great Sage Masters and the Host of the Most Real,
Who, having attained the Dao,
Ascend into the Formless.
Harmony unites with the True Dao.

On this morning audience in the Dao,
We, the ritual assembly, offer this third pinch of incense.
May its fragrant smoke ascend through the heavens,
Directly to present offerings to the Most High and Perfect Masterly Treasure.
We prostrate ourselves, body and life,
Bowing our heads to the ground,
Relying upon the Three Worthies of the Most High.
May these merits and virtues
Flow to the patron of this retreat, so-and-so,
That the disasters clinging to his person be dispelled,
And his misfortunes be stilled.
May illness and infirmity be healed,
And enmities be reconciled.
May the Lord of Life of Southern Prosperity
Open the Register of Life to prolong his years;
May the Imperial Lord of the Northern Office
Erase his name from the Black Book of Death.
May his hun-soul and shen-spirit be purified and rectified,
And his myriad qi endure forever.
May his kin and affinal relations
Together partake in this sublime blessing.
Whether soaring or sinking, of different natures or forms,
May all moving creatures
Bathe in this mysterious grace,
And together attain integrity and felicity.

Now therefore we kindle incense,
Taking refuge in the Perfected Virtue of the Great Sage Masters and the Host of the Most Real,
Who, having attained the Dao,
Ascend into the Formless.
Harmony unites with the True Dao.

The rites are complete;
We repent our transgressions.

Each visualizes the nine-hued spherical image, swallows saliva, and recites the secret incantation to command demons—thrice intoned:

*"I take the Dharma as my wife,
Cherish the sutras as pearls and jade.
Holding precepts to restrain the six senses,
Mindful of the Dao to dispel desires.
In purity, the true qi settles;
In serenity, the spirit grows still.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect—
Lifetimes of boundless fortune unfold.
Prosperous are the households and states,
Flourishing the scriptures and the Dao.
Heaven and humankind share this vow,
Ethereally entering the Great Vehicle.
By the heart’s resolve, the field of merit is sown;
The Dharma-wheel ascends in endless motion.
Seven generations ascend to celestial halls,
While this body soars in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the mysterious void—
With thought, nothing fails to align.
Refining the form to join the immortals,
Thus attaining the vajra-body.
Transcending the three realms’ tribulations,
The five hells’ sufferings are dissolved.
All return to the Most High’s sutras—
In stillness, we bow in reverence."*

Thrice we bow:
We, with utmost sincerity, prostrate and bow to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao.
We, with utmost sincerity, prostrate and bow to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, with utmost sincerity, prostrate and bow to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reaffirming the Dharma ranks:
We, your humble servants, [Names] and others, with unified devotion, reverently address the Most High, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Venerable of the Origin; the Most High Lord of the Great Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the Boundless Great Dao and Virtue’s host of sages across the ten directions; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm; and all the true numina of the three realms’ official retinues.

Having received the mystic ordinances and reverently upheld the compassionate teachings, we aid the times and assist the state, propagating the Dao to pacify the people.

Yet our traces mingle with the marketplace and court, our merits as light as dust and dew. Ever deepening our vigilance and fear, we dare not rest in ease. Yet the Dharma demands propagation, and duty calls first to deliverance and salvation.

Now the patron of this retreat, [Name], pressed by calamitous celestial omens and assailed by illness and distress, grieves as if life were a flickering candle, his very existence imperiled. Today, he lays bare his heart to plead for life, prostrating at the gate of the Dharma. We, your servants, accordingly follow the luminous ordinances, conducting this retreat and performing the Dao. We inscribe the petitions, enumerate the transgressions, and offer repentance for both the living and the dead.

We fear that through nine generations, karmic misfortunes have flowed and accumulated; that in past lives and former ages, grievances have knotted and congealed. Perhaps in resolve or thought, he has transgressed against hidden virtue; or in emotion or intent, failed to align with the numinous. Past faults and former errors, hidden sins and manifest transgressions—all these causes and conditions, layer upon layer, have woven this disaster and peril.

We further fear that in the three destinies and five phases, the nine palaces and eight trigrams, the celestial patterns and stellar constellations, the revolutions of fate and the cycles of years, baleful influences have descended, and stars have cast their baleful light. Perhaps his life’s allotment is meager, his fortune weak; or he has incurred old slayings, unintended harms, new grievances, or past debts. Or perhaps the qi of the five pestilences and hundred poisons, or the followers of malevolent spirits and demonic attachments, have assailed him—externally penetrating his skin and flesh, internally invading his viscera and bowels—giving rise to this grave illness, which has yet to be cured or dispelled.

We humbly beseech the Most High to bestow mercy, and the Three Luminaries to absolve his sins. May all karmic enmities be dissolved, all disasters and misfortunes harmonized and released. For sins without limit across past lives and this present existence, we now offer repentance and supplication, praying that all be forgiven and erased. May his true qi flow freely, his numinous fluids spread and moisten. May the hundred afflictions be purged, the six palaces attain peace. May his allotted blessings increase in abundance, his years extend in longevity. May his entire household enjoy fortune, and both inner and outer realms be graced with prosperity.

Above, we pray for the tranquility of the altars of soil and grain, and the eternal life of the emperor. May wind and rain be timely and harmonious, the years abundant, and the times prosperous. May all sentient beings with consciousness ascend to the realm of longevity.

May the great compassion of the Most High Heavenly Venerable shine above, and may our sincerity in prayer and repentance be met below. We reverently present this petition for your hearing.

**Invocation of Intentions**

First intention: For the Dao, the four great elements unite in virtue. May the patron’s seven generations of parents be freed from sorrow and suffering, ascend to the heavenly halls, and enjoy sustenance as natural as the Dao itself.

Second intention: For the emperor and sovereign, may the transformative power of the Dao flourish and prosper. May the schools and academies thrive, the imperial teachings expand in grandeur. May their majesty and dignity be revered by all under heaven. May the people praise the era as one of great peace, and the four barbarians submit in awe. May evil and malevolence vanish of their own accord, and worthy individuals arise daily.

Third intention: For the Dharma Master, may great merit and virtue be established. May their teachings be luminous and far-reaching, and may they together attain the flight of immortals.

Fourth intention: For fellow aspirants and disciples, may they swiftly attain the Dao of immortality and mutually guide one another to liberation.

Fifth intention: For the nine relations, may harmony prevail. May they esteem benevolence and righteousness, honor the Dao and disdain wealth, and serve as models for all beings.

Sixth intention: For selfless giving, may offerings be made to Daoist masters and those who suffer from hunger and cold. May all people under heaven find their rightful place.

Seventh intention: For all creatures that creep and crawl, may every sentient being attain fulfillment and completion.

Eighth intention: For the absolution of past lives’ sins and present-life karmic retributions, may merits be established to redress transgressions.

Ninth intention: For the prosperity of family and state, may ancestral temples be tended by worthy descendants, and generations give rise to sages and talents.

Tenth intention: For reverence toward the master and scriptures, may we never falter in diligence, maintaining a mind of equanimity. May all beings be broadly delivered, and may we together attain the rank of immortals, ascending to heaven in broad daylight to pay homage to the Most High. May we forever become perfected beings, riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages, harmonizing with the Dao to become true. **The incense burner is sealed.**

To the Incense Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attending Incense Spirits: May the place where this incense is offered naturally give rise to golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected beings gather here before the incense burner. May this disciple study the Dao and attain the Dao, seek immortality and attain immortality. May the patron receive blessings, and may both the hidden and manifest realms be graced with favor.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions, who attend the orchid-scented smoke, swiftly convey the words just uttered to the August Jade Sovereign of the Golden Portal of the Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Supreme Dao of Boundless Vastness.

*Exiting the chamber*
**End of the Twenty-Ninth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat Rites**
**Beginning of the Thirtieth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat Rites**
*Compiled by Tang Dynasty Master of Broad Achievement, Du Guangting*

*Entering the chamber*
Each pays homage to the master, contemplating as prescribed.

**Guardian of the Numinous**
Chanting the empty and cavernous, the Lord of the Altar stands guard.
The Five Emperors review records, receiving talismans from the Three Officials.
The four gates are secured, binding demons and expelling treachery.
Flaming bells are cast, impurities burned, and remnants purged.
The body bears the golden script, refining the elixir and rejuvenating the countenance.
Merging with the mysterious and plain, the heart stirs the three barriers.
Riding lions and cranes, mounting dragons and phoenixes.
The stars guard their stations, a thousand demons dare not intrude.
The Dao and qi endure, the myriad immortals rest in peace.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
O Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Three Qi of the Mysterious Origin, Supreme Dao Lord: Summon forth from within this disciple’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attending Messengers, the Golden Youths of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Thirty-Two Incense Officials of the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans and Daily Spirits. Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to report to the Divine Lords of the Mysterious Altar and the Heavenly Emperor. Let them now invoke the local earth deities and true officials of this domain.

This disciple now offers prayers with utmost sincerity: May the wondrous light of the Jade Clarity’s Dao qi and Numinous Treasure descend and flow into our bodies. May the altar within and without be purified and made true. May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth cleansed of demonic dust. May the jade chimes resound, the ten directions be solemn and clear. May the myriad demons not intrude, and may true sincerity ascend. May the words just uttered swiftly reach the August Jade Sovereign of the Golden Portal of the Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Supreme Dao of Boundless Vastness.

**Each declares their dharma rank**
We, your humble disciples of such-and-such rank, together with utmost sincerity, reverently address the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous Origin, the Supreme Jade Dawn Lord of the Boundless Dao, the Most High Lord Lao, the Jade Emperor of the August Heaven, the great sage hosts and perfected lords of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Heavenly Emperors, the Jade Clarity Emperor, the Great Emperor of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Flower, Southern Ultimate, Western Numinous, and Northern True Lords of the Mysterious Capital, the Golden Portal, the Seven-Jewel Mysterious Terrace, the Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace, the Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, and all responsive and perceptive numinous beings of the three realms.

We prostrate ourselves, having heard that the wondrous and marvelous origin, vast and transformative, preceded the emperors; the supreme and ultimate honored one, whose mysterious merit extends beyond all things. Though yin and yang rise and fall, and kalpas begin and end, it remains serene and constant, majestic and self-sustaining. Thus, the three thousand luminous realms all submit to its divine grace; the five hundred million celestial gates together attain its Dao transformation.

As fortune and misfortune alternate, and blessings and calamities shift, all may be dispelled by its sagely power, washed clean by its numinous grace. It rescues the imperiled, saves all beings, assists the state, and transforms the people. For ten thousand ages, it has been revered, its responses unfailing.

Now, bearing our petitions and presenting our pleas, we humbly seek its favor. Whatever we pray for, by principle, should be reported. Having received these words, how dare we not make them known above?

**Reading the Petition**
In accordance with the sincerity of these words, deeply do we knock and pray. Disciple So-and-so, afflicted by the interplay of yin and yang, harmed by cold and heat, bows in reverence, baring his heart, earnestly seeking protection.

We, your disciples, reflect that the Heavenly Worthy, ever compassionate, constantly saves all beings. Raising the Dharma raft to ferry across the sea of delusion, suspending the jewel to gather all beings. Proclaiming the precepts and expounding the teachings, warding off distress and aiding the imperiled.

Thus, we purify our thoughts and cleanse our hearts, performing the retreat and practicing the Dao. We pray that your sagely power may dispel calamities and obscurations.

Today, at the noon audience, we conduct the Dao ritual. The Dharma assembly now offers the first pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most High and Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, reverently relying upon the Three Honored Ones of the Most High. May these merits flow to the august spirits of the altars and ancestors, to the former sages of our lineage. May they ascend to the eight luminous realms, merge with the nine purities. Gazing upon the great void, may they bestow blessings upon the great enterprise.

May the emperor embody the virtue of Yao, establishing the ultimate, succeeding Yu and inheriting the mandate. May he illumine the golden mirror in the purple court, turning the jade balance in the azure heavens. May the star of longevity shine ever brighter, the mountain of fortune grow ever loftier. May the empress and consorts assist in transforming the six palaces, and the ministers and aides secure the myriad domains. May radiance spread through the realm of the Dao, and harmony be perfectly achieved through non-action.

For this, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely hosts and perfected virtues of our masters. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into non-action, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

Today, at the noon audience, we conduct the Dao ritual. The Dharma assembly now offers the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Most High and Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, reverently relying upon the Three Honored Ones of the Most High. May these merits flow to the household of disciple So-and-so. May the nine generations and seven lineages, the myriad ancestors and hundredfold forebears, depart from the courts of the dark netherworld, leave the courts of eternal night. May their karmic nets be dissolved, their blessings and auspices gather abundantly. Even those in the springs’ sealed chambers and the flying and moving beings of other realms—may all receive the blessings of good fortune and be universally delivered.

For this, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely hosts and perfected virtues of our masters. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into non-action. We harmonize with the Dao to become true.

Today, at the noon audience, we conduct the Dao ritual. The Dharma assembly now offers the third pinch of incense.

May this incense smoke ascend through the void, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Master-Treasures. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves with heads to the earth, reverently relying on the Three Supreme Ones. May these merits and virtues flow to the disciple So-and-so’s person. May calamities be washed away, and misfortunes be dissolved. Past grievances and old debts, through repentance and prayer, be wholly eradicated; deep-seated transgressions and hidden blemishes, through the fragrance of cultivation, be purified. May malevolent forces be stilled, and years of fortune be prolonged.

For this, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the great sagely hosts and perfected virtues of our masters. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into non-action. We harmonize with the Dao to become true.

We bow in ritual, repent, and reflect. Envisioning the nine-colored perfect image, we swallow saliva and recite the secret incantation against demons. Stepping in emptiness, we circumambulate:

The azure canopy of Primordial Qi unfurls,
Golden incense forms pearl-like smoke.
The flying dawn gathers reins as one,
Bowing before the Jade Emperor’s presence.
His heart vast and at ease, he bestows upon us the *Tai Ling Pian*.
This is the indestructible Dao,
By which the myriad heavens uphold our authority.
We traverse the hollow void,
While lower immortals grope in its depths.
The One Qi transforms the primordial origin,
Vastly preceding the Two Modes.
Precious ramparts race golden steeds,
True incense sprays from jade lotuses.
Soaring through space, we rein in dragon steeds,
While Brahmanic chants guide the divine chariot.
Through endless kalpas of eternal spring,
We soar in the formless heavens.
The mysteries of the Initial Perfected are hard to fathom,
Thus we admonish the immortals within the precepts.
The exalted Perfected illuminate virtue and the Dao,
Bequeathing to the world the *Five Thousand Words*.
Though our explanations are meager and shallow,
We exhaust our sincerity to fathom the wondrous origin.
Rainbow banners adorn the sacred canons,
Feathered hymns resound through cloud-borne chariots.
Auspicious cranes hover in the sky,
Propitious winds dispel summer’s heat.
The vault of heaven responds to these sounds,
Bestowing a reign of countless years.

We perform the Three Bows:
With utmost sincerity, we bow in reverence to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
With utmost sincerity, we bow in reverence to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, we bow in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reaffirming our ranks, we, the humble disciples So-and-so, respectfully re-present our supplication to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Commencement; the Supreme Great Dao Lord; the Supreme Lord Lao; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm; the High Ministers and Prime Aides; the Four Directors and Five Emperors; the Right and Left Perfected Ones of the Orthodox Unity; the Supreme Perfected Purple Void Primordial Lady of the Southern Peak; and all the divine officials and hosts of the Three Realms.

We humbly recall: when the Heavenly Origin established the supreme pole and the Earthly Principle marked the pivot, riding the wondrous Dao to differentiate forms and fixing the Two Modes to set forth images, their vast embrace knew no bounds, their sheltering power was inexhaustible. Yet the cycles of nine and six bring changes of ascent and descent; the alternations of decline and prosperity mark the passage of kalpas. How much more so for human kind—how could they be free from decline and decay?

Disciple So-and-so, dwelling in the worldly net and stained by the dusty realm, is constrained by qi and phenomena, struck by fortune and misfortune. Thus, he is entangled in illness and misfortune, ever more deeply beset by worry and peril. We fear that in past lives and this existence, karmic blemishes remain unwashed, old grievances and accumulated transgressions, debts and disputes, are yet unresolved. Perhaps through intentional killing or accidental harm, he has incurred misfortune and blame. Or through the stars and his natal destiny, he has suffered evil and calamity. His form and fate are humble and fragile—there is nowhere to turn for repentance and prayer.

Therefore, we lay bare our hearts to the Great Dao, prostrating ourselves before the Mystic Code. We establish the altar and humbly offer repentance and gratitude. Following the rank and protocol of the Heavenly Master, we initiate the first ritual document. In accordance with the Purple Void Primordial Lady’s method of repentance for calamities, we now petition on behalf of So-and-so:

We summon the Heavenly Prosperity Lord and one hundred thousand Yellow-Clad Soldiers to gather and remove all inauspicious influences, the twelve criminal and deadly qi, from within and without the disciple’s household.

We further summon the Southern Palace Heavenly Bright Lord and the Northern Star Six Mechanisms Lord to collect the five pestilences, hundred poisons, and hundred illnesses.

We summon the Feng-Li Lord and the Red Plain Lord to eliminate the disciple’s ailments of the heart, abdomen, and urinary obstructions.

We summon the Heavenly Official Five Balances Lord, the Earthly Official Five Balances Lord, the Nine Rivers Northern Sea Lord, the Kingly Law Lord, the Nine Assemblies Lord, the Great Official Yang Order Lord, the Southern Superior Lord, the Momentary Lord, and the Stone Immortal Lord to expel all inner and outer demonic afflictions causing illness.

We summon the Heaven-Covering Great General and the Upper Prime Officer Lord to capture and subdue all malevolent deceased spirits, averting misfortune and inviting blessings.

We summon the Earth-Restraining Lord and the Four Hu Lords to dispel the calamities of the disciple’s current year and natal destiny, severing the qi of deceased spirits’ influences.

We summon the Qi-Moving Calamity-Dissolving Lord, the Supreme High Granary Lord, the Supreme Heavenly Lord, and the Level Heaven Lord to dissolve and remove the ghosts of death, mourning, punishment, harm, and the five graves.

We summon the Numinous Plain Heavenly Essence Lord, the Red Heaven Qi-Consuming Lord, and the Spirit-Gathering Upper Bright Lord to sever the disciple’s nightmares, malevolent ghosts, and the qi of lingering illnesses.

May the twenty-four divisions of heavenly officials and soldiers descend in timely fashion to punish evil, extinguish malevolence, and subdue inauspicious influences. May true qi secretly aid him, granting peace and well-being. May his dreams and waking be upright, his lifespan prolonged. May his nine generations of ancestors ascend to heaven, and his six relations receive blessings. May dragon spirits guard and protect him, his dwelling secure and tranquil.

Above, we pray that the imperial Dao shines resplendently, the Heavenly Origin be bright and serene. May weapons of war be forever stilled, wind and rain arrive in due season. May grain and crops be abundant, the hidden and manifest realms harmonious. May all beings be universally included, even those in the darkest chambers. May all together bathe in the profound grace and together attain the realm of blessings. May the luminous Heavenly Worthy’s vast compassion respond to our humble repentance and supplication.

We respectfully present this entreaty.

We now make our vows:

First, may the Great Dao be serene and empty, tranquil and still, dwelling in clarity and purity. May it widely open the gates of the Dharma, instructing the stubborn and foolish. May all receive its beneficent grace and cultivate with diligence. May we, together with our fellow students, universally ascend to the void, preserving our union with heaven, abiding forever without care.

Second, may the myriad heavens condense their qi and become clear. May the high void broadly shelter, preserving the true and securing the numinous. May the climate be harmonious, the four seasons balanced. May the nation be secure, the people prosperous, and all under heaven be at peace. May all beings be universally aided, and its beneficence extend to all life. May the heavens be preserved for countless kalpas, never to collapse.

Third, may the earth bear and sustain without end.

May the earth remain stable and unshaken, the seas calm and uncollapsed. May it safeguard and secure the state and family, and the myriad people flourish in harmony. May it nurture life and grant peaceful death, its beneficence extending to the ten directions. May crops and grains flourish, and daily sustenance abound. May all receive its abundant support, and the myriad beings follow in accord.

Fourth, may the sun and moon, the two luminaries, stand high and bright. May they know no sudden eclipses, their waxing and waning serene and clear. May their light illumine all heavens, dissolving the deepest darkness. May they preserve the kalpas’ course, and the world’s destiny be at peace. May their moistening grace universally extend, showering blessings upon all beings.

Fifth, may the stars and constellations shine with the same radiance as the sun. May their revolving brilliance illuminate, casting clear light in the ten directions. May each abide in its proper place, their paths straight and true. May they safeguard and secure the state and family, sparing them from harm and disaster. May the four seas be at peace as one, and all under heaven flourish.

Sixth, may the four seasons follow their appointed cycles. May their climates be harmonious and balanced, free from calamity and misfortune. May pestilence and plague be eradicated, and all under heaven dwell in peace. May the five grains ripen in abundance, the nation prosper, and the people rejoice.

Seventh, may floating clouds condense their qi and gather their mists. May they soar high and clear in the heavens, casting their shadow over the profound and mysterious. When concealed, they act without contrivance; when dispersed, they fill the sky. May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the host of perfected beings. May their beneficence flow to all, fostering the nation and cherishing the people. May they universally aid all beings, and humanity endure as long as the kalpas.

Eighth, may wind and rain flow and shower without end. May they universally bestow their bounty, nurturing growth and flourishing. May the myriad things thrive, the nation’s stores be full, and the people abundant.

Ninth, may the Five Peaks each abide in their proper place. May they tower majestically, ever serving as immortal palaces. May they secure the nation’s destiny, preserving heaven without end. May they protect and deliver all beings, none who do not look to them in reverence.

Tenth, may the rivers and seas stretch boundlessly. May they contain and embrace all with vastness, nurturing even the smallest of things. May their depths be profound and their kindness gentle, moistening all that wriggles and breathes. May heaven and humanity receive blessings, their years enduring like the kalpas’ stone.

Eleventh, may the emperor and the kingdom prosper day by day. May the four frontiers be at peace, and weapons of war not be raised. May heaven and humanity sing in praise, and auspicious omens come soaring. May teachings be widely spread, and virtuous transformation overflow. May the myriad people rejoice, and boundless joy never end.

Twelfth, may all creatures—those that fly, crawl, and move, whether born or yet unborn—universally receive safety. May all attain life and growth. May they all behold the primordial qi and receive the form of yang. May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests endure winter without withering. May all be delivered and aided, none that do not flourish in fresh splendor. May harmony unite with the Dao and merge with the true. The furnace is restored.

May the Fragrant Official Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all spirit-officials attendant upon the incense ensure that where I offer this fragrance, golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms naturally arise. May the hundred numinous perfected ones gather here before the incense burner. May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the patron of this retreat receive blessings, and may the living and the departed alike be touched by grace.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the orchid-scented smoke, swiftly conveying my supplications directly to the Throne of the Supreme Non-Ultimate Dao—formless, nameless, empty, and spontaneous—in the Golden Palace of Jade. The door is opened.

*End of the Thirty-First Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat Rites*

*The Thirty-Second Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat Rites*
*Edited by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting*

*Repentance and Exorcism for Illness, Circumambulation at Dusk*

The door is entered. Each pays homage to the master and contemplates as prescribed.

The radiance of the guardian spirits shines brightly, auspicious qi swirls in coils. The Dipper and the Ladle gleam with pure light, the halls of mushrooms stand serene. Jade pupils and golden perfected ones, the precious altar is wholly yang. Night is transformed into day, the hour is turned back to before noon. Mount Taihua streams with color, the cinnabar phoenix soars upon the axle. Demons are stilled, treachery is extinguished, one strides high through the mist of blessings. Heavenly perfected ones gather together, all arriving before the Emperor. The dharma drum is sounded twenty-four times.

The Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Origin, First Three Qi, Supreme Dao Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Attendants of the Left and Right, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans and Daily Incense Officials—thirty-two of each—let them emerge. As they emerge, let them solemnly prepare and open the gates of the Mysterious Altar to the Heavenly Thearch and Divine Lords, and summon the local earth gods and territorial true officials. This servant now, acting on behalf of the intent herein, prays that the wondrous light of the Jade Purity Dao Qi and Numinous Treasure may descend and flow into the bodies of this servant and company, thereby rendering the Mysterious Altar pure and transforming both inner and outer into truth. Let the heavens be free of defilement, the earth purged of demonic dust. Let the chiming of jade resound, the ten directions grow solemn and clear. Let the myriad demons not intrude, true sincerity ascend above. May the words this servant utters swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless, Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Golden Gate Jade Steps of the Great Dao.

Each declares their dharma rank:
In reverent unity, we, your servants, humbly address the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Boundless Great Dao Supreme Jade Dawn Great Dao Lord, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Jade Thearch of the August Heaven, the Great Sage Hosts of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the Perfected Lords and Venerable Masters, the Thirty-Six Heavenly Thearchs, the Jade Void Thearch, the Great Thearch of the Jade Capital, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection, Mysterious Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Gate, Seven Treasures, Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity, Upper Palace, Numinous Treasure, Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, and all the true numina of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have heard that the undifferentiated gives rise to form, the True One congeals into light. Heaven and earth rely upon it for their inception, yin and yang operate through it for generation and transformation. Flourishing and decline alternate, good and evil intertwine. The sun and moon have their times of waning and decline, cold and heat have their cycles of advance and retreat. Only this Great Dao pervades the hidden and manifest. It extends blessings and bestows grace, broadly aiding all existence. We, your servants, early explored the true instructions and obtained a glimpse of the numinous charts. The Three Caverns’ jade cases contain rites of prayer and exorcism; the Nine Heavens’ golden tablets transmit texts of salvation and protection. For forty thousand kalpas they have been expounded, by five hundred million heavens they are revered. They subdue demonic evil and summon demonic spirits. They assist the state in establishing merit, deliver beings and save things. When there is something to be prayed for, how dare we not make it known above?

Recitation of the Petition:
Following the words of the petition, we are truly sincere and earnest. Disciple So-and-so, with disasters yet unceased and illnesses yet unalleviated, surrenders his life to the various heavens and lays bare his heart to the Great Dao. He requests to perform the fast and vigil, to invite the descent of numinous power. Thus, with cinnabar sincerity, he together hopes for mysterious protection. Tonight, during the evening audience and circumambulation, the Dharma assembly is entreated to offer the first pinch of incense. May the smoke of this incense ascend directly to offer reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We, your servants, surrender our bodies and lives, prostrate ourselves, and look up in reliance upon the Three Worthies of the Supreme. May the merit of this act flow to the Emperor and the august personages of the nine ancestral temples. May they ascend in splendor to the Three Purities, bestowing auspiciousness upon the myriad states. May the great foundation be firmly established, the phoenix calendar eternally flourishing. May the Crown Prince and various princes steadfastly support the great enterprise. May the empresses, consorts, and all officials assist in the sagely plans. May the tracks of carts be as one, the ladders and ships all gather. For this reason, we now burn incense and personally take refuge in the Great Sage Hosts, the Perfected and Virtuous Ones. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into non-action, harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as truth.

Tonight, during the evening audience and circumambulation, the Dharma assembly is entreated to offer the second pinch of incense. May the smoke of this incense ascend directly to offer reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.

We, your servants, surrender our bodies and lives, prostrate ourselves, and look up in reliance upon the Three Worthies of the Supreme. May the merit of this act flow to the patron of this fast, the household of So-and-so. May the nine ancestors and seven generations, the obscured and lingering spirits, transcend the earthly dust and ascend to the celestial thoroughfares. May litigation be stilled at the gates of darkness, blessings and auspiciousness flow to future descendants. May the Nine Yous and earthly prisons all behold the light of compassion. May the beings of the six destinies together ascend to the realm of goodness. For this reason, we now burn incense and personally take refuge in the Great Sage Hosts, the Perfected and Virtuous Ones. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into non-action, harmonizing and uniting with the Dao as truth.

Tonight, during the evening audience and circumambulation, the Dharma assembly is entreated to offer the third pinch of incense. May the smoke of this incense ascend directly to offer reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.

We, your servants, surrender our bodies and lives, prostrate ourselves, and look up in reliance upon the Three Worthies of the Supreme. May the merit of this act flow to disciple So-and-so’s person. May karmic debts be pacified, disasters and calamities dissolved. May inauspicious declines melt like ice, illnesses and misfortunes disperse like clouds. May the Southern Dipper extend life, the Eastern Palace register blessings. May all kin and dependents, universally including humans and heavens, together enjoy the good merit and all attain the realm of the Dao.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense and surrender ourselves in refuge to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters, whose virtue is most true. Having attained the Dao, they ascend into the realm of non-action, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the Real.

We bow in the four directions, repent, and pace the void. As we circumambulate, our steps trace the celestial net; the heavenly winds blow swiftly upon us. Our fluttering robes rise to the handle of the Dipper, while we hold the fly-whisk and bow to the Banner of the Three Stars. Lions bear vermilion tassels, and qilins lead jade-green chariots. Flying through the eight extremities, how often have we seen the spring branches burst forth? Verdant temples crown crimson headbands, and azure mists entwine our feathered robes. At dawn we hasten to the Hall of Solar Virtue; by night we arrive at the Gate of Lunar Splendor. We strike and play with the fires of the celestial sphere, and the soaking rains awaken the earth’s mechanisms. The Jade Chamber cannot retain us—we soar instead toward the ninefold heavens.

Once, in the Hall of Extended Grace, at midnight, the Nine August Ones descended. The Six Perfected divided left and right, while yellow mists coiled around the balustrades. Within the vast palace, the divine lords were revered, and celestial soldiers guarded the Dao sanctuary. Today, as filial descendants, we continue this resolve, standing but a foot’s span from the numinous radiance.

With threefold prostration, we, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity to the Supreme, Boundless Dao of the Great Ultimate.
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reverently addressing the ranks of the Dharma, we, your servants, So-and-so and others, humbly reaffirm our supplication to the Supreme, Boundless Dao of the Great Ultimate, the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin; the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Supreme Lord Lao; the Venerable Perfected of the Ten Directions’ Boundless Dao and Virtue; the Celestial Thearchs and Great Emperors; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm; the High Ministers and Prime Ministers; the Four Directors and Five Emperors; and all the divine officials and numinous spirits of the Three Realms.

We bear the precious script upon our persons, ever ashamed of the divine grace bestowed. Privately delving into the profound mysteries, our aspiration lies in spreading the light of yang. We seek to establish merit through transformation, broadly benefiting all beings. Disciple So-and-so, beset by inauspicious fate and afflicted by illness, presents this petition with utmost sincerity, praying for blessings. We request the elevation of this fast and the invocation of the true numina. Thus, we respectfully follow the canonical rites, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao.

First, we repent for disciple So-and-so’s transgressions, both past and present, which are deep and grievous. Some offend the benevolence of heaven and earth’s nurturing embrace; others betray the virtue of the sun and moon’s illumination. We have violated the nature of the two qi and five phases, harmed the harmony of the three luminaries and six regulations. Unresolved karmic debts from the past compound with newly accrued sins. We have caused harm through error and killing, indulging our wills and following our hearts. Ignorant of causes and conditions, heedless of prohibitions and taboos, moved by the six emotions, and acting through the three karmas, we have transgressed against the unseen and the manifest, contravened the teachings of the scriptures. Thus, we incur these retributions and construct these calamities.

We further fear having offended the dragon spirits by initiating construction on earth and wood, violating geomantic principles and contravening celestial timing. We dread the influences of the stellar lodges and the afflictions of yearly cycles, the clashes of the Nine Palaces and the conflicts of the Eight Trigrams. Obstruction runs deep, and our anxieties are acute. Therefore, we now perform this fast and practice the Dao, repenting for our transgressions. We kindle incense, recite scriptures, and pray to heaven to petition for life. May all calamities, sins, and faults be repented and eradicated. May the Great Unity extend life, and the Three Primes avert death. May the Jade Lads dispense medicine, and the Five Emperors bestow talismans. May the six viscera be harmonized, and the hundred passages flow freely. May longevity be prolonged and emolument endure, misfortune vanish and fortune arise.

We further pray that the nine generations of ancestors ascend to heaven, and the six relations receive protection. May those who soar and those who sink fulfill their natures, and all beings, moving and still, be secure. Above, we wish for the imperial enterprise to flourish, heaven to endure and earth to last. May martial prowess be stilled, and civil virtue be consummated. May the sun’s wisdom shine doubly bright, and rivers float with sagely grace. May linked pearls and conjoined jades once more be seen in the dark heavens; may the Eight Trigrams and Nine Categories be re-revealed in the limpid Luo. May the three agricultural seasons proceed in order, and the nine grains know no fault. May drought and flood not arise, and pestilence not occur. May weapons be forever sheathed, and wind and rain come in due season.

Extending to the hidden paths, may all sentient beings be universally included. May the ministers of yin and yang, the officials of mountains and rivers, propagate the Dao and pacify the people, punish the perverse and protect the upright. May all ascend the shore of fortune and together attain the stages of the Dao.

May the vast compassion of the Heavenly Venerable above be manifest, and may the sincere devotion of your servants below be answered.

We make our vows:
First, may heaven and earth be bright and pure.
Second, may the atmosphere be clear and mysterious.
Third, may the sage live ten thousand years.
Fourth, may transformation reach the eight boundaries.
Fifth, may heaven bestow sweet dew.
Sixth, may earth emit auspicious mists.
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their course.
Eighth, may the myriad things be born whole.
Ninth, may families abound in filial piety and fraternal duty.
Tenth, may the state teem with talent and worthies.
Eleventh, may the officiants of this rite obtain blessings.
Twelfth, may those who study the Dao attain immortality.

We replenish the incense burner. May the Incense Officials, the Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and the various spirit officials of the incense attend to where we present this incense, naturally generating golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms. May the hundred numinous perfected gather here before the incense burner. May we who study the Dao attain the Dao, and those who seek immortality attain immortality. May the sponsor of this fast receive blessings, and the living and deceased partake of grace. May the words we have uttered swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Dao, the Celestial Venerable of the Origin, in the Golden Portal and Jade Steps of the Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous.

The ritual concludes.
*End of the Thirty-First Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites*

*The Thirty-Second Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites*
*Edited by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting*

**Morning Dao Procession on the Three Primordials**
*Entering the Chamber*
Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
The Golden Perfected and Green Radiance illumine the Three Heavens.
Crimson clouds traverse the cinnabar skies, as the host of heavens reins their chariots.
Dawn’s splendor dispels the shadows of yin, all darkness cast away.
The Ninefold Subtlety shakes the void, the Five Stars wheel in revolution.
Myriad immortals respond to the resonance, spontaneously wondrous and mysterious.
In the profound obscurity, light scatters—forms divide into billions.
Jeweled pearls radiate brilliance, auspicious signs descend upon the altar’s northwest.
The living and dead receive grace, bathed and refined in the golden spring.
The Demon Kings tremble in fear, their shadows merging with the Three Fields.

*Strike the Dharma Drum twenty-four times*

O Supreme Mysterious Origin, Supreme Dao Lord, summon forth from within this servant’s body:
the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys,
the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens who transmit words and scatter flowers,
and the Thirty-Two Incense Officials of the Five Emperors, the Direct Talismans, and the Day-Officials.
Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to open the gates of the Mysterious Altar’s Celestial Emperor and Divine Lords.
Summon the local earth deities and territorial true officials of this place.
May the numinous treasure-light of Jade Purity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous radiance descend,
flowing into our bodies, so that our supplications swiftly reach the presence of the Supreme, Boundless Dao—
the Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous—before the Golden Portal and Jade Steps.

*Each states their dharma rank*

We, your humble servants, together with utmost sincerity, reverently address the Primordial Celestial Worthy of the Void and Spontaneous Origin,
the Boundless Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao,
the Supreme Lord Lao,
the Jade Emperor of the August Heaven,
the perfected and divine lords and venerable sages of the ten directions who have attained the Dao,
the thirty-six Celestial Lords,
the Jade Purity Emperor,
the Jade Emperor the Great Emperor,
the Eastern Flower, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, and the Mysterious Capital’s Jade Capital and Golden Portal,
the Seven-Treasured Mysterious Terrace and Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace,
the Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord,
the Five Elderly Emperors,
the Lords of the Three Primordials,
the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water,
the thirty-six revered scriptures,
the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center,
and all the true numina of the three realms’ official retinues.

We have heard that before heaven and earth existed, the Primordial Origin spread the transformation of non-action;
at the dawn of the primordial chaos, the Perfected Ones bequeathed the statutes of vast salvation.
Thus, the configurations of qi were divided among the Three Primordials,
and boundless compassion was disseminated to the myriad beings.
The Three Officials were commanded to examine and assess,
while the Five Emperors were entrusted to govern.
Punishment and reward are impartial, grace and blessings extend afar.

We, having long received the shelter of the Dao, now encounter this auspicious conjunction of the mysterious.
We have studied the precious texts and perused the numinous mysteries,
resolved to propagate the great transformation and aid the state and its people.
On the eight festivals and Three Primordials, establishing merit is fundamental.
Now, as this Primordial’s seasonal rite arrives, on this propitious day of fasting and purification,
we offer thanks for transgressions and pray for grace—it is fitting to present our devout entreaties.
Moreover, as we uphold the imperial edict, how dare we not make this known above?

*Read the petition*

In accordance with the petition’s words, our resolve to cultivate and serve runs deep.
Moreover, as this season’s rite arrives, we reverently perform the numinous scriptures.
The Luminous Statutes of the Supreme Ultimate record the ledgers of faults in the Nine Bureaus;
the canonical standards of the Mysterious Capital designate the Three Primordials as the great period of amnesty.
The merit of the fast extends afar to the living and deceased,
while its beneficent influence flows broadly to family and state.

We, having joined together, have established the altar.
With lamps, candles, incense, and flowers, we pledge our hearts to the three realms.
With silk and ritual offerings, we present our petitions to the myriad heavens.
We hope that the Great Dao will achieve perfect communion,
gazing upon our sincerity to bestow blessings;
that the Perfected Ones will respond in mystery,
following our repentance to shed their radiance.

May the flying celestial beings bear the Nine Dragon Talismanic Commands,
traversing the three realms to notify the four bureaus.
May they record the merit of this fast and attest to our earnest prayers.

Now, at this morning’s Dao procession, we, the assembly of ritualists,
kindle this first pinch of incense.
May its fragrant smoke ascend to the heavens,
directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves,
looking up to rely on the Three Supreme Ones.
May this merit flow to the august spirits of the altars of soil and grain and the ancestral sages of the ancestral temples.
May they ascend to the Golden Portal of Perfection and wander in the Jade Capital.
May they attend the Sacred Ancestor in the Upper Palace and bestow blessings upon the precious descendants.

May the Emperor’s lifespan rival Penglai’s immortals, his achievements match those of Shun and Yu.
May he harmonize the jade candle to pacify Hua and Yi,
and solemnize the pearl’s orbit to still heaven and earth.
May the six palaces’ consorts and empresses possess inner virtue, reverent and enlightened.
May the Crown Prince and various princes flourish like jade branches.
May the civil and military ranks alike incline their hearts toward loyalty and filial piety;
may the four seas and ten thousand directions together blend under the transformative power of unified governance.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtue of the Perfected Ones, who after attaining the Dao ascend into formlessness, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

On this morning audience, as we perform the Dao rites, we invite the dharma assembly to offer this first pinch of incense. May its fragrant smoke ascend directly to present offerings to the supreme and most true scriptural treasures. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves with heads to the ground, reverently relying upon the Three Supreme Ones. May the merit of this act flow to the patron of this retreat, such-and-such household—may their nine generations of ancestors and seven lineages of kin, their three masters and four companions, depart the dark night and ascend to behold the radiant light. May they bathe in the Pool of Flowing Fire and rest beneath the shade of the Hall of Bright Clouds. May they transcend to the highest realms, and may blessings and protection extend to the living.

May all within the Three Wretched Paths and Five Courses, the Six Realms and Nine Hells, have their names stricken from the ledgers of sin and their records of judgment erased. May they forever escape the depths of suffering and all be delivered.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtue of the Perfected Ones, who after attaining the Dao ascend into formlessness, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

On this morning audience, as we perform the Dao rites, we invite the dharma assembly to offer this second pinch of incense. May its fragrant smoke ascend directly to present offerings to the supreme and most true master treasures. We devote our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves with heads to the ground, reverently relying upon the Three Supreme Ones. May the merit of this act flow to the patron of this retreat, such-and-such household—may their past transgressions dissolve, their calamities and misfortunes cease. May their lifespan be recorded in the Southern Palace and extended by the Eastern Dipper. May their family and kin all prosper, and auspicious signs gather in abundance.

Thereafter, may all sentient beings, whether moving or still, flying or submerged, equally receive the grace of this amnesty and together ascend to the realm of carefree wandering.

Now, therefore, we burn incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly, the virtue of the Perfected Ones, who after attaining the Dao ascend into formlessness, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

We now perform the rites of repentance and confession.

Each visualizes the nine-hued perfect image, swallows saliva, and recites the secret demon-commanding incantation. Treading the void in dance, circling in reverence, they prostrate to the Supreme, burn incense, and return to the formless. Radiant light follows their turn, and the Dharma-wheel likewise completes three revolutions. Mystic vows arise in the four quarters, and numinous blessings extend to kings and lords. Seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven, their splendor spreading in glorious display. Their songs resound beyond the vast desert, and celestial music delights their joy. Together they offer fragrant virtue to the Supreme, with whom even the lower immortals cannot compare. Wondrous thoughts illumine dark enlightenment, and in throngs they ride the void in wandering. Circling, they tread the cloud-net, mounting the void to walk the dark principle. Chanting the hymns of the Lord of Unity, a hundred channels naturally harmonize. Below, they command the lads of the eight seas; above, they escort the lofty immortals. The hosts of heaven scatter flowers of incense, and a serene numinous wind arises. Long-held vows fix the root of destiny, thus attaining the highest eminence. Rejoicing before the Supreme, even ten thousand kalpas would not mark its beginning. Towering is the Dark Capital Mountain, where the ten directions revere the August One. Lofty is the Heavenly Treasure Terrace, its radiance streaming like the sun’s flame. Resplendent are the jade-forest blossoms, their crimson fruits gleaming bright. Ever mindful to feast on primordial essence, refining the fluids to secure bodily form. Golden light scatters through the Purple Tenuity, profound and serene, the Great Vehicle glides free.

**Three Bows**
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity to the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Ranks**
We, your humble servants, such-and-such and others, now respectfully reaffirm our address to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Celestial Worthy, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm, the Three Master Lords, the High Ministers and High Chancellors, the Four Offices and Five Emperors, and all the divine officials of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, dust-bound and of humble merit, have accumulated good fortune over lifetimes to encounter this assembly. The mystic wind spreads universally, and the true teaching is proclaimed afar. Precious talismans and jade-scriptures descend from the Three Clarities to unfold transformation; dragon-writ and phoenix-edicts encompass the myriad sages in transmitting truth. Reverently receiving the guidance of our masters, we have all been graced with their instruction. Yet we have not been able to cultivate diligently nor preserve our ascent to flight. Only by establishing merit, delivering people, and aiding beings can we repay the virtue of the Perfect Dao in shaping all things and requite the benevolence of heaven and earth in covering and supporting all. Whatever beings turn their hearts toward it should be duly reported.

The patron of this retreat, such-and-such, has learned that the Three Primes possess their ranks, and the Supreme Sages have bequeathed their texts. This is the season when the Celestial Prime renews its mandate, the day when the Three Palaces of the Emperor issue their amnesty. Both the hidden and the manifest receive protection, and all that moves or grows is touched by grace. Privately reflecting that to repay one’s lord and parents, nothing precedes the building of blessings; to serve one’s family and country, nothing surpasses the merit of this retreat. Thus we prostrate at the numinous altar, turning our hearts to the Supreme Sages. Bearing the tokens of the Dharma, we have reverently established this ritual precinct. Jade pendants and pearl banners mingle with sacred regalia in dazzling splendor; whale-bell and phoenix-chime lead the immortal chants in ethereal measure. The Perfected and Sages draw near from afar, and our sincerity is lifted upward. We humbly pray that the great treasure of your numinous influence may bless and protect the imperial enterprise. May the phoenix calendar be subtly extended, and the dragon majesty firmly secured. May the emperor’s sagacity surpass that of Fuxi and Huangdi, his benevolence equal that of Yao and Shun. May the myriad dwellings rest in harmony, and the nine regions submit to transformation. May the three frontiers be pacified, forever free from the toil of beacon fires; may the eight extremities shine in clarity, ever open to tribute from afar. May the imperial enterprise of Great Peace outshine all rivals. May the stars follow their courses in the nine heavens, and wind and rain be balanced through the four seasons. May weapons, disease, and epidemics not afflict the common people; may floods, droughts, fires, and locusts not arise within the kingdom’s borders.

Next, we pray for the household of the patron of this retreat: may the nine lineages be delivered, and the five clans live in harmony. May their name be inscribed in the south for accumulated goodness, and their record of transgressions erased in the northern bureau. May calamities not arise, and blessings be ever renewed. May their official emoluments be increased in the heavenly palace, and their lifespan extended in the immortal precincts. Thereafter, may the frozen courts of the long night and the riverine realms of Fengdu be transformed. May dark prisons become pure and tranquil abodes, and hells be converted into realms of formlessness. May all beings fulfill their natures, and every kind awaken. May heaven endure and earth abide, ever advancing in the Dao’s transformation. Above, may the radiant grace of the Heavenly Worthy of Vast Salvation be manifest; below, may the sincerity of we, your servants, in turning toward the Dao be answered.

Respectfully we make this address known.

**Initiating the Vows**
First vow: for the four great elements of the Dao to unite in virtue with the patron of this retreat. May the seven generations of parents escape suffering and sorrow, ascend to heaven, and enjoy natural sustenance.

Second vow: for the emperor and lords of the realm, that the Dao’s transformation flourish. May schools and academies thrive, and the imperial teaching expand. May their majesty and decorum be revered, and all under heaven look upon them. May the people praise Great Peace, and the four barbarians submit. May evil and perversity vanish of themselves, and sages and worthies arise naturally.

Third vow: for the Dharma Master, that great merit be established. May their teaching and transformation be clear and far-reaching, and all attain flight as immortals.

Fourth vow: for fellow students of the Dao. May they swiftly attain the immortal way and mutually aid one another in deliverance.

Fifth vow: for the nine relations to live in harmony, esteeming benevolence and righteousness. May they value the Dao and scorn wealth, their conduct a model for all beings.

Sixth vow: to diminish oneself and bestow alms upon Daoist masters and those who suffer hunger and cold. May all people under heaven find their proper place.

Seventh vow: for creeping and crawling beings. May all sentient beings equally achieve fulfillment.

Eighth vow: to pardon past transgressions. May the sins of this life be redressed by establishing merit to compensate for faults.

Ninth vow: for the flourishing of the household. May the ancestral temple have descendants, and worthy talent arise in every generation.

Tenth vow: to honor and receive the scripture masters, never daring to grow remiss, but maintaining a single, equal mind. May all beings be broadly delivered, and all attain the rank of immortal. May they ascend to heaven in broad daylight, pay homage to the Supreme, and forever become Perfected Ones, riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages. Harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

The incense is replenished.

Incense Official Messengers, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attending Incense Spirit-Officials—may they cause the place where this servant burns incense to naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred numinous Perfected Ones gather here, assembling before the grotto-altar and incense burner. May this servant, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions receive the rising incense smoke and swiftly convey the words this servant has just uttered directly to the August Jade Court of the Supreme, Boundless, Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Dao.

*Exiting the chamber*
*End of the Thirty-Second Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat Rites*
*Thirty-Third Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Retreat Rites*
*Edited by Tang Dynasty Master Du Guangting of Broad Completion Abbey*

*Entering the chamber*
*Dividing the Three Primordials to perform the Dao*
*Upon entering, each bows to the master and visualizes as prescribed*

**Guardian Spirits**
Chanting the *Empty Cavern* hymns, the Thearch visualizes the altar.
The Five Emperors review records,
Receiving talismans from the Three Officials.
Four gates are guarded,
Demons bound and traitors expelled.
Fiery bells cast forth,
Banishing filth and burning remnants.
The body bears the golden scripture,
Refining the elixir to rejuvenate the countenance.
Mysterious void and plain harmony,
The heart moves the Three Passes.
Riding lions and mounting cranes,
Commanding dragons and mounting simurghs.
Ten thousand stars guard the abode,
A thousand demons dare not intrude.
The Dao-qi endures,
Myriad immortals rest in peace.

*Strike the dharma drum twenty-four times*

The Supreme Dark Prime, Most High Dao Lord, summons forth from within this servant’s body:
The Three and Five Merit Officers,
Left and Right Attending Messengers,
Incense-Bearing Golden Youths,
Message-Conveying Petal-Scattering Jade Maidens,
Five Emperors’ Direct Talisman-Holders,
Direct-Day Incense Spirits—
thirty-two of each—emerge.
Emerging, they solemnly prepare and open the gates of the Mystic Altar’s Heavenly Thearch Spirit Lords, calling forth the local earth gods, domain spirits, and true officials of this place.
On this occasion, with utmost sincerity, may the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend, flowing into the bodies of this servant and all present, swiftly conveying the words this servant has uttered directly to the August Jade Court of the Supreme, Boundless, Formless, Nameless, Void, and Spontaneous Dao.

*Each declares their dharma rank*

We, your servants, [names], together with one heart, reverently address the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Boundless Supreme Dao Lord, the Great Sage Ancestor, Highest Supreme Dao, Golden Court Mysterious Prime Heavenly August Emperor, the Supreme Lord Lao, the Supreme Elder, the Dark Prime Supreme Elder;
The perfected and sagely lords and elders of the ten directions who have already attained the Dao;
The thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs;
The Jade Clarity Highest Emperor;
The Jade Emperor;
The Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, Mystic Capital, Jade Capital, Golden Court, Seven-Jewel Mystic Terrace, Purple Tenuity Upper Palace, Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord;
The Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center;
The officials and all true numina of the Three Realms—

We, by former vast causes, have been able to receive the mysterious transformation, bearing the great Dharma and wearing the precious scriptures. Truly, we should lift our traces to the cloudy groves, nest our spirits in the tranquil vastness, shake our robes free of the vulgar, and pursue friendship with the highest Perfected. Yet the Great Sages have bestowed their regulations, and the Primordial August One has spread the teachings. First, we must aid the state and proclaim transformation, succoring beings and pacifying the people, propagating the Dao and establishing merit, broadly covering all kinds. For every prayer and supplication, how dare we not report it above?

*Reading the petition*
According to the words of the petition, it is fitting to submit this report.
The retreat master, [name], above reveres the ancestral temples, below extends to all beings. Hoping to establish good merit and broadly propagate excellent blessings, especially as this is the auspicious season of the [specific] Primordial Festival, a day of purification and retreat. The Jade Emperor presides above, and the ten thousand sages review merit in the Three Realms. The living and the dead share in blessings, not a hair’s breadth omitted. Thus, we perform this rite of prayer and supplication to express the sincerity of human servants. Holding the Dharma tokens, we have reverently established the altar. We, your servants, relying on the canonical rites, concentrate our spirits and purify our thoughts, directing our hearts to the Crimson Palace and bowing our hands to the Pure Capital. We hope that feathered canopies and cloud chariots will descend in semblance, that the highest Perfected and august Sages will vaguely manifest their presence, bestowing blessings across seas and mountains, encompassing the hidden and the manifest with their protection.

Today, at the noon audience, we, the Dharma assembly, perform the first offering of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao. We, your servants, surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves, looking up to the Three Supreme Ones of the Most High. May this merit, above, benefit the sacred spirits of the altars of soil and grain and the ancestral temples, causing them to ascend to the Azure Heavens and bestow blessings upon the imperial domain.

May the Emperor’s virtue equal that of Fuxi and Shennong, his merit match that of the Yellow Emperor and Emperor Yan. May the mountain of his longevity grow ever higher, the sun of his sagacity shine ever brighter. May the tracks of chariots unite, weapons be stilled, the stars and planets move in harmony, wind and rain come in season. May the Crown Prince and the various kings inherit the celestial mandate and continue the sagely line. May the Empress, consorts, princesses, the hundred officials, and all ministers daily receive new blessings, their illustrious glory flourishing. Thereafter, may civil arts embrace distant customs, martial arts pacify perilous crises. Within the seas and the realm, may all ascend to the realm of longevity.
