May it extend universally to the hidden and manifest, broadly encompassing the moving and growing.
Together they may fear the wondrous joy and all accord with non-action.
Where the sagely power extends, all under Heaven are wholly saved.
Above, it manifests the Heavenly Worthy’s great compassionate blessings;
below, it fulfills our repentance and confession.
We humbly make this known.

**Invoking the Ten Thoughts**
First thought: For the four great elements of the Dao, in harmony with the virtue of the fast’s sponsor,
may the seven generations of parents be spared from falling into sorrow and suffering,
ascend to the Heavenly Palace, and have clothing and food naturally provided.

Second thought: For the emperor and the lord of the state, may the Dao’s transformation flourish and prosper.
May the schools and academies be thriving, the imperial teachings vast and expansive.
May the majestic deportment be reverent and solemn, universally regarded by all under Heaven.
May the people praise the Great Peace, and the four barbarians submit in reverence.
May evil and perversity self-destruct, and sages and worthies naturally arise.

Third thought: For the Dharma Master, may great merit be established.
May the teachings be clear and far-reaching, and all attain the flight of immortals.

Fourth thought: For fellow practitioners of the same aspiration,
may they swiftly attain the immortal Dao and mutually enlighten and deliver one another.

Fifth thought: For the nine relations to be harmonious, esteeming benevolence and righteousness.
May they honor the Dao and despise wealth, their conduct a model for all beings.

Sixth thought: For self-denial, bestowing alms upon Daoist masters and the hungry and cold.
May all the people under Heaven each attain their rightful place.

Seventh thought: For the crawling and creeping, all sentient beings,
may they all receive accomplishment.

Eighth thought: For pardoning past lives’ karmic retributions in this present existence,
may they establish merit to compensate for transgressions.

Ninth thought: For the flourishing of the household,
may the ancestral temples have descendants, and worthy talents arise in every generation.

Tenth thought: For reverently receiving the scripture masters, never daring to slacken in equanimity,
with one mind broadly delivering all, may they swiftly attain the ascent to immortality.
Ascending to Heaven in broad daylight, they may pay homage to the Supreme.
Forever becoming perfected persons, riding cloud chariots and feathered carriages,
harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

**Returning the Incense Burner**

Fragrant Official Messengers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all Attendant Fragrant Spirits, may they cause this place of my audience with the Primordial to naturally generate golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred numinous perfected beings gather here, assembling before the grotto’s incense burner. May they illumine my body with golden radiance, severing the roots of the womb’s bonds. May the Seven Mysteries be uprooted, and the hundred passages perfected in immortality. May the register of death be dissolved, and may I sit in repose at the Mud-Pill Palace. May the Eastern Florescence record my name, and may I be inscribed in the Register of the Void and Profound. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the incense smoke, conveying the words I have just uttered swiftly to the August Presence of the Supreme, the Boundless Dao, the Formless and Nameless, the Void and Spontaneous, before the Golden Portal and Jade Throne.

The thirty-seventh scroll of the *Yellow Register Retreat Rites* of the Supreme concludes here.

**The thirty-eighth scroll of the *Yellow Register Retreat Rites* of the Supreme**
Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang Guangcheng

**Advancing and Withdrawing During the Procession of the Dao**
Entering the chamber, each bows to the master and contemplates as prescribed.

**Guardian Spirits**
Cinnabar numina and vermilion flames, blazing auroras and surging winds. The crimson wheel turns with刚 vigor, the celestial light radiating through the eight directions. Its might bursts forth, enveloping all, transforming myriad realms. Molten gold scatters and falls, while demonic hordes vanish without trace. It repels evil and shatters malevolence, illuminating the primordial merit. The golden talismans summon and command, treading clouds and spurring dragons. Songs of celebration resound, scattering flowers across the vast heavens. The numinous transformation operates in hidden motion, bringing peace and prosperity to the four extremities. Prostrating before the August Emperor, none dare be irreverent.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
The Supreme Mysterious Primordial Lord of the Dao summons forth from within my body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Messengers, the Golden Youths of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmitted Words and Scattered Flowers, and the Fragrant Officials of the Five Emperors and the Direct Day, thirty-two each, to emerge. Those who emerge shall solemnly prepare and open the gates of the Mysterious Altar to the Celestial Divine Lords, and summon the local earth deities and true officials of this realm. As I now proceed with the Dao, I reverently memorialize the intent of this rite, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend and flow into my body. May what I have memorialized swiftly reach the August Presence of the Supreme, the Boundless Dao, the Void and Spontaneous, before the Golden Portal and Jade Throne.

**Declaring Dharma Ranks**
We, your humble servants of such-and-such ranks, together with utmost sincerity, reverently memorialize the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Venerable, the Boundless Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Supreme Lord Lao, the August Jade Emperor on High, the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the Lords and Elders of the myriad true beings, the thirty-six Celestial Emperors, the Jade Clarity Supreme Emperor, the Great Emperor of the Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numen, Northern Perfected, Mysterious Capital, Jade Metropolis, Golden Portal, Seven-Jewel Mysterious Terrace, Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace, Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Lord of the Dao, the thirty-six revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, and all the true numina of the three realms’ official retinues. We, having long been favored by the mysterious destiny and gained access to the Dharma gate, have glimpsed the numinous chapters and followed the precepts and canons.

May we dwell in mountain vales and secluded grottoes, vanish our traces by numinous springs. Casting off the clamor of the dusty world, we refine ourselves in secret wonders. Yet the true and merciful nurture all beings as their first priority; the Great Dao delivers humanity by establishing merit as its foundation. Thus we humbly petition for salvation, universally extending to both the hidden and the manifest. Though the dead may plead for deliverance, their karmic bonds are not easily severed. Now, in accordance with the sacred decree, how dare we not make this known above?

Having recited the petition and verified its words, we find the supplicant’s aspiration lies in liberation and salvation. In this long night of the unseen, compassion and sorrow are our duty. We reflect that the Great Image divides its form to endow life and nurture essence. Riding harmony and yielding to fate, we embody earth and emulate heaven. Yet the void and purity are difficult to preserve, and the mechanisms of karma easily lead astray. Consciousness drifts with the dust, illusory realms shift and change. Transgressions and errors abound, the tally of sins is immeasurable. Sunk in the eternal night of the underworld, redemption seems impossible across countless kalpas. Only through devoted cultivation may we hope for ascent and deliverance.

Therefore, we lay bare our hearts before the Three Caverns and surrender our lives to the hosts of heaven. The Yellow Register unfolds its rites of repentance and deliverance; the Mysterious Capital possesses the ranks for the transference of spirits. With utmost sincerity and purity, we seek to atone for our faults and transgressions. Each of us directs the cinnabar heart, praying for auspicious blessings.

Today, at the midpoint of the ritual circuit, the assembly of Dharma practitioners raises the first incense offering. May the smoke of this incense ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We, your servants, surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits flow to the revered spirits of the state altars and the ancestral sages of our lineage. May they ascend and wander in the true realms, transcend and attain the ranks of immortality. May they feast in the Southern Palace and bestow blessings upon the Northern Gate. May the imperial destiny endure forever, the sagely lifespan extend boundlessly. May the sound of their teachings spread across the eight seas, uniting the chariots and writings of the ten thousand nations.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense, taking refuge in the Great Sagely Host of Master and Honored Ones, whose virtue is most true. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

At this midpoint of the ritual, we, the assembly of the Dharma, raise the second incense offering. May the smoke of this incense ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.

We, your servants, surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits flow to the patron of this retreat, the household of so-and-so.

May the nine generations and seven lineages, the myriad ancestors of countless generations, emerge from the realm of dark yin and ascend to the land of purity. May they receive blessings in the Vermilion Mound, refine their spirits in the Elixir of Cinnabar. May the departed souls and shadowed consciousnesses wash away their long-standing stains. May their names fall from the ledgers of sin and be inscribed in the Azure Palace. May they transcend the苦 realms, be released from the prisons of darkness. May they ascend to the Court of Eternal Joy and attain the fruit of non-action.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense, taking refuge in the Great Sagely Host of Master and Honored Ones, whose virtue is most true. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

At this midpoint of the ritual, we, the assembly of the Dharma, raise the third incense offering. May the smoke of this incense ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.

We, your servants, surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves to the ground, reverently relying upon the Three August Ones of the Supreme. May these merits flow to the patron of this retreat, the household of so-and-so.

May their kin and karmic relations together partake in this sublime fortune. May their official emoluments endure and their lifespans extend, their sins be eradicated and their calamities dispelled. May this broadly extend to all beings, reaching even the most distant and conscious. May all together ascend to the realm of longevity and bathe in the mysterious compassion.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense, taking refuge in the Great Sagely Host of Master and Honored Ones, whose virtue is most true. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into formlessness, harmonizing and uniting with the true Dao.

The rites are complete; we repent.

Let each visualize the nine-hued perfect image, swallow the saliva, and intone the secret incantation to command demons. Stepping into the void, circling and revolving—
our cloud-steps ascend the celestial net,
where the heavenly winds blow with a sudden rush.
Robes flutter, brushing the Dipper’s handle;
we hold jade tablets and bow to the Banner of Three Stars.
Lions bear vermilion tassels in their jaws,
while qilin lead jade-green chariots.
In flight we traverse the eight directions,
how often have we seen spring branches bloom?
Dark locks rise beneath scarlet headbands,
azure mists weave through feathered robes.
At dawn we hasten to the Palace of Yang Virtue,
by night we arrive at the Moon’s Radiant Gate.
We grasp and play with the fires of the celestial sphere,
then conceal and withdraw like Lu Ji’s steed.
The Jade Chamber cannot retain us—
we soar back toward the ninefold heavens.
Water is sprayed to subdue demonic palaces,
lamps are lit to illuminate the nocturnal courts.
The winds of the nine heavens fall silent,
the qi of the four poles clarifies.
We chant and sing in the Vermilion Mound,
soaring through the White Jade Capital.
How shall we offer our utmost sincerity?
May the nation’s blessings endure in eternal peace.

Threefold prostration:
We, your servants, reverently bow our heads to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, reverently bow our heads to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, reverently bow our heads to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

Reaffirming the sacred ranks:
We, your humble servant so-and-so, now respectfully readdress and supplicate the Most High, Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning; the Most High Lord of the Great Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the boundless hosts of Dao and virtue in the ten directions; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm; the High Ministers and Prime Officers, the Four Administrations and Five Emperors, and all divine officials and numinous beings of the Three Realms.

We have heard that the Most Sagely One, in compassion, opened the eight gates to deliver the suffering; the true scriptures unfolded transformations, spreading the Three Caverns to ferry humankind. Their grace extends to the hidden and the manifest, their blessings pervade heaven and earth. Having encountered this decree, we now exhaust our sincerity, establishing merit to propagate the Dao and uphold its luminous teachings.

The patron of this retreat, so-and-so, for the sake of the departed soul—whose form was shaped in remote antiquity, whose qi was received from the primordial heavens—from beginningless time until this day, has followed the turning of karmic conditions, deluded within the dream-realm. The six senses stirred dust, the ten fetters obscured the nature. Easily were sins born, swiftly did transgressions accumulate. Some offenses violated the true numina, others transgressed prohibitions and taboos, offending the heavenly Dao above and disrupting the earthly shades below. There were instances of intentional killing or accidental harm, greed for wealth that harmed righteousness. They lacked the virtue of compassion and yielding, disrupted the harmony of ritual and music. They encroached upon and harmed living beings, damaged and destroyed creatures’ lives. Their sins bound the courts of the Three Officials, their names filled the registers of the Five Emperors. Since the body’s dissolution, they have faced karmic retribution—some detained in the dark prisons, others adrift in alien destinies. Endlessly they wander in the long night, with no means of deliverance.

Thus, we gather our hearts in prayer, pouring out our pleas to heaven. We present patterned silks to fulfill the rites of supplication, prepare dragon-brocade tokens to convey the pledges for the soul’s ascent. We kindle the Nine Dark Lamps to illuminate the long night, perform the rites to the ten directions’ sagely titles to open the path through dense darkness. Above, we report to the various heavens; below, we notify the various earths, extending to the realms of the Five Peaks and Fengdu, the paths of the three evil destinies and six destinies. May the dew of compassion quench their scorching toil, may the winds of mercy dispel their burning afflictions. May enmities be reconciled, debts and disputes resolved. May the black ledgers on Mount Fengdu be burned, the red records on the Southern Culmen inscribed. May a thousand transgressions and ten thousand errors all be expunged. May they be refined in the Court of Flowing Fire, their souls purified in the Palace of Lesser Yin. Ascending to the ranks of immortals, they shall ride the celestial thoroughfares. Thus, may the Three Luminaries shine upon the Two Modes, may the Five Weapons be sheathed and the Hundred Grains flourish. May the celestial mandate abound, the sagely lifespan extend. May the dragon spirits endure, secretly aiding wind and rain. May all living beings be harmoniously nurtured, all in the patron’s household—living and deceased—receive blessings, their kin prosper. May the dark courts and nether ferries together attain true fruition. Above, may this manifest the great compassion of the Heavenly Worthy; below, may it fulfill our devotion in taking refuge.

Respectfully submitted for your attention.

Vows:
First vow: May the Great Dao abide in tranquil emptiness, at ease in stillness and void, dwelling in clarity. May it widely open the gates of the Dharma, instructing the stubborn. May all receive its grace, cultivate with diligence, and join the assembly of learners, universally ascending to the void. May they preserve harmony with heaven, enduring without care.

Second vow: May the various heavens condense qi and clarify, their vast expanse sheltering and preserving the true and numinous. May the climate be regulated, the four seasons harmonious. May the nation be secure, the people prosperous, all under heaven tranquil. May all be broadly delivered, their blessings reaching all living beings. May the heavens endure, unshaken for countless kalpas.

Third vow: May the earth bear and sustain without end, stable and unyielding, the seas and abysses unshaken. May it protect and secure the nation and households, the multitudes thriving. May the living be nurtured, the dead at peace, blessings extending to the ten directions. May crops flourish, enterprises prosper. May all receive its abundant support, all beings follow.

Fourth vow: May the sun and moon, the two luminaries, shine brightly, free from eclipses, their waxing and waning serene. May their light illuminate the heavens, dispelling all darkness. May they safeguard the kalpas, the world’s blessings enduring in peace. May their moisture and grace universally bestow blessings upon all beings.

Fifth vow: May the stars and constellations share the radiance of the sun and moon, their revolving lights shining brilliantly, illuminating the ten directions. May each remain in its proper place, their paths straight. May they protect and secure the nation and households, free from calamity. May the four seas be at peace, all under heaven flourish.

Sixth vow: May the four seasons follow their cycles, the climate harmonious, free from disaster. May plagues and poisons vanish, all under heaven at peace. May the five grains ripen abundantly, the nation prosper and the people rejoice.

Seventh vow: May floating clouds condense qi and gather mist, soaring high and clarifying, shading the mysterious. Concealed, they are quiescent; dispersed, they fill the heavens. May immortals and transcendents dwell together, befriending the hosts of perfected beings. May their grace flow to all, benefiting the nation and cherishing the people. May all beings be universally delivered, sharing the kalpa’s years.

Eighth vow: May wind and rain flow and shower without end, universally bestowing their bounty. May all things flourish, the nation’s stores and people’s wealth abound.

Ninth vow: May the Five Peaks each remain in their proper place, towering and encompassing, ever serving as immortal palaces. May they secure the nation’s blessings, preserving heaven without end. May they protect and ferry all, none who do not revere them.

Tenth vow: May rivers and seas flow boundless and without limit. Embracing and vast, they nurture all, no matter how small. Profound and gentle, their kindness moistens all that wriggles and breathes. May heaven and humanity receive blessings, their years enduring like the kalpa’s stone.

Eleventh vow: May the emperor and lords of the realm prosper daily. May the Four Guardians remain in harmony, weapons of war never raised. May heaven and humanity sing in praise, auspicious omens descending in flight. May teachings spread in abundance, majestic transformation flourishing. May all the people rejoice, their joy unending.

Twelfth vow: May all that flies and crawls, born or unborn, universally enjoy safety and secure existence. May all behold the primordial qi, receiving the forms of yang. May grasses, trees, fruits, and forests endure winter without withering. May all be universally delivered, none failing to flourish in radiant glory. In harmony, they unite with the true Dao.

Again, to the Fragrance Officials, Envoys, the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all the attendant spirit officials of the incense altar: May this place where I perform the Dao naturally generate liquid-gold elixirs, cinnabar, and jade mushrooms. May the hosts of a hundred spirits and perfected beings gather here before the incense altar and brazier. May I, in studying the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the rising incense, swiftly conveying the words I have just uttered directly to the Jade Emperor’s court of the Supreme Non-Ultimate Great Dao, the Void and Spontaneous.

Exiting the chamber—*The Thirty-Eighth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites* concludes.

**The Thirty-Ninth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites**
*Compiled by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting*

**Transferring the Departed and Conducting the Falling Twilight Rite**
Entering the chamber—Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Invoking the Protective Spirits**
The Five Stars shine brightly, auspicious qi soars and drifts.
The Primordial One gathers the spirits, Heaven and Earth unite in harmony.
Jade talismans and precious seals summon the subtle and hidden.
Fire is cast, might is displayed—no treachery or evil lingers.
The ten thousand demons tremble and submit, their malevolence disperses like scattered petals.
Monsters are crushed, wickedness is vanquished, the Dao’s qi circulates freely.
Divine light illumines the night, shadows and darkness are wholly gathered.
The myriad spirits descend in reverence, riding the winds upon the spreading radiance.
All beings attain fulfillment, grace pervades the divine lands.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**
The Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Three Qi, Supreme Dao Lord:
Summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Envoys, the Attendant Incense Golden Youth, the Message-Conveying and Flower-Scattering Jade Maidens, and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Attendants and Incense Officials of the Day—thirty-two each.
Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn attire, to report to the Heavenly Thearchs and Divine Lords of the Mystic Altar.
Let them invoke the local earth gods and territorial true officials.
With this falling twilight, as incense is burned and the Dao is practiced, may the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-qi and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend, flowing into this servant’s body.
May what this servant has declared swiftly reach the Jade Emperor’s court of the Supreme Non-Ultimate Great Dao, the Void and Spontaneous.

**Each States Their Dharma Rank**
The humble servant [Name], in unison with all present, respectfully petitions the Void and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Non-Ultimate Great Dao’s Supreme Great Dao Lord, the Most High Lord Lao, the Supreme Mystic Elder, the perfected and sagely hosts of the ten directions who have attained the Dao, the thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs, the Jade Clarity Highest Emperor, the Jade Emperor Great Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern True, and the Mystic Capital Jade Capital Golden Palace Seven-Treasured Mystic Terrace Purple Tenuity Supreme Palace’s Numinous Treasure Perfected Radiant August Dao Lord, the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm, and all the divine officials of the Three Realms.

We, your servants, have been blessed to ascend this sacred path, encountering the turning of the Dao’s fortune.
Golden scriptures expound the teachings, jade tablets reveal the charts.
We wear the numinous texts and uphold the wondrous instructions.
We reflect that the August Void established the ultimate, the Supreme suspended the ordinances.
Grace extends to the hidden and manifest, mercy suffuses the living and the dead.
In the Northern Feng nightly courts, divine light bestows the compassion of illumination;
In the Southern Huo immortal precincts, true standards display the ranks of transcendence.
From kalpas beyond measure to this very hour,
Numinous blessings wash away the dust of toil, the Dharma boat ferries the drowned and lost.
Rescuing the living, delivering the dead, aiding the state and benefiting the people.
The wondrous pivot and mystic axis bring protection to humans and heavens.

We, your servants, aspire to propagate the profound and abstruse, to transfer and protect the living and the departed.
Whatever is prayed for, by principle, should be reported.
Moreover, as we receive these sacred commands, how dare we not make them known above?

**Reading the Petition**
As the petition states, the matters at hand are vast in their salvation.
The fast’s sponsor, [Name], sincerely cultivates and reverently upholds, earnestly seeking to honor the departed.
To rescue the courts of the night’s darkness, to grieve the suffering of the nether springs.
With devout sincerity in this fast and offering, may resonance be attained.

We, your servants, follow the Numinous Treasure’s revered scriptures and the Perfected’s highest ranks.
We open the jade caskets and numinous coffers to deliver the night’s darkness and the drowned.
Relying on the flying heavenly divine beings, we proclaim the karmic bonds of sin and fortune;
Facing the revealed ordinances of deliverance, we establish the altar grounds.
Silken candles and fragrant flowers express the sincerity of our hearts.
We present the petition and transmit the requests, reporting to the myriad heavens.
We hope that blessings will cover the yin and the hidden, grace will extend to families and the state.

With this falling twilight, as the Dao is practiced, we, the assembled Dharma hosts, now offer the first pinch of incense.
May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We, your servants, surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full devotion, reverently relying on the Supreme Three Worthies.
May these merits flow to the ancestral temples and former spirits, transcending the three realms.
May the emperor and lords of the realm emulate the virtue of the Two Modes.
May the phoenix calendar extend its vastness, the dragon charts endure eternally.
May the celestial origin be bright and serene, the earthly records secure and peaceful.
May wind and rain come in due season, all living beings enjoy health and prosperity.

Now, therefore, we kindle this incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Hosts of Master and Honored Ones, whose virtue is most true. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with reality.

As twilight lingers and the Dao is practiced, we, the assembled Dharma hosts, now offer the second pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Sutra Treasure of the Dao.

We, your servants, surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full devotion, reverently relying on the Supreme Three Worthies. May these merits flow to the patron of this rite, [Name], their nine generations and seven lineages, their myriad ancestors and ten thousand forebears—all the departed, all wandering spirits. May those sunk in the six destinies, those suffering in the three paths, find release from the ledgers of karmic transgression, their sins erased in the courts of the unseen. May their souls be refined in the Cavern of Yang, their spirits born anew through the Elixir of Cinnabar. May the icy springs of the Night Palace know no labor of retribution; may the gates of hell and the dark passes transform into realms of cool purity. May enmity dissolve, debts and disputes be settled. May the living be blessed with prosperity and auspicious fortune.

Now, therefore, we kindle this incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Hosts of Master and Honored Ones, whose virtue is most true. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with reality.

As twilight lingers and the Dao is practiced, we, the assembled Dharma hosts, now offer the third pinch of incense. May this incense smoke ascend to the heavens, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Master Treasure of the Dao.

We, your servants, surrender our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full devotion, reverently relying on the Supreme Three Worthies. May these merits flow to all living beings under heaven, all creatures possessing consciousness. May all receive protection and blessing, each attaining peace and tranquility. May those bound in the six paths of rebirth, those fettered in the nine shades, be illumined by divine radiance, freed from suffering to be reborn in heaven. May the far-reaching power of the sages bathe them, that they may hear the sutras and awaken to the Dao. May the patron of this rite, [Name], their six relations and five clans, their inner and outer kin, ever draw upon this reservoir of fortune, their calamities dispelled. May the merit of this rite dissolve their transgressions, extend their years and blessings, and gather manifold auspices. May all creatures, all moving beings, together receive this vast grace and ascend to the realm of the Dao.

Now, therefore, we kindle this incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Hosts of Master and Honored Ones, whose virtue is most true. After attaining the Dao, they ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with reality.

The rites are complete; we now offer repentance.

**Threefold Invocation Hymn**

The Law is my bride, the sutras my pearls and jade.
I hold the precepts to curb the six passions,
mindful of the Dao to cast off desire.
In stillness, the upright qi abides;
in serenity, the spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and guard—
life after life, they receive great fortune.
The household and kingdom flourish in splendor,
the Dao and its teachings thrive in majesty.
Heaven and humankind share this vow,
soaring into the Great Vehicle.
By the heart’s resolve, the field of merit is sown;
the Wheel of Dharma ascends in boundless motion.
Seven generations of ancestors rise to heaven,
while this body soars in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the profound void—
with thought, none fails to harmonize.
Refining the form to join the immortals,
one attains the adamantine body.
Transcending the three realms’ trials,
the five hells’ torments are dissolved.
All return to the Supreme Scriptures;
in silent devotion, we bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the thirty-six revered scriptures.
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity,
paying homage to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirmation of Dharma Ranks**
We, your humble servants, [Names], now reverently address
the Supreme, Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of the Origin;
the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao;
the Supreme Lord Lao;
the Ten Directions’ Boundless Great Dao, the Host of Virtuous and Perfected Heavenly Worthies;
the Great Thearchs and Heavenly Emperors;
the Heavenly Masters and Lords;
the Supreme Ministers and Prime Ministers;
the Four Offices and Five Emperors;
the thirty-six revered scriptures;
the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm;
and all responsive and perceptive numinous spirits of the three realms.

We, though base and insignificant, have been permitted to partake in the Great Dharma.
The Three Vehicles unfold their transformations,
the supreme Dao radiates its light.
Dragon-script and phoenix-writ,
celestial chapters and jade precepts—
all have we received and pledged to uphold.
Yet we have not hidden in secluded forests,
nor dwelled in realms beyond the world,
aspiring to ascend on high,
renouncing the dusty realm.
Instead, we drift with the mundane,
mingling with the common throng.
Transgressions accumulate unceasingly,
devotion falters in constancy.
Still, we strive to propagate the teachings’ rites,
to expound the wondrous instructions,
to ferry beings and deliver creatures,
to aid the state and establish merit.
We offer our sincere devotion,
hoping to assist the mysterious transformation,
that all may enter the Dharma-gate,
opening blessings for the living and the dead,
safeguarding the hidden and the manifest.

Now, the patron of this rite, [Name], has set forth their vows and pledges,
presenting their sincerity as offering.
Following the canonical rites,
we undertake this fast and vigil.
Beneath the Three Luminaries, we humbly plead;
before the myriad sages, we prostrate in devotion.
We kindle the Nine Dark Lamps,
illuminating the three paths’ sins and sufferings,
dispelling their gloom,
ushering in radiant light.
We perform the Dao, recite the scriptures,
and repent with utmost sincerity.

We reflect that the departed spirits,
through countless kalpas,
have cast off bodies and assumed new forms,
cycling through rebirth.
Some are born in heaven,
some descend among humankind,
some dwell in the Central Kingdom,
others in distant lands.
Some are noble, some base,
some rich, some poor.
Some fail to awaken to good causes,
some never encounter the true Dharma.
Some cling to falsehoods, scorning the true;
some envy the worthy, slandering the good.
Some tread crooked paths, coveting gain;
some sever human bonds, forsaking love.
Some harm living creatures,
offering wanton sacrifices and taking life.
Some endanger others for their own safety,
harming others for personal gain.
The ten evils and three karmic deeds
plant the roots of sin.
Indulging desire, unrestrained,
they wallow in excess.
Some angle in rivers or hunt at night,
burn forests or drain mountains.
Some impose unjust punishments,
inflicting harm against reason.
Some, as ministers, are disloyal;
some defile the Three Luminaries,
cursing thunder and rain.
Some disrespect heaven and earth,
fearing no divine judgment.
The sins they commit
are beyond measure.
Some bear unresolved grudges,
unsettled debts from past lives.
Unresolved retributions,
deep afflictions unrepented—
after death, they drift into the Three Offices,
enduring agony,
their souls imprisoned in darkness.
Beneath the Yellow Springs,
within hell’s depths,
they sink into eternal night,
the path of life severed.
For eons, they suffer,
with no means of deliverance.
Some endure confinement,
some face interrogation and torture.
They bear mountains, haul stones,
draw from the boundless sea.
Driven by lightning, chased by thunder,
they toil without rest.
In darkness, they receive their due—
when will they return?
Without the Great Dao’s mercy,
the Heavenly Worthy’s compassion,
this torment would know no end,
no path to repentance and liberation.

Now, with a single thought of utmost sincerity,
we purify our hearts and turn toward the Dao.
May all boundless suffering
be pardoned and absolved.
We humbly pray that the departed,
through countless kalpas and generations,
may receive this sublime merit,
all ascending to heaven.
May their tombs remain secure,
lawsuits cease.
May the Nine Springs’ torments end,
the dark night brighten.
May the six paths and four births,
all beings with consciousness,
together reach the shore of fortune,
attaining the true and real.

May the Dao’s transformation flourish,
the Two Modes remain steadfast.
May the Three Luminaries shine brightly,
the imperial enterprise prosper afar.
May cultural unity prevail,
warfare and strife cease.
May weapons, plagues, floods, fires, droughts, and locusts
no longer afflict the people,
no longer invade the realm.
May the people enjoy wealth and longevity,
the world know peace and harmony.
May the patron’s household and kin
ever receive the mysterious protection,
a thousand disasters dispelled,
ten thousand virtues nurtured.
May all prayers and supplications
be answered and conveyed,
all repentances and thanksgivings
be felt and reciprocated.
Above, may the Heavenly Worthy’s compassionate grace descend;
below, may our repentant sincerity be met.

**Vows**
First, may the Great Dao spread far and wide,
all under heaven embracing its virtue.
Second, may all sentient beings
awaken to the Dao.
Third, may the sorrowful souls of the Nine Nights
find liberation at once.
Fourth, may the lonely, unattached spirits
all receive rebirth.
Fifth, may the world know peace,
the five grains ripen in abundance.
Sixth, may ministers be loyal, children filial,
rulers benevolent, fathers kind.
Seventh, may the four seas unite,
enemies and kin reconcile.
Eighth, may the hidden and the unborn
all come to life and thrive.
Ninth, may chronic and acute illnesses
swiftly heal.
Tenth, may the destitute and orphaned
abound in clothing and food.

**Reigniting the Incense Burner**
Incense Officials and Envoys,
Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
Attendant Incense Spirits—
may this place of our Daoist practice
naturally yield golden elixir, cinnabar,
and azure mushrooms.

May the hundred spirits and host of perfected beings
gather here in assembly,
before the grotto’s incense burner.
May I, who study the Dao, attain the Dao;
may I, who seek immortality, attain immortality.
May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions
receive this fragrant smoke,
and swiftly convey the words I have just uttered
directly to the Jade Throne of the Supreme Vast Dao,
before the Golden Gates of the Infinite.

*Exiting the Chamber*
Here ends Scroll Thirty-Nine of the *Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Supreme*
Here begins Scroll Forty of the *Yellow Register Retreat Rites of the Supreme*
Compiled by Master Du Guangting of Tang Guangcheng

*Dissolving the Three Times, Circulating the Dao, Presenting the Petition*
*Sealing the Altar, Overnight Invocation—all as prescribed in the Lingbao scriptures*

The assembled officials take their places before the Dark Master and stand in formation.

*Chanting the Dao*
The *Hymn of Huaxia* is sung, leading the procession to the Earth Gate.

*Entering the Chamber*
Circling the altar, beginning from the East, the five directions are honored with incense.
Incense is offered at the Master’s table.
Incense is offered with the secret mantra.
Incense is offered at each station.
Each bows to the Master, visualizing as prescribed.

*Guarding the Spirits*
At dawn’s radiant clarity, purple mist rides the sky.
The star altar shines resplendent,
transforming into a cloud palace.
Sun’s essence and moon’s spirit
flank the Li and Kan trigrams.
Golden perfected ones summon with a whistle,
spirit tigers ward off Feng.
On this auspicious day, the ritual proceeds,
the Eight Mighties drum in attendance.
Jade blossoms unfurl, rainbow banners swirl.
Heavenly light descends in gaze,
the Dao’s qi flourishes in abundance.
All beings receive universal deliverance,
boundless blessings flow without end.

*Striking the Dharma Drum twenty-four times*

Supreme Mysterious Origin, Supreme Lord of the Dao,
summon forth from within this servant’s body:
the Three and Five Merit Officers,
the Left and Right Envoys,
the Golden Lads who attend incense,
the Jade Maidens who transmit words,
the Five Thearchs’ Direct Messengers,
and the Incense Officials of the Day—
thirty-two of each—
to emerge in full regalia.
Let them swiftly report to the local earth gods and territorial deities,
the true officials and rightful spirits of this place,
that I now, on behalf of the petitioner’s intent,
pray for the descent of the wondrous qi of the Lingbao’s spontaneous divine vitality,
to flow into our bodies,
so that the words I have uttered
may swiftly reach the Jade Throne of the Supreme Vast Dao,
before the Golden Gates of the Void and Spontaneous.

*Each declares their dharma rank*

Your humble servant, [Name], in full sincerity, together with all present, respectfully petitions:
the Spontaneous and Vast Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Original Beginning,
the Supreme Lord of the Infinite Dao,
the Supreme Lord Lao,
the Jade Emperor of the August Heaven,
the host of great sages who have attained the Dao in the ten directions,
the perfected lords and venerable masters,
the thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs,
the Jade Clarity Thearch,
the Great Thearch of the Jade Capital,
the Golden Waves of the Seven Treasures,
the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace,
the Lingbao Perfected Sovereign of Luminous Augustness,
the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures,
the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center,
and all the true spirits of the three realms’ officialdom.

We prostrate ourselves and recall:
when the great transformation first divided,
all beings received their endowment.
Yin and yang rise and fall,
determining life and death;
rewards and punishments, seen and unseen,
manifest sin and fortune.
From ancient times to the present, nothing has erred;
great and small alike are justly measured.
The supreme Dao proclaims its compassionate salvific decrees,
while the Lingbao scriptures prescribe rites of repentance and prayer.
Relying on this retreat’s offerings,
we seek to deliver the dim and benighted.
Having been entrusted with this office,
we have glimpsed the profound mysteries.
Whatever we now declare,
how dare we not make known above?

*Reading the Petition*
As the words of the petition state, we devote ourselves deeply to cultivation and reverence.

We turn our thoughts to the myriad generations of ancestors—both inner and outer kin—and to all departed spirits, bound through kalpas past. Some bear sins beyond absolution, grievous transgressions without measure, knotted fast and never undone. They may dwell in the ten directions of the cosmos, within the Five Peaks or the Nine Netherworlds, or under the governance of the Water Palace or Earth Bureau, confined in the dark courts of night, where wretched souls and suffering shades are held fast in the depths of the Yellow Springs. There, they endure the torments of water, fire, wind, and blade, day and night, their forms and spirits broken, their pain unbearable. Their afflictions extend to descendants, calamity flowing to later generations. In the endless dark of the netherworld, there is no path to liberation. Following the scriptural ordinances, we humbly seek their deliverance. Through the earnest observance of this retreat and the rites of repentance, we beseech mercy, offering our sincere devotion and praying for the gaze of the Mysterious One.

At this moment, as [Name] conducts the ritual and the assembly of the dharma invokes the first offering of incense, may this fragrant smoke ascend directly to honor the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves in reverence, and turn in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones. May the merit of this act flow to [Name]’s family—thirty-six generations, nine ancestors, seven lineages—and to all departed spirits and hidden souls. May the radiance of the divine descend to illuminate the ninefold darkness, and may the power of the Dao suffuse all, ending the trials in every prison. May enmities dissolve, sins be absolved, souls bathed in the Pool of Flowing Fire, and rebirth granted within the Palace of Southern Florescence. May celestial robes adorn their forms and the dew of wisdom purify their hearts. May they forever sever evil ties and forever ascend to the realm of blessings.

Now, as incense is kindled, we take refuge in the great sagely assembly, the perfected virtues of the Most High, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the realm of Non-Action, harmonizing with the True Dao.

As [Name] conducts the ritual and the assembly of the dharma invokes the second offering of incense, may this fragrant smoke ascend directly to honor the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves in reverence, and turn in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones. May the merit of this act flow to the state, to the august rites of the Nine Temples, and to the ancestral sages of the imperial line. May their spirits gather in the Crimson Towers, bestowing blessings upon the grand design. May the emperor’s virtue align with the Three Absences, his benevolence spread to the Nine Realms. May the realm enjoy peace, wind and rain be harmonious. May his reign surpass that of the Zhou in longevity, and his transformative influence shine as brightly as the Han’s. May weapons remain sheathed, and all within the four seas thrive in tranquility.

Now, as incense is kindled, we take refuge in the great sagely assembly, the perfected virtues of the Most High, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the realm of Non-Action, harmonizing with the True Dao.

As [Name] conducts the ritual and the assembly of the dharma invokes the third offering of incense, may this fragrant smoke ascend directly to honor the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters. We surrender body and life, prostrating ourselves in reverence, and turn in devotion to the Three Supreme Ones. May the merit of this act bring fortune to [Name]’s family, that they may forever enjoy blessings and auspiciousness, all attaining purity and good fortune. May disasters vanish before they arise, sins be extinguished without limit. May the nine clans and six relations together receive the mysterious protection. Extending to all beings—whether soaring or creeping, animate or inanimate, sentient or insentient—and to those in the dark paths of hell, the four modes of birth, and the six destinies, may the wind of the Dao spread afar, and the sagely grace suffuse all. May all awaken to Non-Action and ascend through every rank.

Now, as incense is kindled, we take refuge in the great sagely assembly, the perfected virtues of the Most High, who, having attained the Dao, ascend into the realm of Non-Action, harmonizing with the True Dao.

The rites are now complete.

To the East, we wholeheartedly take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the East, the Most High Lord Lao, the Venerable Celestial Elder, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Eastern Realm. With three bows, we reverently repent and offer thanks. After this repentance, we now kindle incense, dedicating it to so-and-so’s establishment of the wondrous retreat for the *Lingbao* Rite of Deliverance from Torment, wherein we recite scriptures and perform the Dao-circumambulation, repenting for the boundless sins of our countless ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

These sins may include: straying from the true Dao, flattery and deceit without end; envy of the worthy and capable, defiling and disrupting the divine Dao; cruelty and violence without measure, slaughter driven by whim; betrayal of oaths and covenants, plotting with curses and hexes. Such transgressions have congealed and accumulated like mountains, their weight crushing, their punishments profound. Yet they remain unforgiven. The souls of the guilty are seized and struck, confined within the Wooden Bureau’s Eastern Peak’s Punishment and Torture Prison, subjected to the torments of copper pillars, iron beds, and golden hammers. Day and night, they endure agony, their suffering unrelenting, their rest and sustenance denied. They afflict the living with lawsuits, pleading for deliverance. Yet in the endless dark of night, no release is found.

Now, through this Dao-circumambulation and retreat, we pray for mercy and repentance to cleanse these sins. We humbly implore the great compassion to grant forgiveness, the power of the Dao to bestow its light. May a decree descend within the Eastern Bureau, at the gates of the Torture Office. May the torments of the living and dead be dissolved, their souls delivered and uplifted, receiving blessings in the Heavenly Halls. May the living ascend to the divine realms above, and the dark and light realms alike know peace. Bearing the mysterious grace, having attained the Dao, may they ascend into Non-Action, harmonizing with the True Dao.

To the South, we wholeheartedly take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the South, the Most High Lord Lao, the Venerable Celestial Elder, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Southern Realm. With three bows, we reverently repent and offer thanks. We now kindle incense, dedicating it to so-and-so’s establishment of the wondrous retreat for the *Lingbao* Rite of Deliverance from Torment, wherein we recite scriptures and perform the Dao-circumambulation, repenting for the boundless sins of our countless ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations, nine lineages, and seven branches—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

These sins may include: inflicting cruelty and harm at will, slaughtering the innocent; breaking oaths and covenants, casting hexes upon beings.

Indulging in depravity and wantonness, violating and oppressing the chaste and upright. Defying the steps of goodness, creating sinful karma. Offending Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, and all divine spirits. Their punishments are severe, their calamities profound, yet they have not received pardon. Their souls are seized and struck, confined within the Fire Bureau’s Southern Marchmount’s Punishment-Pounding Hell, enduring the torment of furnace and charcoal, scorched and broken by cruel punishments. Day and night, they are tortured and flogged, their pain and poison unbearable. The misfortune extends to their descendants, flowing endlessly without cease. In the boundless dark of the long night, there is no means of deliverance. Today, through repentance and the washing of hearts, through the establishment of the retreat and the performance of the Dao-circumambulation, we humbly implore the Three Worthies to witness and protect, the Great Saints to bestow compassion. We beseech the Fire Bureau of the Southern Palace and the wardens of the Punishment-Pounding Gate to absolve their accumulated sins and release the imprisoned souls. May they emerge from the Hell of Mount Huo, reborn within the Crimson Palace of Cavernous Yang. May their descendants receive blessings, forever bearing the grace of the divine. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into Non-Action, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

To the West,
we take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the West, the Most High Lord Lao, the Venerable Celestial Elder, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Western Realm. With three bows, we reverently repent and offer thanks. We now kindle incense, dedicating it to so-and-so’s establishment of the wondrous retreat for the *Lingbao* Rite of Deliverance from Torment, wherein we recite scriptures and perform the Dao-circumambulation, repenting for the boundless sins of our countless ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

These sins may include: acting contrary to kindness and nurture, lacking benevolence and humanity, lacking loyalty and filial piety. Harming the good and upright, offending and defying the divine spirits.

Violating the Five Constants, indulging in all manner of evil. Engaging in curses and malevolent prayers, committing wanton and groundless acts. Their transgressions are grave, their calamities profound, yet they have not received absolution. Their souls and spirits are bound and confined within the Golden Bureau’s Hua Mountain Grinding Prison, enduring the torments of sword trees, blade mountains, and the sufferings of wind and thunder. Day and night, they are tortured and afflicted, their pain and poison unrelenting. Their grievances entangle their descendants, their misfortunes flowing into the present. In the endless darkness of the long night, there is no means of deliverance. Today, through repentance and supplication for mercy, we establish the wondrous retreat and perform the Dao-circumambulation. We humbly beseech the Great Compassion to bestow nurturing grace, that the myriad sages may turn their radiant light. We implore that a decree be issued within the Western Bureau, beneath the gates of the Grinding Officials. May the imprisoned and suffering be delivered, their souls and spirits absolved. May they be entrusted to the divine courtyards, reborn in the Pure Realms. May the living enjoy peace and prosperity, forever bearing the profound favor. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into non-action, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the True.

To the North:
With utmost sincerity, we reverently submit ourselves to the Boundless Great Dao of the North, the Most High Lord Lao, the Venerable Celestial Elder, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Northern Realm. With three bows, we reverently repent and offer thanks. We now kindle incense, dedicating it to so-and-so’s establishment of the wondrous retreat for the *Lingbao* Rite of Deliverance from Torment, wherein we recite scriptures and perform the Dao-circumambulation, repenting for the boundless sins of our countless ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

These sins may include: defying the heavenly Dao above, offending the earthly authorities below. Defiling the Three Luminaries, belittling the Four Great Elements. Harboring resentment against wind and rain, enlisting ghosts and spirits. Casting curses and hexes upon others, inflicting harm upon living beings. Their souls and spirits are arraigned and confined within the Water Bureau’s Zhen Mountain Grinding Prison, enduring the sufferings of freezing ice, nightly courts, and icy rivers. Their flesh and skin split from the cold, their pain and poison unbearable. They entreat the living, seeking deliverance and salvation. In the endless darkness of the long night, there is no means of release.

With this present Dao-procession and fast, we reverently confess and repent. We humbly beseech the Heavenly Honored and Great Sage to bestow boundless grace. May proclamation be issued within the Northern Bureau, beneath the gates of the Judgment Officers. May their offenses be pardoned, their suffering souls delivered and uplifted. May they depart the long night’s icy courts, escape the Three Paths and Five Sufferings. May they ascend to the Pure Realm, receiving blessings and protection for the living. May their clans and kin find peace, the living and dead alike prosper. Having fulfilled these vows, we look up in gratitude for the mysterious favor. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the realm of Non-Action, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with truth.

In the northeast direction, we, your servants, wholeheartedly submit and entrust ourselves to the Boundless Great Dao of the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the northeast quarter. We perform the Three Bows, each with reverent confession and repentance.

We now burn incense and dedicate this Numinous Treasure Expiation Fast for Deliverance from Judgment, reciting scriptures and performing the Dao-procession, confessing the boundless sins of our ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

These sins may include: as children, failing in filial piety; as subjects, failing in loyalty; as fathers, lacking compassion; as rulers, lacking the Way. Envying the worthy, resenting the good, forsaking uprightness to embrace perversity.

Words at odds with the heart, self-deception before one’s own form and shadow. The Five Heinous Crimes committed in full, every evil act performed. Wrongfully harming the innocent, unjustly killing without cause. From life to death, grievances pierce the heavens above. Cursing the divine, invoking malevolent spells, resorting to sorcery and witchcraft. Calamity deep and transgressions grave—condemned to the Earth Bureau’s Lower Yuan, within the crushing prisons of judgment. Tortures of ten thousand kinds, body and soul broken and withered. In the endless dark of night, no means of deliverance to be found.

Now, in repentance we beg for mercy, establishing this fast and performing the Dao-procession. We prostrate ourselves, hoping the Ten Heavens will grant pardon, the Three Saints bestow grace. May a decree descend to the Earthly Mansion, to the gates of the Judgment Officials. May karmic retribution be dissolved, souls and spirits absolved. Freed from the realm of bondage, released from the suffering of heavy fetters. Bathed in the divine cinnabar and radiant fire, ascending the Scarlet Mound. Litigation forever dispelled, descendants at peace and prosperous. The living and the dead alike share in this blessing, looking up to receive the profound grace. After attaining the Dao, we ascend into the realm of Non-Action.

In harmony with the Dao, united with true reality.

Southeast Quarter
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the southeast quarter. We perform the Three Bows, each with reverent confession and repentance.

We now burn incense and dedicate this Numinous Treasure Expiation Fast for Deliverance from Judgment, reciting scriptures and performing the Dao-procession, confessing the boundless sins of our ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

These sins may include: secretly acting with violence, wantonly oppressing others; scorning the orphaned and destitute, despising the aged and infirm.

Revealing others’ faults while concealing their good deeds. Disrupting the proper order of kinship, suppressing the orphaned and weak. Scheming through unrighteous means, slandering sages and worthies. Undermining others’ accomplishments, envying those who surpass oneself. Inflicting harm and killing without just cause, acting wantonly as one pleases. Invoking Heaven and Earth, the sun, moon, and stars as witnesses—such sins run deep, and their retribution is severe. The souls are cast into the prisons of the Earth Bureau, where they endure the torments of water, fire, wind, and blade, day and night, without respite. The punishments are meted out in succession, with no means of deliverance.

Now, through this repentance and expiation, we perform the fast and Dao-procession. We prostrate ourselves in hope that the Perfected Saints of the Ten Directions and the August Lords of the Five Quarters will decree to the prisons of the southeast quarter, to the courts of the Judgment Officials, that the imprisoned souls be redeemed, their forms and spirits cleansed. May their accumulated sins be absolved, their long-standing calamities eradicated. May the living be guided onto the path of blessedness, receiving protection and favor. May misfortunes vanish into the Nine Yin, and disasters sink beneath the Four Boundaries. May both the living and the dead share in this felicity, forever bearing the profound grace of the Dao.

After attaining the Dao, they ascend into non-action, united with true reality.

Southwest Quarter
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the southwest quarter. We perform the Three Bows, each with reverent confession and repentance.

We now burn incense and dedicate this Numinous Treasure Expiation Fast for Deliverance from Judgment, reciting scriptures and performing the Dao-procession, confessing the boundless sins of our ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

These sins may include: uttering deceitful and frivolous words, feigning falsehoods; deceiving both the wise and the foolish, insulting true sages.

Bullying the weak while submitting to the strong, insatiably greedy and sacrilegious.
Or contending for profit and wealth, mutually harming one another.
Or seeking glory and lusting after beauty, violating and oppressing the chaste and virtuous.
Swearing oaths and forging pacts, invoking spirits and summoning ghosts.
Thereby incurring karmic retribution, accumulating in the netherworld.
Souls are struck within the courts of Earth Prison, beneath the gates of the Judgment Officers.
Bound in layered pits, they never behold the light.
Subjected to interrogation and torture, they suffer endlessly without relief.
Now, by performing this fast and Dao-procession, we confess sins and beseech mercy.
We humbly implore the Most High Sages and Perfected Ones, in great compassion and forgiveness,
to let their divine radiance descend and illuminate the underworld.
We petition the Judgment Halls of the Southwest Quarter, the gates of the Judgment Officers,
to release the imprisoned souls and deliver them to the Pure Realms above.
May blessings extend afar, bringing peace to both the living and the dead.
Should our prayers be answered, we shall ever bear the profound grace of the Dao.
After attaining the Way, we shall ascend into non-action, united with true reality.

**Northwest Quarter**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the northwest quarter. We perform the Three Bows, each with reverent confession and repentance.

We now burn incense and dedicate this Numinous Treasure Expiation Fast for Deliverance from Judgment, reciting scriptures and performing the Dao-procession, confessing the boundless sins of our ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.

Deep calamities and heavy judgments remain unresolved through countless kalpas.
In the six destinies and three evil paths, they endure all manner of retribution.
Souls are seized and struck within the Earth Prison’s Judgment Halls, suffering unbearable torment, their afflictions extending to descendants.
Mutually flowing and perpetuating, their suffering spans eons without end.
Now, by confessing sins and establishing this fast, we beseech compassionate forgiveness.
We humbly implore the assembled Venerable Ones and Most High Sages to universally bestow their merciful radiance,
releasing the destitute souls and delivering them from dark suffering.
We petition the Judgment Halls of the Northwest Quarter, the gates of the Judgment Officers,
to wash away deep transgressions and dissolve accumulated grievances,
reconciling karmic enmity and delivering both the living and the dead.
Should our prayers be answered, we shall ever bear the profound grace of the Dao.
After attaining the Way, we shall ascend into non-action, united with true reality.

**Upper Quarter**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the upper quarter. We perform the Three Bows, each with reverent confession and repentance.

We now burn incense and dedicate this Numinous Treasure Expiation Fast for Deliverance from Judgment, reciting scriptures and performing the Dao-procession, confessing the boundless sins of our ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.
Or offending the true Dao, defiling and disrespecting the Three Luminaries.
Baring the sacred before the gods, cursing and raging at thunder and rain.

Deceiving and deluding the true sages, unafraid of the unseen and manifest.
The Nine Bureaus bind their forms, the Three Offices raise their indictments.
Souls and spirits are seized and bound, within the Three Paths and Nine Dark Prisons of the grinding hells.
Dragged through the Cold Courts, shut in eternal night.
For countless eons in darkness, never beholding light.
Flowing into descendants, drawing in the living and the dead.
Mutually entangled and obstructed, with no means of cleansing.
Now, by performing the Dao-procession and establishing this fast, we lay bare our hearts in confession and repentance.
We humbly implore the Three Venerable Great Sages, the host of celestial perfected, the Three Luminaries and constellations, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors.
Together, may they bestow vast grace, universally descending great mercy.
Proclaiming to the hells of the lower quarter, to the courts of the Judgment Officials:
Absolve accumulated sins, deliver suffering souls.
Ascend into the Hall of Blessings, hear the scriptures and awaken to the Dao.
Living and dead alike at peace, all litigations forever dissolved.
All sentient beings together ascend the shore of fortune.
By this supplication, we receive the boundless grace.
United with true reality, we ascend into non-action.

**Lower Quarter**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao of the Most High Lord Lao, the Most High Elder, the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the lower quarter. We perform the Three Bows, each with reverent confession and repentance.

We now burn incense and dedicate this Numinous Treasure Expiation Fast for Deliverance from Judgment, reciting scriptures and performing the Dao-procession, confessing the boundless sins of our ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.
Or falsely assuming the role of master, carving up the land, hills, ridges, and royal veins of the plains, damaging graves and temples.
Restraining and obstructing the spirits, blocking water sources, damming mountains and filling valleys.
Destroying city walls and altars of soil and grain, offending the lords and local officials.
Unafraid of the divine, wantonly committing transgressions.
Souls and spirits are struck and seized, within the Nine Dark Hells of the lower world.
Drawing from the River of Eternal Night to irrigate the Four Seas.
Bearing mountains and transporting stones, condemned to myriad labors.

The pain is boundless, enduring without end.
It extends upward to past lives, downward to descendants.
Karmic retribution remains unresolved, calamities weigh heavy with stern reckoning.

Now, by establishing this fast and performing the Dao-procession, we confess and uproot the roots of sin.
We humbly implore the Most Sacred Host of Venerables to open the streams of compassionate salvation.
We proclaim to the Nine Earths and Five Peaks, the Four Waterways and mountains and rivers,
to Mount Tai and the Dai Zong, to the Fengdu Underworld and the lower realms’ prisons of punishment,
to the courts of the infernal judges:
Absolve the accumulated sins of countless lives and kalpas.
Deliver the destitute souls, free them from dark suffering.
Let them wander in the true realm, dwell peacefully in the courts of fortune.
May descendants flourish, the living and dead share in blessings.
Should our plea be granted, we shall look up in profound gratitude for boundless grace.
After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the realm of Non-Action,
harmonizing with the Dao to unite with the True.

To the Ten Directions, we wholeheartedly submit and entrust ourselves:
To the Perfected Great Sages of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao,
to the Most True Lords and Venerable Masters,
to the Divine Immortals of the Ten Lands and all spirit-officials—
we offer the Three Bows, each with utmost sincerity, confessing and giving thanks.

We, the assembled, dedicate body and spirit, submitting ourselves in devotion.
Now, by burning incense and performing the Dao-procession,
we establish the Supreme Lingbao Fast of Deliverance from Punishment for so-and-so,
confessing the boundless sins of our ancestors—extending to thirty-six generations—
and all departed spirits, whether living or dead.
Some have offended the Great Sages of the Heavens, the Host of the Great Dao,
the Three Luminaries and Five Phases, the Sacred Host of the Void,
the spirits of wind, clouds, thunder, and rain, and all divine beings.
Some have violated the Five Peaks and myriad mountains, the Thirty-Six Earths,
the hills and water palaces, the officials of the underworld.
Some have defied sages and worthies, transgressed against benevolence and righteousness.
Some have desecrated ancient and modern sacred sites, contravened the Four Great Elements and Five Constants.
Each action has bound karmic causes, each has incurred retribution.
The Ten Evils have been fully committed, the Five Heinous Crimes repeatedly performed.
In life, no virtuous deeds; in death, only evil consequences.
Sunk in the Five Sufferings, dragged through the Three Wretched Paths.
Exiled souls endure hard labor, never granted pardon.

Now, by establishing this fast and performing the Dao-procession, we confess and uproot the roots of sin.
We humbly implore the Three Supreme Ones to open the streams of great compassion,
to send down the Mandate of the Nine Dragons.
We proclaim to all realms and the infernal courts of the judges:
Release the souls from eternal night.
Bathe them in the Crimson Mound’s courts, clothe them in the robes of the Cavern Yang’s palace.
Let them be born on the shores of blessed fortune, bestowing grace upon descendants.
May auspicious blessings draw near, the living and dead dwell in peace.
Should our plea be granted, we shall look up in profound gratitude for mysterious grace.
After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the realm of Non-Action,
harmonizing with the Dao to unite with the True.

Each shall meditate on the Nine-Colored Perfect Image,
swallow the saliva, recite the secret demon-subduing incantation,
pace the void, circumambulate.
The Supreme Ultimate divides into height and depth,
the light and pure ascend to belong to Heaven.

One who cultivates the Perfect Dao,
the body becomes a true immortal.
Their deeds surpass the three thousand,
their time spans forty thousand years.
The cinnabar terrace opens its treasure scrolls,
the golden mouth transmits the flow.
The Great Brahmā, Lord of the Three Heavens,
the Void Sovereign, the Five Venerable Ones—
even they cannot fathom its subtlety,
how then could it be captured in words?
The jeweled throne descends in the golden hall,
the rosy coronet illumines the jade pavilion.
Myriad perfected ones pay homage at the imperial court,
their flying sandals treading the roots of clouds.
The melodies of Hua and Xia resound afar,
the cadence of human voices rises and falls.
In emptiness they return to virtue and power,
their turns and twists harmonizing with the celestial tones.
The halls are steeped in sandalwood’s fragrance,
the towers cool beneath the moon’s dew.
How shall utmost sincerity be offered in prayer?
May the harvests forever flourish in abundance.

**Threefold Reverence**
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures.
We, your servants, prostrate with utmost sincerity,
bowing to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm.

**Reaffirming the Dharma Titles**
We, your humble servants, [names], reverently reaffirm our sincerity and humbly address the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning, the Most High Dao Lord, and the Most High Lord Lao.
We, of lowly and insignificant station,
have received and upheld the precepts and ordinances.
Following the sacred decree,
our duty lies in delivering sentient beings.
We rescue and liberate the living and the dead,
that all may dwell in peace.
Whatever we declare,
we dare not withhold from your august hearing.

Now, there is [name], an official and devout believer,
who lays bare his sincerity and reveals his earnest plea.
He requests to perform a fast and vigil,
to repent of sins and beseech grace.
In accordance with the canons and ritual forms,
we have examined the mystic protocols.
We have heard that when ancestors do good,
blessings extend to their descendants;
when they do evil,
calamities flow to later generations.
The retribution of sin and fortune
follows like a shadow.
Without thorough repentance and prayer,
there is no means of cleansing.

The nine generations and seven ancestors of [name]’s family,
the recently departed and those long gone—
through countless kalpas,
they may have committed various transgressions:
violating the one hundred eighty prohibitions of the Three Primes,
or the fourteen categories of offenses in the Jade Treasury,
arising from the six senses,
the three karmas,
the ten evils,
and myriad wrongs,
all accumulated in the nether courts.

Perhaps their eyes were ensnared by the five colors,
unable to perceive the true and real;
their ears clung to the five sounds,
unable to hear the supreme principle;
their mouths craved the five flavors,
consuming and harming life;
their bodies were bound by the five entanglements,
tainted by desire and harming their nature.

Perhaps they offended the celestial Dao above,
violating the sun, moon, and stars;
or transgressed against the earthly darkness below,
and the mountains, rivers, hills, and temples;
or disrupted human affairs in the middle,
undermining the harmony of benevolence and righteousness.

As children and subjects, they were disloyal and unfilial;
as rulers and fathers, they were unprincipled and unkind.
Their words belied their hearts,
they envied the worthy and resented the good.
They harmed others and seized their possessions,
bullied the orphaned and impoverished.
They estranged kin and befriended the distant,
revered the perverse and turned from the upright.
They exploited wealth and usurped merit,
drained marshes and burned forests,
angled for the hidden and shot the roosting.
They flew hawks and coursed hounds,
slaughtering without end.

Or perhaps they caused strife among the nine clans,
violence among the six relations.
Their words lacked propriety and deference,
their actions were always invasive and deceitful.
As officials, they coveted wealth,
oppressed their superiors and tyrannized their subordinates,
seeking prestige through cruelty.
They flogged the innocent,
executed the guiltless.

Or they made oaths and curses,
invoking gods and spirits;
or undertook construction projects,
damaging graves and temples.
They followed their whims and indulged their desires,
entangling themselves in deep sin and calamity.
Their souls are bound to the three paths,
confined in eternal night.
They endure a thousand torments and ten thousand trials,
their suffering spanning countless kalpas.
The distant heavens are dim,
the bridge of the Dharma broken.
The dark hells below offer no escape,
thus bringing misfortune upon the living
and disasters upon their descendants.
Their endeavors falter,
their movements meet with misfortune.

Now, we pour out our hearts in earnest plea,
returning in repentance and prayer.
We implore the Three Treasures,
prostrating before all the heavens.
We humbly beseech the Great Sage to bestow mercy,
to universally grant pardon and forgiveness.
May the edict be issued to the Four Controllers, the Five Emperors,
and the mighty deities of the Three Realms,
to proclaim below to the Nine Dark Realms of the netherworld,
the judges and their subordinates,
to absolve and pardon the countless ancestors and myriad souls.
Release their sins and remove their transgressions,
reconcile grievances and dissolve faults.
Open the heavy prisons and dark dungeons,
liberate the suffering souls.
The sword trees lose their blades,
the knife mountains lay down their edges.
The frigid realms and eternal night
are filled with light.
Their refined essences ascend to the Southern Cinnabar,
their spirits rise to the Azure Vault.
They roam the Eight Scenic Realms,
ride the Ten Heavens.
The officials of the netherworld are promoted to Great Perfected,
soaring to the Golden Gates.
The calamities of [name]’s family cease,
blessings and grace draw near.
They ascend the steps of longevity and fortune,
enjoying the rewards of peace and integrity.

May all sentient beings of the four births and six destinies,
the conscious and the feeling,
through this merit,
together ascend the shore of the Dao.
May the three luminaries shine in mystery,
the six qi harmonize.
May the imperial reign be long,
and the world dwell in peace.
Above, may the great compassion of the Celestial Venerable be manifest;
below, may the sincerity of our repentance be answered.

**Vows**
First, may heaven and earth be bright and pure.
Second, may the atmosphere be clear and mysterious.
Third, may the sage enjoy ten thousand years of life.
Fourth, may transformation extend to the eight limits.
Fifth, may sweet dew descend from heaven.
Sixth, may the earth emit auspicious vapors.
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their course.
Eighth, may all things grow in perfection.
Ninth, may families abound in filial piety and fraternal love.
Tenth, may the nation flourish with talent and virtue.
Eleventh, may the officiating officials obtain blessings.
Twelfth, may those who study the Dao attain immortality.

**Reactivating the Incense Burner**
Incense Official Messengers,
Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords,
Attendant Spirit Officials of the Incense—
may this place where we offer incense
naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms.
May the hundred spirits and myriad perfected ones
gather here before the incense burner.
May we who study the Dao attain the Dao,
those who seek immortality become immortals.
May the officiant receive blessings,
the living and the dead partake in grace.
May the words we have declared
swiftly reach the august presence of the Supreme Boundless Great Dao,
the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning,
in the Golden Gates and Jade Palace of the Void and Spontaneity.

**Verbal Petition**
We, your humble servants [names],
prostrate and humbly address the Supreme Boundless Great Dao,
the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning,
the Most High Great Dao Lord,
the Most High Lord Lao,
the thirty-six divisions of the Venerable Scriptures,
the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Realm,
and all the spirit officials of the Numinous Treasure.
Having received the Orthodox and True,
