We pray that the wondrous light of the Jade Clarity’s Dao-*qi* and Numinous Treasure descend and flow into our bodies, that our petitions swiftly ascend to the presence of the Supreme, Boundless, and Great Dao—before the Jade Threshold of the Formless and Spontaneous Golden Gate.

**Each declares their ritual rank:**

We, your humble servants, in unison and sincerity, reverently address the Formless and Spontaneous Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Boundless Great Dao, the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, the Supreme Venerable Lord Lao, the Jade Emperor of the August Heaven, the Great Sage Assemblies and Perfected Lords of the Ten Directions who have attained the Dao, the Thirty-Two Heavenly Lords, the Jade Clarity Emperor, the Great Jade Emperor, the Eastern Florescence, Southern Culmen, Western Numinosity, Northern Perfection, the Seven Jeweled Mysterious Terrace of the Jade Capital and Golden Gates in the Purple Tenuity’s Upper Palace, the Numinous Treasure Perfected Sovereign of Luminous Augustness, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the officials of the Three Realms, the Perfected Immortals of the Grotto-Heavens, the Five Primordial Thearchs, the Numinous Treasure’s Mighty Spirits, and all true numina above and below.

We have heard that the Great Dao fuses with the true, and the Primordial August One governs the course of destiny. The Five Scriptures unfold the teachings, and the Three Caverns proclaim their practice. The Heavenly Worthy bestows the ordinances of boundless deliverance; the Supreme One spreads limitless grace. All beings are shaped and refined, all lives rescued and uplifted. We, having accumulated good causes over countless kalpas, have been bathed in the mysterious transformation. Dragon scripts and phoenix records, jade tablets and jasper scrolls—we have been privileged to receive and cultivate them, seeking ascent and deliverance. Yet at the outset of our vows, we pledge salvation as our foremost duty. No petition may be withheld or denied. How much more so when commanded by sacred decree—dare we not make this known above?

**The petition is read.**

As the words express, our sincerity is earnest and our devotion profound. It is fitting that deliverance be granted, that the mysterious compassion be fulfilled.

We reflect that before the Five Ultimates, the Three Spirits divided their transformations. In the lower antiquity, customs remained uncorrupted. Dwellings were carved into cliffs and nests built in trees; all embraced the Dao and held fast to virtue. Each found contentment in their place, harmonizing in effortless non-action. But when the myriad signs of yin and yang appeared, and the symbols of beams and rafters arose, fortune and misfortune, good and evil, intertwined in mutual succession. Those who followed the natural order enjoyed generations of blessings; those who defied it suffered calamities and afflictions. The sages, moved by compassion, made salvation their heart’s work. Through repentance of sins and prayer for grace, they exalted the rectitude of the retreat. We now humbly join together, adhering to the canonical rites. We establish the altar and seek blessings and protection.

Today, as we proceed with the rite, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the first pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend through the void, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Dao.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full submission, reverently relying on the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the august spirits of the altars of state and the ancestral shrines. May the Celestial Capital gleam with radiant purity, and the Purple Culmen extend its blessings. May fortune grace the imperial residence, and felicity transmit the imperial enterprise. May it stand as firm as Mount Song and Mount Heng, and shine as brightly as the sun and moon. May the Crown Prince and the various princes inherit and uphold the sagely enterprise. May worthy ministers and good counselors ably assist in planning and strategy. May the myriad states come as if by bridge and boat, and all beings enjoy peace and prosperity.

For this purpose, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Assemblies, the virtues of the Perfected Ones. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

Today, as we proceed with the rite, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the second pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend through the void, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Scriptures.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full submission, reverently relying on the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the nine ancestors and seven generations of the sponsor’s family, and to the departed spirits in the hidden realms. May they dwell in the Crimson Garden and refine their souls on the Cinnabar Terrace. May they don the *qi* of immortality and ascend to the cloudy peaks, entrusting themselves to transformation. May fortune bless their descendants, and grace extend to both the living and the dead. May they ever bear the mysterious felicity and constantly receive primal auspiciousness.

For this purpose, we now burn incense, taking refuge in the Great Sage Assemblies, the virtues of the Perfected Ones. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao in truth.

Today, as we proceed with the rite, we invite the Dharma assembly to offer the third pinch of incense. May this fragrant smoke ascend through the void, directly offering reverence to the Supreme Perfected Treasure of the Masters.

We dedicate our bodies and lives, prostrating ourselves in full submission, reverently relying on the Three Supreme Ones. May this merit flow to the sponsor’s household, their kin and relatives, bringing them shared blessings. May their fortune extend and their lives endure; may misfortunes vanish and calamities dissolve. May the dragon spirits of the dwelling, the yin and yang officers, and the terrestrial officials receive promotions in rank and rewards for merit, their titles and honors augmented. May they bring auspicious protection to the central palace and dispel disasters and misfortunes from the outer realms.

Now, therefore, we kindle incense and take refuge in the Great Sage Assembly of Masters, whose supreme virtue, having attained the Dao, ascends into formlessness. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

**Ritual Orientation**
With utmost sincerity, we prostrate ourselves and submit our lives to the Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the East, the Azure Emperor of the Nine Qi Celestial Lord, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the eastern quarter. Thrice we bow, each time offering reverent repentance and gratitude. Hereafter, follow this pattern for each direction.

**Repentance**
**East**
We, your servants, offer this rite on behalf of the sponsor, so-and-so, humbly giving thanks to the Boundless Supreme Perfected Azure Emperor of the Nine Qi of the East, the Seven Star Lords of the Azure Dragon and Eastern Dipper—Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket—the Wood Virtue Deities of Jia-Yi and Yin-Mao, the Lesser Yang Qi of the Nine Yi Elder Lord, the Spring Sovereign Gou Mang of Grand White, and the Stellar Officials of Jupiter, the Wood Palace.

We reflect with awe that the dwelling place may have offended or transgressed against the divine, violated prohibitions, and thereby invited misfortune. Now, therefore, we kindle incense and submit our lives to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy. We perform this fast and practice the Dao, seeking to repent our faults and entreat blessings.

May our transgressions be absolved and blessings bestowed. May the qi of central earth be harmonized, and all disasters and misfortunes dissolved. May sins be expiated, calamities stilled, and both the living and the dead enjoy peace. May fortune and longevity be renewed, the entire household flourish in integrity, and all beings—moving and still—receive glory. May our prayers be granted, and may we ever bear the profound grace of the Mystery.

Having attained the Dao, we ascend into formlessness. Harmony unites with the true Dao.

May our prayers be granted, and may we ever bear the profound grace of the Mystery.

**Above**
We, the servants, on behalf of the fast’s sponsor, so-and-so, offer reverent thanks to the Perfected and Supreme Heavenly Lord of the Brahman qi of the Above; the Most High and Sacred Ones of the Heavens; the sun, moon, and stars; the Eight Winds and Five Phases; the wind, rain, thunder, and lightning; the Deities of Yin and Yang; and above to the Heavenly Way of Qian, the movements of the sun and moon, the Eight Dragons and Nine Tigers, the Supreme Unity and Ten Essences, the Flying Banners and Eight Destructions, the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper, and all the deities above and below the heavens.

We reflect that in our dwelling, we may have offended the true spirits, violated prohibitions, and defiled the Three Luminaries. Above, we have failed to revere the Way of Heaven; below, we have not feared the spirits. Our transgressions have accumulated, inviting misfortune. Now, therefore, we kindle incense and submit our lives to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy. We perform this fast and practice the Dao, seeking to repent our faults and entreat blessings.

May a thousand disasters be dispersed, and ten thousand sins expiated. May the entire household receive blessings, and both the living and the dead enjoy peace.

May official emoluments be prolonged and life extended, misfortunes extinguished and blessings born. Having received the grace of our entreaty, we reverently bear the profound favor.

After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the true.

Below, we, your servants, on behalf of the fast’s sponsor, so-and-so, offer reverent thanks to the perfected and true immortals of the boundless world below, the High August Earthly Mansion, the Nine Palace Perfected, the Four Directors and Five Emperors, the Twelve Immortal Lords, the numinous caverns and rivers, the august deities of the Five Marchmounts. We further offer thanks to the Eight Trigrams and Nine Palaces governed by yin and yang, the Supreme Perfected of the Two Dwellings and the Earthly Thearch, the lords and marquises of the underworld and the Four Directions, the generals of the Eight Divisions who guard the dwelling and enforce prohibitions, the officials of the Five Soils and their descendants, the General of the Year-Star, the Leopard-Tail and Yellow Pennant, the Scribal Masters of Memorials, the deities of Punishment and Virtue, and the seventy-two inner and outer spirits.

We reflect that in our dwelling, we may have offended the numinous spirits, violated prohibitions, and invited misfortune. Now, therefore, we kindle incense and submit our lives to the Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy. We perform this fast and practice the Dao, seeking to repent our faults and entreat blessings.

May a single repentance dissolve our sins, and ten thousand virtues be fulfilled. May the offenses of our transgressions be entirely expiated. May the entire household enjoy health and peace, their dwelling secure and tranquil. May official emoluments and longevity increase, and both the living and the dead share in blessings. Having received the grace of our entreaty, we reverently bear the profound favor. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the true.

*Step into emptiness, circumambulate afar, and perform the Three Reverences.*

We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.
We, your servants, bow our heads in utmost sincerity to the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures.
We, your servants, bow in utmost sincerity to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Center.

*Reiterating the dharma ranks:*

We, your servants, so-and-so and others, humbly reaffirm our entreaty to the Supreme Boundless Great Dao, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy; the Supreme Great Dao Lord; the Supreme Lord Lao; the great sagely hosts who have attained the Dao in the ten directions; the Heavenly Thearchs and Celestial Emperors; the thirty-six divisions of revered scriptures; the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Center; the Supreme August of the Earthly Mansion; the Five Emperors of the Underworld; the Great Dharma Masters of the Three Heavens; the Orthodox Unity Perfected; the officials of the Three and Five, and all responsive numinous spirits.

We have heard that the mysterious transformation is proclaimed and the Dao’s influence spreads, bestowing grace upon the Three Realms and extending kindness to all beings. The covenantal might suspends the statutes that aid the state, and the Numinous Treasure sets forth the forms of repentance and entreaty. Whatever is sought is surely attained through resonance.

Your disciple, so-and-so, dwells amidst the dust of the world and has not yet fathomed the subtle and wondrous. Yet in choosing this site for construction, the dwelling may not be auspicious. We fear we have offended the true spirits and violated prohibitions, contravening the signs of the Eight Dwellings and Five Phases, and failing in the directions of yin, yang, punishment, and virtue. Overcome with anxiety and doubt, we now present our repentance and thanksgiving.

Thus, we solemnly prepare the altar and meticulously follow the canonical rites. With reverence, we offer incense and flowers, devoutly performing the fast. We turn our hearts to the Ten Poles, repenting our sins before all heavens. In accordance with the Orthodox Unity scriptures and the Heavenly Master’s prescribed forms, we invoke the officials of the Three and Five, the celestial lords and their officers, to dispel inauspicious influences and dissolve disasters and calamities.

We humbly request on behalf of so-and-so the presence of the Supreme High Granary Lord, the Director of the Central Qi, the Lord of the White Chariot and White Horse, the Lord of Summoning and Investigation, the Lord of Qi Circulation and Disaster Resolution who guards the dwelling, the Celestial Lord of Faults and Transgressions, the Vast Controller, the Northern City Lord of Harmonious Fate and Transformative Counsel, the Celestial Heart Censor and Attendant who pacifies the heavens, the Supreme Great Harmony Lord, the Lord of Spirit Gathering and Supreme Clarity, the Upper Prime Earth Lord, the Heaven-Covering Great General and Supreme Heavenly Lord, the Red Heaven Granary Qi Lord, the Four Hu Lords, the Earth-Restraining Lord, the Heavenly Prosperity Lord, and the Five Guardians and Great Generals.

May they, on behalf of so-and-so’s household, dissolve the influences of the Three Mounds and Five Graves, the myriad spirits of the underworld, the earthly qi consumed by lunar eclipses, the hundred diseases and malevolent transgressions, the depredations of thieves and harmful losses, the qi of punishment and inauspicious calamities, the five epidemics and hundred illnesses, the spirits of curses and malevolent prayers, the destructive emanations from the four directions, the military incursions of the Five Divisions, the curses of household shrines, the various trials and all demonic entities, as well as the qi of the Five Phases’ retribution and the lingering, hidden spirits.

May the accumulated misfortunes of past generations and the disasters of the current year, the twelve punishments and harms, and all boundaries within and without be entirely dissolved. May all inauspicious spirits be dispelled.

Should there be any quarrying of timber or moving of stones, any groundbreaking or construction that offends the true spirits of heaven and earth, disrupts the true qi of yin and yang, encroaches upon the Earthly Mansion, or violates the numinous spirits—though the realms of the unseen and visible differ, and mortal understanding is limited—we now repent and offer thanks, beseeching that all be dissolved.

May the true qi be proclaimed and spread, the dragon spirits stand guard. May disasters and calamities be eradicated, and blessings and goodness come forth. May the dwelling be secure and tranquil, all movements harmonious and peaceful. May kin and clan alike be bathed in upright benefit. May the seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven, the three paths be purified and serene. May the Nine Darks cease their accusations, and the long night be illuminated. May grievances and debts be resolved, schemes and plots stilled. May the lingering dead and stagnant qi, the bound souls and hidden spirits, all receive blessings and each be delivered. May they abandon evil and return to the correct, attune to the Dao and commune with the true.

May the imperial reign be long and distant, the vitality of the people bright and flourishing. May all under heaven be wholly saved, and every moving thing partake in glory. Above, may the vast grace of the Illuminated Heavenly Worthy be manifest; below, may our repentant sincerity be answered.

*Making vows:*

First, may heaven and earth be bright and pure;
Second, may the atmosphere be clear and mysterious;
Third, may the sage live ten thousand years;
Fourth, may transformation reach the eight limits;
Fifth, may heaven bestow sweet dew;
Sixth, may earth emit auspicious mist;
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their courses;
Eighth, may all things grow whole;
Ninth, may households abound in filial piety and fraternal duty;
Tenth, may the state teem with talent and worthies;
Eleventh, may the merit of the fast spread widely;
Twelfth, may good omens daily increase.

*Replenishing the incense burner:*

Incense Official Messengers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, Attendant Incense Spirits—may the place where we offer incense naturally produce golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected gather here before the incense burner. May we who study the Dao attain the Dao, and those who seek immortality become immortals. May the fast’s sponsor receive blessings, and both the seen and unseen partake in grace.

May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the orchid-scented smoke, swiftly conveying our entreaty to the Golden Portal of the Supreme Boundless Great Dao.

*Exiting the Chamber*

*Concluding* **Ritual of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast, Scroll Forty-Four**
*Beginning* **Ritual of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast, Scroll Forty-Five**
*Compiled by Tang Dynasty Master Guangcheng, Du Guangting*

**Rite of Pacifying the Dwelling and Universal Repentance**

We now kindle incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao-practice. We reverently offer thanks to the Ten Directions’ Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the host of perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the most real lords and elders, the sun, moon, and stellar lodges, the deities of the Three Realms and all heavens, the numinous powers of the Five Marchmounts and Water Palaces, the Three Treasures, the august spirits of heaven above and earth below, the ten poles’ honored numina, and extending to the Yellow Thearch of the Central Yellow Nine Lands, the Yellow Spirits of Wu and Ji, the Five Emperors of the Earthly Palaces, the Six Jia and Five Agents, the Nine Palaces and Eight Trigrams, the rectified spirits of yin and yang, the deities of the Year-Star’s Punishment and Virtue, and all divine beings.

We reflect with reverence: in the place where this dwelling was built, we may have offended the numinous officials—perhaps by encroaching upon the earth’s veins or polluting the springs’ sources; openly violating prohibitions or secretly offending the dragon-spirits. These transgressions have accumulated into offenses, and we have no means to repent and seek pardon. Today, through this fast and Dao-practice, we confess and beseech grace. May the Heavenly Worthy bestow favor, may the Numinous Treasure radiate light. May the hundred spirits bring blessings, may the Five Emperors grant felicity. May our offenses be absolved, may we be granted renewal. May calamities and misfortunes be swept away, may sins and faults be dissolved and leveled. May our kin all thrive, may our emolument and longevity be extended. May the dragon-spirits be pacified and settled, may all that moves and grows partake in glory. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the real.

Today, we kindle incense and practice the Dao, performing the fast to establish merit. May our offenses be absolved, may we be granted felicity. May the Eastern Wood’s qi and all calamities be dissolved. May sins and faults be swept away, may misfortunes be stilled. May all that moves and grows thrive, may blessings and goodness all arrive. May the dragon-spirits be pacified and settled, may our kin enjoy well-being. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the real.

**North**
We now kindle incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao-practice. We reverently offer thanks to the Northern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the host of perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the most real lords and elders, the Black Thearch and Five Qi Heavenly Lords, the Dark Warrior and Northern Dipper’s Dipper, Ox, Girl, Emptiness, Danger, Encampment, and Wall Seven Stellar Lords, the Water Virtue of Ren and Gui, the Hai and Zi spirits of the Water Agent, the Imperial Chariot, Imperial Carriage, Imperial Lodging, the Elder Lord of Greater Yin’s qi of the Five Di, the Celestial Star, Grand Star, and Grand Unity, the execution spirits of the Xuan Yao and Chen Star, the Xuan Ming and Zhuan Xu Winter and Water Official rectified spirits.

We reflect with reverence: in the place where this dwelling was built, we may have offended the divine beings, transgressing prohibitions and disturbing the dragon-spirits. Today, we kindle incense and practice the Dao, performing the fast to establish merit. With utmost sincerity, we surrender our lives, confess our transgressions, and beseech grace. May the Southern Fire’s qi and all calamities be dissolved. May sins and faults be gradually swept away, may disasters and adversities be leveled. May our entire clan flourish, may blessings and goodness all arrive. May the dragon-spirits guard and settle, may our kin be at peace. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the real.

**Northeast**
We now kindle incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao-practice. We reverently offer thanks to the Northeastern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the host of perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the most real lords and elders, the Heavenly Lord of Brahman qi, the spirit of Greater Yin of the Gen Palace’s Earthly Palace, the stellar lords of the Demon-Subduing and Four Executioners, and the Eight White spirits.

We now consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwellings, we may have offended and disturbed the assembly of spirits, transgressed prohibitions and taboos, and agitated the dragon-spirits. Thus, we kindle incense and perform the Dao-practice to repent our faults and pray for blessings. May our offenses be dissolved, may blessings and goodness all arrive. May the living and the departed alike flourish, may our kin be at peace. May the dragon-spirits settle in tranquility, may our longevity and fortune increase. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the real.

**Southeast**
We now kindle incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao-practice. We reverently offer thanks to the Southeastern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the host of perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the most real lords and elders, the Heavenly Lord of Brahman qi, the spirit of the Wind Palace’s Earthly Gate and the Celestial Shaker, and the stellar lords of the Three Punishments, Four Executioners, and Six Xin.

We consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwellings, we may have offended the divine spirits, transgressed prohibitions and taboos, and agitated the dragon-spirits. Thus, we kindle incense and perform the Dao-practice to repent our faults and pray for grace. May our offenses be dissolved, may blessings and goodness all arrive. May the living and the departed flourish, may our kin be at peace. May the dragon-spirits guard and settle, may our longevity and fortune increase. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the real.

**Southwest**
We now kindle incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao-practice. We reverently offer thanks to the Southwestern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the host of perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the most real lords and elders, the Heavenly Lord of Brahman qi, the spirit of the Human Gate’s Lunar Domain and the Celestial Regulator, and the stellar lords of the Four Corners, Four Extremes, Yi, and Gui.

We consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwellings, we may have offended the divine spirits, transgressed prohibitions and taboos, and agitated the dragon-spirits. Thus, we kindle incense and perform the Dao-practice to repent our faults and pray for grace. May our offenses be dissolved, may blessings and goodness all arrive. May the living and the departed flourish, may our kin be at peace. May the dragon-spirits guard and settle, may our longevity and fortune increase. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the real.

**Northwest**
We now kindle incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao-practice. We reverently offer thanks to the Northwestern Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the host of perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the most real lords and elders, the Heavenly Lord of Brahman qi, the spirit of the Azure Dragon, Controller of Destiny, and the Heavenly Gate, and the stellar lords of the Six Palaces, Qian Position, Ren, and Jia.

We consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwellings, we may have offended the divine spirits, transgressed prohibitions and taboos, and agitated the dragon-spirits. Thus, we kindle incense and perform the Dao-practice to repent our faults and pray for grace. May disasters and adversities be extinguished, may our offenses be leveled. May the living and the departed flourish, may our kin be at peace. May the dragon-spirits guard and settle, may our longevity and fortune increase. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the real.

**Above**
We now kindle incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao-practice. We reverently offer thanks to the Supreme Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Above, the host of perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the most real lords and elders, the Boundless Supreme Heavenly Lord of Brahman qi, the exalted sages of the Three Clarities and Three Realms, the spirits of the sun, moon, and stars, the eight winds and five phases, wind, rain, thunder, and lightning, the regulators of yin and yang, and below, we offer thanks to the celestial patterns of the Qian Trigram, the daily movements of the sun and moon, the Eight Dragons, Nine Tigers, Supreme Unity, Ten Essences, Flying Banners, Eight Executioners, Northern Dipper’s Seven Stars, and all true numina above and below heaven.

We consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwellings, we may have offended the divine spirits, transgressed prohibitions and taboos, and agitated the dragon-spirits. We have defied the celestial Dao, defiled and disrespected the Three Luminaries. Our offenses have accumulated, prolonging and inviting disasters. Thus, we kindle incense and perform the Dao-practice to repent our faults and pray for grace. May the celestial light shine down, may all offenses be leveled. May the living and the departed share in fortune, may our kin be blessed. May the dragon-spirits guard and settle, may our longevity and fortune increase. May disasters dissipate, may all beings—moving and still—be at peace. After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to merge with the real.

**Below**
We now kindle incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao-practice. We repent and offer thanks to the Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Below, the host of perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the most real lords and elders, the true and perfected immortals of the boundless world, the true persons of the Lofty Emperor’s Earthly Palace and Nine Palaces, the Four Controllers, Five Emperors, and Twelve Immortals, the revered spirits of numinous caverns, rivers, marshes, mountains, and streams, and below, we offer thanks to the regulators of yin and yang, the eight trigrams and nine palaces, the Five Phases and Two Dwellings, the Supreme Earthly True Ones, the earthly lords and marshals of the four directions, the generals who guard the eight prohibitions of the dwelling, the officials and subordinates of the Five Earths, the Five Earths’ descendants, the Generals of the Grand Year, the Leopard Tail and Yellow Banner, the Scribes of Memorials, the multitudes of Executioners and Virtues, the seventy-two inner and outer spirits, and extending to the nine layers of the netherworld’s windy marshes, the Five Emperors of the Dark Realm, the Five Earths’ Supreme Emperors, the Central Yellow, Wu and Ji, and all divine spirits.

We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwellings, we may have offended the divine spirits, harmed the earth’s veins, and disturbed the springs and sources.

We have transgressed the prohibitions, disturbing the Dragon Spirits. Or by the clash of the Five Phases, the Four Destructive Forces have encroached. Strange dreams arise in confusion, and our dwelling knows no peace. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, offering repentance and seeking grace. We humbly pray that our transgressions be swept away, grievances be reconciled, the living and the dead be blessed with prosperity, and our kin be granted safety. May the Dragon Spirits return to their rightful places, and our lifespan and fortune be extended. May the Three Paths receive blessings, and all beings—moving and still—share in glory. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**The Three Luminaries**
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao rites, reverently offering repentance to the Most Perfect and Great Saints of the Sun, Moon, and Stellar Palaces, the Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries. We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwelling, we may have offended the divine spirits, violated the prohibitions, and defiled the Three Luminaries. Unaligned with the celestial cycles of stars, sun, and moon, we have accumulated faults, inviting misfortune and decline. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, seeking forgiveness and grace. We humbly pray that the divine radiance shine upon us, dissolving ten thousand sins. May the living and the dead prosper, our kin be at peace, the Dragon Spirits return to their posts, and our fortune and longevity be extended. May the dark gates be illuminated, and all beings—moving and still—flourish. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**The Five Peaks**
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao rites, reverently offering repentance to the Perfected Lords of the Five Peaks, the Divine Immortals of the sacred mountains and grotto-heavens. We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwelling, we may have offended the divine spirits, transgressing the celestial prohibitions and earthly taboos under the jurisdiction of the Five Emperors and Five Peaks. Faults have accumulated, yet remain unforgiven. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, seeking forgiveness and grace. We humbly pray that a single repentance erase our sins, and ten thousand virtues be fulfilled. May the offenses be dissolved, the living and the dead prosper, our kin be at peace, misfortune be swept away, and our lifespan and fortune be extended. May the Dragon Spirits guard their posts, and all beings—moving and still—share in glory. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**The Water Realms**
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao rites, reverently offering repentance to the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Divine King of Yang Valley, the Water Emperors of the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the Nine Jiang, the Twelve River Sources, and the Divine Immortals of the Water Realms. We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwelling, we may have offended the divine spirits, harmed the water veins, and blocked the springs. We have violated the nature of supreme goodness, diminished the nurturing power below, slighted the Perfected Saints, and defiled the rivers. Faults have accumulated within the Water Realms, entangling us across generations, yet remaining unresolved. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, seeking forgiveness and grace. We humbly pray that the august spirits look upon us with mercy, washing away our transgressions. May all offenses be dissolved, the living and the dead prosper, our kin be at peace, misfortune be transcended, and our lifespan and fortune be extended. May the Dragon Spirits return to their posts, and all beings—moving and still—share in glory. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**The Sacred Scriptures**
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s fast and Dao rites, reverently offering repentance to the Most Perfect and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of Sacred Scriptures, the True Writs and Treasure Talismans, the Orthodox Teachings of the Three Caverns, the Ten Directions’ Secret Treasures, and all the divine officials who guard the scriptures. We humbly consider that in the construction and renovation of our dwelling, we may have offended the Perfected Spirits, defiled sacred grounds, or trespassed upon the traces of the Three Treasures, where the teachings have spread, and where divine officials and Perfected attendants reside—places unknown to the profane. Such transgressions have accumulated faults within the Treasury of the Three Treasures, yet remain unforgiven. Today, therefore, we burn incense and perform the Dao rites, seeking forgiveness and grace. We humbly pray that the myriad sages illuminate our path, and the august ones grant us pardon. May all offenses be dissolved, blessings and goodness come forth, and our lifespan and fortune be enriched. May the living and the dead prosper, our kin be at peace, all beings receive grace, the Dragon Spirits return to their posts, the Six Paths be aided, and the Three Paths be reached. May the sagely grace extend to all, both hidden and manifest, bringing complete deliverance. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

*Concluding the Forty-Fifth Scroll of the* **Yellow Register Fast Rites of the Most High**
*Beginning the Forty-Sixth Scroll of the* **Yellow Register Fast Rites of the Most High**

**Compiled by Master Du Guangting of the Tang Dynasty**
**Fivefold Repentance Rite for Grace and Auspicious Signs**

When ascending the altar during extreme cold, intense heat, or inclement weather—lest one’s demeanor be deemed improper—this repentance rite may be employed for simplicity.

**First: General Repentance to the Ten Directions**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy** of the Ten Boundless Directions, the **Perfected Saints Who Have Attained the Dao**, the **Supreme Perfected Lords and Venerable Ones**, and the **Divine Officials of the Ten Realms’ Immortal Hosts**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

**Repentance**
We humbly acknowledge that the **Dao/Way** transforms without limit, manifesting responses in accord with the moment; that sincerity evokes resonance, and the numinous Perfected bestow the merit of answering prayers. Profound indeed is the **Mystery upon Mystery**, subtly returning radiant blessings. We now offer solemn thanks to reciprocate this grace.

The Emperor, extending the **Great Dao** in compassion and receiving the protection of the **True Immortals**, devoutly presents purity and reverence to repay the **Mysterious Favor**. For three days and nights, we reverently conduct this **Supreme Yellow Register Daoist Altar**, offering incense, flowers, ritual gifts, oil lamps, and patterned silks. We take refuge in the **Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Primordial Ultimate**, the **Heavenly Lords of the Ten Poles**, and the **Divine Officials of the Ten Realms’ Immortal Hosts**.

May the **Myriad Saints** incline their radiance, and the **Three Venerables** descend their gaze. May auspicious blessings grace the ancestral temples, and longevity extend to the imperial domain. May the land expand beyond Yu’s borders, and the dynasty’s fortune surpass the Zhou’s divination. May the Emperor’s **Dao/Way** outshine the light of **Xuan Yuan** and **Fu Xi**, his virtue surpassing theirs. May he share equal honor with the sun and moon, and equal longevity with **Mount Penglai**. May the Empress, consorts, and concubines illuminate the imperial residence; may the Crown Prince and princes secure the great enterprise. May Hua and Yi alike flourish, and the myriad peoples rejoice in well-being. May celestial patterns remain constant, winds and rains harmonious. May weapons fall silent, and harvests abound. Extending to the denizens of water and land, the **Three Paths and Six Realms**, may all attain the realm of longevity and together delight in harmony. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Three Luminaries**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **Perfected Great Saints of the Sun, Moon, and Star Palaces**, and the **Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries’ Immortal Hosts**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

We humbly acknowledge that the **Two Images** divided their splendor, and the **Three Luminaries** cast their radiance. The sun’s palace and moon’s domain govern day and night with constancy; the **Five Planets and Six Mansions** oversee illumination without fail. They manifest karmic consequences, governing humans and heavens. The Emperor, bestowing the **Great Dao’s** grace and invoking divine response through numinous merit, seeks to exalt the blessings of purity in repayment to the **True Spirits**. With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the **Perfected Great Saints of the Sun, Moon, and Star Palaces**, and the **Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries’ Immortal Hosts**.

May boundless pardon and impartial favor be proclaimed. May auspicious omens fill the imperial palace, and the dynasty’s fortune endure. May it surpass the **Ji** and **Zhou**, and extend the glory of the **Han**. May the Emperor’s civilizing influence equal the **Ascendant Peace**, and his grand design rival **Yao** and **Yu**. May his lifespan match the **Five Peaks**, his virtue equal the **Three Antiquities**. May the six palaces and hundred ministers perpetually enhance his governance; may the eight frontiers and nine domains all enjoy stability and prosperity. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Five Peaks**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **True Lords of the Five Peaks**, the **Perfected Immortals of the Famous Mountains and Grotto-Heavens**, and their **Divine Officials**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

We humbly acknowledge that the **Nine Lands** are thus divided, and the **Five Peaks** stand as guardians. They uphold the **Pivot of Heaven** above, arrayed among the stars; they press upon the **Axis of Earth** below, encircling rivers and streams. They govern good and evil, overseeing life and death. The Emperor, bestowing the **Great Dao’s** grace and invoking divine response through numinous merit, seeks to magnify the blessings of purity in repayment to the **True Spirits**. With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the **True Lords of the Five Peaks**, the **Perfected Immortals of the Famous Mountains and Grotto-Heavens**, and their **Divine Officials**.

May their **Mysterious Gaze** extend afar, and their **Vast Grace** be universally bestowed. May the ancestral temples and former sages receive radiant blessings to ascend as Perfected; may the altars of soil and grain and their revered spirits enjoy enduring auspicious fortune. May the Emperor’s wisdom equal the **Two Luminaries**, his lifespan match the **Lofty Peaks**. May he surpass the **Mysterious Antiquity** in non-action, governing all directions with transformation. May the Empress, consorts, Crown Prince, and princes inscribe their names in the **Cinnabar Registers of Immortals**, enjoying the longevity of the **Pure Capital**. May all under heaven with awareness, and all within the realm with life, universally attain the fruits of blessing, both hidden and manifest. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Water Realms**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **Great Emperor of Fusang**, the **Divine King of Yang Valley**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang**, the **Divine Officials of the Twelve River Sources’ Water Realms**, and their **Immortal Hosts**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

We humbly acknowledge that the **Three Powers** are thus established, and the **Xun** winds flow into the boundless sea; that the **Seven Virtues** are manifest, and the **Kan** palace is vast. They embrace the myriad streams, cradling the **Nine Heavens**. They govern living beings and oversee karmic consequences. The Emperor, concentrating his spirit upon the **Three Realms** and directing his thoughts to the **Nine Purities**, invokes the **Great Dao’s** grace and divine response through numinous merit. Seeking to magnify the blessings of purity, he repays the **True Spirits**. With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the **Great Emperor of Fusang**, the **Divine King of Yang Valley**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang**, the **Divine Officials of the Twelve River Sources’ Water Realms**, and their **Immortal Hosts**.

May extraordinary auspices be widely bestowed, and vast currents bring radiant protection. May the ancestral temples and altars of soil and grain, together with the **Eight Seas**, remain eternally at peace; may the sacred longevity of the imperial domain stand as firm as the **Ten Mountains**. May the six palaces’ consorts and concubines, and the hundred officials, flourish in loyalty and integrity, perpetually receiving blessed fortune. May the Eastern Palace and princely residences, the inner screens and outer defenses, all propagate the **Wind of Dao and Virtue**, eternally enjoying the transformation of **Ascendant Peace**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Sacred Scriptures**
We, with utmost sincerity, take refuge in the **Thirty-Six Divisions of the Supreme Scriptures**, the **True Writs and Sacred Talismans**.

**Three Bows**—each performed with reverent repentance.

We humbly acknowledge that before the **Kalpas of Eons**, the **Supreme Perfected** propagated transformation. They revealed the **Root of Non-Speech** through tranquility, and accomplished the **Non-Governing** through subtlety. When the **Two Images** first took form, diverse paths emerged. The **Eight Assemblies’** texts were established, and the **Six Forms’** functions vied in application.

The **Jade Slips and Jade Cases**, treasured in secrecy above the **Nine Pures**; the **Tortoise Script and Dragon Seal**, proclaimed and circulated throughout the ten thousand realms. They govern humanity and heaven, overseeing the bright and the hidden, the manifest and the obscure.

Now, the Emperor, by heaven-endowed sagacity, grasps the celestial reckoning and unfurls the primordial. Bearing the grace bestowed by the **Great Dao**, moved by the luminous manifestation of divine merit, he aspires to exalt the **Fast of Blessings**, repaying the profound favor from on high.

With utmost sincerity, we take refuge in the **Supreme Perfected, Thirty-Six Divisions of the Most Revered Scriptures**, the **True Writs and Sacred Talismans**.

We humbly pray that the Emperor’s longevity equal the **Mountains of Heng and Hua**, his brilliance match the **Sun and Moon’s** radiance. May his divine merit surpass the **Divine Works of Lianlu**, his sagely virtue crown that of **Yao and Tang**. May the Empress, consorts, and princesses, the Crown Prince and the various princes, jointly assist in the flourishing era, extending the grand and precious mandate. May the dukes, ministers, and officials, the people of the Hua and Yi, together ascend the court of **Humaneness and Longevity**, and share in the transformation of **Ascendant Peace**.

May the **Three Paths and Nine Nights**, all beings—whether moving or still, flying or submerged—all rest in the mysterious merit, and together ascend into the **Realm of the Dao**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Forty-Sixth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites** concludes.
**The Forty-Seventh Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Rites** begins.

**Compiled by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting**
**Fivefold Confession of Ministers Serving the State**

**The Ten Directions**
We, your ministers, wholeheartedly take refuge in the **Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy** of the Ten Directions, the **Perfected Great Sages** who have attained the Dao, the **Most Real Lords and Elders**, and the **Divine Officials of the Ten Realms**. With three bows, we each sincerely confess and repent.

We have heard that the **Ten Poles of the Heavens** and the **Three Thousand Dao Realms** encircle the Great Void within, encompassing the courts of the **Three Realms**. They manifest wondrous transformation in the **Upper Mystery** and bestow numinous grace upon the **Lower Lands**. How vast is this radiant fortune, faithfully protecting the state and its households!

Today, we humbly offer the **Great Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [such-and-such] official, dedicating it to the Emperor. Following the **Mysterious Pattern**, we array the imperial altar, beseeching blessings and grace, performing the fast and practicing the Dao. With reverence, we present incense, flowers, dragon-brocade offerings, and pledges of sincerity, taking refuge in the **Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy** of the Ten Directions, the **Perfected Great Sages** who have attained the Dao, the **Most Real Lords and Elders**, and the **Divine Officials of the Ten Realms**. Now, we establish this fast, burning incense and kindling lamps to brightly illuminate the myriad heavens.

May these merits flow to the **August Spirits of the Altars of Soil and Grain**, the **Ancestral Shrines**, and the **Former Sages**. May the **Nine Radiant Cranes and Canopies** ascend to the **Three Realms** in carefree wandering; may the **Eight-Feathered Dragon Chariots** roam the **Ten Heavens** in boundless freedom. May vast blessings and mighty fortune secretly protect the **Sacred Chart**. May the Emperor embody the Dao and concentrate his regalia, his virtue like Heaven spreading transformation. Riding the **Flying Dragon** to govern all things, may the mountains solidify his grand foundation; wielding the **Great Image** to uphold Heaven, may his sacred longevity equal the peaks.

May the Empress, consorts, and princesses gently assist in the imperial plans. May the Crown Prince and the various princes filially support the imperial throne. May the civil and military officials, both central and regional, propagate the winds of **Peace and Dao-Virtue**, perfecting the principles of **Ritual and Music in Harmonious Prosperity**. May the seasons regulate the **Five Candles**, and the years yield **Jade-like Stores**. May the **Hundred Offices** follow their proper order, and the **Five Armies** remain ever at rest. May the **Dragon Spirits** stand guard, and pestilence and poison dissolve. May the **Four Numinous Beasts** present auspicious omens, and the **Seven Regulators** follow their constant courses in perfect measure.

Extending to all—whether hidden or manifest, flying or submerged—may all receive the benevolence of his governance and together emulate the customs of **Huaxu**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Three Luminaries**
We, your ministers, wholeheartedly take refuge in the **Most Real Great Sages** of the **Palaces of the Sun, Moon, and Stars**, and the **Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries**. With three bows, we each sincerely confess and give thanks.

We have heard that when Heaven and Earth divided their numina, Yin and Yang formed their images. The positions of the **Sun, Moon, and Stars** were established, determining the distinctions of dusk and dawn, concealment and visibility. The **Seven Governors and Three Palaces** faithfully hold the essentials of life and death; the **Wenchang and Dipper Poles** still wield the authority over sin and fortune. It is fitting to exhaust our reverence in cultivation to aid the state and nation.

Today, we humbly offer the **Great Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [such-and-such] official, dedicating it to the Emperor, presenting ritual pledges. We array the altar, beseeching blessings and grace, performing the fast and practicing the Dao, taking refuge in the **Most Real Great Sages** of the **Palaces of the Sun, Moon, and Stars**, and the **Divine Officials of the Three Luminaries**. Now, we establish this fast, burning incense and kindling lamps to brightly illuminate the myriad heavens.

May these merits flow to the **August Spirits of the Altars of Soil and Grain**, the **Ancestral Shrines**, and the **Former Sages**. May **Rainbow Banners and Feathered Streamers** transcend to the **Palace of the Southern Culmen**; may they **Verify and Penetrate the Mysterious Real**, roaming and feasting in the **Upper Clarity**. May hidden blessings and mighty gifts faithfully protect the imperial foundation.

May the Emperor’s luminous spirit equal the honored, his **Mysterious Pivot** prolonging his years. Riding the **Imperial Chariot** to administer governance, may he grasp the **Jade Axle** to regulate the seasons. May the Empress and consorts illuminate the **Virtuous Standards** among the women’s quarters; may the various princes and the Crown Prince deepen the **Numinous Streams** at the **Starry Ford**. May the chief ministers remain loyal and steadfast, the **Fiefdom Walls** harmonious and peaceful. May the **Hundred Institutions** forever flourish, bringing peace to the **Myriad Regions**. May they swiftly spread the **Virtuous Teachings** and receive **Tribute of Gems** in abundance. May the **Three Luminaries** maintain their order, the **Five Wefts** commit no errors. May the years yield **Bountiful Harvests**, and the people attain **Health and Joy**.

Extending to all—whether flying or submerged, sentient or insentient—may all, whether hidden or manifest, together ascend to the **Realm of Longevity**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Five Peaks**
We, your ministers, wholeheartedly take refuge in the **True Lords of the Five Peaks**, the **Flying Immortals**, the **Perfected**, and the **Divine Officials of the Named Mountains and Grotto-Heavens** who have attained the Dao. With three bows, we each sincerely confess and repent.

We have heard that when **Hundun** was split open, the **Myriad Peaks** took shape. They support the **Azure Vault** in their ascent and press down upon the **Yellow Chariot** in their descent. The greatest, like **Changli**, stretch across vast wilds, housing the mists and clouds beyond the seas; the next, like **Heng and Hua**, tower as cloud-pavilions, gathering the finest essences of the world. They are the abodes of **Immortals** and the reliance of states and nations. We now present the rites of **Incense and Prayer** to broaden the blessings of **Radiant Fortune**.

Today, we humbly offer the **Great Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [such-and-such] official, dedicating it to the Emperor, presenting ritual pledges and arraying the altar. Beseeching blessings and grace, we perform the fast and practice the Dao, taking refuge in the **True Lords of the Five Peaks**, the **Flying Immortals**, the **Perfected**, and the **Divine Officials of the Named Mountains and Grotto-Heavens** who have attained the Dao. Now, we establish this fast, burning incense and kindling lamps to mystically illuminate the myriad heavens.

May these merits flow to the **August Spirits of the Altars of Soil and Grain**, the **Ancestral Shrines**, and the **Former Sages**. May they transcend the fruits of the **Seven Stages of Cultivation** and verify the **Flying Ascent of the Three Heavens**. May they refine their spirits in the **Courts of Flowing Fire** and ride the **Palaces of Radiant Clouds**.

May boundless fortune forever flourish, reverently aiding the **Dragon Chart**. May the Emperor’s **Five Peaks** be equally tranquil, his longevity matching the **Three Isles**. May his brightness rival the **Sun and Moon of Yao’s Heaven**, and his domain expand the **Frontiers of Yu’s Realm**. May his **Frugal Virtue** surpass that of **Fenqiu**, and his **Benevolent Warmth** exceed that of **Jie’s Net**. May the Empress, consorts, and attendants assist the **Purple Throne**. May the Crown Prince and the various princes propagate the **Radiant Transformation**. May the ministers and officials proclaim the **Supreme Dao in Non-Action**; may the **Myriad Peoples of Hua and Yi** delight in **Great Peace** and fulfill their natures.

May the **Heavenly Lights** be clear and upright, the **Earthly Records** entirely at rest. May the **Nine Grains** be ever abundant, the **Five Armies** forever at rest. Whether in the **Hidden Gates of Night** or among **Exotic Beings of Distinct Kinds**, may all receive the compassion of the **Wondrous Dao** and fully enter the **Realm of Longevity**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

To the **Water Realms**, we, your servants, wholeheartedly prostrate and submit to the **Great Emperor of Fusang**, the **Divine King of Yang Valley**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang**, and the **Twelve River Sources**, along with the **Divine Immortals and Spirit Officials of the Water Realms**. With triple reverence, we each offer sincere repentance and gratitude.

We humbly acknowledge that, embodying the **Dao** and drawing upon the numinous, the **power of Water** is indeed paramount. Receiving the **Primordial Yang** to nurture and transform, it pervades all forms; originating from the **First Qi** to generate and complete, it encompasses all beings. Thus, the **Nine Seas and Eight Oceans** display the majesty of floating heaven and nourishing the sun; even a single leaf or slender stem bears the grace of moistening blessings and bestowed glory. Through its **mysterious merit and wondrous efficacy**, it brings fortune to the state and the household.

Today, we reverently conduct the **Grand Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [Title] the Emperor, adhering to the **mystic rites** and establishing the **imperial altar**. We beseech blessings and grace, performing the fast and practicing the **Dao**. We prostrate and submit to the **Great Emperor of Fusang**, the **Divine King of Yang Valley**, the **Water Emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang**, and the **Twelve River Sources**, along with the **Divine Immortals and Spirit Officials of the Water Realms**. For this fast, we now kindle incense and light lamps, illuminating all heavens.

May these **merits and virtues** flow to the **august spirits of the altars and temples**, the **ancestral sages of the imperial lineage**, who wander the boundless and unite with the **subtle and formless**. May they receive **secret instructions** on the **Mystic Continent** and obtain the **divine pearl** from the **Red Waters**.

May the Emperor’s **azure waves bestow fortune**, and the **blue seas grant equal years**. May all regions rejoice in the **vast and boundless grace**, and the **ten thousand states** follow the **tributary currents**. May the Empress, consorts, and attendants spread **sagely favor** within the **Jade Palace**; may the Crown Prince and the various princes dredge the **source of the Silver River**. May the ministers and officials, both civil and military, extend the **nurturing and embellishing principles**, and broaden the **serene and clarifying transformation**. May the **Nine Rivers** offer strategies, and the **Warm Luo** reveal its chart. May Heaven and Earth manifest auspicious signs, and the **black-haired people** receive blessings. May all beings, near and far, even those in the **hidden depths**, together attain the **wind of virtue and Dao**, and forever enjoy the **gift of peace and stability**. After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

---

To the **Scriptures**, we, your servants, wholeheartedly prostrate and submit to the **Most True and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures**, the **True Writ and Treasure Talismans**. With triple reverence, we each offer sincere repentance and gratitude.

We humbly acknowledge that the **Dao in Non-Action** is the root, and the **true lineage** is emptiness and quiescence. Its **wondrous nourishment** is wordless, its **subtle and imperceptible** nature beyond measure. Thus, it initiates the **vast and expansive teaching**, revealing the **secret and profound merit**. Here, the **Eight Assemblies of Numinous Writ** and the **Nine-Ray Cloud Script** take form: dragons coil and phoenixes dance, first congealing within the **Great Vastness**; jade tablets and jasper scrolls are then inscribed within the **layered terraces**. The **thirty-six divisions** are vast, and the **myriad thousands of categories** are numerous. Their principles flow through the **profound and mysterious**, and their meanings encompass all wonders. They are revered by humans and heavens, and followed by states and nations. They **illuminate the imperial Dao and assist the royal enterprise**, dispersing the **Nine Schools** to bring peace to the **ten thousand realms**.

We now reverently conduct the **Grand Yellow Register Fast** on behalf of [Title] the Emperor, adhering to the **ritual codes** and venerably establishing the **altar**. We beseech blessings and grace, performing the fast and practicing the **Dao**. We prostrate and submit to the **Most True and Supreme Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures**, the **True Writ and Treasure Talismans**, the **secret treasuries of all heavens**, the **orthodox Dharma of the ten directions**, the **guardian scriptures**, and all **spirit officials**. For this fast, we now kindle incense and light lamps, illuminating all heavens.

May these **merits and virtues** flow to the **august spirits of the altars and temples**, the **ancestral sages of the imperial lineage**, who **join the True on the Purple Ultimate** and **shed their forms in the Vast Capital**. May they **bestow protection upon the imperial line**, and **flow blessings through ten thousand generations**.

May the Emperor **communicate with the true and contract the Dao**, his reign enduring as **Heaven and Earth**. May he **unify the ten thousand states under one chariot and script**, and **harmonize Great Unity to pacify seas and mountains**. May the Empress, consorts, and attendants **enjoy blessings in the Purple Court**; may the Crown Prince and the various princes **inherit the auspicious imperial standard**. May the loyal and meritorious officials **constantly exert themselves in assisting and advising**; may the **myriad living beings** **secure the flourishing and peaceful era**. May the **Heavenly Principle follow its course**, and the **auspicious stars and radiant sun** be witnessed; may the **Earthly Records be peaceful and stable**, and the **Nine Grains and Eight Silkworms** manifest their wonders. May the **hidden and manifest** together prosper, and all **movement and stillness** be at peace. May those within the **seas and the realm** together attain the **transformation of the Dao**.

After attaining the **Dao**, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the **Dao** and uniting with the true.

**The Forty-Seventh Scroll of the Grand Yellow Register Fast Rites concludes.**
**The Forty-Eighth Scroll of the Grand Yellow Register Fast Rites.**

**Compiled by Master Du Guangting of the Tang Dynasty: Methods for Expiation and Repentance**
**General Repentance**

We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so, who follows the rites of expiation and examination, conducts the fast, and practices the Dao, repenting for the boundless transgressions committed by thirty-six generations of ancestors, from the myriad past forebears to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These offenses, accumulated through the ages, have:

**Offended above** the great sages of the myriad heavens, the host of honored ones of the Great Dao, the Three Luminaries and Five Phases, the deities governing the void, wind, clouds, thunder, and rain.
**Offended below** the Five Marchmounts and all mountains, the thirty-six earthly realms, the mounds and water palaces, and the underworld officials.
**Offended within** the Eight Trigrams and Nine Palaces, the yin-yang bureaus, the ancient and modern numinous sages, and the worthies of former ages.

They have violated the Five Constants and transgressed against the Four Great Elements. Their names are inscribed in the ledgers of sin, and calamities are bound at the gates of darkness. Their lifespans were cut short, failing to fulfill Heaven’s allotted span. After their bodies perished, they remained detained in the earthly courts, confined as suffering souls in the deepest prisons. They have endured every torment, undergone every trial, shuttled through the Three Wretched Paths, and drifted through the Five Destinies. Subjected to cruel punishments and exhausting labors, their forms are broken and emaciated beyond endurance. Their offenses and misfortunes linger unending, with no hope of absolution.

Today, in accordance with the ranks of the transcendent immortals, we repent our sins and seek mercy. We burn incense, light lamps, conduct the fast, and practice the Dao, surrendering our lives to the Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Ten Directions, the perfected great sages who have attained the Dao, the true lords and venerable ones, and the divine officials of the ten celestial realms.

We humbly implore the Three Honored Ones and the great sages of the myriad heavens to open the fount of great compassion and bestow boundless grace. May they command the flying celestial beings to bear the Nine Dragon Talismanic Decrees, proclaiming to the courts of the Ten Directions and the officials of the underworld hells: absolve the boundless sins accumulated through the ages. Open the Nine Dark Hells and release the souls of the long night. Bathe them in the Crimson Mound’s courts, clothe them in the regalia of the Cavernous Yang’s precincts. May they be reborn in the blessed realms of the divine, and may blessings flow to their descendants. May auspicious protection ever attend them, and may the living and the dead alike find peace. May this uphold the nation’s fortune and extend to all beings. May all attain the mysterious bliss and forever ascend to the true ranks. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**East**
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so, who conducts the great fast of expiation and examination, recites the scriptures, and practices the Dao, surrendering our lives to the Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the East, the Nine Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the eastern celestial realm. We repent for the boundless transgressions committed by so-and-so’s thirty-six generations of ancestors, from the myriad past forebears to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These sins, accumulated through the ages, include:

Acts contrary to kindness and nurturance, lacking benevolence and humanity; disloyalty to lords and teachers, failing in filial piety; harming the good and upright, offending the divine; violating the Five Constants and indulging in all manner of evil; curses and malevolent prayers, killing the innocent. Their punishments are severe, their calamities profound, yet they have not received absolution. Their souls are seized and beaten, confined in the Wood Bureau’s Eastern Marchmount’s pounding hell, suffering the torments of sword trees, blade mountains, wind, and thunder. Day and night, they endure excruciating trials beyond endurance. Their misfortunes afflict their descendants, and their woes flow endlessly to later generations. In the endless dark of night, there is no means of deliverance.

Today, we repent, seek mercy, conduct the fast, and practice the Dao. We humbly implore the great compassion to show mercy, and the myriad sages to turn their radiance toward us. May they proclaim to the courts of the Eastern Bureau and the officials of the underworld: untangle the knots of enmity, absolve the souls of their sins. May they be entrusted to the courts of blessings, ascend to the pure realms. May the living enjoy peace and prosperity, forever bearing the mysterious grace. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**South**
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so, who conducts the supreme wondrous fast of expiation and examination, recites the scriptures, and practices the Dao, surrendering our lives to the Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the South, the Three Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine officials of the southern celestial realm. We repent for the boundless transgressions committed by so-and-so’s thirty-six generations of ancestors, from the myriad past forebears to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These sins, accumulated through the ages, include:

Following cruel impulses to kill the innocent; making vows and pacts to inflict harm upon beings; lewd and improper conduct, oppressing the chaste and good; transgressing rites and decorum, indulging in evil deeds; offending Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, and all divine beings. Their punishments are severe, their calamities profound, yet they have not received absolution. Their souls are seized and beaten, confined in the Fire Bureau’s Southern Marchmount’s pounding hell, suffering the torments of furnace and charcoal, their forms burned and broken. Day and night, they endure excruciating trials beyond endurance. Their misfortunes afflict their descendants, flowing endlessly onward. In the endless dark of night, there is no means of deliverance.

Today, we repent, seek mercy, conduct the fast, and practice the Dao. We humbly hope the Three Honored Ones will look upon us with mercy, and the host of sages will cast their radiance upon us. May they proclaim to the Fire Bureau’s Southern Marchmount’s pounding hell: absolve the accumulated sins, pardon the souls of the dark. May they emerge from the Huo Mountain hells and ascend to the Crimson Cavern’s Yang Palace. May the living receive protection, forever bearing the mysterious grace. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**West**

We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so who performs the Supreme Wondrous Fast for Liberation from Torment, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We take refuge in the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the West, the Seven Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Western Quarter. We repent for the boundless sins committed by so-and-so across thirty-six generations, from countless ancestors to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These sins may include: failing to yield with righteousness, flattery and deceit without cause; envying the worthy and able, defiling and disrupting the divine Dao; cruelty without measure, slaughter driven by whim; breaking vows and violating covenants, scheming with curses and hexes. The misfortunes and transgressions congeal like mountains, the punishments severe and the trials profound, yet no absolution has been granted. The souls are bound and detained in the Metal Bureau’s Hua Mountain hells, enduring the torments of copper pillars, iron beds, and golden hammers. Day and night, they suffer unrelenting agony, with no respite in eating or resting. Their grievances entangle the living, lingering unresolved. In the endless dark of night, there is no means of deliverance.

Today, we practice the Dao and conduct the fast, beseeching mercy and repenting for liberation. We humbly hope the Heavenly Worthy will show compassion, and the Great Dao will cast its radiance upon us. May they proclaim to the Western Bureau’s halls and the courts of the torment officials: dissolve the accumulated misfortunes, release the bound souls. May they ascend to the Heavenly Paradise, reborn in the realm of immortals. May the living and the dead alike find peace, forever bearing the mysterious grace. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**North**

We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so who performs the Supreme Wondrous Fast for Liberation from Torment, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We take refuge in the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the North, the Five Qi Heavenly Lords, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Northern Quarter. We repent for the boundless sins committed by so-and-so across thirty-six generations, from countless ancestors to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These sins may include: defying the Heavenly Dao above and offending the Earthly Offices below; polluting the Three Luminaries and belittling the Four Great Elements; resenting wind and rain, invoking ghosts and spirits; inflicting harm upon others, destroying living things. The souls are bound and arraigned in the Water Bureau’s Heng Mountain hells, suffering the agonies of freezing ice, night gardens, and icy rivers. Their flesh splits from the cold, myriad pains piercing their bodies. The misfortunes extend to their descendants, the calamities flowing unceasing. In the endless dark of night, there is no means of deliverance.

Today, we practice the Dao and conduct the fast, beseeching mercy and repenting for our transgressions. We humbly hope the hosts of heaven will look upon us with favor, and the myriad sages will bestow their grace. May they command the Northern Bureau’s halls and the courts of the torment officials: absolve the sins and transgressions, liberate the suffering souls. May they depart the frozen gardens of endless night, escape the Three Paths and Five Sufferings. May they ascend to the pure realms of the spirits, and the living receive blessings and protection. May their clans and kin find peace, the living and the dead alike secure. Having received what we sought, we look up in gratitude for the mysterious grace. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**Northeast**

We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so who performs the Supreme Wondrous Fast for Liberation from Torment, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We take refuge in the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Northeast, the Qi of Purity Heavenly Lords, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Northeastern Quarter. We repent for the boundless sins committed by so-and-so across thirty-six generations, from countless ancestors to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. These sins may include: as children, failing in filial piety; as subjects, failing in loyalty; as fathers, lacking compassion; as rulers, lacking the Dao; envying the worthy and resenting the good; turning from uprightness to embrace depravity; speaking falsely while harboring deceit, self-deception even in solitude; committing the Five Heinous Crimes and perpetrating every evil; wrongfully harming the innocent, killing without just cause. From life to death, their grievances pierce the heavens. They curse the divine, employ hexes and sorcery. The misfortunes run deep, the punishments severe, their souls tormented in the earthly prisons and pounding hells. They endure myriad trials, their bodies and souls broken and exhausted. In the endless dark of night, there is no means of deliverance.

Today, we repent for our sins and seek mercy, conducting the fast and practicing the Dao. We humbly hope the Ten Heavens will grant absolution, and the myriad sages will open the gates of mercy. May they command the Northeastern Quarter’s pounding hells and the courts of the torment officials: dissolve the karmic retributions, pardon the imprisoned souls. May they depart the land of dark confinement, escape the suffering of heavy fetters. Bathed in the divine cinnabar of Huo Mountain, may they soar to the Crimson Numinous realm. May their grievances be forever resolved, their descendants secure and at peace. Having received what we sought, we look up in gratitude for the mysterious grace. After attaining the Dao, we shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao and uniting with the true.

**Southeast**

We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so who performs the Supreme Wondrous Fast for Liberation from Torment, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We take refuge in the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Southeast, the Qi of Purity Heavenly Lords, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Southeastern Quarter. We repent for the boundless sins committed by so-and-so’s family across countless generations, from ancestors to the departed spirits and all kith and kin, and across thirty-six lifetimes. These sins may include: wanton violence and oppression; bullying and tormenting others; scorning the orphaned and destitute, despising the elderly and infirm; exposing others’ faults while concealing their virtues; sowing discord among kin, suppressing the poor and weak; scheming through unrighteous means, slandering the worthy and good; undermining others’ achievements, envying those who surpass them; killing without just cause, indulging in cruelty without restraint. They invoke the heavens and earth, the sun, moon, and stars as witnesses to their crimes. The sins run deep, the punishments severe, their souls bound in the earthly prisons and courts of torment. They endure the trials of water, fire, wind, and blades, day and night without respite. The misfortunes extend endlessly, with no means of deliverance.

Today, we repent and seek mercy, conducting the fast and practicing the Dao. We humbly hope the Ten Directions’ Great Sages and the Five Emperors’ August Worthies will command the Southeastern Quarter’s pounding hells and the courts of the torment officials: redeem the imprisoned souls, cleanse their bodies and spirits. May their myriad sins be absolved, their accumulated misfortunes eradicated. May their grievances be resolved, their debts and disputes settled in peace. May the living receive blessings, and the spirits ascend to the pure realms.

May the hidden and the manifest alike receive protection, forever bearing the profound grace.

After attaining the Dao, they ascend into the formless,
harmony merging with the true Dao.

To the Southwest Quarter:
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s performance of the Supreme Fast for Deliverance from Torment. We recite scriptures and practice the Dao, reverently submitting to the Southwest’s Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Celestial Lords of Pristine Qi, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Southwest Realm. We repent for the boundless sins committed by so-and-so’s ancestors across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. In their lifetimes, they may have spoken ornately without substance, feigned truth with deceit, deceived the wise and foolish alike, or insulted true sages. They may have sided with the strong to oppress the weak, or indulged in greed and malice without restraint. They may have contended for profit and wealth, seized reputations and ranks, or schemed to harm and poison the loyal and good. They may have endangered others to secure their own safety, killed living beings for personal gain, or plundered wealth without pity for the orphaned and destitute. They may have sworn oaths and formed pacts, invoking gods and ghosts, thereby incurring karmic retribution that now lingers in the hidden realms.
