Their souls are bound in the earthly prisons and courts of torment, confined in dark cells, deprived of light. They endure ceaseless trials, suffering without end. Today, we conduct the fast and practice the Dao, repenting and seeking mercy. We humbly hope the Most High Sages and August Perfected Ones, in their great compassion and forgiveness, will cast their divine light downward to illuminate the darkness. May they command the Southwest Quarter’s pounding hells and the courts of the torment officials: deliver the imprisoned souls, that they may be reborn in the courts of blessing. May all receive grace, the living and the dead alike finding peace. Should our prayers be answered, we shall forever bear the profound grace.

After attaining the Dao, they ascend into the formless,
harmony merging with the true Dao.

To the Northwest Quarter:
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s performance of the Supreme Fast for Deliverance from Torment. We recite scriptures and practice the Dao, reverently submitting to the Northwest’s Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Celestial Lords of Pristine Qi, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Northwest Realm. We repent for the boundless sins committed by so-and-so’s ancestors across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. Their transgressions run deep, their torments severe, their offenses spanning kalpas without resolution. They suffer retribution across the six destinies and three evil paths, their souls beaten and bound in the earthly prisons and pounding hells. The pain is unbearable, extending to their descendants, the misfortunes flowing endlessly across kalpas. Today, we repent and seek mercy, conducting the fast and practicing the Dao. We humbly beseech the assembled August Sages and Most High Worthies to bestow their compassionate light, absolving the imprisoned souls and delivering them from hidden suffering. May they command the Northwest Quarter’s pounding hells and the courts of the torment officials: resolve grievances, settle disputes, and eradicate all accumulated transgressions. May the living and the dead alike be delivered, their households and nations receiving grace.

After attaining the Dao, they ascend into the formless,
harmony merging with the true Dao.

To the Upper Quarter:
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s performance of the Supreme Fast for Deliverance from Torment. We recite scriptures and practice the Dao, reverently submitting to the Upper Quarter’s Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Thirty-Six Celestial Lords, the Lords of Pristine Qi of the Jade Capital, Mystic Metropolis, Purple Tenuity, Golden Gates, the Three Clarities, and the Three Realms, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Upper Realm. We repent for the boundless sins committed by so-and-so’s ancestors across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. In their lifetimes, they may have defied the heavenly Dao, defiled the Three Luminaries, exposed the divine to the elements, or raged against thunder and rain. They may have deceived both the hidden and the manifest, showing no fear of true spirits. The Nine Offices have imposed punishments, the Three Bureaus have meted out trials. Their souls are beaten and bound in the eternal night of the Nine Dark Prisons. They drift through the cold courts, confined in dark cells, lost in endless kalpas without light. Their misfortunes flow to their descendants, entangling both the living and the dead in mutual accusations, with no means of cleansing. Today, we repent and seek mercy, conducting the fast and practicing the Dao. We humbly beseech the Three Clarities, the myriad sages, the Most High Perfected Ones, the Celestial Lords, the Four Controllers, the Five Emperors, the Three Luminaries, the constellations, and the true spirits of the Three Realms to bestow their vast compassion and witness our sincere devotion. May they command the courts of the torment officials and the earthly prisons: deliver the souls, absolve their crimes, resolve grievances, and free them from suffering to be reborn in heaven. May they ascend to the halls of blessing, hear the scriptures, and awaken to the Dao. May they forever transcend life and death, entering the realm of non-action. May disputes be settled, the living and the dead alike finding peace. Should our prayers be answered, we shall forever bear the profound grace.

After attaining the Dao, they ascend into the formless,
harmony merging with the true Dao.

To the Lower Quarter:
We now burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this to so-and-so’s performance of the Supreme Fast for Deliverance from Torment. We recite scriptures and practice the Dao, reverently submitting to the Lower Quarter’s Limitless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Nine Mound Earthly Sovereigns, the Four Controllers, the Five Emperors, the Twelve Immortal Lords, the Nine Palace Perfected Ones, the divine immortals, jade maidens, and the spirit officials of the Lower Realm. We repent for the boundless sins committed by so-and-so’s ancestors across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. In their lifetimes, they may have falsely claimed mastery of the Dao, carved up lands, hills, ridges, plains, and waterways. They may have destroyed tombs and temples, suppressed divine spirits, blocked water sources, or dammed mountains and valleys. They may have razed city walls, altars, and shrines, or offended the earthly officials of marquisates and principalities. They showed no fear of the divine, indulging in evil without restraint. Their souls are beaten and bound in the Lower Realm’s Nine Dark Prisons. They draw water from the eternal night’s river to irrigate the Four Waterways, or bear mountains and carry stones, condemned to endless labor.

Their suffering is bound as an infant’s, endless through all time. It extends upward to past lives, downward to descendants. Retribution remains unfulfilled, calamity deepens, and punishment grows heavier. Now, through the performance of this fast and the practice of the Dao, we repent and uproot the roots of sin. We prostrate ourselves, beseeching the august assembly of saints to open their mercy and grant pardon. We implore the underworld officials of Fengdu, the Nine Dark Prisons, and the halls of judgment to absolve the boundless karmic causes of past kalpas. May the destitute souls be delivered, freed from the depths of darkness, to roam the true realms and dwell in the land of blessings. May descendants enjoy peace and prosperity, and may the living and the dead alike find serenity. Should our plea be granted, we shall reverently bear the profound grace. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

The Three Luminaries:
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this supreme and wondrous fast for the liberation of so-and-so, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We take refuge in the palaces of the sun, moon, and stars, the perfected and great sages, the divine immortals and all spirit-officials of the Three Luminaries. We repent for the boundless sins of so-and-so’s family—across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. They may have been unrighteous rulers, disloyal ministers, unkind fathers, or unfilial sons. They violated the celestial patterns and earthly principles, as well as the sun, moon, and stars, accumulating deep stains of evil. Their hidden sins and manifest transgressions were inscribed in the ledgers of wickedness. Upon death, their souls were seized by ghostly officials and confined in the eternal night’s halls of judgment. Beaten and bound in heavy fetters, they had no means of expiation. Now, through repentance and the seeking of grace, through the performance of this fast and the practice of the Dao, we prostrate ourselves, hoping the great sages of the heavens and the august assembly of the Three Luminaries will command the underworld prisons and halls of judgment to absolve their accumulated sins and reconcile their enmities. May their debts and disputes be settled, and may the living and the dead find peace. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

The Five Peaks:
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this supreme and wondrous fast for the liberation of so-and-so, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We take refuge in the True Lords of the Five Peaks, the grotto-heavens of the famous mountains, and the divine immortals and all spirit-officials who have attained the Dao. We repent for the boundless sins of so-and-so’s family—across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. They may have recklessly provoked offenses, defying the divine. They violated the famous mountains and great rivers, the sacred sites and blessed lands, the lords of hills and plains, and the hidden officials and spirit-offices. Their sins coiled endlessly, never pardoned. Their souls were seized and bound in the earthly prisons of the Five Peaks. Their suffering was complete, endless through all time. Now, through the performance of this fast and the practice of the Dao, we repent and seek grace. We prostrate ourselves, hoping the myriad sages will extend their compassion and the heavens will witness and protect. We implore the officials of the Five Peaks’ prisons and halls of judgment to dissolve their enmities, wash away their sins, and eradicate all evil. May the Nine Dark Prisons be illuminated, and may our plea be granted, bearing the profound grace. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

The Water Realms:
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this supreme and wondrous fast for the liberation of so-and-so, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We take refuge in the Great Emperor of Fusang, the Divine King of Yang Valley, the water emperors of the Three Rivers, Four Seas, and Nine Jiang, and the divine immortals and all spirit-officials of the Twelve River Sources and Water Realms. We repent for the boundless sins of so-and-so’s family—across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. They may have slighted the true spirits, disrespected the divine, defiled the springs, or harmed the rivers and marshes. Their transgressions became manifold, binding them in the nether courts. Their souls were seized and beaten, confined in the Water Realms’ prisons under the halls of judgment. They endured every torment, their suffering unbearable, hauling and drawing the dark waves to irrigate the Four Waterways. Through the icy rivers and freezing nights, their bodies cracked. They saw no light, with no means of deliverance. Now, through the performance of this fast and the practice of the Dao, we repent and seek grace. We prostrate ourselves, hoping the myriad sages will witness our plea and the Three August Ones will grant pardon. We implore the officials of the Water Realms’ prisons and halls of judgment to untie their enmities, absolve their sins, and erase their transgressions. May they depart the land of darkness and ascend to the realm of purity. May their souls be refined, attaining ranks to be born in heaven. May their sins be forever erased, and their descendants enjoy peace and prosperity. Should our plea be granted, we shall reverently bear the profound grace. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

The Sacred Scriptures:
We now reverently burn incense, surrendering body, spirit, and life, dedicating this supreme and wondrous fast for the liberation of so-and-so, reciting scriptures and practicing the Dao. We take refuge in the thirty-six divisions of the most perfected and supreme sacred scriptures, the true writs and precious talismans, the secret treasuries of the heavens, the true Dharma of the ten directions, and all spirit-officials who guard the scriptures. We repent for the boundless sins of so-and-so’s family—across a hundred million generations and thirty-six lineages, extending to the departed spirits and all kith and kin. In past kalpas and future kalpas, across a hundred million lives, through the deeds of the three karmas and the creations of the six senses, their hidden sins and manifest transgressions were heavy in judgment and deep in punishment. They may have slighted or desecrated texts, defiled sacred writs, slandered the holy scriptures, or leaked secret texts. Their calamities coiled endlessly, never repented. Their souls were seized and beaten, confined in the Nine Dark Prisons. They endured torture and were bound in dark fetters. Through the eternal night, they had no means of deliverance. Now, through repentance and the seeking of grace, through the performance of this fast and the practice of the Dao, we prostrate ourselves, hoping the spirit-officials will memorialize the throne and extend their merciful blessings. We implore the officials of the underworld prisons and halls of judgment to dissolve their karmic retributions and reconcile their enmities. May they transcend the gates of the Yellow Springs and ascend the path of blessings. May their descendants be secure and prosperous, and may the Nine Nights and Three Paths alike receive radiant protection. Should our plea be granted, we shall reverently bear the profound grace. After attaining the Dao, they shall ascend into the formless, harmonizing with the Dao to become true.

*Concluding the forty-eighth scroll of the* **Ritual of the Yellow Register Fast of the Most High**.

**Forty-Ninth Scroll of the Ritual of the Yellow Register Fast of the Most High**
*Edited by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting*

**Reporting Merits and Presenting Memorials**

When the days of the fast are complete, either at midnight of the final day or at dawn the following morning, the assembled officials shall arrange themselves in ranks before the Mystic Master. Once the formation is set, they shall chant the *Dao* and enter the chamber. Each shall bow to the Master, maintaining visualization as prescribed.

**Invocation of the Five Stars’ Protective Radiance**
The Five Stars array their illumination, resplendent across the five directions.
The Water Star averts calamity,
The Wood Power brings prosperity.
Mars dispels misfortune,
Venus repels warfare.
[Missing character] The Earth Star’s fourfold governance ensures the state’s flourishing.
Inscribed upon jade tablets, names recorded in the Celestial Palace,
They ride the whirlwind, wielding light, soaring through the Great Void.
Emerging from and entering the unseen, they wander and feast in the ten directions.
Five-colored clouds overspread them, summoning spirits and commanding winds.
They dispatch the myriad numina, upholding the Transcendent Elder above.

**Striking the Dharma Drum Twenty-Four Times**

O Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Origin, First Three *Qi*, Supreme Dao Lord, we summon forth from within our bodies the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Incense-Bearing Golden Youths, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Thirty-Two Fragrant Officials of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Register for this day. Let them emerge, arrayed in solemn vestments, to open the gates of the Mystic Altar’s Celestial Thearchs. Let the local earth gods and territorial true officials swiftly ascend to receive this summons.

We now reverently offer incense on behalf of the petitioner’s intent, praying that the numinous radiance of the Jade Clarity’s Dao *qi* and the wondrous light of the Numinous Treasure descend and flow into our bodies. May the Mystic Altar be purified, within and without, to attain perfection. May the heavens be free of defilement, the earth purged of demonic dust. May the jade chimes resound, the ten directions grow hushed and clear. May the myriad demons not intrude, and our sincerity ascend unobstructed. May our plea swiftly reach the presence of the Most High, Boundless, Perfect, and True Jade Emperor of the Supreme Dao.

**Each declares their dharma rank:**
Disciples of the Three Luminaries of the Great Cavern of the Mystic Capital, conducting the Great Yellow Register Fast, reporting merits and presenting memorials, performing the rite of offering and casting the dragon tablets, and concluding the return-to-palace liturgy.

We now burn incense, dedicating these merits above for the ancestral spirits of the imperial ancestral temple, the reigning emperor, the civil and military officials, the ministers and all functionaries, as well as for the petitioner’s nine generations and seven degrees of kin, living family members, our own three masters and nine ancestors, all people under heaven, every sentient being, and those lost in the dark paths of the unseen realms. We surrender body, spirit, and destiny to the Ten Directions’ Boundless Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy.

We beseech forgiveness for the heavy sins of past lives and this existence, deliverance from the Three Evil Paths, and relief from the ten sufferings, eight adversities, and nine calamities. May our bodies attain the true Dao and traverse the empty sky. May we ascend to heaven in broad daylight, awaiting attendance upon the Dao Lord. May we roam freely in the Supreme Golden Palaces of the Seven Treasures’ spontaneous halls, forever harmonizing with the Dao.

May our mystical entreaty ascend before the Perfect and Boundless True Dao.

**Homage to the Ten Directions**
**Confession of Transgressions**

**Threefold Invocation Hymn**

The Law is my beloved wife,
the scriptures treasured as jade bright.
Holding fast the precepts, I restrain the six passions;
mindful of the Dao, I cast aside all desire.
Serene and pure, my upright qi abides;
tranquil and still, my spirit rests in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and guard me,
life after life I receive boundless fortune.
My household and kingdom flourish in abundance,
the scriptures and Dao thrive in majestic splendor.
Heaven and humankind share this one aspiration,
soaring aloft in the vastness of the Great Vehicle.
From the heart I establish my field of merit,
as the Wheel of Dharma ascends in gentle ascent.
My seven ancestors ascend to the heavenly halls,
while my own body soars in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the mysterious void—
with thought, nothing fails to align.
Refining my form, I enter the immortal truth,
and attain the adamantine body.
I transcend the trials of the Three Realms,
the five torments of hell are released.
All return to the scriptures of the Most High;
in silent contemplation, I bow in reverence.

**Threefold Prostration**
With utmost sincerity, I bow in reverence to the Boundless Great Dao of the Most High.
With utmost sincerity, I bow in reverence to the thirty-six revered scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, I bow in reverence to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

**Ritual Circumambulation**
Gathering the true writ, from the east, south, west, north, and center, each at their respective altars, incense is lit to fumigate the true writ. All officials chant the true writ in unison, and the disciple holds the true writ over the incense to fumigate it.

The Dharma Master strikes his teeth twelve times and recites the incantation:
*"Primordial Beginning of the Upper Heavens,
the Three Luminaries shine in lofty brilliance.
Turning light to illuminate,
the four directions gleam in clarity.
Guiding the flow of destiny,
sparking yang like streaming stars.
The five phases clash in discord,
the three constellations lose their peace.
The Five Celestial Palaces gather the stars,
the Seven Luminaries radiate their numen.
True Lord, Great Chief,
whose hidden name is Jade Essence.
The Lady, Heavenly Consort,
is called Nurturer of Infants.
Together they govern the Mysterious Pass,
revolving all heavens.
Now, with certain calamities,
ominous portents have been mystically revealed.
I present this true writ,
inscribed in red, to ascend above.
Disheveling my hair, I confess my transgressions,
baring my crimson sincerity.
I beseech your mysterious scrutiny,
to restore the celestial scriptures.
Let qi not flow amiss,
let disasters not arise untimely.
Burning the sacred writ,
its smoke scatters in the Jade Court.
The Upper Radiance oversees and delivers,
proclaiming to the myriad spirits.
Qi purifies the Three Passes,
disasters vanish in the Nine Nether realms.
Yin and yang harmonize,
the land enjoys great peace.
I entreat the Golden Dragon,
to swiftly transmit this by wind and fire."*

This incantation derives from the *Red Writ of Jade Secrets*. During the Three Primes and Eight Festivals, when performing the Yellow Register rites or rituals of deliverance, inscribe the text of the Year Star’s assistance to the liver, and use this incantation. If exorcising demonic epidemics, inscribe the Eastern Mountain Divine Incantation, which has its own separate incantation. To avert the hundred-and-six great calamities, inscribe the text to subdue the Eastern River. For scholars cultivating the self, inscribe the Nine Qi of the East. If stars or constellations stray from their courses and the Nine Luminaries bring disaster, follow this incantation.

The *Jade Secrets* state: *"In all prayers and exorcisms, if one does not first strike the teeth before reciting the incantation, external demons will intrude, and the gates of response will remain unopened."* It further states: *"If the baleful star is in the east, expose the writ for nine days, and the Golden Dragon will pacify it. For seven days in the west, three in the south, five in the north, and twelve in the center—all follow the qi and numerology of the Great Dao. The baleful star in the east refers to its presence among the Horn and Neck constellations; the rest may be inferred accordingly."* Conclude by burning this true writ along with the memorial.

Amidst the dispersing azure smoke of incense.

Upon the conclusion of the incantation, all officials bow again, each following this precedent.

Solemnly invoking their dharma-positions, the disciples of the Upper Clarity and Mystic Capital, your servants [Name] and others, reverently and repeatedly address the Most High, Boundless, and Great Dao—the Primordial Celestial Venerable of the Origin; the Most High Lord of the Great Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the Supreme Mystic Elder; the Ten Directions’ Numinous Treasure Celestial Venerables; the Great Sage Assemblies who have attained the Dao; the Perfected Lords and Masters; the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures; the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Center; the Celestial Master Lord; the Supreme Ministers and Prime Councilors; the Four Offices and Five Emperors; the Eastern Marchmount’s Minister of Fate and True Lord of Life; the Western Ultimate’s Sovereign of All Perfected Ones; the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Great Peace’s Lower Teaching; the Numinous Palaces of the Five Marchmounts; the Grotto-Realms of Famous Mountains; and all responsive and efficacious numina of the Three Realms.

By karmic affinity with the Dao, your servants have personally encountered the true transformation. The Celestial Venerable expounded the Dharma, and the Three Caverns proclaimed its practice. Sacred instructions and numinous charts bring salvation to households and peace to the realm. Having been granted participation in the wondrous and true, we were permitted to receive and cultivate it. Yet first, we must establish merit to universally benefit both the hidden and the manifest. It is fitting to magnify the sagely teachings and broadly deliver heaven and humanity. None who sincerely submit shall be rejected or forsaken. Now, in obedience to the edict, how dare we not report above?

Reading the memorial:
Following the memorial’s sincerity, we have joined together in mutual support. Consulting the codes of the numinous immortals and perusing the texts of the Yellow Register, we act on behalf of [Name] at the [Name] Abbey in [State and County], establishing the ritual forms of the Mystic Rite and modeling the Two Modes. We present the lamps, candles, incense, flowers, golden dragons, and silken banners—pledges of our destined lives—to attest and verify our cinnabar sincerity. Beginning at the midnight hour of [Day], we initiate the fast. Burning incense and pacing the Dao, we repent and give thanks to the Mystic Perfected. Kindling lamps to continue the light, we illuminate the Three Realms, reaching downward through the Nine Earths and upward to all heavens. We deliver the living and rescue the dead, universally benefiting household and state. For [Number] days and nights, we pace the Dao and recite the scriptures. At the eleventh hour of [Day], the merit is perfected and the task accomplished. The lotus lamps dim their flames, and the jade chimes gather their sound. The immortal chariots return to the Upper Mysteries, and the Dharma’s flow disperses through the lower realms. Golden dragons ascend in radiance to report the fast’s merit. The sagely grace extends compassion, opening deliverance to the hidden and the lost. Rewarding merit and bestowing honors, it universally reaches the numinous offices.

Within our bodies, the inner and outer Perfected Officials we bear, the soldiers and scribes of the Three Caverns, the stellar lodges and Nine Palaces, the Five Emperors, the Five Marchmounts and Four Waterways, the Three Rivers and Four Seas, the troops and cavalry, the attendant incense-bearing Golden Lads, the flower-scattering Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans who transmit and report, and the Flying Dragon Cavalry—all have labored with merit. Now, they shall be separately honored. On yellow silk and vermilion memorials, their merits are proclaimed and promotions recommended.

Your servants’ mastery of the Dharma remains incomplete, constrained by the measures of reverence and humility.

Advancing or halting in violation of statutes, failing to conform to ritual propriety—we fear being impeached by the Four Offices or seized by the Five Emperors. For a thousand transgressions and ten thousand faults, we beseech pardon and forgiveness. Though our ignorance remains unenlightened, may no punishment be visited upon us.

At the commencement of this retreat, we reverently invited the Wisdom of the Highest Grade and performed the Ten Precepts Dharma rites, which now being concluded, we escort them back to the Heavenly Palace. The retreat we have conducted is now complete in merit and accomplishment. To further clarify these merits, we present a memorial on yellow silk with vermilion script.

Upon our jade table, we request the inspection of the memorial text. The text is inscribed on five feet of fine yellow silk, with vermilion borders and vermilion script, each line containing twenty-four characters. No "living" character appears at the bottom of a line, nor any "dead" character at the top. The first line records the Dharma rank in full, concluding with the phrase "bowing my head." The opening address occupies its own line. "The Most High and Boundless Dao Lord" appears on the third line. After "the memorial is hereby presented," omit the supplicant’s surname for three lines. After the sacred title, again omit the surname for three lines. The date follows, separated from the sacred title by three lines. All must adhere strictly to the prescribed format, with no emendations—lest corrections incur reprimand, a matter of utmost gravity.

**Reading the Memorial**
Take the memorial from the incense burner, fumigate it, and begin reading. At the mention of the Dharma rank, bow twice, then resume the kneeling posture. Maintain a harmonious voice and upright qi. When the disciple’s name is read, bow twice again. From the phrase "your servant, in trembling awe," bow twice more. At the date and place, bow once more, then bow twice again. When finished, spread the memorial upon the jade table, aligning it directly before the Celestial Presence. Secure it with a dragon-headed writing knife to the left of the sacred title and a vermilion brush to the right, then resume the kneeling posture. Light three pinches of incense, strike the teeth three times, and dispatch the memorial, issuing the decree:

We solemnly dispatch the Perfected Officials of the Five Constituents within our bodies, each accompanied by one minor clerk and twelve scribal assistants. We further command the Merit Officers, the Flying Dragon Cavalry, and the Courier Envoys to attire themselves in full regalia—crowns, sashes, pendants, inkstones, brushes, and girded swords—to prepare the records. Without delay, they shall bear this yellow-silk vermilion memorial to the Heavenly Bureaus and present it in audience. Should any errors occur—omissions, misplaced characters, disordered phrases, or improper sequencing—the transmitting scribes, attendant clerks, and their dragon-headed writing knives and long-haired brushes shall correct them on the spot. Let no supervising official have cause to return it.

Holding the breath, ascend the memorial directly to the presence of the Most High and Boundless Dao Lord of the Three Heavens. Proceed without delay. The Left Lord shall pass through the gates, the Right Clerk shall announce in proper order. Each official shall proceed according to rank. May what we have requested descend, what we have summoned arrive, what we have healed be cured, what we have condemned be destroyed, what we have proclaimed be transmitted, what we have promoted advance, what we have wished be fulfilled, and what we have sought be obtained. Should any subordinate official dare obstruct or intercept this memorial, preventing its ascent, they shall be seized and delivered to the nearest prison, their crimes adjudicated according to celestial law to uphold the heavenly statutes.

We prostrate ourselves, awaiting the response of mysterious grace.

The Dharma Master, standing behind the table, closes his eyes and faces the Heavenly Gate, bowing deeply in visualization. The officials and soldiers within his body, along with the Generals of the Three Primes and the Merit Officers with their mounts, array themselves before and behind him. His body ascends in a feathered carriage, a dragon-drawn chariot, rising gently within the purple qi to the gate of the Three Heavens. First, he pays homage to the Dharma Masters of the Three Heavens, then enters the left gate of the Mysterious Capital Palace. After presenting the memorial, he bears the case directly into the Three Heavens Gate. Twelve attendants—those bearing the memorial, presenting it, and awaiting its review—stand in readiness. Upon completion, he exits the Three Heavens Gate, mounts his feathered carriage with his retinue, and returns. The passage through the heavenly palaces and celestial roads follows the same sequence as the memorial rites of the Three and Five Heavens—details of which are not repeated here.

Next, the inner officials strike their teeth twelve times and recite the incantation:
The memorial having been presented, the Merit Officers, Courier Envoys, and Perfected Officials of the Three and Five Heavens who emerged from our body shall now return—entering through the Gate of Myriad Mysteries, those on the left returning to the left, those on the right to the right. The Directing Merit Officers and overseers shall resume their original positions, ensuring no confusion. When summoned again, they shall arrive as before.

Strike the teeth twice, swallow the saliva twice. Visualize the officials of the Three and Five Heavens memorial rites returning to their places within the body. Bow twice, then roll the memorial into its case, sealing it with the true writ. Place it upon the incense table. The Cavern Tablet Officer shall bear it, the Retreat Supervisor shall escort it, with banners and regalia leading the way, the disciples following. At the Heavenly Gate, it is burned.

The Dharma Master, from his position, faces the Heavenly Gate and visualizes the Perfected Officials bearing the true-writ memorial ascending with the azure smoke and vermilion flames into the Heavenly Gate.

**Burning the Memorial with Invocation**
Beings are beset by obstacles and hardships,
The Great Dao shows profound compassion.
Salvation and deliverance abide in precepts and rites,
All are enabled to repent their karmic entanglements.
Transgressions are recorded in the earthly prisons,
Offenses have reached the ears of Heaven.
We confess our faults and pray for true protection,
Our sincerity reverently directed to the sages.
Devoutly we worship the Three Treasures,
Praying to present our memorial for longevity.
The burning words ascend to the upper realms,
Names presented before the Jade Emperor.

Light three pinches of incense, hold the Mountain Memorial Text, strike the teeth nine times, fumigate the text thrice, then read:

We, the humble Dharma disciple [official title, name, age], born under the governance of [Celestial Emperor], named in the register of [Marchmount], now residing in [prefecture, county, village], respectfully conduct this Yellow Register Grand Retreat of [number] days and nights at [prefecture, county, temple, abode] for the sake of the state, the household, the living and deceased kin, and [specific intention]. The Daoist rites now concluded, we cast this memorial upon the Sacred Mountain. May the divine and immortal ones, the perfected of the Five Marchmounts, most numinous and efficacious, erase our names from the ledgers of sin and inscribe them in the Nine Heavens. We beseech the Sacred Mountain to dispatch a golden dragon courier.

In the reign year [name], the [year] of the [Celestial Stem-Branch], the [month], the [day] of the [lunar phase], the Three Caverns Dharma Master [name], at the [Sacred Mountain Cavern Abode], hereby concludes this proclamation.

All officials bow twice again. The disciples are then instructed to hold the memorial tablet above the incense smoke, while the Dharma Master strikes his teeth nine times and recites the incantation:

"Mystic and luminous, the Primordial Beginning oversees the true.
The Five Elders of the Supreme Emperor, crimson script on vermilion writ.
Heaven and Earth’s origin, governing the Three Luminaries.
Gathering qi to summon the assembly, hastening the ascent of immortals.
The exalted talisman’s decree, proclaimed throughout the ten directions.
Sun, moon, and stars; the Five Marchmounts and sacred peaks.
Above in the heavens, below on the earth, the great spirits of the unseen.
Overseeing life and the Register of Destiny, the Southern Three Gates.
Receive the jade tablet, inscribe names in the cinnabar scroll.
Erase the records of transgression, elevate them as imperial retainers.
So-and-so (name) entrusts himself to the supreme Dao, establishing merit through this retreat.
Redeeming the nine generations of ancestors, all suffering souls.
The Daoist rites now concluded, we respectfully approach the Sacred Mountain.
We beseech the casting of this jade tablet, the erasure of sinful names,
that all may attain liberation, without enmity or kinship.
Departing the Three Evil Realms, souls ascend to the Nine Heavens.
Deliverance in life and death, eternal existence through kalpas.
Today’s supplication is heard by the myriad perfected.
We entreat the dragon tablet to seal the pact with the true officials.
May our plea be conveyed by the golden dragon courier."

As the officials bow twice, all repeat the invocation aloud. The phrase *"golden dragon courier"* and the four-character memorial tablet inscription are each recited three times.

The tablet is made of *hu* wood, twelve inches in length, two inches and four *fen* in width, and two *fen* in thickness. It is bordered in vermilion, divided into five columns: four for the memorial text and one for the date. The text is written meticulously in red, without corrections or emendations.

Each tablet is borne by a dragon, three inches and six *fen* in length. For the Son of Heaven, the dragon is of gold; for dukes and marquises, of secondary gold; for scholars and commoners, silver gilded with gold suffices.

Upon completion of the incantation, the mountain and water tablets are sealed with blue paper, bound with silk, and stamped with the seal of the Nine Elders’ Immortal Capital. The earth tablet is sealed with yellow paper and green thread.

According to ancient ritual, a jade *bi* head is placed within the Dragon-Casting Ceremony, marking the sealed tablet. The Dharma Master respectfully presents it to the designated cavern abode:
- For mountains: *[Name] Mountain Cavern Abode*
- For waters: *[Name] Spring Water Palace*
- For earth: *[Name] Sacred Altar Earth Palace*

The Three Caverns Dharma Master [Name] seals the proclamation.

---

**Reading of the Water Tablet Proclamation:**
"Now, with reverence, [prefecture, county, village], official so-and-so (name), aged [number], humbly conducts this Supreme Yellow Register Grand Retreat of [number] days and nights at [location] for the sake of the state, the household, and all living and deceased kin. We pray for blessings, grace, and the augmentation of fortune and longevity.

The Daoist rites now concluded, we cast this memorial upon the Water Palace. May the divine and immortal ones, the Three Origins in unity, the Water Emperors of the Nine Palaces, the Twelve River Sources, the Jiang, Hai, Huai, and Ji rivers, and the great spirits of the unseen, erase our names from the ledgers of sin and inscribe them in the Nine Heavens. We beseech the Water Palace to dispatch a golden dragon courier.

In the reign year [name], the [year] of the [Celestial Stem-Branch], the [month], the [day], the Three Caverns Dharma Master [name], at the [location] Sacred Spring Water Palace, hereby concludes this proclamation."

The disciples are then instructed to hold the tablet above the incense smoke, while the Dharma Master strikes his teeth twelve times and recites the incantation:

"Primordial Beginning, Five Elders, Supreme Emperor, exalted and revered,
the perfected of the ten directions, the numinous immortals of Mount Taihua,
crimson writ proclaiming the decree—no hidden realm remains unheard.
Ascending the Nine Heavens, we beseech the descent of the jade script.
Sun, moon, and Three Stars; the Northern Dipper’s Seven Origins.
We petition the Five Marchmounts, the sacred peaks of the four directions.
Below, we address the rivers and seas, the Twelve Fountainheads.
The Nine River Water Emperors, the great spirits of the unseen,
today’s supplication is laid bare before the myriad wishes.
The disciples conduct this retreat and perform the Daoist rites for all living and deceased.
We redeem the seven generations of ancestors, severing the roots of past transgressions.
We respectfully cast this jade tablet, beseeching its ascent to the heavens.
Inscribe our names in the Water Palace, that the departed may ascend to the heavens.
Deliverance in life and death, heard by the myriad spirits.
We entreat the dragon tablet to pledge our oath to the Water Emperors.
Grant our plea as proclaimed, conveyed by the golden dragon courier."

All officials bow twice again, and the incantation concludes. The sealing and inscription follow the previous method.

**Reading of the Earth Tablet Proclamation:**
"Now, with reverence, [prefecture, county, village], official so-and-so (name), humbly conducts this Supreme Yellow Register Grand Retreat of [number] days and nights at [location] for the sake of the state, the household, and all living and deceased kin. We pray for blessings, grace, and the augmentation of fortune and longevity.

The Daoist rites now concluded, we cast this memorial upon the Sacred Altar. The Yellow Thearch of the Nine Earths, the Yellow Spirits of *wu* and *ji*, the Five Emperors of the Earth Palace—we beseech the erasure of sinful names. We petition the Central Palace to inscribe the tablet in the Great Mystery. With golden clasps and white credentials, we entreat the golden dragon courier.

In the reign year [name], the [month], the [day], the Three Caverns Dharma Master [name], at the [location] Sacred Altar Earth Palace, hereby concludes this proclamation."

The disciples are then instructed to hold the tablet above the incense smoke, while the Dharma Master strikes his teeth twelve times and recites the incantation:

"Heaven and Earth unfold, the myriad qi divide and manifest.
The Three Origins in harmony, the ten directions radiant and clear.
The Five Elder Supreme Emperors, governing death and overseeing life.
Crimson script on vermilion writ, the essence of the Primordial Beginning.
Proclaimed throughout the world, the august spirits of the Nine Earths.
Today’s supplication is heard, the myriad immortals decree life.
The disciples conduct this retreat and perform the Daoist rites for all living and deceased.
Our wishes, our immortals—we beseech the casting of jade names.
The Supreme Thearch of the Earth Palace, erase our sinful names.
Present the tablet to the Upper Palace, inscribe it in the Register of Flourishing Clarity.
Bodies ascend in flight, in unity with the numinous of Heaven and Earth.
The nine generations of kin, though bones decay, are renewed in glory.
Souls ascend to the Southern Palace, transformed in the immortal courts.
Today’s decree is heard by the myriad spirits.
We entreat the golden clasp and white tablet to attest our utmost sincerity.
Grant our plea as proclaimed, conveyed by the golden dragon courier."

All officials bow twice again.

"Praying to the true, ascending the Purple Palace,
proclaiming the decree at the Sacred Altar.

golden lads offer incense smoke.

characters arrayed, ascending the Three Heavens.

attaining the exalted immortality of the highest."

All officials bow twice again.

**Yellow Silk Vermilion Memorial Template**

For the right side, use finely woven yellow silk six *chi* in length, taking half its width. Mark red borders and write in red ink, twenty-four characters per line. On the first line, the name and title are written in secret script, ensuring the final *dunshou* character concludes the line precisely. The two characters for "supplication" occupy the second line alone. "The Supreme Peerless Great Dao" begins the third line. From this point, maintain twenty-four characters per line, ensuring the character for "life" does not appear at the bottom, nor the characters for "death," "ghost," or personal names at the top. Follow the prescribed format strictly.

The undersigned, officiating the Yellow Register Grand Fast ritual, [Title] Master of [Sacred Peak] [Name] Emperor Perfected, your subject [Name], prostrates and bows deeply, respectfully addressing:

**Supplication to the Supreme Peerless Great Dao, the Most True and Spontaneous, beneath the Golden Gates of the Celestial Palace.**

Your subjects, in our ignorance, have presumptuously partaken in the Great Dharma. Our merits are but dust and dew, while our transgressions tower like mountains. Overwhelmed with shame and trepidation, our forms and souls lack truth.

Your subjects bow deeply, bow deeply again. We, indeed humble and insignificant, fortunately rely upon the blessings of the Dao. Gratefully encountering its wondrous transformation, we are filled with boundless joy. Though entrusted with the mysteries of the celestial office and charged with the duty of salvation, our nature remains dull and blind. Yet we pledge our utmost sincerity. We pursue the compassionate breeze and embrace its teachings.

The wondrous teachings—seeing righteousness, we think of courage, day and night dwelling in our hearts. In the karmic conditions we encounter, how dare we fail to make this report?

Now there is a disciple of the Great Dao from [such-and-such] prefecture, county, village, [holding such-and-such] office, named [so-and-so], aged [such-and-such] years, born on the [such-and-such] day of the [such-and-such] month. We bow our heads, prostrate ourselves, and set forth our words in full.

We have heard that the Supreme Orthodox Dharma of the Yellow Register Great Retreat dissolves the sins of past and present lives—those of body, speech, and mind. Above, it benefits the imperial throne; below, it extends to all beings. It safeguards the nation and pacifies the people, averts calamities and repels harm. It augments blessings and prolongs life, dispels misfortune and dissolves disasters. It delivers the nine generations of ancestors and the seven lineages of forebears, all the departed spirits. It rescues the living and the dead, bestowing universal grace.

Respectfully, we present offerings to the ten directions: golden dragons as tokens of faith, life-thread silks, incense, flowers, oil, and candles—all the requisites of devotion. With sincere hearts, we submit our words for your hearing.

Through our practice of the Dao, we confess and repent, acknowledging the transgressions of past lives. We sever misfortune and deliver the living and the dead. Though our words may falter, the principle remains clear and worthy of presentation.

Respectfully, we lead fellow Daoist priests [so-and-so] and others, numbering [such-and-such], in accordance with the Yellow Register liturgy of the Lower Prime, the sacred statutes of the immortals. At the altar of the mysterious sanctuary in [such-and-such] prefecture, [such-and-such] county, [such-and-such] abbey, we establish the rites of the mysterious canon, modeling heaven and earth. With the golden dragons and silken banners presented, we consecrate the ten directions. We beseech heaven and implore earth, rescuing the living and the dead. Together, we exert ourselves, purifying our hearts and calming our thoughts. Covered in ashes, we prostrate ourselves, surrendering to the Most True, to pray for our wishes.

For [such-and-such] days, [such-and-such] nights, [such-and-such] hours of repentance rites, and [such-and-such] hours of scripture recitation, beginning at dawn on the [such-and-such] day of the [such-and-such] month, we establish the retreat and perform the Dao. This continues until the hour of *hai* on the [such-and-such] day, totaling [such-and-such] hours. Upon the completion of our prayers and the fulfillment of our rites, we respectfully conclude the liturgy and dissolve the altar, casting the dragons into the mountains and waters. With cinnabar writings and talismanic petitions, we submit our words to the sacred altar. Prostrate upon the earth, we present a vermilion memorial on yellow silk, to be heard in the Nine Heavens. We reverently await...

The Most High, Boundless Dao, Original Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning; the Most High Lord of the Great Dao; the Most High Lord Lao; the Most High Venerable One; the Supreme Mysterious Elder; the Celestial Worthies of the Numinous Treasure, spontaneously arisen in the Ten Directions; the assemblies of Great Sages who have attained the Dao, the Perfected Lords and Venerable Ones; the Supreme Thearchs and Heavenly Thearchs; the Heavenly Master Lords; the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center—may the radiant grace of these whom we reverently address incline toward our crimson sincerity.

Should our petition be granted and the imperial decree bestowed, may it be proclaimed to the Five Elder Thearchs of the Ten Directions, the True Immortals of the Five Marchmounts, the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus, and the True Spirits of the Ten Realms. May they deliver and ferry across the nine generations and seven ancestors of such-and-such a household, whether bound by affinity or not, whether foe or kin, all equally—every shade and soul in darkness. May they all be enabled to emerge from the eternal night, ascending from the Nine Dark Realms into the Southern Palace. May withered bones be crowned and girded, may decayed remains bloom anew, may the wheel of transmigration be exhausted, and may they be transformed and reborn at the Gate of Blessing. May the local earth spirits guard and protect their forms, and when the spirits return to their former state, may they unite with the light and the unseen.

May all transgressions of such-and-such a disciple’s household, from past lives to this present existence, be eradicated and dissolved, all grievances reconciled. May calamities be averted, disasters dispelled, life prolonged, and destiny preserved. May the living and the dead flourish, and kinfolk dwell in peace.

Above, may the Seven Luminaries shine in full splendor, and the Two Modes endure forever. May yin and yang harmonize, and the nine grains yield abundant harvests. May the nation prosper and the people rejoice, and may all under heaven know great peace. May the Six Directions be purified, and the imperial reign prolonged. May pestilence vanish, and auspicious omens appear daily. May primal felicity be preserved, and the grace of the Dao be eternally cherished.

With reverence, we dispatch the celestial hosts summoned for this ritual fast: the celestial immortals’ legions, the perfected ones’ legions, the divine beings’ legions, the earthly immortals’ legions, the sun and moon’s legions, the stellar constellations’ legions, the Nine Palaces and Five Emperors’ legions, the Three Rivers and Four Seas’ legions, the Five Peaks and Four Waterways’ legions—each numbering nine hundred million myriad cavalry. The overseers of the fast’s affairs, the golden youths attending incense, the jade maidens scattering blossoms, the direct envoys of the Five Emperors, the messengers bearing petitions, the flying dragon couriers.

Within our bodies, the inner and outer true immortals we bear, the officials of the Numinous Treasure, the guardian generals of the palace—along with the local earth gods and territorial deities, the divinities of the Three Realms, all those who supervise, protect, and transmit commands, or who have labored diligently in honoring and safeguarding the fast—are now fully arrayed. Following our petition, they ascend to the Mysterious Capital to receive their due rewards and commendations. We beseech that the true officials be promoted in rank, the highest immortals elevated to imperial titles. According to their grades, let them be appointed to offices, their ranks and stations duly ordered, all exalted and advanced in accordance with the rites of the Great Perfected.

We, whose mastery of the Dao remains incomplete, have acted with humility yet transgressed the proper forms; our conduct has violated the statutes, our actions fallen short of ritual decorum. We fear the censure of the Four Offices and the judgment of the Five Emperors. For our thousand faults and myriad sins, we implore pardon and forgiveness. May our ignorance be met with compassion, our offenses spared from punishment.

Within our bodies, the true officials of the five viscera, having fulfilled their duties, return each to their respective bureaus. May we, through our study, attain the Dao; through our seeking, become immortals, ever to be numbered among the Perfected. May we shine with the radiance of the Three Luminaries and endure with the Five Qi.

We entreat the Most High and the assembled venerables to bestow their mercy and favor. Through the flying immortals and direct envoys of the true officials, the Merit Registrars of the Orthodox Unity, the left and right official messengers, the yin-yang divine decree officers, the chariot officers of the red talismans, the couriers of the fierce winds, the flying dragon couriers, the celestial immortal couriers, and the flying immortal couriers—each twenty-four in number—we now act.

With utmost reverence, we, on behalf of so-and-so, have conducted the Great Yellow Register Fast. The rites now concluded, we dissolve the altar, restore the ranks of heaven, and reaffirm the merit and virtue. We present a petition inscribed on yellow silk in vermilion, to be conveyed to the Most High Court of the Supreme Oneness. We, so-and-so, prostrate ourselves in awe and dread, bowing twice in submission, to make this known.

[Your name], of [your state, county, and abbey], respectfully submits this on the [day] of the [month] in the [year] of the reign [title], when the Celestial Gate opens at [hour], at the altar within [abbey].

All who transcribe this petition must refrain from deletions, emendations, errant characters, interpolations, or defacement. Precision and care are required, for even earthly memorials demand meticulous calligraphy—how much more so those presented to the celestial court?

The vow is sealed, the incense reignited.

Fragrant Bureau Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all attending Fragrant Spirits—may the places where we perform the Dao naturally yield golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and divine herbs. May the hundred numinous perfected ones gather here, before the incense and flame. May the disciples who observe this fast, whether living or deceased, receive blessings; may their families and nations be graced with favor. May the ten directions’ immortal lads and jade maidens attend the fragrant smoke and swiftly convey all that we have petitioned to the Most True, Boundless, and Great Dao—the Three Clarities’ August Saints and the Jade Emperor’s celestial court.

*Exit the chamber*

Yet the Dao permits salvation and aids the state in establishing merit. As all who turn their hearts toward it cannot be refused, we now have the Great Dao disciple, the official so-and-so, acting for family and state, presenting his faith and submitting his petition. He requests the establishment of a grand Yellow Register Retreat, lasting so many days and nights, to conclude at the hour of the boar on such-and-such a day of such-and-such a month. May merit be accomplished and obstacles not arise—all relying upon the ritual register’s clerks and soldiers, the inner and outer officials, the host of perfected saints, and all responsive numinous spirits. By your great favor, may his sincere prayers be answered.

In the course of these invocations and submissions, should we have erred in offerings or violated ritual codes, or in any movement or stillness offended the divine and true, we now seek to repay the grace of your protection and entreat the bestowal of future blessings. Thus, as the rites conclude, we humbly prepare this offering feast, beseeching your majestic presence to deign to accept and receive it.

Your servants and disciples, unable to bear the weight of our reverent hope, prostrate ourselves in awe and trepidation, bowing again in homage.

We have heard that the Three Clarities’ exalted sages, the Five Venerables, the true numina of Heaven and Earth, and the mysterious directors of fate—
generate and complete the cosmos, nurture the ten thousand spirits.
Their embodiment harmonizes with non-action; their merit precedes the covering and bearing of all things.
Their divine efficacy is unfathomable; their virtue/power shines in both hidden and manifest realms.
They secretly protect the state and silently assist all beings.
No disaster remains unresolved; no peril goes unaverted.
Whatever is petitioned, they surely witness and safeguard.

Disciple So-and-so, turning his heart toward the Ten Poles, bows his head to the host of perfected ones,
beseeching that the merit of this retreat be recorded and the covenant of his devotions be attested.
May the ninefold ancestors and seven generations of this disciple ascend into the Vermilion Mound,
where clothing and sustenance arise spontaneously and he roams carefree through the Azure Empyrean.

May your servants and disciples see all misfortunes and calamities dispersed, all transgressions and burdens dissolved.
May true qi flourish within, and numinous officials guard without.
May their years and life be prolonged, their blessings and protection ever renewed.

May the Northern Palace release the dead; may the Southern Dipper raise them to new life.
May the local earth deities constantly provide vigilant protection.

Above, we pray for the emperor’s ten-thousand-year reign, for the flourishing of the altars of soil and grain.
May the realm know great peace, and weapons fall silent.
May the long night of the Nine Dark Realms see all reborn in Heaven.
May every being under the sky together ascend to the realm of longevity.

Your servants, still imperfect in their mastery of the Dao, fear transgressing the mysterious statutes.
We worry that our submissions may not reach, that our prayers may not be heard.
We humbly pray that the blue petitions and vermilion memorials swiftly ascend to the Nine Heavens,
that the true writs and numinous scriptures universally succor the hidden and manifest worlds.
May the mysterious wind spread far and wide, and beneficent blessings descend upon the earth below.
May the unseen and seen alike be graced with glory, and the living and dead alike know prosperity.

The rites of invocation and thanksgiving now complete, may the response be swift.
We, dust-bound and humble, dare not detain you long.
May the celestial perfected of the upper realms together ascend to their palaces.
May the numinous officials of the sacred peaks and rivers return each to their proper office.
May the fivefold bodily true officials revert to their celestial precincts.
We entreat that the grace of your ascent be manifestly bestowed.

Your servants and disciples, unable to bear the weight of our earnest prayers, prostrate ourselves in awe and trepidation, bowing again in homage.

May they partake of the offerings and respond to the sincerity of these rites, each returning to their respective domains. May they extol the transformative power of the Dao and assist in rectifying the upright while repelling evil. For so-and-so, may they dispel misfortune and ward off calamity. On the days of the Three Assemblies, their merits shall be duly reported. Should any transgress, the Orthodox Unity’s great law provides clear penalties.

All gods present, return each to your governance. Should there be further prayers and petitions, they shall be duly announced again.

**Hymn for Sending Forth the Gods**

Vast and formless, the empty void,
Yet deeply moved by heartfelt emotion.
Reverence draws forth Heaven’s grace,
Neglect invites demonic intrusion.
Fortune and misfortune rise with fate’s turning,
Adversity and prosperity arise from karmic conditions.
The Dao does not prize pearls or jade,
The gods respond only to utmost sincerity.
With crimson and azure hues, we toil in earnest,
Pouring forth our deepest devotion.
Naturally, the Great Sage is moved,
And all receive the descent of radiant numina.
Holding incense, we state our wishes,
Bowing in hope of auspicious blessings.
The Heavenly Worthy abides in quiescence,
Turn your hearts to reverence the unseen.

Next, proceed with the hymn of precepts, circling thrice to the position of the Precentor.

**The Heavenly Worthy’s Great Compassion**

The Heavenly Worthy, in great compassion,
Preaches the precepts to deliver all beings.
Virtue and power extend to the unseen and seen,
Karmic retribution moves the gods.
The hosts of heaven come to bow in homage,
The hordes of demons restrain their forms.
The past transcends the Eight Difficulties,
The present safeguards a thousand years of life.
The merit of the fast now draws to a close,
Together we send forth our devout sincerity.
The flowing Sanskrit chant soars like clouds,
Incense smoke mingles with the sound of voices.
Jade phoenixes bear the cinnabar carriage,
Golden dragons draw the emerald palanquin.
In life and death, all find joy,
Families and nations all know peace.

Next, complete the Three Bows of the precepts.

**The Officials Receive Their Duties**

The High Master, Precentor, Fast Supervisor, Scripture Attendants, Incense Attendants, and Lamp Attendants—each according to their station—proceed in order before the Three Treasures, bow once, and kneel. The tablet is presented to the High Master, who rises, performs the Three Bows, and retires to stand in their respective positions. The High Master rises, bows thrice, and returns to their place.

**The Vows**

First, may Heaven and Earth shine in purity;
Second, may the cosmos be clear and mysterious;
Third, may the sagely ruler enjoy myriad years;
Fourth, may transformation reach the Eight Limits;
Fifth, may Heaven bestow sweet dew;
Sixth, may Earth emit auspicious mist;
Seventh, may the four seasons follow their course;
Eighth, may the myriad things flourish in wholeness;
Ninth, may families abound in filial piety and fraternal duty;
Tenth, may the nation flourish with talent and wisdom;
Eleventh, may the merit of this fast spread widely;
Twelfth, may good omens daily increase.

**Replenishing the Incense Burner**

Incense Officials and Envoys, Lords of the Left and Right Dragon-Tiger, and all attending spirit officials—let them now, at the place where the memorial is presented, naturally generate golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and jade herbs. May the hosts of a hundred spirits and all the Perfected gather here before the incense burner. May the living and the dead receive blessings, and may families and nations be graced with favor.

The jade maidens and immortal youths of the Ten Directions, who attend the incense smoke, transmit the petitions we have just presented, directly reaching the presence of the Utmost True and Boundless Dao, the Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven.
