The Seven Primes of the Northern Dipper.
Petitioning the Five Marchmounts at the center,
The numinous mountains of the Four Quarters.
Petitioning the rivers and seas below,
The Twelve Fountainheads.
The Water Thearchs of the Nine Palaces,
The Great Spirits of the Vast Cold.
Today’s supplication is heard,
All vows are declared.
Conducting the retreat and performing the Dao,
Universally for the living and the dead.
Praying for the redemption of the Seven Ancestors,
The roots of karmic transgressions.
Reverently casting the Jade Tablet,
Praying it be heard above.
Inscribed in the Water Palace,
Ascending to heaven in the past.
Delivered from life and death,
All spirits hear the plea.
Presenting the Dragon Tablet,
Pledging alliance with the Water Thearchs.
Grant as petitioned,
Transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

The incantation concluded, the assembled officials bow twice more.
Next, cast the tablet into the Water Palace.
Chant the *Ode to the Dragon Tablet*.
Three bows.
Return to the incense burner.

The *Hymn to Lesser Immortals* concludes, dispersed as in the usual rite. The *Method for Casting the Earth Tablet* follows. Each bows to the master, visualizing as prescribed.

**Guardian of the Numinous**
Twenty-four strikes of the Dharma Drum.

To the Most High Three Heavens, the Mysterious Primordial Three Qi, the Supreme Lord Lao: summon forth from within this servant’s body the Three and Five Merit Officers, the Left and Right Attendant Envoys, the Left and Right Fragrant-Bearing Dragon Courier Scribes, the Golden Lads of Incense, the Jade Maidens of Transmission, and the Thirty-Six Fragrant Officers of the Five Thearchs’ Direct Registers for the Day.

At once summon the local Earth Gods and Domain Spirits, the True Officers and Righteous Deities, to swiftly emerge, array themselves, and open the gates.

This servant now burns incense and casts the tablet, praying that the Primordial Qi of the Ten Directions’ True and Upright Ones enter this body, that this petition swiftly ascend and directly reach the presence of the Most High Boundless Dao, the Nine Lands’ August Spirit of the Earth Mansion, and the Great Deities of the Underworld.

Each performs three bows.
Next, each declares their Dharma rank.
Then, facing the southwest, they descend in truth.
Next, kneeling in full prostration, they intone:

This servant reverently petitions the Most High Boundless Dao, the Supreme Three Worthies, the Ten Directions’ Perfected Great Sages, the Most Real Lords and Venerable Ones, the Eastern Flowery Radiance, Southern Culmen, Western Numinous, Northern Perfected, the Five Elder Thearchs, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Mysterious Center, the Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate, the Three Perfected of the Mysterious Unity, the Great Emperor of Fengdu, the Nine Mansion Palaces, the Masters of the Yellow Springs and Crooked Springs, the August High Thearch of the Boundless Realm, the Nine Lands’ August Spirit of the Seasons, the Central August, the Nine Lands’ Earth Gods of the Central Yellow, the Five Thearchs of the Earth Mansion, the officials of the Three Realms, the local Earth Gods and Domain Spirits, the True Officers and Righteous Deities, and all numinous spirits of this abode and dwelling.

This servant, born of coarse qi and foolish nature, has by karmic fortune encountered the True Dharma and auspicious causes. At the opening of the Numinous Treasure’s radiance and the proclamation of the Red Writ, this unworthy one was permitted to attend the Perfected. Aiding the state and serving the times, establishing merit and propagating the teachings, this servant received the Register of the Dharma on such-and-such a day, month, and year, from the Three Caverns’ Dharma Master, the Perfected of Such-and-Such Peak. The transmission included the Five Elder Perfected Texts, the Red Writ Numinous Chapters, the Three Divisions and Eight Effulgences, the Inner Sounds of All Heavens, the Two Registers of Gods and Immortals, the Eight Might Commandments, the Five Thearchs’ Talismanic Staffs, the Central Alliance Scriptures, and other texts. The transmission complete, the tablet is cast into the Central Palace, inscribed with a golden clasp—omitting the phrase “afterward twice without clasp” and these four characters.

Transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

The Yellow Register Retreat’s sponsor, on behalf of such-and-such an official or such-and-such a person, has established the Great Yellow Register Retreat for state and family, universally for the living and the dead. To dissolve calamities, atone for transgressions, pray for blessings, and beseech grace. The Daoist rites concluded, the tablet is cast upon the numinous altar, transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

Pray that the Earth Tablet erase transgressions and remove sins. May vows be fulfilled and lives preserved, bodies safeguarded. May names be inscribed in the Jade Calendar of the Nine Elder Immortals’ Capital. May the nine generations of ancestors, parents, karmic kin of countless kalpas, the previously and recently deceased, all partake of blessed causes. May they depart from the Nine Darks below, the Eight Gates’ realm, the earth prisons’ interiors, and the midst of suffering. May their calamitous records dissolve, their tombs and dwellings be purified. May evil roots be severed, and may they ascend to the Hall of Blessings. May this servant’s studies be perfected, merits and deeds resplendent. May life and death share in fortune, eternal protection without peril. May the emperor receive blessings, the world know peace.

This servant reverently petitions, praying for compassionate response. With utmost awe and trepidation, this servant kowtows twice more. Respectfully submitted.

Next, the tablet’s text is held and fumigated over incense. Twelve knocks of the teeth.
The tablet’s text read, it is sealed with yellow paper, bound with azure silk, and adorned with a dragon clasp and jade disk. The disciple holds it over the incense while the master intones:

Heaven and Earth unfold,
Myriad darknesses part, spirits divide.
The Three Origins unite in tally,
The Ten Directions shine in clarity.
The Five Peaks ascend in report,
Masters of death, stewards of life.
Cinnabar Writ, Red Text,
Primordial Scripture of the Most High.
Universally proclaimed to the Supreme,
The Nine Lands’ August Spirits.
Today’s supplication is heard,
All immortals’ lives are secured.
Conducting the retreat and performing the Dao,
Universally for the living and the dead.
This servant’s vow, this servant’s immortality,
Pray cast the jade name.
Earth Mansion’s August Thearch,
Inscribe and remove the sentence of punishment.
Petition the Upper Palace,
Engrave the register in the Flowery Clarity.
May this body ascend in flight,
Heaven and Earth share in numinosity.
Nine generations of karmic kin,
Rotten bones renewed in glory.
Souls ascend to the Southern Palace,
Refined in the Immortals’ Court.
Today’s decree proclaimed,
All spirits hear the plea.
Pray with the golden clasp,
Manifest utmost sincerity.
Grant as petitioned,
Transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

The incantation concluded, the assembled officials bow twice more.
Next, cast the tablet into the altar’s center or beneath the lunar station.
Chant the *Ode to the Dragon Tablet*.
Three bows.

The furnace is restored. Upon concluding the *Primary School of Immortals’ Hymns*, disperse this earthen tablet. On the night of merit’s proclamation, after the recitation of incantations and hymns, by dawn it may be buried within the altar—no further petition or announcement is required. Here, following the rites of Master Zhang Chengguang, three tablets are presented for petition, each corresponding to a distinct true rank; thus, they are recorded again.

If within the altar of the purification fast, only the proclamation of merit is made, and at the time of the libation the incantation is recited, the tablet may then be cast. As for the mountain and water tablets, though proclaimed with the merit’s announcement and the incantation concluded, if a libation is set at the grotto’s site, one must proceed in proper sequence: each is recited, sealed with incantation, and then cast. This ensures completeness; one must not, having petitioned within the altar, proceed directly to the mountain and cast them at will. The true spirits may fail to acknowledge receipt, the merit may not reach its destination, and the loss would be grave—utmost care and deliberation are essential.

The reason for petitioning these mountain and water tablets within the altar is that the fast’s sponsor or disciples, constrained by public or private affairs, may be unable to personally visit the grotto’s gate. Thus, they are proclaimed together within the altar. If the sponsor or disciples do not shrink from the distance of mountains and waters or the toil of ascent, and personally accompany the assembled officials to the grotto’s precincts, then on the night of merit’s proclamation, after the memorial is presented, only the earthen tablet is petitioned. The mountain and water tablets are set aside, to be addressed in their proper rites at the mountain and water sites—this is most fitting. Careful deliberation must guide action; one must not cling rigidly to the text.

When casting the three tablets, it is most excellent to burn one or two hundred paper coins for the local earth deity.

**Method for Casting the Five Thearchs’ Tablets on the Three Primes and Eight Nodal Days to Seek Pardon for Transgressions and Petition the True Ones**
*From the* True Writ Jade Formulae

**Supreme Petition Tablet for the Lingbao Tradition to Remove Transgressions and Seek Immortality at the Five Marchmounts and Sacred Mountains**

Lingbao so-and-so, Master of the Imperial Thearchs, your servant [Name], aged [X] years, born in the month of [X], fate governed by the Thearch of [X], name registered at [X] Marchmount. Aspiring to transcendence, aspiring to immortality, to attain long life and cross the world’s bounds, to soar and ascend to the Upper Clarity. O True Ones of the Five Marchmounts, most divine, most numinous: beseech that my transgressions be erased from the records, my name inscribed in the Nine Heavens. Petition to approach the sacred mountain, transmitted via the Golden Dragon Courier.

[Reign title, era name, year, month, first day, day, hour] at this [location] the proclamation is made.

These three tablet texts each include the year, name, and governing Thearch. The aspiration for transcendence and immortality, and the following text, are as stated in the Water Mansion’s earthen tablet and the Yellow Register’s water tablet. The sealing incantation of the Dragon-Wall Clasp is as in the previous fast’s method.

For the first casting of the three tablets, each uses nine clasps. For the second and third castings, only the dragon tablet is used, without clasps.

After casting is complete, scatter incense, pour forth water, and chant the hymn:

The Primal Beginning’s covenant shines,
Immortals’ names are inscribed.
The Three Offices, Nine Bureaus—
No transgression remains unremoved.
Scatter incense to the Five Thearchs,
Proclaim the covenant to the Great Void.
As petitioned, may I dwell
Through ten thousand kalpas.

Three bows.

With utmost sincerity, prostrate and bow to the Most High, Boundless Dao.
With utmost sincerity, prostrate and bow to the Thirty-Six Divisions of the Venerable Scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, prostrate and bow to the Great Dharma Master of the Mysterious Center.

The furnace is restored.
O Fragrant Officer Envoys, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, Attendant Fragrant Spirits: may the place where your servant casts the tablet spontaneously generate golden liquor, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms. May the hundred spirits and host of true ones gather here, before the grotto’s furnace. May your servant, in learning the Dao, attain the Dao; in seeking immortality, attain immortality. May the jade maidens and immortal youths of the ten directions attend the fragrant smoke, swiftly conveying the words just proclaimed to the Most High, Boundless Dao, before the Sun Valley Divine King and the Nine Rivers’ Water Mansion and Water Thearch.

Each: three bows.

The *Primary School of Immortals’ Hymns* is sung as usual.

The Dao speaks: You who with sincere heart set forth upon the supreme Dao, desiring to deliver all celestial beings, all good men and women, from the Three Evils, the Five Paths, and the Eight Difficulties—may they transcend the Three Evils, and in every life encounter the Dao. On the days of the Eight Nodes and the first of the month, cast the Three Primes’ jade tablets. Erase the records of past transgressions, inscribe names in Heaven. After three offerings, the Three Offices, Nine Bureaus, and all celestial realms will relay the petition to Heaven.

To the right, distinguish the myriad spirits, reverently guard the Five Thearchs. Attend and protect the Three Realms, oversee the gates and portals. Purify Heaven and Earth; gods, earth deities, sun, and moon come to pay homage. A thousand demons, ten thousand spirits dare not rashly intrude. With steadfast resolve, all endeavors are fulfilled. Seven generations of ancestors are liberated; from the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, they ascend to Heaven’s halls. Karmic retribution for good and evil in life and death is repaid in kind. The Three Offices and Nine Bureaus record merits and transgressions—this principle is most clear. Through countless lives, not a hair’s breadth is lacking.

If there are those of utmost dedication—emperors, kings, rulers of lands, officials, all people, nine generations of ancestors, those trapped in the Three Paths of darkness—who undertake the great Yellow Register fast for three days and nights, proclaim the covenant to the Nine Heavens, and cast the Three Primes’ tablets, the blessings and benefits are boundless, beyond words. You who earnestly uphold this, do not grow lax or idle, lest demons mar your body.

Master Daoist Zhang Chengguang says: Upon ascending the altar and receiving the Lingbao Central Covenant, in accordance with the *Spontaneous Golden Regulations*, cast ten golden clasps, release the dragon into the clear spring—this is the way to seek immortality. Ascend the altar again to receive the Five Elders’ Red Writ, the Two Registers, staff, and scepter, and stabilize resolve through contemplation of the subtle. Following the *Luminous True Regulations*, cast the Three Dragons’ twenty-seven clasps, with the mountain, water, and dwelling as pledges for the study of immortality. Then, with the jade formula, separately cast nine dragons’ twenty-seven clasps, and on the Eight Nodal Days cast the mountain, water, and dwelling tablets, forever erasing the records of transgressions and inscribing names in Heaven. Upon concluding the Yellow Register fast, cast the dragon tablet as well, following only the Three Primes’ tablet text, without additional proclamations or established oral formulae. The ignorant masses, passing this down, practice in confusion. In the past, I encountered my master, Lord Lu, who communed with spirits and entered the wondrous, whose words accorded with principle—none failed to evoke response.

The sublime resides in the heart, yet its writings lack ritual forms. If one merely copies and submits them according to the scriptural text, the mountain, water, and dwelling spirits will not be duly recorded—all actions, seen and unseen, will be reckless, greatly deviating from the Mysterious Tradition. Thus, I have composed these *Three-Part Petition Texts*, each addressed to its respective immortal bureau. Additionally, I have separately set forth *Three Tablet Ready-Made Formulae*. Now, if one follows these clearly in practice, one will surely receive the carving of one’s name in the registers and the erasure of transgressions, with one’s name recorded in the Nine Mysteries. This will elevate one’s family to prior glory, cause one’s studies to flourish, and secure immortality in life and death. I reveal this to my disciples, to be revered and kept secret.

Guangting states: The Great Dao, through the One *qi*, generates and transforms the Three Powers, shaping the myriad existences. Thus, the Three Primes’ courts were established to govern transgressions and blessings—namely, the Three Officials of Heaven, Earth, and Water, who truly preside over the Three Primes. Human life and death, longevity and early demise, transgressions and goodness, fortune and misfortune—none are not bound to them. The *Three Register Tablet Texts* are likewise the canonical forms of the Three Primes. In the method of the fast, one should submit the three tablets to report to the Three Primes. Thus, the mountain tablet is submitted to the Heavenly Cavern of Prostration, petitioning the Celestial Official of the Upper Prime; the water tablet is submitted to the Numinous Spring Water Palace, reporting to the Water Official of the Lower Prime; and the earth tablet is submitted at the altar or dwelling, reporting to the Earth Official of the Middle Prime. Within the tablet texts, the titles and ranks of the true spirits are clearly set forth.

In recent times, only the mountain and water tablets have been submitted. However, in the regions beyond the Huai and Zhe rivers, the ritual of the three tablets has long been practiced. Now, upon examining the origins, I have found the texts recorded by Master Zhang Chengguang, which petition the Three Primes with great precision, leaving no doubt in the submission and offering of pledges. Thus, they may be followed as a permanent model. Not only in receiving the scriptures but also in submitting the three tablets and conducting the fast for deliverance, all depend on the Three Primes. If all three tablets are duly submitted, the tallying of meritorious deeds will reach the courts of the Three Officials. Those who cultivate and uphold this Way should not hesitate or doubt.

*Concluding the Fifty-Fifth Scroll of the* Supreme Yellow Register Fast Ritual
*Beginning the Fifty-Sixth Scroll of the* Supreme Yellow Register Fast Ritual

Revised by Master Du Guangting of the Tang, *Ritual of the Lantern*

The method of the ritual lantern originates from the *Golden Register* scriptures. In all fasts and Dao-trails, burning incense and kindling lanterns are the most urgent tasks. Incense conveys the heart’s sincerity and ascends to move the perfected spirits. Lanterns dispel darkness and illuminate the hidden, opening the underworld’s eternal night. Thus, the scriptures decree: burning incense and kindling lanterns illumine the blessed halls of all heavens above and the long-night hells below. Suffering souls and stagnant spirits, riding this radiance, may at last attain liberation.

Since lanterns must each follow their proper method, they are arrayed according to the fundamental numbers of the Five Phases: nine in spring, three in summer, seven in autumn, five in winter, and twelve in the four seasons. The positions of lanterns for all heavens, all earths, the Eight Trigrams, and the Nine Underworlds are arranged according to their directions in the complete register texts.

When incense is burned and invocations are chanted, blessings swiftly descend and misfortunes naturally dissolve. Whether on the night of the fast’s commencement or during its three- or seven-day course, lanterns are kindled according to the method. At dusk, when the Dao-trail concludes, the altar is exited. At the earth-gate, with hymns and banners, in measured and elegant steps, the master leads the assembled officials and disciples in circumambulation beneath the lanterns, chanting invocations at each position. After each invocation, the officials and disciples bow. Upon completion, with a resonant, empty tone, they are guided back before the Mystic Master. The dispersal follows the usual ritual.

*Hymn of the Illumined Lantern*
The Most High scatters light in the ten directions,
Floral lanterns convey pure sincerity.
All heavens glow resplendent,
All earths shine with clarity.
My body, too, becomes luminous,
The five viscera blossoming in splendor.
The blazing radiance illumines the Great Void,
Far-reaching thoughts reach the Jade Capital.

This hymn is chanted in a drawn-out voice in the eastern regions of Songshan, the Yellow River, and Tonghua. At dusk, ascending the altar, the master of invocations is led beneath the lanterns. When the lantern ritual begins, this hymn is chanted first, and the assembly circumambulates the lanterns once, then arranges ranks at the earth-gate to chant invocations, thus fulfilling the ritual.

The officials arrange their ranks at the earth-gate. The master speaks:

The Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate and Great Void declare: Yin and yang conjoin in form, heaven and earth divide in shape. Day and night differ, light and darkness diverge. Thus, the pure and ethereal manifest as the abodes of immortals and sages in all heavens, while the turbid and dense flow into the realms of ghosts and spirits in all earths. Above the Nine Heavens, yin qi is wholly dispelled; below the Nine Earths, yang radiance is forever barred. In these shadowed realms, no light remains. At midday, they are veiled in thick mist; at dusk, they sink deeper into gloom. The souls of the long night have no means to awaken. Some beings, devoid of good karma and burdened by past sins, have since their deaths sunk into hell, enduring myriad torments, imprisoned in Fengdu. Deprived of the Three Luminaries, they suffer for kalpas uncounted.

Our Heavenly Worthy, in great compassion, opens many gates of salvation. He bequeaths the scripture of kindling lanterns to continue the light and illumine the night. Where the numinous radiance reaches, sins and afflictions are all dispelled. Through the merit of repentance and deliverance, they may fulfill the vow of rebirth.

If there are good men and good women who arouse the mind for the supreme Dao, follow the regulations, and come to the fast, preparing incense and oil, they may kindle lanterns on behalf of the sovereign, the emperor, the ruler and ministers, fathers and sons, the Three Wretched Paths, and the Nine Nights—whether in darkness or light—illuminating within and without according to the method. Above, they reflect upon the heavens and the halls of blessings; below, they shine upon the Nine Earths and the depths of hell.

May the suffering souls be delivered, the benighted spirits illuminated. Shall the nine generations ascend to heaven? The Three Wretched Paths cease their accusations. Blessings extend to all, and merit knows no bounds. Know then that such a person, having accumulated good causes over kalpas, shall surely attain the Dao.

Now, so-and-so official, so-and-so, has established the *Huanglu Lingbao* fast, following the ritual texts to kindle lanterns in offering. May it be that the emperor enjoys blessings, the Three Luminaries shine brightly, the seven generations ascend to heaven, and the Three Paths become radiant and serene. In this life, may divine spirits venerate and protect, true sages guard and sustain. May the fortune be majestic, and the immortal fruit be eternally attained.

The disciple bows twice.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the Dao gate, kindle two lanterns to illuminate the residence of the fast’s sponsor. For the disciple, to dispel calamities and transcend misfortune, to pacify the residence and secure the spirits.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
The Dharma Master intones:
*"The light of the Orthodox Unity shines upward in crimson smoke.
Twelve Light-Opening Lads,
illumine all under heaven and our own bodies.
A hundred evils are shattered, ten thousand ghosts repelled.
The radiance is bright and clear, communicating with the true and reaching the numinous.
Ascending into the formless, merging with the Dao’s spontaneity."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the position of one’s life destiny, kindle three lanterns to illuminate the three souls. For the disciple, to restrain evil and transcend adversity, to bind and guard the three souls.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"The yang light shines brilliantly, the three souls arise of themselves.
All spirits are recorded, ever attached to my form.
Like the sun at its zenith, may I forever stand firm."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the position of one’s current age, kindle seven lanterns to illuminate the seven po. For the disciple, to pacify the spirits and avert misfortune, to restrain the po and expel evil.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"The bright lanterns gather light, the wandering essences do not flee.
The seven po are secure, all spirits return in full.
Like the moon at its zenith, may I forever abide in radiance."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the position of the Grand Year, kindle one lantern to illuminate the year-star. For the disciple, to eliminate a year’s disasters and bring blessings and fortune.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"The Grand Yang flows its brilliance, its radiance filling the four directions.
Illuminating my body, sevenfold and ninefold encircling.
Within, it shines; without, it brightens, penetrating the great void."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the great tomb, kindle three lanterns to illuminate the ancestral burial mounds of the fast’s sponsor. For the disciple, to deliver and transcend the departed souls of former generations, to be reborn in pure realms, to sever karmic entanglements, and resolve the disasters of retribution.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"Bowing toward the tomb positions of gong, yu, chen, shang, chou, jue, wei, zheng, and xu.*
*The Grand Yin is dark, kalpas without end.
The yang light shines brilliantly, illuminating the decayed bones below.
The souls receive the light, refining their forms and returning to the womb.
Born in pure realms, they dwell in joy and harmony."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the lesser tomb, kindle five lanterns to illuminate the recent burial mounds of the fast’s sponsor. To deliver the divine spirits and enable rebirth in heaven, to benefit and protect the living, and to prosper blessings and fortune.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"Bowing toward the tomb positions of gong, yu, xu, jue, chou, shang, wei, and zheng.*
*The long night is dark, kalpas without end.
The light hides in the Grand Yin, the seven po drift and flee.
The Crimson Numinous Lads, the Grand Yang shines brilliantly.
Illuminating the souls and po, the divine spirits return as one."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, before the altar hall, kindle seven lanterns to illuminate the seven generations of ancestors. May the suffering souls and benighted spirits be reborn in heaven.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"Heaven turns, earth revolves, the ages shift in succession.
The Nine Darks are lightless, the seven generations unseen.
The Grand Yang opens the way, the dead souls respond and return.
The bright lanterns continue the night, the decayed bones shine anew."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, in the central courtyard, kindle the lanterns of the Nine Darks to illuminate the long-night abodes of the Nine Darks. To deliver the departed souls of the disciple’s ancestors within the Nine Darks, that they may behold the light.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"The Nine Darks are dark, kalpas without light.
The long night imprisons the souls, the Primordial Beginning unopened.
The flower lanterns continue the light, illuminating the Earthly Sovereign below.
Delivering the seven generations, ascending to the heavenly palaces.
Illuminating within and without, may they become immortal kings for all generations."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the side gates, kindle two lanterns to illuminate the palace and residence. For the disciple, to expel evil and capture malevolence, to protect the entire household.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"The yang light opens and brightens, crimson smoke blazes in splendor.
The Grand Flame Lads guard the mysterious gates.
Illuminating the palace and residence, the four windows and eight openings are revealed.
Expelling ghosts and capturing evil, ten thousand spirits are shattered.
The Three Realms venerate and protect, generation after generation unwaning.
All the perfected gather, sun and moon shine together."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the earthly gate, kindle twenty-four lanterns to illuminate the twenty-four vital breaths. For the disciple, to prolong life and augment qi, to increase blessings and pacify the spirits, to inscribe the name in the register of the living and erase it from the ledger of the dead.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*"Bowing toward the earthly gate.*
*The Three Divisions and Eight Luminaries compose my body.
The twenty-four breaths form my spirit.
The bright lanterns arise of themselves, ascending to the Great Mystery.
My body transcends water and fire, merging with qi’s spontaneity.
The Eight Luminaries align as one—may I attain divine transcendence."*

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the eight directions, kindle eight lanterns to illuminate the eight trigrams. For the disciple, to illuminate the eight reaches, open the nine palaces, secretly guard the eight spirits, and open the eight directions.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*Bowing toward the royal presence.*
The Three Luminaries shine brightly, the Eight Trigrams open their portals.
Heavenly qi quietly seals, the Great Yin conceals its light.
The resplendent lanterns illuminate—may all vows be fulfilled.
My body enters radiance, to eternally partake of boundless blessings.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the four cardinal directions and the center, kindle nine lanterns to illuminate the nine palaces. For the disciple, to transcend the nine palaces’ calamities and inscribe their name among the nine celestial palaces’ immortals.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
The Nine and Five stand divided, heaven and earth unfold.
Mysterious light lies hidden, the Great Yin does not brighten.
May my resplendent lanterns ascend to illuminate the nine palaces.
The dark night clears—may my vows prosper.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the ten directions, kindle ten lanterns to illuminate the ten extremities. For the disciple, to illuminate the ten poles, summon the true and descend the numinous, dissolve calamities, and inscribe their name in the ten heavens.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*Bowing toward the celestial gate.*
Heaven opens, earth seals; the mysterious Yin does not shine.
Crimson smoke ascends, for me it pierces the unseen.
The honored deities of the ten directions, with their profound vision, behold my form.
My soul and spirit glow resplendently, naturally radiant in essence.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the four directions, kindle twenty-eight lanterns to illuminate the twenty-eight constellations. For the disciple, to erase their name from the ledger of the dead and augment their inscription among the living. The Northern Dipper decrees death, the Southern Dipper extends life.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*Bowing toward the southeast.*
The bright star blazes brilliantly, its light flowing through the ten gates.
Mysterious essence descends, illuminating the Nine Dark Realms of the north.
I kindle the resplendent lanterns, riding their light to ascend and be heard.
May I attain the azure canopy to illuminate my form and soul.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, above the celestial gate, kindle thirty-six lanterns to illuminate the thirty-six heavens. For the disciple, to deliver their seven generations of ancestors and ascend them into paradise.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
*Bowing toward the celestial gate.*
The Dragon Han era stretches boundlessly, the Three Qi ride the mysterious.
The Brahmanic path is distant, the Maitreya’s great chiliocosm vast.
My long soul gazes upward, yearning endlessly.
Today’s bright lanterns—may my vow to attain immortality be fulfilled.
With my seven ancestors, may we together ascend the celestial realms.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, at the five directions, kindle five lanterns to illuminate the five sacred peaks. For the disciple, to inscribe their name in the immortal register and safeguard their bodily form.

The disciple performs three bows beneath the lanterns.
The numinous mountains of the five peaks stand guard over the five directions.
The honored deities of the Five Emperors, the ancestral lineage of immortals.
Today I kindle lanterns, ascending to illuminate the Heavenly Kings.
May my destiny be recorded, my passage into the immortal palaces assured.
May my seven ancestors be liberated, together ascending the Great Void.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: The *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity* bear the weightiest merit. Above, they illuminate the heavens; below, they illuminate the earth. For eight directions and nine nights, all witness the radiance. Those who behold these lanterns shall have their sins extinguished and blessings arise. The one who kindles the lanterns shall receive profound fortune. Their nine generations of ancestors shall ascend to paradise, departing sorrow and suffering, forever escaping the Nine Dark Realms. They shall roam freely in the Upper Prime, within the immortal palaces. The living shall know peace, descendants shall flourish, households shall be purified, and myriad calamities shall not encroach. The living and the dead shall be delivered, and all shall bear the grace of life and death. The merit is boundless, and all aspirations shall be fulfilled. For family and nation, all shall enjoy prosperity and harmony. For nine nights and the Three Wretched Realms, all shall ascend the true Dao. Universally, we revere the Supreme Honored One.

Next, recite the *Lesser Immortal Hymn of Praise*, lead to the presence of the Mysterious Master, and disperse according to the usual rites. Extinguish the lanterns at dawn.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, the officials responsible for the lanterns must diligently attend to their duties. Ensure the lanterns’ light shines brightly throughout the night, without extinguishing midway. If they dim partially, the one responsible shall incur fault—this must be heeded with care.

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, extinguish the lanterns at dawn. The Dharma Master recites the incantation:
*"The mysterious Yin seals its light, the eternal lanterns continue to shine.*
*The Great Yang has dawned, the Eight Dark Realms open and clear.*
*The lanterns return to the Great Yin, their light merging with the radiant essence.*
*The Two Perfected Ones of Sun and Moon unite with me."*
Upon completing the incantation, extinguish the lanterns.

Whenever conducting the *Yellow Register Fast*, one must follow the true texts and jade instructions. Apart from kindling lanterns in the four seasons, separately kindle the various lanterns of the *Golden Register* according to the rites, completing the bows and incantations. Whether performing the rites for three consecutive days or completing the bows and incantations in a single night, all shall receive blessings and benefits, and both the living and the dead shall partake of grace. Even without a fast altar, one may specially kindle these lanterns. Following the rites with bows and incantations, the merit shall be equivalent. Those who revere goodness should widely propagate this.

Alternatively, within the fast, kindle the *Nine Dark Realms Lanterns* and perform the separate rites of bows and incantations. Even without a fast, one may specially kindle the *Nine Dark Realms Lanterns* for the living or the dead, also performing the separate rites of bows and incantations. The ritual procedures are appended below.

**Rites and Incantations for the Nine Dark Realms Spirit Lanterns**

The *True Immortal Section of the Upper Prime Golden Register Ritual Texts* states: For the *Lantern-Kindling Rites of Dignity*, to eliminate celestial calamities for the emperor and rulers, rectify the celestial divisions, pacify the myriad people, and deliver the living and the dead, kindle the *Nine Dark Realms Spirit Lanterns*. Above, they illuminate the nine celestial halls of fortune; below, they illuminate the nine dark realms of hell. Both humans and heavens receive grace, and the living and the dead bear the favor.

The *Wondrous Scripture of the Nine Perfected Marvelous Precepts and the Golden Register for Deliverance* states: Across the eight directions of heaven and earth lie the nine dark realms of hell. The tormented and exiled sinful souls arise from the sins committed in life and death. After their bodies perish, they sink into the Three Wretched Realms, enduring retribution endlessly, with no means of liberation. In the eternal night, they never behold light. Were it not for the great sages’ compassion and the opening of karmic deliverance by good causes, they would dwell in darkness forever, their suffering unending through eons. Thus, the Heavenly Worthy established the statutes, composing the *Lantern-Kindling Rites*.

Following the radiance of the western sun, its light illumines the depths of the Yellow Springs. Where its flowing brilliance reaches, the suffering of forsaken souls is stilled. Where its divine splendor shines, the anguish of the dark and forlorn ceases. The merit of kindling lanterns brings boundless blessings—whether to deliver the departed or to dispel calamity and remove misfortune.

One should prepare fragrant oil and journey to the sacred temples. With sincere devotion, bow in reverence, and with utmost piety, gaze upon the true numina. Burn incense, kindle lanterns, and offer rites with vows and worship. Through earnest sincerity and heartfelt devotion, the power of blessings extends. The departed ascend to heaven, and the living receive grace. The doctrine of karmic retribution fully encompasses the law of cause and effect. The *Golden Register*, *Nine Dark Realms*, and *Numinous Treasure* scriptures briefly expound its principles; here, we shall not elaborate further.

As for the *Nine Dark Realms Lanterns*, one must procure pure and fragrant oil, refraining from wealth obtained through unrighteous means or impure, defiled substances. Alternatively, infuse various incenses into the oil, so that the lamp’s flame burns with purity, diffusing its fragrance. Above, it moves the heavens; below, it purges foul impurities. The lantern’s light shines brightly, dispelling darkness and continuing illumination—thus accruing great merit.

The *Nine Dark Realms Lanterns* should be arranged before the sacred altar in the grand hall of the multitude of sages, divided into nine trees. Align them according to the nine directions, with nine lamps on each tree. Alternatively, each tree may have nine tiers, with nine lamps per tier. The number nine times nine accords with the pattern of heaven and earth. Below, it opens the nine nights; above, it reaches the nine mysteries. Delivering the living and rescuing the dead is the most sacred of blessings. For those of limited means, even nine lamps suffice—full preparation is not required. In this rite, one need only burn incense and invoke the true, offering sincere prayers in silent devotion. The merit thus communicated is of the same essence.

Alternatively, one may prepare nine portions—or eighty-one—of water, congee, and seasonal fruits, arranging them before the nine directions, which is especially refined. Next, burn incense, meditate upon the deities, and strike the teeth twenty-four times. Then, make the invocation...

The officiant, your humble servant [Name], respectfully invokes the Local Domain True Officials, the Day-Directing Messengers, and the Void-Space Surveillance and Response Spirit Bureau. Now, on behalf of [Name] for [matter] at [location], we kindle the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps to beseech grace and bestow blessings.

May this rite ascend to connect with the Three Luminaries above and descend to address the Nine Depths below. Through prayer and communion, may merit be accomplished. All that is petitioned and all that is wished, may it be granted as spoken.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Central Heaven, their radiance piercing the light, their brilliance suffusing the ten thousand directions.
At the center, they shine upon the divine precincts of the Central Palace and the sacred lands of the Nine Provinces, where malevolence vanishes in concealment and calamities cease.
Below, they penetrate the Central Universal Prison, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. The blades of the Sword Trees sheathe their edges; the knives of the Knife Mountains still their blades. The destitute souls end their torments; the sin-laden spirits halt their anguish. Freed from suffering, they ascend to heaven, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Eastern Limitless Heavens, where the yang light blazes resplendent, suffusing the Eastern Quarter.
At the center, they shine upon the Eastern Palace, the Mao sector, and the domain of the Azure Emperor, sweeping away calamities and dispelling baleful vapors.
Below, they penetrate the Eastern Wind-and-Thunder Hell, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. All flying spears and drifting halberds, all thunderclaps and lightning bolts, cease their terrors and end their torments. The sin-laden souls are pardoned and absolved. Having fulfilled their karma, they ascend to heaven, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Southern Limitless Heavens, where the yang essence shines resplendent, its brilliance boundless.
At the center, they shine upon the Wu sector, the Nine Palaces, and the wilds of the Vermilion Emperor, pacifying calamities and dispelling baleful influences.
Below, they penetrate the Southern Fire-Shrouded Hell, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. All who endure the Fire City and Fire Mountain, who swallow flames and consume embers—every destitute soul—attains coolness and relief, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Western Limitless Heavens, where the divine light blazes radiant, suffusing the vast firmament.
At the center, they shine upon the Western Palace, the You sector, and the domain of the White Emperor, sweeping away filth and cleansing calamities.
Below, they penetrate the Western Vajra Hell, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. All who endure the iron staves and metal hammers cease their torments. The destitute souls end their suffering; the accumulated sins are pardoned. Swiftly they ascend to heaven, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Northern Limitless Heavens, where the auspicious light blazes, its brilliance boundless.
At the center, they shine upon the Kan sector, the First Palace, and the wilds of the Black Emperor, dispelling evil filth and cleansing calamities.
Below, they penetrate the Northern Dark-and-Cold Hell, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. All who endure the torments of poisonous juices and icy pools, the agony of freezing halberds and frosty blades, the suffering of sin-laden souls—all ascend to heaven, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Northeastern Limitless Heavens, where the numinous light shines clear, suffusing the void.
At the center, they shine upon the Gen trigram, the Eighth Palace, and the wilds of the Chou and Yin sectors, clearing away calamities and dispelling baleful influences.
Below, they penetrate the Northeastern Cauldron-and-Boiling Hell, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. All destitute souls receive this blessing. The iron forks and boiling cauldrons cease their torments; suffering and anguish end. Swiftly they ascend to heaven, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Southeastern Limitless Heavens, where the light shines universally, its brilliance boundless.
At the center, they shine upon the Xun trigram, the Fourth Palace, and the wilds of the Chen and Si sectors, purging evil and dispelling calamities.
Below, they penetrate the Southeastern Bronze-Pillar Hell, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. All sin-laden souls are spared from scorching and decay. Their sinful roots are eradicated; within and without, they are cleansed. All ascend to heaven, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Southwestern Limitless Heavens, where the numinous light shines clear, suffusing the void.
At the center, they shine upon the Kun sector, the wilds of the Jing and Shen sectors, clearing away calamities and dispelling baleful influences.
Below, they penetrate the Southwestern Slaughter Hell, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. All sin-laden souls are spared the agony of sharp blades and keen edges. Swiftly they ascend to heaven, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

The disciple [Name] kindles the Nine Nights’ Spirit Lamps:
Above, they illuminate the Blessed Halls of the Northwestern Limitless Heavens, where the light shines universally, its brilliance boundless.
At the center, they shine upon the Qian Palace and the wilds of the Kui and Bi sectors, purging evil and dispelling calamities.
Below, they penetrate the Northwestern Fire-Cart Hell, shattering all darkness and revealing all light. All sin-laden souls receive this blessing. The fire-carts cease their bellows; the torments of scorching ash and embers end. Swiftly they ascend to heaven, carefree and joyous.

The disciple bows twice.

Here ends the fifty-sixth scroll of the *Highest Clarity Yellow Register Fast Rites*.

*The Highest Clarity Yellow Register Fast Rites, Scroll Fifty-Seven*
*Edited by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting*

*The Eight Celestial True Writs*

The Yellow Register Fast is fundamentally purposed to deliver the souls of the departed, elevate the wandering spirits, open the path through the long night, and ferry the lost from the depths of the Yellow Springs. Yet its merit extends further: averting calamities and summoning blessings, atoning for transgressions and seeking grace, its cultivation spans the realms of humans and heavens, its benefits embrace both households and nations—no merit remains unbestowed.

The *Five Elders’ Vermilion Writs of the Numinous Treasure*, which it enshrines, serve four distinct functions when invoked in detail:

First, for seeking immortality and receiving the Dao: the twenty-four characters descending from the Nine Qi of the Eastern Direction.
Second, for warding off and restraining stellar influences: the thirty-two characters descending from Jupiter, the Liver-Assisting Star.
Third, for subduing and vanquishing demonic forces: the thirty-two characters descending from the Incantation of the Eastern Mountain Spirit.
Fourth, for dispelling and mitigating water-borne disasters: the thirty-two characters descending from the Subjugation of the Eastern River below.

The applications of these five writs are herein complete.

As recorded in the ritual canons of Celestial Master Zhang Wanfu of the Pure Capital Abbey in the Western Capital: the esoteric languages of the heavens and the *Eightfold Jade Scripts of the Assemblies* were expounded by the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning in the Fragrant Grove Garden to the Youth of Supreme Wisdom. They deliver from the Five Sufferings and universally rescue the Nine Nether Realms. In the rites for the transference of spirits, they are engraved upon stone and put into practice.

Here follows the translation:

For the present Yellow Register Fast and Altar rites, these texts are fitting for use. Whether in felicitous or inauspicious observances, their apportionment is just and proper. May they circulate for kalpas eternal.

The incantations are to be burned, the same as the true writs. There are established methods for this, to be jointly propagated.

Written on the fifth day of the tenth month, the *guiwei* day of the *xinyou* year of the Tianfu era (901), by Du Guangting, Feathered Robe of Tianmu Peak, in homage to the Sage.

All true writs are to be inscribed in cinnabar upon azure paper, together with the *Eight Hidden Characters of Heaven* and the *Jade Writs of the Central Heaven*, to guard the five directions of the fast altar. On the eve of the rite, the texts are read aloud; thereafter, a golden dragon is placed to secure them. Upon the dispersal of the altar, the texts are read aloud at night, whereupon the disciple holds them above the incense smoke. When the Dharma Master completes the incantation, they are burned in accordance with the memorial casket, precisely as prescribed in the *Rites of the Numinous Treasure True Writs*.

**Eastern Jade Writ**
Dǎnlóu Āhuì, Wúxiǎng Guānyīn.
Xūyán Míngshǒu, Fǎlǎn Pútán.
Jiànà Āyì, Hūhē Liúyín.
Huādū Qūlì, Xiānpú Yùzhēn.
Táiluò Dàfàn, Sàn yān qìngyún.
Fēisǎ Yùdū, Míng mó shàng mén.
Wúxíng Shàngshǒu, Huízhí Liúxuán.
Ātuó Lóngluó, Sìxiàng Xūfù.

**Southern Jade Writ**
Nányán Dòngfú, Yùmóu Shēnshēn.
Fànxíng Luòkōng, Jiǔlíng Chuīqián.
Zéluò Pútái, Lǜluó Dàqiān.
Miǎomǎng Jiǔchǒu, Sháo yáo yán zāo.
Yún shàng Jiǔdū, Fēishēng zì qiān.
Nàyù Yùfù, Móluó Fǎlún.
Wù chí wú jìng, Lǎnzī Yùnróng.
Fùlǎng Kuòyì, Shényīng zì gōng.

**Western Jade Writ**
Dāolì Chányóu, Póní Jiùtōng.
Wǎnsǒu Dí sè, Tài miǎo zhī táng.
Liúluó Fànméng, Jǐngwèi Xiāoyú.
Yì miǎo wú jì, Wǎnshǒu Shǎodū.
Āyù Yùzhú, Huámò Yányóu.
Jiǔkāi Zìbiàn, Āluó Pǐnshǒu.
Wúliàng Fúgài, Fúluó Hé shén.
Yù dàn Chángsāng, □ kōng dù xiān.

**Northern Jade Writ**
Juéwú Zìyù, Jiǔrì Dǎoqián.
Kūnmǔ Dōngfù, Xíng shè shàng xuán.
Tuóluó Yùmiǎo, Miǎo qì hé yún.
Fēitiān Dàchǒu, Zǒngjiān Shàngtiān.
Shātuó Jiéliàng, Lónghàn Yīngxiān.
Bìluò Fúlí, Kōng gē bǎo zhēn.
Èyì Wúpǐn, Dòngmiào Zìzhēn.
Yuánfàn Huīmò, Yōujì dù rén.

**Central Jade Writ**
Huángzhōng Zǒngqì, Tǒngshè Wúqióng.
Zhènxīng Tǔhuī, Liú liàn shéngōng.

Thereafter, the disciple holds the writ above the incense smoke. The Dharma Master strikes his teeth twelve times and recites the incantation:

O Supreme Perfected, Great Sage, Lofty Venerable,
Who disseminates transformation and governs the qi of the Thirty-Two Heavens,
Whose Eight Assemblies and Nine Radiances naturally form writs,
Who pacifies and guards heaven and earth, preserving and regulating the kalpas,
Whose primordial mandate from the Originator is universally proclaimed to the Three Primes,
Who commands the Nine Earths below and seals the manifold heavens above,
Who announces to the seas and mountains, the famous peaks and great rivers:
Today, this proclamation is made on high, and the myriad spirits all hear it.
As your disciple performs the fast and practices the Dao to deliver and cross over the souls of the dark realms,
May the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus erase and extinguish the roots of sin.
May the sources of the Three Paths and Five Sufferings be forever crossed,
And may blessings be received life after life, with names inscribed in the cinnabar register.
May spirits be born in heaven, refined and transformed by nature.
May the gates of life and death be opened and the passage granted,
That they may abide for kalpas eternal.
The mandate of the Nine Heavens is transmitted by wind and fire couriers.

Again, bow in reverence.

**The Fifty-Seventh Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Ritual Concludes**
**The Fifty-Eighth Scroll of the Supreme Yellow Register Fast Ritual**
*Edited by Master Guangcheng of the Tang, Du Guangting*

**Ritual for Repentance and Supplication to Cure Illness**
**Preliminary Reverence to the Directions**

We, your disciples, wholeheartedly take refuge in and submit to the Eastern Direction’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Nine *Qi* Heavenly Lords, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Eastern Realm.
*Three bows, each with utmost sincerity and repentance.*
*The other directions follow this pattern.*

**Repentance**

**Eastern Direction**
We, your disciples, on behalf of the official so-and-so and the individual so-and-so, perform the fast and practice the Dao, taking refuge in and submitting to the Eastern Direction’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Great Sage Host, the Perfected Lords and Venerable Ones, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Eastern Realm.
Now, we kindle incense, take refuge, and offer repentance. Your disciple so-and-so, in past lives, this life, and through kalpas uncounted,
Has offended above against the Nine *Qi* Heavens of the East, the Wood Bureau’s palace, the Azure Emperor’s court, the stellar deities of Jupiter’s Wood virtue—Jiao, Kang, Di, Fang, Xin, Wei, Ji—and the Azure Dragon’s spirits.
Has offended below against Gou Mang, the Spring King; the Yin-Yang of the Wood phase—Jia, Yi, the Azure Dragon, and Lesser Yang; the cyclical spirits of the Merit Clerk; the directional spirits of the Grand Thoroughfare; the *qi* of the Spring Equinox; the might of thunder and lightning; the Zhen trigram of the Xuanyuan; and the host of the Azure Emperor’s deities.
These accumulated sins and grievous transgressions have bound us above to the palaces and bureaus of the Eastern Direction’s Boundless Realm, forming calamities and misfortunes that have persisted through generations.
Today, through repentance and supplication, we humbly beseech their complete eradication.
May it be granted that the Emperor be securely enthroned and the nation’s fortune flourish.
May the state and household receive blessings, and the realm be enveloped in grace.
May your disciple so-and-so’s souls in the Nine Dark Realms be released, and the seven generations of ancestors ascend to heaven.
May disasters and misfortunes be dissolved, and blessings and fortune be boundless.
After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the realm of Non-Action,
In harmony and union with the Dao, becoming true.

**Southeastern Direction**
We, your disciples, on behalf of the official so-and-so and the individual so-and-so, perform the fast and practice the Dao, taking refuge in and submitting to the Southeastern Direction’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Great Sage Host, the Perfected Lords and Venerable Ones, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Southeastern Realm.
Now, we kindle incense, take refuge, and offer repentance. Your disciple so-and-so, in past lives, this life, and through kalpas uncounted,
Has offended above against the Southeastern Direction’s Brahman *qi* Heavens, the Wind Bureau’s palace, the Yellow Emperor’s deities of late spring, the Celestial Stem’s position, and the directional spirits of Chen and Xun.
Against the Four Palaces of the Victorious Serpent, the *qi* of the Beginning of Summer, and the numina of the altars of soil and grain.
These offenses have bound us above to the palaces and bureaus of the Southeastern Direction’s Boundless Realm, forming calamities that have persisted through generations without resolution.
Through today’s repentance and supplication, we humbly beseech their complete eradication.
May it be granted that the ancestral line endure forever, and the imperial fortune be prolonged.
May the living and the dead alike receive blessings, and the state and household be graced with favor.
May your disciple so-and-so’s seven generations of ancestors and nine degrees of kin ascend to heaven.
May disasters and misfortunes be dissolved, and blessings and goodness be boundless.
After attaining the Dao, may we ascend into the realm of Non-Action,
In harmony and union with the Dao, becoming true.

**Southern Direction**
We, your disciples, on behalf of the official so-and-so and the individual so-and-so, perform the fast and practice the Dao, taking refuge in and submitting to the Southern Direction’s Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy, the Great Sage Host, the Perfected Lords and Venerable Ones, and the divine immortals and spirit officials of the Southern Realm.
Now, we kindle incense, take refuge, and offer repentance. Your disciple so-and-so, in past lives, this life, and through kalpas uncounted,
